body: Indonesia's membership in BRICS, effective early 2025, is expected to expand the global market for palm oil, its top export commodity, with the 10 member countries offering promising markets due to their average income of $11,200 per year. The cooperation is hoped to attract foreign direct investments and increase market access, with a potential market size of 3.8 billion people, or 44% of the global population.

title: Palm oil production found to cause lowest biodiversity loss compared to other vegetable oils.
body: A recent study found that palm oil production causes the lowest biodiversity loss compared to other vegetable oils, with soybean oil being the largest contributor to biodiversity loss. The study's findings suggest that reducing palm oil consumption and switching to other vegetable oils could lead to an increase in global biodiversity loss, highlighting the importance of sustainable oil palm plantations and conservation efforts.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Industry Has Huge Potential to Help Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
body: Indonesia's palm oil industry, which accounts for 18% of the country's total national emissions, has the potential to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 31.89% by 2030 through better waste management, energy efficiency, and forest protection. By processing palm oil waste into biochar, the industry can produce up to 583,000 tons of biochar, which can be used as fertilizer, reducing dependence on chemical fertilizers and generating economic value.

title: Palm Oil Remains Global Market Leader Despite Unfair Criticisms Due to Its Higher Productivity and Versatility
body: Palm oil, which controls around 40% of the global vegetable oil market, has become a target of jealousy from competitors due to its high productivity, efficiency, and versatility, with one hectare of oil palm plantation producing 3.8-4.2 tons of palm oil per year, outcompeting soybean, rapeseed, and sunflower. The palm oil industry, which employs over 16 million workers in Indonesia and contributes significantly to the country's foreign exchange through exports, has been increasingly compliant with sustainability principles, with growers encouraged to apply certification and multi-cropping systems to foster biodiversity.

title: Number of Idul Fitri Migrants in 2025 Predicted to Decrease by 24% to 146.48 Million People
body: The number of people traveling for Idul Fitri in 2025 is expected to decrease by 24% to 146.48 million, or 52% of Indonesia's population, compared to 193.6 million in the previous year. Despite the decline, the number of travelers in 2025 is still higher than in 2023, with no specific financial metrics or company names mentioned in the article.

title: Ministry of Trade Evaluates Regulation on Packaged Palm Oil and People's Cooking Oil Distribution Amid Controversy
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Trade is evaluating Minister of Trade Regulation No. 18/2024 regarding packaged palm oil and people's cooking oil management, following controversy over Minyakita's packaging not meeting regulations and suspected fraud in its distribution. The regulation not only sets the highest retail price but also governs distribution patterns, according to Director General of Domestic Trade Iqbal Shoffan Shofwan.

title: Digital Realty and Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Form Joint Venture to Develop Data Center Business in Indonesia
body: Digital Realty (DLR) forms a joint venture with Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia, named Digital Realty Bersama, to develop and operate data center businesses in Indonesia, with equal ownership stakes. The JV will absorb Bersama Digital Data Centres, a subsidiary of BDIA, which is majority-owned by Provident Capital Partners, PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk, Macquarie Asset Management, and Distro Hub.

title: PT Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate targets sale of 20-hectare land by 2025, focusing on data center industry.
body: PT Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate Tbk aims to sell 20 hectares of land by 2025, which is expected to significantly contribute to the company's revenue, with a focus on selling land for industrial data centers due to high demand. This segment is crucial for Bekasi Fajar's income, and the company is optimistic about meeting its target.

title: Pakuwon Jati to Strengthen Recurring Income Strategy Amid Business Challenges
body: PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk (PWON) remains optimistic about increasing revenue despite business challenges this year, and will focus on strengthening its recurring income strategy, particularly by expanding its shopping center business. The company expects to increase its total portfolio by around 7% in 2025, driven by the opening of two new shopping centers late last year.

title: Pertamina and authorities seal off gas station in Bogor for violating fuel quality and quantity standards.
body: Pertamina Patra Niaga (PERTM) sealed 34,431 dispensers at a gas station in Bogor, Indonesia, in collaboration with the Ministry of Trade and the Police, to ensure consumer rights and prevent fraud. As a result, the management of the gas station will be taken over by Pertamina Retail, a subsidiary of Pertamina Patra Niaga, to improve operational services and prevent future violations.

title: Ministry of Trade Issues Export Permit for 1.4 Million Tons of Copper Concentrate to PT Freeport Indonesia.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Trade has issued an export permit to PT Freeport Indonesia (no ticker) to export 1.4 million wet metric tons of copper concentrate, valid for six months from the date of the export recommendation issued on March 17, 2025. This allows Freeport to export until September 2025, with the permit volume aligned with the recommendation from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.

title: PT Vale Indonesia CEO Discusses Project Developments and Future Business Plans Amid Nickel Price Pressure and Royalty Hike Proposals
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk's CEO, Febriany Eddy, discussed the latest developments in the company's projects and business plans amidst the decline in nickel prices and proposed royalty tariff increases. The company is navigating these challenges to move forward with its plans, with details available to subscribers of the publication.

title: Government and Stock Exchange Authority to Meet with Investors to Address Slumping Stock Market Performance
body: The Indonesian government and stock exchange authorities are making efforts to boost the country's underperforming stock market, with President Prabowo Subianto set to meet with investors to address the decline in the composite stock price index. The meeting's schedule will be arranged by the Cabinet Secretary, aiming to revitalize the market's performance.

title: Ciputra Development's Prospects Remain Attractive Despite Challenging 2025 Outlook.
body: PT Ciputra Development Tbk's prospects remain attractive despite a challenging year, with high marketing sales in 2024 expected to be difficult to repeat in 2025, according to Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia's senior analyst Sukarno Alatas. The company's financial performance is expected to face hurdles in the coming year, making it essential to monitor its progress closely.

title: Indonesia's 10-year government bond yield rises above 7% amid stock market decline.
body: Indonesia's 10-year government bond yield has risen to above 7% amid the decline of the Indonesian stock market, presenting an opportunity for investors to enter the bond market with high yields. According to Pefindo's fixed income analyst Ahmad Nasrudin, the current yield level offers a chance for investors to secure high yields, which may become scarce in the future if interest rates trend downward.

title: Economic Activity Continues to Grow at Solid Pace Despite Rising Uncertainty.
body: The economy continues to grow at a solid pace, with low unemployment rates stabilizing over the past few months, while inflation remains somewhat high. The committee aims to achieve maximum employment and 2% inflation in the long term, but uncertainty surrounding economic prospects has increased, with risks on both sides of its mandate.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Rises 1.41% to 6,311.66 After Previous Day's Decline
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) surged 1.41% or 88.27 points to close at 6,311.66 on Wednesday, marking a significant rebound. Analysts have provided several stock recommendations for today, with the article offering further insights for subscribers, available for a 7-day free trial or a monthly subscription of IDR 20,000.

title: Directorate General of Taxation Targets 16.21 Million Annual Income Tax Reports This Year
body: The Indonesian Directorate General of Taxes targets 16.21 million annual income tax returns this year, equivalent to 81.92% of taxpayers required to report, which is lower than the 85.72% formal compliance rate achieved in 2024. The director of education, service, and public relations at the Directorate General of Taxes, Dwi Astuti, did not explain the decline in the projected formal compliance rate.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 1.42% After Four Consecutive Days of Decline
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 1.42% or 88.27 points to 6,311.66 on Wednesday, rebounding from a four-day decline, but still accumulated a 5.3% loss over the past week and a 10.85% drop since the beginning of the year.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buys 707,900 Shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher, an insider, purchased 707,900 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 416 per share, increasing his holding from 17,597,000 to 18,304,900 shares. The transaction type is a "buy" with the purpose of investment. This insider trading activity may indicate confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rebounds 1.42% After Previous Day's 3.84% Decline
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) rebounded 1.42% to 6,311.66 after plummeting 3.84% to 6,223.39 on Tuesday, with the government assuring that the issue will be closely monitored. The government also committed to being more cautious with fiscal discipline and President Prabowo Subianto is set to meet with investors to address the decline in IHSG.

title: Bank Indonesia Holds Benchmark Interest Rate at 5.75% to Control Inflation and Stabilize Rupiah Exchange Rate.
body: Bank Indonesia decided to maintain the benchmark interest rate at 5.75% to control inflation expectations for 2025 and 2026 and to stabilize the rupiah exchange rate, which has been weakening, closing at Rp 16,531 per US dollar on Wednesday, down 0.63% from the previous day. The central bank's decision aims to maintain economic stability amidst the declining value of the rupiah.

title: Commission XI of the DPR to Expand Discussion on Revision of Financial Sector Development Law
body: The Indonesian Parliament's Commission XI is set to discuss revisions to the 2023 Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law, which may include adding new mandates for Bank Indonesia and addressing economic growth. The revised law is expected to cover strategic issues, including the role of the central bank in promoting economic growth.

title: Financial Authority Relaxes Buyback Rules, Allowing Banks to Proceed with Share Repurchase Plans
body: The Financial Services Authority has relaxed rules on share buybacks, allowing banks to proceed with their plans without waiting for shareholder approval, a move welcomed by banks such as Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) that have already announced buyback plans. This relaxation of rules is expected to enable banks to quickly realize their share buyback plans, which could have a positive impact on their financial metrics.

title: Government's Stimulus Fails to Boost Mobility During Lebaran Holiday as Number of Travelers Expected to Decrease.
body: The Indonesian government's stimulus package to boost mobility during the Eid al-Fitr holiday appears to be less effective, as a survey by the Ministry of Transportation's Policy Agency and academics shows a decline in the number of travelers this year compared to last year. The survey's results may impact the economy, with potential implications for businesses and investments in the transportation sector.

title: BPI Danantara's Investment Officer Expects Positive Economic Impact in Indonesia
body: Pandu Patria Sjahir, Chief Officer of Investment at BPI Danantara, expressed optimism about the company's potential to be a positive catalyst for the Indonesian economy, citing the country's stronger economic fundamentals compared to others. This outlook suggests a promising future for BPI Danantara, which could have a positive impact on the national economy.

title: Indonesian Corporations' Business Expansion Slows Down in Q1 2025 with Significant Decline in Syndicated Loan Disbursement.
body: In the first quarter of 2025, Indonesian corporations have not expanded their business significantly, reflected in the significant decline in syndicated loan disbursements, with mandated lead arrangers securing only $743.2 million in deals, an 84% drop compared to the same period in 2024. This decline indicates a sluggish business expansion in the country, with no specific company mentioned.

title: Legendary textile firm PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk files for bankruptcy, lays off thousands of employees.
body: PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (Sritex), a legendary textile company, has gone bankrupt and will lay off tens of thousands of employees after being declared insolvent as of March 1, 2025, due to a lack of working capital and high labor and production costs. The company's creditors have agreed to halt operations and proceed with debt repayment, marking the end of Sritex's operations.

title: Electronic Money Transactions Based on Bank Cards Expected to Surge During Eid Al-Fitr Holidays
body: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) expects a surge in electronic money transactions based on bank-issued cards, driven by increased mobility and the upcoming Eid al-Fitr holiday, with the company's secretary, Agustya Hendy Bernadi, stating that the holiday season typically boosts transactions on its Brizzi card. This growth is expected to contribute to a significant increase in overall electronic money transactions.

title: Electric Vehicle Financing in Indonesia Reaches IDR 16.63 Trillion by December 2024
body: As of December 2024, the multifinance industry in Indonesia has disbursed IDR 16.63 trillion in electric vehicle financing, with electric vehicle financing accounting for only 3.31% of total financing receivables. Despite the positive trend, the proportion of electric vehicle financing remains minimal, indicating room for growth in this sector.

title: Indika Energy to Invest USD 10 Million in Nanshan Aluminium's IPO on Hong Kong Stock Exchange
body: PT Indika Energy Tbk will invest USD 10 million in Nanshan Aluminium International Holdings Limited's initial public offering on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange through its subsidiary, PT Perkasa Investama Mineral, as a cornerstone investor. The investment, scheduled to be completed on March 25, 2025, aims to enhance operational capabilities, diversify the portfolio, and expand the company's presence in international markets.

title: Truck drivers in Indonesia stage protest at Tanjung Priok port against operational restrictions during Lebaran period.
body: Truck drivers, part of the Indonesian Truck Entrepreneurs Association, staged a protest at Tanjung Priok Port in Jakarta, opposing operational restrictions during the Lebaran period, which may impact distribution and logistics. Despite the protest, some truck drivers continued to operate, and port activities remained ongoing, albeit at a slower pace, to meet distribution needs.

title: Indonesia's richest woman Marina Budiman's net worth plummets $3.6 billion in three days due to sharp stock fluctuations.
body: Marina Budiman, Indonesia's richest woman, saw her net worth shrink by $3.6 billion in just three days due to sharp fluctuations in DCI Indonesia's (DCII) stock, which had briefly positioned her as the wealthiest woman in Indonesia with a net worth of $7.5 billion. The company's market valuation stood at nearly $17 billion, despite reporting only $112 million in revenue and $49 million in profit last year, with its stock trading at 416 times its profit, the highest valuation among its industry peers.

title: Indonesia's travel spending expected to reach Rp 375.2 trillion during Eid al-Fitr holidays.
body: Indonesia's tourism minister projects travel spending to reach Rp 375.2 trillion during the upcoming Eid al-Fitr holidays, with 146 million trips expected and an average expenditure of Rp 2.57 million per trip. However, the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry estimates Eid-related spending at a lower Rp 137.97 trillion, citing a 24% decline in travelers from last year due to factors such as the approaching new academic year and decline in purchasing power.

title: Indonesia and Russia to Hold Bilateral Trade Talks Ahead of President Prabowo's State Visit to Moscow
body: Indonesia and Russia are set to hold bilateral trade talks next month, with President Prabowo Subianto expected to sign a principal agreement on Indonesia's trade pact with the Russia-led Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU), which could potentially remove trade barriers and boost trade. Indonesia's trade with Russia has already seen a significant increase, jumping from $3.3 billion in 2023 to almost $3.6 billion the following year, with bilateral trade amounting to $403.6 million in January 2025.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buy Transaction of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher, an insider, purchased 566,500 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk, a publicly traded company, at prices ranging from IDR 396 to IDR 402, increasing his holding from 18,304,900 to 18,871,400 shares. The transaction, classified as an "Investasi" or investment, suggests that Dannacher is bullish on the company's prospects. This significant increase in ownership may indicate confidence in the company's future performance, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara Buys 150,000 Shares of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, an insider, purchased 150,000 shares of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk, increasing their holding from 67,000,000 to 67,150,000 shares. The transaction type was a "buy" with a price of IDR 925 per share, totaling IDR 150,000,000. The purpose of the transaction was for investment. This transaction suggests that Negara has confidence in the company's prospects, potentially indicating a positive outlook for PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk.

title: Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara Sell Transaction of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, an insider, sold 500,000 shares of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk, reducing their holding from 67,500,000 to 67,000,000 shares. The transaction, classified as a divestment, was executed at a price of IDR 915 per share, resulting in a total transaction value of IDR 500,000,000. This sale represents a 0.74% decrease in Negara's ownership stake in the company. The purpose of the transaction is stated as divestment, implying a reduction of Negara's investment in PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk. This transaction may have implications for the company's ownership structure and potentially influence the market dynamics of PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk's shares.

title: Andreas Utomo Sell Transaction of PT Aman Agrindo Tbk.
body: Andreas Utomo, an insider, sold 6,870,200 shares of PT Aman Agrindo Tbk on January 22, 2025, reducing their holding from 194,051,300 to 187,181,100 shares. The transaction, classified as a "sell" with a purpose of "investment strategy," was executed at a price of 355 per share. This transaction resulted in a decrease of approximately 3.5% in Utomo's ownership stake in the company. The significance of this transaction lies in the potential impact on the company's ownership structure and the potential influence of Utomo's decision on the market.

title: Jonathan Tahir Buys Transaction of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Jonathan Tahir, an insider, executed a buy transaction involving 16,826,000 shares of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk, a publicly traded company. The transaction increased Tahir's holding from 58,252,800 shares to 75,078,800 shares, representing a significant 29% increase in ownership. The purpose of the transaction was for investment, with each share purchased at a price of IDR 1,880. This transaction may indicate Tahir's confidence in the company's future prospects, potentially influencing market sentiment and investor decisions.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Rises 1.11% Led by Technology Stocks Despite Foreign Selling Pressure
body: The Jakarta Composite Stock Price Index rose 1.11% to 6,381.57, led by a 9.84% surge in technology stocks, driven by PT DCI Indonesia Tbk's 19.99% share price increase. Meanwhile, shares of state-owned banks PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk and PT Bank Mandiri Tbk fell 1.35% and 1.28%, respectively, as foreign investors continued to exert selling pressure, albeit at a slower pace than the previous day.

title: Amar Bank targets double-digit loan growth by 2025 driven by digital lending platform Tunaiku.
body: PT Bank Amar Indonesia Tbk (AMAR) targets double-digit growth in loan disbursement by 2025, driven by the performance of its digital lending platform, Tunaiku, which contributed around 60% to its total portfolio in 2024 and grew 30% year-on-year. The bank plans to expand into new customer segments, including corporate commercial, to broaden its financing services, particularly for small and medium enterprises, aiming to become a digital bank that serves SMEs.

title: Jenius launches Cash Cow and Bayar & Nabung features to encourage saving habits among digitally savvy customers.
body: Jenius, a digital banking service of PT Bank SMBC Indonesia (SMBC), has launched two new features, Cash Cow and Bayar & Nabung, to encourage customers to build saving habits, with Cash Cow offering interest rates up to 9% per annum from March 19 to August 31, 2025. The features allow customers to save from cashback earned through merchant promotions and set aside funds from their active balance while shopping or paying bills, targeting customers with average savings balances less than IDR 5 million.

title: Foreign Investors in Indonesia's Stock Exchange Record Net Buy of 187.39 Million Shares
body: Foreign investors in the Indonesia Stock Exchange turned net buyers, purchasing 3.92 billion shares and selling 3.74 billion shares, with a net buy of 187.39 million shares, led by PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) with a net buy of 214.20 million shares. Other top net buys included PT Bukalapak.com Tbk (BUKA) with 202.82 million shares, PT J Resources Asia Pasifik Tbk with 56.20 million shares, and PT Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur Tbk with 67.23 million shares.

title: Ferryawan Utomo Buy Transaction of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Ferryawan Utomo, an insider, purchased 211,400 shares of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 1,828 per share, resulting in a total transaction value of IDR 211,400,000. This buy transaction increased Utomo's holding from 0 to 211,400 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for investment, suggesting that Utomo is bullish on the company's prospects. This insider buying activity may be seen as a positive signal by the market, potentially influencing investor sentiment and the company's stock price.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Rises 1.11% to 6,381.67, Led by Gains in Banking, Energy, and Mining Sectors
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) surged 1.11% to 6,381.67, driven by large-cap stocks in the banking, energy, and mineral mining sectors, with notable gainers including PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (up 0.60%), PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (up 5.66%), and PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (up 15.10%). Meanwhile, other indices such as LQ45, IDX30, IDX80, and IDXESGL weakened, with declines ranging from 0.09% to 0.91%.

title: Nini Liemijanto Buy Transaction of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk.
body: Nini Liemijanto, an insider, purchased 126,800 shares of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk on January 22, 2025, at a price of IDR 1,828 per share, increasing their holding from 25,200 to 152,000 shares. This "buy" transaction, classified as an investment, represents a significant increase in Liemijanto's ownership stake in the company. The purpose of the transaction is stated as an investment, suggesting that Liemijanto is bullish on the company's prospects. This transaction may have implications for the company's stock price and investor sentiment, as insider buying activity can be seen as a positive signal.

title: Budi Susanto Buy Transaction of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Budi Susanto, an insider, purchased 84,600 shares of PT Samator Indo Gas Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 1,828 per share, totaling IDR 154,808,000. This "buy" transaction increased Susanto's holding from 0 to 84,600 shares, indicating a significant change in ownership. The purpose of the transaction was for investment, as stated in the filing. This transaction may imply that Susanto has confidence in the company's future performance, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: Adi Putera Widjaja Buy Transaction of PT Tourindo Guide Indonesia Tbk.
body: On January 22, 2025, Adi Putera Widjaja, an insider, executed a buy transaction of 23,400,000 shares in PT Tourindo Guide Indonesia Tbk, increasing their holding from 1,000 to 23,401,000 shares. The transaction was valued at IDR 2,040,000,000 (approximately USD 137,931) at a price of IDR 88 per share. The purpose of the transaction was to implement the MESOP (Management Employee Stock Option Program) Phase IV & V. This significant increase in ownership may indicate Widjaja's confidence in the company's future performance and could potentially impact the company's governance and decision-making processes.

title: Samudera Prawirawidjaja Sold Transaction of PT Campina Ice Cream Industry Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Samudera Prawirawidjaja, an insider, sold 2,354,000,000 shares of PT Campina Ice Cream Industry Tbk, valued at IDR 2,354,000,000,000 (approximately USD 165,000,000). This transaction resulted in Prawirawidjaja's holding decreasing from 2,354,000,000 shares to 0 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for business purposes. This significant sale may indicate a shift in Prawirawidjaja's investment strategy or a potential change in the company's ownership structure.

title: Indonesia's Oleochemical Exports Face Challenges from EU and India's Anti-Dumping and Anti-Subsidy Policies
body: Indonesia's oleochemical exports have been increasing, with a total export value of $5.4 billion in 2022, $3.7 billion in 2023, and $4.3 billion in 2024, despite facing challenges from the European Union's anti-dumping policy and India's anti-subsidy policy. The Association of Indonesian Oleochemical Producers (APOLIN) has filed a trade dispute against the EU policy at the World Trade Organization and is working with the Trade Ministry to tackle the trade obstacle with India.

title: Indonesia to Launch Carbon Trading from Forestry Sector, Estimated to Reach $1.6-3.2 Trillion in Transaction Value by 2025
body: The Indonesian government is set to launch carbon trading from the forestry sector, with a projected transaction value of between Rp1.6 trillion and Rp3.2 trillion per year, potentially reaching Rp97.9 trillion to Rp258.7 trillion per year by 2034. The initiative is expected to create 170,000 new job opportunities and generate significant revenue, including tax contributions of between Rp23 trillion and Rp60 trillion and non-tax state income of between Rp9.7 trillion and Rp25.8 trillion per year.

title: Bank Indonesia Continues to Absorb Government Securities Amid Government's Funding Needs
body: Bank Indonesia has been actively absorbing government securities, with a total purchase of Rp 70.74 trillion as of March 18, comprising Rp 47.31 trillion from secondary market purchases and Rp 23.43 trillion from primary market purchases, including Sharia-based government securities. This move is seen as crucial as the government faces declining tax revenue and increasing funding needs for its programs.

title: Lintasarta to Focus on Artificial Intelligence Business Development as AI Factory under Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison Group.
body: Lintasarta, a subsidiary of PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT), will focus on developing artificial intelligence (AI) business, earning it the title of "AI Factory" under the Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison Group, and has launched Semesta AI, a program supported by NVIDIA Inception. This program aims to accelerate AI adoption in Indonesia, marking a significant milestone in the country's AI development.

title: INV Management Pte. Ltd. Sell Transaction of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, INV Management Pte. Ltd., an insider, sold 350,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. at varying prices between 420 and 428, resulting in a decrease in their holding from 3,010,935,597 to 3,007,435,597 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for "other investments." This sell transaction implies a reduction in INV Management's ownership stake in PT ITSEC Asia Tbk., potentially signaling a shift in their investment strategy or portfolio rebalancing.

title: Indonesia's economy shows growth in February 2025 with a 5.7% annual increase in broad money circulation.
body: Indonesia's economy showed growth in February 2025, with the broad money supply (M2) reaching Rp 9,239.9 trillion, a 5.7% year-over-year increase, outpacing January 2025's 5.5% growth and February 2024's 5.3% growth.

title: Unilever Indonesia's stock price surges 27.58% in a month without any significant corporate action announcements.
body: PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) has seen its stock price surge 27.58% since the end of February 2025, from IDR 1,015 per share to IDR 1,295 per share, despite no significant corporate action announcements from the management. The stock's upward trend has been observed over the past month, with no clear catalyst identified.

title: DCI Indonesia's stock liquidity raises concerns despite its significant weight in the composite stock price index.
body: PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII) has been under scrutiny due to its low liquidity, with its stock often hovering near the auto-rejection limit with only a few lots traded, sometimes less than 10 lots. Despite this, DCII has a significant weight of around 5% in the Jakarta Composite Index, making its performance crucial for the overall market.

title: Ariston Tjendra Shares Investment Principles, Including Using "Cold Money" and Continuous Education.
body: Ariston Tjendra, President Director of PT Doo Financial Futures, emphasizes the importance of using "cold money" for investments, ensuring that invested funds do not compromise primary needs like food and shelter. This approach provides a sense of security and prevents potential losses that may occur when investment funds are mixed with primary funds.

title: Gold price reaches new all-time high record amid high global uncertainty.
body: Gold prices reached a new all-time high of $3,057.36 per ounce on Thursday, driven by high global uncertainty, before retreating to $3,034.94 by the end of trading.

title: Market Downturn Sparks Panic Selling, but Some Investors See Opportunity to Accumulate Stocks
body: The recent decline in the stock market has sparked panic among market players, leading to massive selling pressure, but for some investors, it presents an opportunity to accumulate undervalued stocks. Notably, controlling shareholders and individual investors have been buying up shares during the market downturn, particularly when the composite stock price index plummeted over 5% on Tuesday, triggering a trading halt.

title: Darma Henwa to Change Company Status to Access Domestic Business Opportunities
body: PT Darma Henwa Tbk (DHEW) plans to change its status from a foreign investment company to a domestic investment company, aiming to increase flexibility in accessing domestic business opportunities regulated by national investment laws. This strategic move is expected to benefit the company's growth and expansion in the domestic market.

title: President Prabowo Subianto inaugurates Industropolis Batang, a special economic zone in Central Java, aiming to boost industrialization in Indonesia.
body: President Prabowo Subianto inaugurated the Industropolis Batang special economic zone in Central Java, which is a transformation of the Batang Integrated Industrial Area, aiming to boost industrialization and downstreaming in Indonesia. The President hopes that Industropolis Batang will become Indonesia's equivalent of Shenzhen, a major manufacturing and technology hub in China, driving economic growth and development.

title: ExxonMobil considers Indonesia as a potential hub for petrochemical industry development in Asia.
body: ExxonMobil Cepu Limited (XOM) is considering Indonesia as a base for developing the petrochemical industry in Asia, which is expected to be a growth center for the polymer industry in the next 20-30 years. The company is working with the Indonesian government to explore business opportunities in the country's petrochemical sector, with the goal of making Indonesia a key location for petrochemical development in Asia.

title: PLN Expects 30% Decrease in Peak Electricity Load During 2025 Idul Fitri Holiday
body: PT PLN (PLN) expects a 30% decrease in peak electricity demand during the 2025 Idul Fitri holiday compared to normal days, due to the closure of offices, factories, and industrial sectors, resulting in reduced electricity usage. This trend of decreased peak electricity demand often occurs during religious holidays, according to Director of Distribution Adi Priyanto.

title: Government Explores Energy and Mineral Sectors to Boost Non-Tax Revenue
body: The Indonesian government is exploring the potential of the energy and mineral resources sector to boost non-tax state revenue, with the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) releasing several policies to increase state revenue. One of the policies includes a plan to increase royalty tariffs for minerals and coal by revising Government Regulation No. 26 of 2022 on types and tariffs of non-tax state revenue applicable in the ESDM environment.

title: US Opens Up to Indonesian Coal Exports After Trump's Fossil Fuel Policy Announcement
body: The US's decision to increase fossil fuel-based electricity production, announced by President Donald Trump, has opened up new export opportunities for Indonesia's coal industry, providing a welcome respite from the burden of royalty tariff hikes. This development also presents an alternative export market for Indonesia's coal, which has primarily been supplied to China, potentially boosting the country's coal exports.

title: Jasa Marga Expects 2.18 Million Vehicles to Use Their Toll Roads During 2025 Idul Fitri Holiday.
body: Jasa Marga Group (JSMR) projects 2.18 million vehicles to use their toll roads exiting Jakarta during the 2025 Idul Fitri holiday, a 1.1% increase from 2024. The projection is based on traffic assumptions from H-10 to H+2 of Idul Fitri, which is expected to fall on March 31, 2025.

title: Rupiah strengthens against US dollar on Thursday's trading, up 0.28% to Rp 16,485 per dollar.
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.28% against the US dollar on Thursday, with the spot rate reaching Rp 16,485 per dollar and the Jisdor Bank Indonesia rate reaching Rp 16,481. The rupiah's strengthening was influenced by the dovish stance of the Federal Reserve, which kept interest rates between 4.25% and 4.5%.

title: Rupiah's Strengthening Limited by Domestic and Global Pressures Despite Dovish Federal Reserve Stance
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.28% to RP 16,485 per US dollar, but has still corrected 2.18% since the start of 2025, with domestic and global pressures expected to continue weighing on the currency in the medium term. According to Lukman Leong, an analyst at Doo Financial Futures, the Federal Reserve's dovish stance may weaken the US dollar, but it won't necessarily boost the rupiah due to unfavorable domestic sentiment.

title: ESSA Industries' Prospects Boosted by High Amonia Prices and Low-Carbon Project Initiatives
body: PT Essa Industries Indonesia Tbk (ESSA) is expected to have a promising long-term prospect due to high ammonia prices and its initiative to develop low-carbon ammonia projects, which is seen as a competitive advantage. Analyst Kenny Shan from Sinarmas Sekuritas views ESSA positively, citing its stable earnings and attractive long-term prospects driven by projects such as decarbonization initiatives.

title: Bukalapak Expects Efficiency and Restructuring Efforts to Reflect in Q1 2025 Financial Report
body: PT Bukalapak.com Tbk expects the results of its efficiency and business restructuring efforts to be reflected in its Q1-2025 financial report, following the closure of its physical product sales service on February 9, 2025. The company is transitioning to a more streamlined and sustainable business model to maximize operational efficiency, according to CEO Willix Halim.

title: PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Accelerates Share Buyback Plan Amid Market Fluctuations
body: PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) has accelerated its share buyback plan, aiming to purchase around 1.5% or 450 million shares of its total issued shares, without needing to hold a general meeting of shareholders. This move is part of the company's efforts to stabilize the capital market amidst significant fluctuations, taking advantage of the relaxed regulations set by the Financial Services Authority.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rebounds with 1.11% Gain After Previous Day's 6% Decline
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) rebounded 1.11% to 6,381.67 on Thursday, driven by a reversal in conglomerate stocks, particularly those of Prajogo Pangestu, which had previously weighed on the index. The total trading volume reached 16.17 billion shares with a transaction value of Rp 11.3 trillion, marking a positive trend in the market.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Prepares to Welcome Three New Listings Amid Fluctuating Market Conditions
body: PT Yupi Indo Jelly Gum Tbk (YUPI) is set to list on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) today, with a potential initial public offering (IPO) of IDR 2.04 trillion, after setting its IPO price at IDR 2,390 per share. This listing is part of the IDX's efforts to welcome three new issuers in the near future, despite the current volatile investment climate.

title: Angkasa Pura Indonesia Predicts 9.3% Increase in Air Travelers During Lebaran Period
body: PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia predicts a 9.3% increase in air passengers, reaching 10.8 million, during the 2025 Lebaran transportation period, compared to the same period last year. This growth is expected to occur across 37 airports, indicating a surge in demand for air travel during the holiday season.

title: Insurance Industry Seeks Out Undervalued Stocks Amid Market Downturn
body: Despite improving in the last two days, the composite stock price index remains in a downward trend, prompting the life insurance industry to seek out potential stocks at discounted prices. PT MSIG Life Insurance Indonesia's Head of Investment, Epsen Halim, stated that the company will stick to its initial strategic plan for the year, despite the pressure on the stock market.

title: Indonesian Banks Struggle to Maintain Net Interest Margin Amid High Funding Costs and Low Liquidity.
body: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) reported a net interest margin (NIM) of 6.15% in January, down from 6.94% in the previous month, as high funding costs and tight liquidity continue to challenge banks in maintaining their NIM targets for 2025. Major banks in Indonesia are struggling to meet their NIM targets, with Bank Rakyat Indonesia's NIM still far from its target for the year.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 1.11% After Four-Day Decline
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 1.11% or 70.01 points to 6,381.67 on Thursday, recovering from a four-day decline, as panic selling eased following a trading halt on Tuesday. The index saw a significant increase in transaction volume and value on Tuesday, with the market stabilizing on Thursday.

title: Sabana Prawirawidjaja buys 2,354,000,000 shares of PT Campina Ice Cream Industry Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Sabana Prawirawidjaja, an insider, purchased 2,354,000,000 shares of PT Campina Ice Cream Industry Tbk, increasing their holding from 2,586,010,100 to 4,940,010,100 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 2,354,000,000,000 (approximately USD 165,000,000), was conducted for business purposes. This significant increase in ownership may indicate a strategic move by Sabana Prawirawidjaja to gain greater control or influence over the company, potentially impacting its future direction and operations.

title: Riana Buy Transaction of PT Mark Dynamics Indonesia Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Riana, an insider, purchased 700,000 shares of PT Mark Dynamics Indonesia Tbk, increasing their holding from 79,900 to 779,900 shares. The transaction, classified as an "Investasi" (investment), was valued at IDR 676,500,000 (approximately USD 47,000). This buy transaction suggests that Riana has confidence in the company's prospects, potentially indicating a positive outlook for PT Mark Dynamics Indonesia Tbk. The significant increase in Riana's holding may also imply a potential shift in the company's ownership structure.

title: Electronic City Indonesia Sets Business Strategies to Achieve Growth Targets by 2025
body: PT Electronic City Indonesia Tbk (ECII) aims to achieve growth in performance by 2025 and has set a revenue target for this year that is higher than its 2024 realization. To achieve this target, the company's management has prepared several business strategies, with the goal of improving its financial performance.

title: Rupiah Weakens 1.51% Since the Beginning of the Year, Causing Concern for Business Actors Amidst Domestic and Global Economic Pressures.
body: The Indonesian rupiah has weakened, with the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate reaching Rp 16,528 per dollar on Wednesday, and despite a brief strengthening to Rp 16,481 per dollar on Thursday, the currency has depreciated 1.51% since the start of the year. The weakening rupiah has raised concerns among business players, particularly in the oil and gas sector, as Indonesia is a net oil importer and a weaker rupiah could increase operational costs for companies in the sector.

title: Warren Buffett of Indonesia Lo Kheng Hong's stock portfolio suffers losses, while newcomer Djoni's investments yield high returns.
body: Lo Kheng Hong, known as the "Warren Buffett of Indonesia", has seen his portfolio of stocks with over 5% ownership decline in value, with PT ABM Investama Tbk (ABMM) down 12.15%, PT Global Mediacom Tbk (BMTR) down 22.95%, and others also experiencing significant losses. Meanwhile, investor Djoni has seen his portfolio of stocks surge, with gains of up to 369.51% in WiFi (WIFI) and over 100% in Mina (MINA) and Nine (NINE), prompting some to suggest following his investment strategy.

title: Pawning Industry Expects Stable Non-Performing Loan Ratio Despite Economic Slowdown
body: During Ramadan and Lebaran, pawnbroking transactions typically increase, but despite the current sluggish economy, the industry is expected to maintain a stable non-performing loan ratio due to its auction mechanism for collateralized goods. This is according to Guladi, Executive Manager of the Indonesian Pawnbroking Association, who expressed confidence that the industry can mitigate the risk of loan defaults.

title: Indonesian Parliament Approves Revision of National Army Law Despite Ongoing Protests
body: The Indonesian parliament has approved a revision to the National Army Law, with all factions in agreement, despite ongoing protests from students and civil society. Meanwhile, the 2025 Lebaran money circulation is predicted to decrease by 12%, according to a separate report.

title: Eric Adijanto Buy Transaction of Resource Alam Indonesia Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Eric Adijanto, an insider, executed a buy transaction of 270,000 shares in Resource Alam Indonesia Tbk, increasing his holding from 1,178,735 to 1,448,735 shares. The transaction was valued at IDR 130,440,000 (approximately USD 9,200) at a price of IDR 482 per share. The purpose of the transaction was for investment rotation. This transaction suggests that Adijanto is bullish on the company's prospects, and the increased stake may indicate a potential long-term commitment.

title: Indonesian Government Urged to Review Foreign Business Deals After Losing $24.1 Million Lawsuit to Navayo International
body: Indonesia's government has been ordered to pay $24.1 million to Navayo International AG (no ticker) by November 22, 2024, after losing a lawsuit over a canceled satellite project, with the amount growing by $2,568 daily if not paid on time. The case has sparked concerns over the government's handling of foreign business deals, with Chief Legal Affairs Minister Yusril Ihza Mahendra urging ministries to be more cautious when drafting contracts to avoid similar disputes.

title: Thailand's Ambassador to Indonesia Meets with Nusantara Authority to Discuss Potential Collaborations and Investment Opportunities in Indonesia's Future Capital.
body: Thailand's ambassador to Indonesia, Prapan Disyatat, led a delegation of Thai entrepreneurs to discuss potential collaborations and investment opportunities in Indonesia's future capital, Nusantara, which is envisioned as a sustainable and environmentally friendly city. The Nusantara Authority has secured Rp 2.42 trillion in private investment agreements from five companies, which will be allocated to develop hotels, office buildings, an entertainment district, and electric vehicle charging stations in the future capital.

title: Erlangga Ksatria buys 1,496,700 shares of PT Imago Mulia Persada Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Erlangga Ksatria, an insider, purchased 1,496,700 shares of PT Imago Mulia Persada Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 100 per share, increasing their holding from 300,000,000 to 301,496,700 shares. The transaction type is a "buy" and the purpose is stated as a personal investment. This transaction suggests that Erlangga Ksatria has increased their stake in the company, potentially indicating confidence in the company's prospects or a strategic move to gain more control.

title: INV Management Pte. Ltd. Sold Transaction of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, INV Management Pte. Ltd. sold 115,000,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk., reducing its holding from 3,012,085,597 to 3,010,935,597 shares. The transaction, classified as "investasi lainnya" (other investments), involved selling shares at prices ranging from IDR 416 to IDR 422. This sale represents a 0.38% decrease in INV Management's ownership stake in PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. The purpose of the transaction is not explicitly stated, but it may be related to portfolio rebalancing or profit-taking. The significance of this transaction lies in the potential impact on PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.'s share price and investor sentiment.

title: Michael Buy Transaction of Petrosea Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Michael, an insider, executed a buy transaction of 550,000 shares of Petrosea Tbk, increasing their holding from 1,400,000 to 1,950,000 shares. The transaction was valued at 550,000 x 3,700 = 2,035,000,000. The purpose of the transaction was for investment. This transaction suggests that Michael has confidence in Petrosea Tbk's prospects, potentially indicating a positive outlook for the company. The increased stake may also imply a greater level of influence or control for Michael within the company.

title: Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc Sold Transaction of PT MD Entertainment Tbk.
body: Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc, an insider, sold 188,751,300 shares of PT MD Entertainment Tbk, reducing its holding from 1,328,152,600 to 1,139,401,300 shares. The transaction, valued at 188,751,300,000, occurred on January 23, 2025. The purpose of the sale was for investment. This significant reduction in ownership may indicate a shift in Morgan Stanley's investment strategy or a potential loss of confidence in PT MD Entertainment Tbk. The transaction may have implications for the company's stock price and investor sentiment.

title: Xiamen Yan Palace Birds Nest Industry Co., Ltd Buys Transaction of PT Esta Indonesia Tbk.
body: Xiamen Yan Palace Birds Nest Industry Co., Ltd, an insider, has acquired 8,225,000 shares of PT Esta Indonesia Tbk, increasing its holding from 197,400,000 to 205,625,000 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 3,037,500,000 (822,500,000 x IDR 370), is classified as an investment. This buy transaction, disclosed on January 24, 2025, suggests that Xiamen Yan Palace Birds Nest Industry Co., Ltd is increasing its stake in PT Esta Indonesia Tbk, potentially indicating confidence in the company's prospects or seeking greater control.

title: Alexandra Sinta Wahjudewanti Sell Transaction of PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk.
body: On January 24, 2025, Alexandra Sinta Wahjudewanti, an insider, sold 150,000 shares of PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk, reducing her holding from 200,000 to 50,000 shares. The transaction, classified as a divestment, was executed at a price of 6,000 per share. This sale represents a significant change in ownership, with Wahjudewanti's stake decreasing by 75%. The purpose of the transaction is stated as divestment, implying a deliberate reduction of her holdings in the company. This transaction may have implications for the company's ownership structure and potentially influence market sentiment.

title: Zurich Assets International Ltd Buy Transaction of PT Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk.
body: Zurich Assets International Ltd, an institutional holder, acquired 13,563,900 shares of PT Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk, an energy company in the oil-gas-coal sub-sector, on January 22, 2025. This "buy" transaction increased Zurich's holding from 139,505,400 to 153,069,300 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. This significant increase in ownership may indicate Zurich's confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing the market and other investors.

title: Wati Kumaedi Buy Transaction of PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk.
body: On January 23, 2025, Wati Kumaedi, an insider, purchased 4,977 shares of PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk, a consumer non-cyclicals company in the nondurable household products sub-sector, at a price of IDR 1,000 per share. This "buy" transaction increased Kumaedi's holding from 2,483,523 to 2,488,500 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. As an insider, Kumaedi's purchase may indicate confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing investor sentiment and share price.

title: Gilarsi Wahju Setijono Buy Transaction of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, GIlarsi Wahju Setijono, an insider, purchased 25,000,000 shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 100 per share, totaling IDR 2,500,000,000. This "buy" transaction represents a change in ownership from 0 shares to 25,000,000 shares, with the purpose of personal investment. As an insider, Setijono's significant purchase may indicate confidence in the company's future performance, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: Hasmoro Buy Transaction of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, Hasmoro, an insider, purchased 853,800 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a publicly traded company, at a price of IDR 1,500 per share, totaling IDR 900,000,000. This "buy" transaction increased Hasmoro's holding from 724,349,889 shares to 725,249,889 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for investment, as stated on January 23, 2025. This insider trading activity may indicate confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing market sentiment and investor decisions.

title: Hady Kuswanto Buy Transaction of PT Trimegah Karya Pratama Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, Hady Kuswanto, an insider, purchased 3,844,400 shares of PT Trimegah Karya Pratama Tbk, a publicly traded company, at prices ranging from IDR 52 to IDR 54 per share. This "buy" transaction increased Kuswanto's holding from 35,389,700 shares to 39,234,100 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for investment. This insider trading activity may indicate Kuswanto's confidence in the company's future performance, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: Hadi Wibowo Buy Transaction of PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, Hadi Wibowo, an insider, executed a buy transaction of 64,100 shares in PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk, increasing his holding from 193,200 to 257,300 shares. The purpose of the transaction was to receive remuneration. This transaction suggests that Hadi Wibowo has increased his stake in the bank, potentially indicating his confidence in the company's performance or future prospects. As an insider, his actions may be seen as a positive signal to investors, potentially influencing the bank's stock price.

title: Dwiyono Bayu Winantio Buys Transaction of PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk.
body: On January 30, 2025, Dwiyono Bayu Winantio, an insider, purchased 31,700 shares of PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk, increasing their holding from 100,400 to 132,100 shares. The transaction type was a "buy" with a purpose of receiving remuneration. This insider trading activity suggests that Winantio has confidence in the bank's performance, potentially indicating a positive outlook for the company. The transaction may also imply that Winantio is committed to their role in the company, as they are increasing their stake.

title: Achmad Amri Aswono Putro Buys 12,500,000 Shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk.
body: On January 31, 2025, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro, an insider, purchased 12,500,000 shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk for a total amount of IDR 1,250,000,000 (approximately USD 87,500) at a price of IDR 100 per share. This transaction represents a change in ownership from 0 shares to 12,500,000 shares, with the purpose of personal investment. As an insider, Putro's purchase may indicate confidence in the company's prospects, potentially signaling a positive outlook for PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk. This transaction may also have implications for the company's ownership structure and potentially influence market sentiment.

title: Achmad Amri Aswono Putro Buys 12,500,000 Shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk.
body: On January 31, 2025, Achmad Amri Aswono Putro, an insider, purchased 12,500,000 shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk for a total amount of IDR 1,250,000,000 (approximately USD 85,000). This buy transaction resulted in Putro holding 12,500,000 shares after the transaction, up from zero shares previously. The purpose of the transaction was for personal investment, specifically to acquire ownership. This transaction may indicate Putro's confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing market sentiment and share price.

title: LEVOCA ENTERPRISE LTD Sell Transaction of PT Bakrie & Brothers Tbk.
body: Levoca Enterprise Ltd, an institutional holder, sold 5,195,000,000 shares of PT Bakrie & Brothers Tbk, a company in the industrials sector, specifically multi-sector holdings, on March 21, 2025. This transaction reduced Levoca's holding from 50,642,237,270 shares to 45,447,237,270 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. This significant sale may indicate a shift in Levoca's investment strategy or a potential loss of confidence in PT Bakrie & Brothers Tbk, which could have implications for the company's stock price and investor sentiment.

title: UBS AG LONDON sells 589,951,245 shares of Visi Media Asia Tbk.
body: On January 28, 2025, UBS AG London, an insider, sold 589,951,245 shares of Visi Media Asia Tbk, a company in the consumer-cyclicals sector and media-entertainment sub-sector. This transaction resulted in a decrease in UBS AG London's holding from 2,165,020,699 shares to 1,575,069,454 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. This significant sale by an insider may indicate a loss of confidence in the company's prospects, potentially impacting investor sentiment and the company's stock price.

title: UBS AG LONDON Buys Transaction of PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka Tbk.
body: On January 17, 2025, UBS AG London, an institutional holder, purchased 26,960,600 shares of PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka Tbk, a properties and real estate company, at a price of IDR 192 per share. This "buy" transaction increased UBS AG London's holding in the company from 1,025,680,210 shares to 1,052,528,621 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. This significant increase in ownership may indicate UBS AG London's confidence in the company's growth prospects, potentially influencing the company's stock price and market sentiment.

title: Elsiscom Prima Karya Sell Transaction of Galva Technologies Tbk.
body: PT Elsiscom Prima Karya, an insider, sold 17,000,000 shares of PT Galva Technologies Tbk on January 31, 2025, at a price of IDR 308 per share, reducing its holding from 884,301,900 to 867,301,900 shares. The transaction type is a sell, and the purpose is divestment. This transaction implies a decrease in PT Elsiscom Prima Karya's ownership stake in PT Galva Technologies Tbk, potentially signaling a shift in its investment strategy or a need for capital. The significance of this transaction lies in the potential impact on PT Galva Technologies Tbk's share price and the market's perception of the company's value.

title: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia to Expand into Food and Beverage Industry with Donut Business Launch
body: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk (FORE) plans to allocate 18% of its IDR 379.76 billion IPO proceeds to its subsidiary PT Cipta Favorit Indonesia (CFI) to open 30 new outlets, with a total maximum offering value of IDR 379.76 billion. The company also allocates 76% of its IPO proceeds to open 140 new outlets, targeting cities in various categories, including tier 1, tier 2, and tier 3, with a goal of opening at least 72 outlets in 2025.

title: PT Elnusa Records 42% Year-on-Year Net Profit Increase to IDR 713.67 Billion in 2024.
body: PT Elnusa Tbk (ELSA) recorded a 42% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR 713.67 billion in 2024, driven by a 7% increase in operating income to IDR 13.39 trillion, contributed by its three main business lines. The company's improved performance reflects the successful implementation of operational optimization and efficiency strategies, with significant growth in its geoscience and reservoir services engineering business lines, and a 10.69% increase in total assets to IDR 10.6 trillion.

title: Barito Renewables Energy to Buy Back Up to 267.57 Million Shares Over Next Three Months
body: PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) will buy back up to IDR 2 trillion worth of its shares over the next three months, funded by its internal cash balance, which will reduce its total assets and equity by USD 123.74 million and USD 609.78 million, respectively. The buyback, which will not require shareholder approval, aims to respond to fluctuating market conditions, with the company's total issued shares recorded at 133.78 billion as of February 28, 2025.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Lifts Suspension on Two Issuers After Brief Trading Halt
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange has lifted the suspension on PT Wira Global Solusi Tbk (WGSH) and PT Agro Bahari Nusantara Tbk (UDNG) shares, which were halted on March 20, 2025, due to a sharp surge in their prices, with WGSH's share price soaring 40% last week and 79.82% last month, and UDNG's share price jumping 42.42% past week and 147.37% past month. The shares of both companies rose on the first trading session after the suspension was lifted, with WGSH gaining 4.08% to IDR 204 and UDNG rising 9.57% to IDR 103.

title: Directors of PT Akr Corporindo Increase Shareholdings with IDR 2 Billion Purchase
body: Directors of PT Akr Corporindo Tbk (AKRA) have increased their shareholding by 1.8 million shares valued at IDR 2 billion, with Jimmy Tandyo adding 1 million shares and Mery Sofi purchasing 800,000 shares. The share price of AKRA has corrected 3.93% over the past week and 10.57% over the past month, closing at IDR 1,100 on Friday.

title: Adhi Karya's Property Business Faces Challenges Amid Decreased Consumer Purchasing Power.
body: PT Adhi Karya Tbk (ADHI) reported a 5.11% increase in total inventory to Rp 5.97 trillion in 2024, driven by low sales realization in its two property projects, Urban Signature and Oase Park, which stood at 5% and 8%, respectively, due to declining consumer purchasing power. The company's secretary, Rozi Sparta, attributed the low sales to decreased consumer spending in 2024 and 2025.

title: Indonesian Government Achieves 39.1% of 2025 State Bond Target by Mid-March
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has issued over 30% of its 2025 state bond target, with a total of Rp 255.59 trillion realized as of March 18, 2025, equivalent to 39.1% of the Rp 645.56 trillion target in the 2025 State Budget. The Director General of Financing and Risk Management at the Ministry of Finance, Suminto, is optimistic that the government's debt financing target for 2025 will be met.

title: PT Indobuildco Fails to Vacate Hotel Sultan Despite Receiving Summons from Government
body: PT Indobuildco, the manager of Hotel Sultan owned by Pontjo Sutowo, has yet to vacate the premises despite receiving a summons from the State Secretariat Ministry in December 2024. The company's non-compliance with the summons has sparked concerns, with the Gelora Bung Karno Complex Management Center awaiting further action.

title: Moody's Maintains Indonesia's Sovereign Credit Rating at BAA2 with Stable Outlook
body: Moody's Investor Service has maintained Indonesia's sovereign credit rating at Baa2 with a stable outlook, citing the country's strong economy, stable economic growth, and solid monetary and fiscal policy credibility. The rating agency expects domestic demand, driven by household consumption and investment, to drive Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 and 2026.

title: Ministry of Public Works to Offer 30% Toll Discount on Certain Jasa Marga Toll Roads During 2025 Lebaran Mudik Period
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Public Works will offer a 30% toll tariff discount on certain toll roads owned by PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSRM) during the 2025 Eid al-Fitr holiday period, applicable during specific periods of outbound and inbound traffic. The toll discount, still considered situational, will be implemented during the return traffic period, aiming to alleviate congestion and facilitate smoother travel.

title: Gold Jewelry Sales Slump Ahead of Eid al-Fitr in Jakarta
body: Gold jewelry sales in Jakarta's stores have been sluggish two weeks before Eid al-Fitr, with transactions not much different from regular days, and sales have actually decreased compared to last year's Eid season, likely due to decreased purchasing power and waning consumer interest in gold jewelry. This decline in sales is a departure from the usual bustling activity seen in gold stores during the holiday season.

title: Corruption Suspicions in Energy and Mineral Resources Sector Grow with Discovery of Alleged Fuel Adulteration Case at Pertamina.
body: A corruption case involving Pertamina (PERTM) has been uncovered, highlighting the vulnerability of the energy and mineral resources sector to corruption due to its complex transactions and large transaction values. The sector's characteristics, including its involvement with state institutions and politicians, make it prone to corruption, with the potential for significant financial losses.

title: Investment in Stocks and Gold Remains Crucial for Indonesians Amid Economic Uncertainty
body: The Indonesian stock market's recent decline has a broader impact on the population than perceived, with 15.5 million individual investors, 1,650 pension funds, and 1,495 financial institutions invested in the market, including BPJS Ketenagakerjaan and BPJS Kesehatan. Meanwhile, the surging gold price, which reached a record high of IDR 1.78 million per gram, has made it difficult for individuals, especially housewives, to save for the future, highlighting the importance of investment for retirement.

title: Metropolitan Land Prepares Strategies to Develop Mall Business Amid Shift in Consumer Trends
body: PT Metropolitan Land Tbk is preparing strategies to develop its mall business, focusing on providing experiences and lifestyle beyond just retail. The company aims to adapt to the current trend of shopping centers shifting towards experiential and lifestyle-focused destinations.

title: Ministry of Public Works to Offer 30% Toll Discount on Certain Routes During 2025 Eid Al-Fitr Exodus
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Public Works will offer a 30% toll discount on certain toll roads owned by PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) during the 2025 Eid al-Fitr holiday, aiming to alleviate traffic congestion. Meanwhile, Jasa Marga will also increase toll tariffs on 12-14 toll roads, while other toll operators, such as Astra Infra Group and PT Citra Marga Lintas Jabar, will raise tariffs on their respective toll roads.

title: Government Encourages Banks to Increase Credit Distribution to Productive Sectors
body: The Indonesian government is pushing for more credit distribution to productive sectors, with banks such as Bank Sumsel Babel, Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) aiming to increase credit disbursement to these sectors, with targets including Rp 156 billion, Rp 3.3 trillion, and Rp 3 trillion, respectively. As of February 2025, Bank Negara Indonesia has disbursed Rp 1.69 trillion in credits, with a total of 7,500 micro, small, and medium enterprises (UMKM) receiving credits, and a 35% year-over-year increase in total credits.

title: E-commerce transactions in Indonesia expected to increase by 15-20% during Ramadan and Lebaran period.
body: Asosiasi E-commerce Indonesia projects a 15%-20% increase in e-commerce transactions during the Ramadan-Lebaran period in 2025 compared to the previous month, driven by high consumer demand and large discounts from marketplace tenants. The growth is also attributed to improved logistics services, which are expected to boost sales for businesses during this period.

title: DFI Retail Shifts Focus to Guardian and IKEA Business Lines After Stopping Hero Supermarket Operations
body: PT DFI Retail Nusantara Tbk (DFI) has shifted its business focus to developing its Guardian and IKEA lines after officially ceasing operations of Hero Supermarket at the end of 2024. The company, formerly known as PT Hero Supermarket Tbk, changed its name to PT DFI Retail Nusantara Tbk to reflect its new business direction.

title: Gold Price Reaches All-Time High in Indonesia, Surging 17% in Less Than a Quarter
body: Gold prices in Indonesia have reached an all-time high, with Antam's 1-gram gold selling for Rp 1,774 million on Thursday, a 17% increase of Rp 259,000 from the previous quarter. This marks a record high for gold prices in the country, with investors continuing to drive up demand.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Weakens This Week Due to Domestic Sentiment.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened this week, primarily due to domestic sentiment, with the currency depreciating 0.1% to IDR 16,502 per US dollar in the spot market on Friday, and 0.9% over the week. According to Bloomberg, the rupiah also weakened 0.12% to IDR 16,501 using the Jisdor rate.

title: Multifinance Companies See Increase in Cash Loan Demand Ahead of Idul Fitri
body: As the Idul Fitri holiday approaches, multifinance companies are seeing an increase in demand for cash loan services, prompting companies like PT Mandiri Utama Finance (MFIN) to aggressively market their products to meet their annual targets. The surge in demand is driven by higher financing needs for activities such as mudik preparations, household consumption, and seasonal business capital.

title: Adaro Shifts Focus to More Sustainable Businesses, Including Mineral and Renewable Energy.
body: PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (ADRO) is shifting its focus to more sustainable businesses, including metallurgical coal and mineral development, through its subsidiary PT Adaro Minerals Indonesia Tbk, and is also developing a large aluminum smelter project through PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry. The company is diversifying its business portfolio, moving away from thermal coal, and investing in renewable energy to ensure a more sustainable future.

title: Digital Banking Industry Sees Opportunity in Stock Market Downturn with High-Yield Savings Products
body: As the stock market plummets, digital banking industry sees an opportunity to offer high-yield savings products, with some digital banks offering a minimum 5% annual interest rate on deposits. Financial advisors recommend considering alternative investment instruments, such as gold, foreign currencies, and deposits, as a safer option during market volatility.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Closes in Red Zone, Down 1.94% on Friday and 3.95% for the Week.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 6,258.17 on Friday, down 1.94% from the previous day, and has fallen 3.95% over the past week. The decline marks a significant correction in the Indonesian stock market, with no specific company mentioned.

title: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Completes Initial Public Offering Period
body: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia has completed the initial offering period in its initial public offering (IPO) process on Friday, after conducting book building since Wednesday. The company, which will be listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange under the ticker code "FORE", has reached a significant milestone in its IPO journey.

title: Poultry Sector Stocks in Indonesia's LQ45 Index Show Strong Performance in 2024.
body: PT Japfa Comfeed Indonesia Tbk (JPFA) and PT Charoen Pokphand Indonesia Tbk (CPIN), two poultry companies listed on the LQ45 stock index, reported strong financial performance in 2024, with both companies experiencing growth in net profit. This positive trend is expected to continue, driven by their solid business fundamentals and industry prospects.

title: Four Companies Under Barito Group to Conduct Share Buyback Following New Regulation
body: Four companies under the Barito Group, owned by taipan Prajogo Pangestu, plan to conduct share buybacks, following the Financial Services Authority's new rule allowing companies to do so without holding a general meeting of shareholders. This move is part of a trend among Indonesian listed companies to repurchase their shares, with several companies already having done so.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia's Stock Price Continues to Plummet Despite Positive News of Bullion Bank Launch.
body: PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BRIS) stock price has continued to plummet, with a correction of -32.25% from February 25 to March 21, 2025, and a daily correction of -9.92% on March 20, 2025. The decline started a day before the inauguration of Bullion Bank on February 26, 2025, which was expected to be a positive event, but instead became a selling momentum.

title: Jakarta Stock Exchange Index Plunges 1.93% to 6,258.18 on Friday, Down 3.95% in a Week and 11.61% Since the Beginning of the Year.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 1.93% or 123.49 points to 6,258.18 on Friday, marking a 3.95% decline over the past week and an 11.61% drop since the beginning of the year. This significant downturn in the Indonesian stock market has raised concerns among investors and market analysts.

title: US Coal Production Decreases by 2.73% in 2023 Amid Trump's Fossil Fuel Push
body: The US is expected to increase its fossil fuel-based electricity production, which may benefit Indonesia's coal exports, as the country's 2023 coal production reached 577.95 million tons, a 2.73% decrease from 2022's 594.15 million tons. This development may have a positive impact on Indonesia's coal industry, potentially boosting exports to the US.

title: Indonesian Banking Industry Faces Challenges in Maintaining Net Interest Margin Amid High Funding Costs and Tight Liquidity.
body: Indonesia's banking industry faces a significant challenge in maintaining its net interest margin (NIM) due to high funding costs and tight liquidity, resulting in a decline in the industry's average NIM from 4.81% in 2023 to 4.62% in 2024. This decline reflects the various challenges faced by banks, including increasing funding costs and intensifying competition in the financial industry.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Sell of 78.92 Million Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Foreign investors on the Indonesia Stock Exchange ended the day with a net sell of 78.92 million shares, driven mainly by transactions in PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) shares, with 4.22 billion shares sold and 4.71 billion shares purchased. The top buys included PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) with a net buy of 176.44 million shares, PT Maharaksa Biru Energi Tbk with a net buy of 40.53 million shares, and PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) with a net buy of almost 34 million shares.

title: Goto Gojek Tokopedia and Bumi Resources top Indonesia's net foreign buy list for second consecutive day.
body: PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) maintained its top spot on the net foreign buy list for the second consecutive day, recording a net foreign buy of 486.60 million shares, with a stable stock price of IDR 81. PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) took the runner-up position, recording a net foreign buy of 176.44 million shares, with its stock price increasing by IDR 1 to IDR 90.

title: PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry to Conduct Share Buyback Worth IDR 1.67 Trillion to Stabilize Stock Price.
body: PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company Tbk (ULTJ) will conduct a share buyback with a maximum allocation of IDR 1.67 trillion, equivalent to up to 10% of its paid-up capital, using its internal funds to maintain stock market stability and increase shareholder value. The share buyback will take place from March 24 to June 23, 2025, and the repurchased shares will be held as treasury shares for a maximum of three years, in accordance with OJK Regulation 29/2023.

title: Bank Jatim to Maintain Dividend Distribution Despite 12% Decrease in Net Profit in 2024
body: Bank Jatim (BJTM) recorded a 12% decline in net profit to IDR 1.30 trillion in 2024, mainly due to an 88% increase in provisioning, but reaffirmed its commitment to distribute dividends to shareholders, with a potential increase in the dividend amount. The bank's dividend payout ratio may need to be raised above 55% to maintain its consistent dividend payment history, with a final decision to be made at the general meeting of shareholders on April 24, 2025.

title: Fore Kopi Indonesia records 135% sales growth in September 2024, targets 50% revenue increase in 2025.
body: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk (FORE) recorded a 135.27% increase in sales to IDR727 billion in September 2024, compared to IDR309 billion in the same period last year, and is targeting 50% revenue growth in 2025 after its initial public offering. To achieve this target, the company plans to add around 140 new outlets by 2026, with at least 72 new outlets opening this year, and is offering 1.88 billion shares to raise funds up to IDR379.76 billion for operational strengthening and business expansion.

title: Researchers Develop Sustainable Building Material from Palm Oil Waste, Creating New Economic Opportunities
body: Research conducted by Ahmad, Ph.D. from Ujungpandang State-Owned Polytechnic College has discovered that empty palm fruit bunches, a biomass waste from palm oil industries, can be processed into building materials, such as house ceiling, with a potential economic benefit of adding value to palm biomass waste. With Indonesia being the world's largest producer of palm oil, this research has huge potential to increase economic benefits, with 23.3 tons of empty palm bunches per hectare per year, and could lead to self-sufficiency in downstream technology and raw materials.

title: Housewife Struggles to Prepare for Eid Celebration Amid Financial Uncertainty
body: As the Eid al-Fitr celebration approaches, Indonesian consumers like Retno are busy preparing for the holiday, but are also worried about their financial situation, with delayed salary payments and tempting promotions from credit cards and paylater services. Amidst the festive atmosphere, consumers are faced with financial pressures, highlighting the importance of responsible spending and budgeting during the holiday season.

title: Electric Vehicle Users Expected to Increase During Idul Fitri Holiday Season
body: As the Idulfitri holiday approaches, the number of electric vehicle users traveling during the mudik season is expected to surge this year, driven by the increasing adoption of electric cars and improved infrastructure and ecosystem. The government is also providing special attention to electric vehicle users, with the Energy and Mineral Resources Minister noting a significant increase in electric vehicle sales recently.

title: Pertamina Trans Kontinental Prepares Marine Services and 453 Vessels to Support Fuel Distribution During 2025 Eid al-Fitr Period
body: PT Pertamina Trans Kontinental (PTK) is preparing 453 vessels to support fuel distribution during the 2025 Eid al-Fitr period, ensuring a steady supply of fuel to meet public demand. The company's marine services will play a crucial role in strengthening national energy supply, particularly during Ramadan and the Eid al-Fitr celebrations.

title: Government Imposes 16-Day Operational Restriction on Goods Transportation to Reduce Congestion During Lebaran Period
body: The Indonesian government's 16-day restriction on cargo transportation during the Lebaran period, from March 24 to April 8, 2025, is expected to increase operational costs and potentially delay supply chain deliveries to various regions, according to the Indonesian Logistics Association. This restriction, aimed at reducing traffic congestion, may burden the logistics sector, leading to higher costs and potential delays.

title: Coal Mining Companies with Special Mining Licenses May Be Exempt from Royalty Tariff Hike
body: The Indonesian government is considering exempting coal companies with special mining permits from the proposed increase in royalty tariffs to ensure the sustainability of their operations. The Deputy Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, suggests that adjusting or reducing the tariff could be a solution for companies that have been paying relatively high royalties amidst increasing production costs.

title: E-commerce transactions in Indonesia expected to increase by 15-20% during Ramadan and Lebaran period.
