body: Asosiasi E-commerce Indonesia projects a 15%-20% increase in e-commerce transactions during the Ramadan-Lebaran period in 2025 compared to the previous month, driven by high consumer demand and large discounts from marketplace tenants. The growth is also attributed to improved logistics efficiency, which is expected to boost sales for businesses during this period.

title: Melissa Siska Juminto's Career Journey in Indonesia's E-commerce Industry
body: Melissa Siska Juminto, a prominent figure in Indonesia's e-commerce industry, was appointed as President Director of Bytedance's e-commerce division in 2024, leading Tokopedia and ShopeeTokopedia, and responsible for the growth of Bytedance's e-commerce business in Indonesia. Under her leadership, the company aims to drive business growth and expansion in the Indonesian market.

title: Fore Coffee Indonesia plans to raise Rp 379.8 billion in IPO to accelerate expansion in country's fast-growing premium coffee market.
body: Fore Kopi Indonesia (FORE) is planning an initial public offering on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, aiming to raise Rp 379.8 billion by offering 1.88 billion shares, or 21.08% of its enlarged capital, with a price range of Rp 160-Rp 202 per share. The company plans to allocate 76% of the IPO proceeds towards expanding its store footprint, targeting 140 new outlets over the next two years, and has seen robust financial growth, with net sales surging 135% year-over-year to Rp 727 billion in September 2024.

title: Government Faces Challenges in Boosting Tax Ratio Amid Sluggish Economy
body: President Prabowo Subianto has urged his ministers to increase the tax ratio to 23% of the country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP), but this goal may be challenging to achieve due to the current sluggish economic conditions. The government's efforts to boost the tax ratio will be hindered by the economic downturn, making it difficult to reach the desired target.

title: INTP Reports 7% Revenue Growth Driven by Cement and Ready-Mix Concrete Sales
body: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) reported a 7% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 18.54 trillion, driven by a 3.21% growth in cement sales to IDR 16.71 trillion and a 14.71% increase in ready-mix concrete sales to IDR 1.56 trillion. The company's sales volume grew 8.4% to 18.9 million tonnes in 2024, supported by the acquisition of Semen Grobogan, according to President Director Christian Kartawijaya.

title: Foreign investors withdraw IDR 28.10 trillion from Indonesian stock market, redirect funds to SBN and SRBI instruments.
body: Foreign investors have withdrawn IDR 28.10 trillion from the Indonesian stock market since the beginning of the year until March 20, 2025, but have redirected IDR 23.87 trillion to SBN instruments and IDR 8.58 trillion to SRBI instruments. Meanwhile, Indonesia's 5-year credit default swap premium has risen to 88.51 basis points, signaling higher risk, prompting Bank Indonesia to strengthen coordination with the government to optimize its policy mix strategy.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 19.48% in Five Months Amid Government's Investment Targets
body: The Jakarta Composite Stock Price Index (JCI) has fallen 19.48% over the past five months, closing at 6,258.18 last week, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR33.18 trillion, contributing to the 11.61% year-to-date decline. The Indonesian government aims to reach IDR1,905 trillion in investment realisation in 2025, a 15.5% increase from 2024, but experts warn that the government needs to maintain a conducive capital market climate to support the country's economic health.

title: Global Oil Prices Surge to Two-Week High Following US Sanctions on Iran and OPEC+ Production Cuts.
body: Global oil prices surged to their highest level in two weeks, with Brent oil prices rising 0.2% to $72.16 per barrel and West Texas Intermediate (WTI) prices increasing 0.3% to $68.28 per barrel, driven by US sanctions on Iran and OPEC+ production cuts. The sanctions are expected to reduce Iran's oil exports by 1 million barrels per day, while OPEC+ members plan to cut production by 189,000-435,000 barrels per day until June 2026, further supporting the price increase.

title: Government Prepares to Establish Special Economic Zone with Family Office to Boost Financial Sector
body: The Indonesian government is planning to develop a special economic zone with a financial center equipped with a family office, following discussions with global investors including Ray Dalio, to address the country's financial sector challenges. The country still lags behind its neighbors in terms of banking asset ratio, capital market capitalization, and insurance assets to GDP, and the new strategy aims to bridge this gap.

title: Financial Market Pressure in Indonesia Expected to Continue Due to Domestic Factors
body: The Indonesian financial market is expected to face continued pressure in the second quarter of this year due to domestic factors such as dividend payments abroad and government debt repayment, which will lead to a decline in the value of the rupiah. The rupiah is predicted to weaken and potentially exceed IDR 16,000 per US dollar, according to Piter Abdullah Redjalam, Executive Director of Segara Institute.

title: Indonesia's Credit Default Swap Rises, Increasing Government Foreign Debt Issuance Costs
body: Indonesia's credit default swap (CDS) has increased, indicating a higher risk of default, with the 5-year CDS rising to 91.66, up 11.08% in the past week, 28.82% in the past month, and 30.42% in the past six months. This increase in CDS may lead to higher borrowing costs for the government, making it more expensive to issue foreign-denominated debt.

title: Gojek Starts Distributing Eid Bonuses to Partner Drivers in Five Categories
body: Gojek (GOTO) has started distributing bonuses to its driver partners, with the top category, "Mitra Juara Utama", receiving around 20% of their average net income. The company has categorized its driver partners into five groups to determine the bonus amount, with the aim of rewarding their hard work during the holiday season.

title: Hotel Industry in Indonesia Faces Significant Challenges Due to Government Budget Cuts and Decreased Consumer Spending.
body: The Indonesian hotel industry is facing significant challenges this year, primarily due to the government's budget cut policy and decreased consumer purchasing power, which is expected to reduce hotel occupancy rates. As a result, hotel businesses may be forced to halt operations, leading to layoffs, with many hotels already experiencing revenue losses from reduced government travel and event bookings.

title: PT Pupuk Indonesia Ensures National Fertilizer Stock Availability Ahead of Eid al-Fitr 2025
body: PT Pupuk Indonesia (PUPUK) has ensured a sufficient national fertilizer stock of 1.63 million tons, comprising 1.19 million tons of subsidized fertilizer and 445,000 tons of non-subsidized fertilizer, ahead of Idul Fitri 1446 Hijriah or Lebaran 2025. The subsidized fertilizer stock consists of 581,000 tons of urea, 552,000 tons of NPK, 22,000 tons of special NPK formula, and 33,000 tons of organic fertilizer, while the non-subsidized fertilizer stock includes 361,000 tons of urea and 84,000 tons of NPK.

title: ExxonMobil Cepu Limited targets drilling five new wells in Banyu Urip field by end of this year.
body: ExxonMobil Cepu Limited (EMCL) targets to drill five new wells in the Banyu Urip field, Cepu block, by the end of this year, adding to the seven wells currently being drilled, with two already operational since 2024, producing an additional 14,000 barrels per day. The new drilling program is expected to further increase production, with EMCL aiming to complete the program before year-end.

title: Indonesian Government Forms Task Force to Accelerate Green Energy and Economy Transition
body: The Indonesian government has formed a task force, Satuan Tugas Transisi Energi dan Ekonomi Hijau, to accelerate the country's transition to green energy and economy, aiming to synchronize policies, speed up licensing, and resolve obstacles across ministries, agencies, and local governments. This move is expected to drive economic growth and investment in the country, with no specific financial metrics mentioned in the article.

title: Government Prioritizes Fossil Energy Sector Development Over Renewable Energy Investments
body: The Indonesian government is accelerating the development of fossil energy sector, including building a 500,000-barrel oil refinery in Sumatra, and investing in coal hilirisasi to produce dimethyl ether as a substitute for liquefied petroleum gas. The government's focus on fossil energy has shifted investment priorities, pushing renewable energy projects to the second wave, according to Eniya Listiani Dewi, Director General of New and Renewable Energy and Energy Conservation at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Closes Week with 3.95% Decline Amidst Hopes for Government Intervention
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 1.94% or 123 points to 6,258.17 on Friday, marking a 3.95% decline over the week, as investors await government measures to boost market confidence. According to Alrich Paskalis, an investment advisor at Phintraco Sekuritas, the market is still hoping for a solution from the Indonesian government to improve investor confidence in the capital market.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 1.94% Amid Foreign Net Sell Pressure
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 1.94% to 6,258.17 on Friday, marking a 3.95% decline over the week, as foreign investors continued to sell off Indonesian stocks, with a net sell of IDR 2.35 trillion on Friday and IDR 11 trillion over the past two weeks. Amidst this decline, analysts have provided recommendations for stocks to watch, including Barito Pacific (no ticker mentioned).

title: Global Crude Oil Prices Surge Following OPEC+ Plan to Cut Production
body: Global crude oil prices surged, with West Texas Intermediate recording the highest weekly gain since the start of the year, driven by OPEC+'s plan to cut oil production by 189,000-435,000 barrels per day from seven member countries until mid-year. The production cut is expected to support oil prices, which have been rising since the announcement on Thursday.

title: Indonesian Industrial Zone Performance Expected to Improve Amid US-China Trade War, Despite Domestic Challenges.
body: The performance of industrial area issuers is expected to improve due to the potential relocation of companies from the US-China trade war, which drove many companies to relocate to Southeast Asia, including Indonesia, in 2018-2019. However, domestic challenges are expected to hinder the growth prospects of these issuers, despite the increased demand for industrial areas during that period.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Expected to Continue Weakening Due to Federal Reserve Interest Rate and Anticipation of Long Lebaran Holiday.
body: The Indonesian rupiah is expected to continue its decline at the start of the week, pressured by the Federal Reserve's maintained interest rate and anticipation of the long Lebaran holiday, with the spot rupiah weakening 0.1% to IDR 16,502 per US dollar. The rupiah also depreciated 0.12% to IDR 16,501 per US dollar in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) at Bank Indonesia.

title: E-commerce transactions in Indonesia expected to increase by 15-20% during Ramadan and Lebaran 2025.
body: Asosiasi E-commerce Indonesia predicts a 15%-20% increase in e-commerce transactions in Indonesia during Ramadan and Lebaran 2025 compared to the previous month, driven by high consumer demand and numerous promotions and discounts from marketplaces. This growth is also attributed to improved logistics services, which are expected to contribute to the surge in online transactions during the festive period.

title: Bank Indonesia's Lower Interest Rate Fails to Reduce Credit Rates, Which Remain High at 9.23% in January 2025
body: Bank Indonesia has lowered interest rates to 5.75% at the beginning of the year, but credit interest rates have not followed suit, with the average basic credit rate (SBDK) in January 2025 standing at 9.23%, up 5 basis points from the previous month. The highest increase was seen in state-owned banks' SBDK, which rose 6 basis points to 9.66%.

title: Minister of Transportation reports increase in mudik traffic on Jakarta-Cikampek and Jakarta-Merak toll roads ahead of Lebaran holiday.
body: As of last weekend, there has been an increase in traffic on Jakarta's toll roads, with 134 rest areas and service points available across 75 operational toll roads in Indonesia, and an additional 192.85 km of operational toll roads expected to be added during the 2025 mudik season. Meanwhile, Bulog has absorbed over 400,000 tons of unhusked rice, with no specific financial metrics mentioned for the toll road operations.

title: Perum Bulog Absorbs Over 400,000 Tons of Rice and Paddy from Farmers in January-March 2025.
body: Perum Bulog, a state-owned enterprise in the food sector, has absorbed over 400,000 tons of rice and paddy equivalent from farmers from January to March 2025, as part of its efforts to support farmers throughout the year. This achievement was announced by Marga Taufiq, Deputy Director of Perum Bulog, during a harvest festival in Klaten, Central Java, last week.

title: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara to Announce Complete Personnel Today
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara is expected to announce its complete personnel today, as announced by Minister of Investment/Head of Investment Coordinating Board Rosan P. Roeslani, who also serves as CEO of BPI Danareksa (no ticker available). The announcement is expected to provide insight into the company's leadership and potential impact on its investment strategies and financial performance.

title: Bank BUMN's Shareholders Meeting to Influence Banking Stock Movement Ahead of Lebaran Holiday
body: The upcoming annual general meeting of state-owned banks in Indonesia is expected to influence the stock prices of banking shares, with strategic decisions made during the meeting potentially catalyzing price movements. Investors are eagerly awaiting the meeting, which will also discuss dividend distribution and changes to the board of directors, and is the first time Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Andalan Nusantara is involved in the meeting.

title: Multifinance Industry Faces Challenges in Early 2025 as Loan Growth Slows Down
body: Multifinance companies are facing a challenging start to 2025, with a slowdown in loan growth since the end of Q3 2024, from 10.5% in August 2024 to 6.04% in January 2025, according to Financial Services Authority data. To stay competitive, multifinance companies need to actively seek market opportunities as vehicle sales remain sluggish.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls 3.95% in Third Week of March 2025.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 3.95% in the third week of March 2025, closing at 6,258.18, with a weekly low of 6,011.84 and a high of 6,557.41. The index's decline marks a significant drop in the Indonesian stock market, with no specific company mentioned as a major contributor to the decline.

title: Indonesia's Credit Default Swap Premium Rises to 91.66, Signaling Higher Investment Risk.
body: Indonesia's credit default swap (CDS) premium, a measure of investment risk, has surged to 91.66, indicating a higher risk of investing in the country, in line with the weakening trend of the composite stock price index. The CDS premium has been rising, up from 89.67 the previous day and 91.64 on Friday, according to World Government Bonds data.

title: Fintech Lending Providers Seek to Boost Productive Loans Following Regulatory Increase in Loan Ceiling.
body: Fintech lending providers are leveraging the increased loan ceiling provided by the Financial Services Authority (OJK) to promote productive loans, enabling them to serve a wider range of entrepreneurs with higher loan values. The OJK has raised the productive loan limit for fintech from IDR 2 billion to IDR 5 billion per loan since the beginning of the year, allowing fintech lending to expand its services.

title: Gojek to Distribute Bonus to Partner Drivers in Indonesia Through Gopay Saldo.
body: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) is set to distribute bonuses to its driver partners across Indonesia, with the bonus to be disbursed through the Gopay driver balance starting Saturday. This move is expected to benefit the company's driver partners, providing them with a financial boost during the holiday season.

title: Historical Trend Shows Jakarta Stock Exchange Index Strengthens Ahead of Eid al-Fitr Holidays
body: Historically, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) tends to strengthen in the last week of trading before the Idul Fitri holiday, as seen in 2023 and 2024 when it rose 0.05% and 0.45%, respectively. This trend is expected to continue in the last week of trading before the 2025 Idul Fitri holiday, according to Oktavianus Audi, VP Marketing, Strategy, and Planning at Kiwoom Sekuritas (no ticker symbol mentioned).

title: Jakarta to Introduce New Commuter Trains Imported from China After Track Trials
body: KAI Commuter, Jakarta's railway operator, is set to introduce 12 new electric commuter trains imported from China, which are currently undergoing track trials before deployment, to address growing demand and limited production capacity at Indonesia's state-owned train manufacturer INKA. The new trains, which will not be ready for service during the upcoming Eid holidays, will increase KAI Commuter's fleet to 101 train sets, serving around 1 million passengers on weekdays in the Greater Jakarta area.

title: Jakarta Composite Index extends losing streak amid global and local uncertainties.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) fell 1.94% to 6,258.1 on Friday, extending its losing streak, as investors reacted to US economic data, China policy uncertainties, and FTSE rebalancing, with 476 stocks declining and 135 advancing. The index has faced sustained pressure since Tuesday's 5% plunge, attributed to mass layoffs, credit rating concerns, and recent downgrades by Goldman Sachs (GS) and Morgan Stanley (MS), which have shaken investor confidence.

title: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto Launches Batang Industropolis, Aiming to Create Indonesia's Version of China's Shenzhen.
body: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto has launched Batang Industropolis, a 4,300-hectare special economic zone in Central Java, which has already attracted 27 investors with investments reaching Rp 17.95 trillion and aims to record at least Rp 60 trillion in investments within the next four to five years. The government will offer incentives, including easier licensing processes and corporate income tax deductions, to companies setting up production plants in the zone, which has created 7,008 job opportunities so far.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Plunges 1.55% to 6,161.22, Down 12.98% Since the Start of the Year.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 1.55% or 96.96 points to 6,161.22 at the close of trading on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Monday, marking a 4.8% decline over the past week and a 12.98% drop since the beginning of the year.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Sell of 101.72 Million Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Foreign investors on the Indonesia Stock Exchange recorded a net sell of 101.72 million shares, with PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) experiencing the largest net sell of 383.57 million shares, followed by PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) with a net sell of 65.35 million shares. On the other hand, PT Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA) saw the largest net buy of 86.46 million shares, followed by PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS) with a net buy of 60 million shares.

title: Darma Henwa and Bumi Resources Minerals top Indonesia's stock market with highest net foreign buys on Monday.
body: PT Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA) topped the list of net buys on the Indonesian stock market on Monday, with foreign investors buying 86.46 million shares, while PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS) secured the runner-up position with 59.54 million shares bought. DEWA's shares fell 6.73% to IDR 97 per share, while BRMS' shares dropped 6.47% to IDR 318 per share, despite being among the most bought stocks by foreign investors.

title: PT Steel Pipe Industry Indonesia Allocates IDR 25 Billion to Repurchase Up to 83.33 Million Shares
body: PT Steel Pipe Industry Indonesia Tbk (ISSP) has allocated IDR 25 billion to repurchase up to 83.33 million shares at a maximum price of IDR 300 per share, with the buyback period commencing from Monday until June 24, 2025. The company's internal cash will fund the buyback, which aims to address the undervaluation of its shares, with the stock currently trading at IDR 248, down 10.79% over the week and 4.62% over the month.

title: Mark Dynamics Indonesia reports 84% increase in net profit to IDR 287 billion in 2024 driven by strong export sales.
body: PT Mark Dynamics Indonesia Tbk reported an 84% increase in net profit to IDR 287 billion in 2024, surpassing management's target of IDR 250 billion, driven by export sales of IDR 756 billion, which contributed 93% to total sales. The company's strong performance was attributed to significant demand for glove products, particularly from export markets such as Malaysia, Thailand, and China, as well as the benefits of the US tariff policy on the domestic industry.

title: PT Temas Allocates IDR 3 Trillion for Fleet Expansion and Decarbonization Efforts by 2025
body: PT Temas Tbk (TMAS) has allocated IDR 3 trillion for capital expenditure in 2025 to expand its fleet, acquire equipment, and support its subsidiaries, aiming to optimize performance and strengthen competitiveness in the shipping logistics industry. The company has also initiated a decarbonization program to support the government's goal of achieving net-zero emissions by 2060 and established a training hub to focus on crew training and education.

title: Number of companies utilizing relaxed share buyback policy increases, with total prepared funds nearing Rp 9 trillion.
body: A growing number of listed companies are taking advantage of the relaxed buyback policy, with over 15 companies preparing to buy back their shares, totaling nearly IDR 9 trillion in funds. The policy, which allows companies to buy back shares without holding a general meeting of shareholders, aims to improve liquidity, according to Iman Rachman, Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: PT Superior Prima Sukses Tbk Switches to Renewable Energy by Integrating Solar Panels in All Factories.
body: PT Superior Prima Sukses Tbk (BLES) has shifted to renewable energy by integrating solar panels into its production facilities, aiming to reduce energy consumption and produce more environmentally friendly products. This move is part of the company's efforts to increase energy efficiency and reduce its environmental impact.

title: End of Electricity Tariff Discount Effect May Boost Inflation Rate
body: The end of the electricity tariff discount is expected to boost inflation in the country, although weak consumer demand will likely keep inflation rates moderate after the Eid holiday. The discount, which was implemented by the government in January and February 2025, was a major factor in the monthly deflation seen in the first two months of the year.

title: Indonesia's Fishery Trade Surplus Increases to 9.1% in 2024
body: In 2024, Indonesia's Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries achieved a 9.1% increase in the trade surplus of fishery commodities, driven by a 5.7% increase in export value to $5.95 billion and a 19.8% decrease in import value compared to the previous year. This significant improvement in trade balance is a notable achievement for the ministry.

title: Over 10.46 million taxpayers submit annual income tax returns, a 5.91% increase from the same period last year.
body: As of March 24, 2025, 10.46 million taxpayers have submitted their annual income tax returns, a 5.91% increase from the same period last year, with 296,000 corporate and 10.17 million individual submissions. This timely submission reflects the community's compliance and love for the country, according to Director of Tax Counseling, Service, and Public Relations, Dwi Astuti.

title: Government to Improve Tax Ratio by Incorporating Informal Sector into Financial System
body: The Indonesian government aims to increase the tax ratio to GDP by incorporating the informal sector into the financial system, with President Prabowo Subianto urging citizens to open bank accounts to achieve inclusive finance. This move is part of a broader effort to boost tax revenue, with the government seeking to improve financial metrics and promote economic growth.

title: Over 14 listed companies prepare to buy back their shares worth nearly IDR 9 trillion following relaxation of buyback policy.
body: More than 14 listed companies are preparing to buy back their shares, with a total value of nearly IDR 9 trillion, following the Financial Services Authority's policy allowing share buybacks without a general meeting of shareholders. The policy aims to improve liquidity, according to Iman Rachman, Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Continues to Fluctuate Amid Sentimental Pressures
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) plummeted 4.6% below the psychological level of 6,000 on Monday, eventually closing at 6,161.22, a 1.55% decline from the previous day, as investors remain cautious amid fluctuating market sentiments.

title: PT Cisadane Sawit Raya Sees Bright Prospects for Palm Oil Industry with Significant Growth Opportunities
body: PT Cisadane Sawit Raya Tbk expects the palm oil industry to have a bright prospect this year with significant growth opportunities, driven by a 7.2% increase in crude palm oil prices to MYR 4,500 per ton. The Indonesian palm oil sector is projected to experience rapid growth by 2025, driven by the rising prices of crude palm oil.

title: Rupiah Weakens to Rp 16,568 per US Dollar Amid Investor Caution Over Trump's Tariff Policy.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.39% to Rp 16,568 per US dollar in the spot market and 0.36% to Rp 16,561 per dollar according to Jisdor BI, amid investor caution ahead of the next round of tariffs from President Donald Trump's policy. The uncertainty is boosting the US dollar, causing the rupiah to plummet, with no company-specific financial metrics mentioned in the article.

title: XL Axiata and Smartfren Telecom Merger to Boost Company Prospects
body: The merger between PT XL Axiata Tbk (EXCL) and PT Smartfren Telecom Tbk (FREN) is expected to boost the prospects of the merged company, potentially increasing its margin in the future by enhancing its service infrastructure. The merger plan has received approval from the Financial Services Authority (OJK) and Axiata Group Berhad's shareholders, paving the way for the deal to move forward.

title: Offshore mutual fund performance in Q1 2025 fluctuates amid US dollar depreciation.
body: In Q1 2025, the performance of offshore mutual funds was volatile due to the depreciation of the US dollar, which led to a correction in the dollar index and negatively impacted dollar-based assets. Despite this, fixed-income mutual funds still managed to generate positive returns, with Syailendra Liberty Fund producing the highest return of 2.23% year-to-date and 2.11% year-on-year as of March 21, 2025.

title: Indonesian Toll Road Authority to Adjust Toll Fees After Eid al-Fitr 2025
body: The Indonesian government's toll road regulator announced that several toll roads in Indonesia will experience tariff adjustments after the 2025 Eid al-Fitr holiday, citing previously established regulations. The tariff adjustment, initially planned for Ramadan, was postponed to reduce the burden on the public during the holy month.

title: Presidential Communication Office and Fiscal Policy Agency Meet with Market Analysts Amid Stock Market Downturn
body: The Indonesian Presidential Communication Office and the Ministry of Finance's Fiscal Policy Agency met with market analysts and economists at the Presidential Palace in Jakarta, amidst a decline in the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) due to negative sentiments, which fell 1.55% to 6,161.22 on Monday. The meeting aimed to address concerns and stabilize the market, which had briefly dipped below the 6,000 level before the announcement of the new management structure of the Investment Management Agency, Daya Anagata Nusantara.

title: Indonesia Secures $1.1 Billion in International Funding for 54 Clean Energy Transition Projects
body: The Indonesian government has secured $1.1 billion in international funding commitments for 54 projects under the Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP), with 9 projects receiving loan or equity funding and 45 projects receiving $233 million in grants. Additionally, the government has obtained a $1 billion guarantee from multilateral development banks to accelerate the realization of clean energy transition projects.

title: Government to Establish and Strengthen State-Owned Enterprise Agrinas to Boost Food Security
body: The Indonesian government plans to form and strengthen state-owned enterprise (SOE) Agrinas, which will become the backbone of food security, through the transformation of three SOEs: PT Virama Karya, PT Yodya Karya, and PT Indra Karya. The three SOEs will change their names to PT Agrinas Jaladri Nusantara, PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara, and PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara, respectively, and focus on the food, plantation, and fisheries sectors.

title: Economic Pressure Causes Decrease in Car Rental Business Ahead of Idul Fitri 2025
body: The economic pressure has led to a significant decline in car rental business ahead of Idul Fitri 2025, as people reduce their consumption and mobility. According to the Indonesian Car Rental Entrepreneurs Association, this year's Lebaran momentum is different from previous years, resulting in a notable downturn in the car rental industry.

title: Pertamina Geothermal Energy's Lumut Balai Area Exceeds 2024 Electricity Production Target by 13.33%.
body: PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk's Lumut Balai area has produced 482,064,456.13 kWh of electricity in 2024, exceeding its 2024 target by 13.33%. The area operates a 55 MW geothermal power plant, Unit 1, which has been in operation since 2019, contributing to the achievement of this production milestone.

title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Receives Copper Concentrate Export Permit Application from PT Amman Mineral Internasional.
body: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has received a request from PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMAN) to export copper concentrate, but it has not been granted due to the absence of force majeure circumstances, unlike PT Freeport Indonesia. The ministry's Director General of Mineral and Coal, Tri Winarno, stated that there is no relaxation of export rules, and only force majeure events such as fires or insurance claims can permit exports.

title: Government to Implement Higher Royalty Tariffs for Mineral and Coal Products Soon
body: The Indonesian government is set to implement a royalty rate hike for minerals and coal, with the policy expected to be finalized before Eid 2025, which could make Indonesia's royalty rates the highest among mineral-producing countries. According to the Indonesia Mining Association, current copper royalty rates in Indonesia range from 10%-17%, 7%-10%, and 4%-7%, and an increase could significantly impact the industry.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold Prepares to Launch Gold Mining Project in Pani by Early 2026
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MRDE) is accelerating the development of its Pani gold project, with mining preparations expected to be completed by the end of this year and first gold production scheduled for Q1-2026. The project is part of the company's expansion into the gold and nickel commodity business segments, which is expected to yield significant results.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Fluctuates, Rebounds After Initial 4.65% Plunge
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) fluctuated on Monday, initially plummeting 4.65% to 5,967.19 before rebounding to close the day with a 1.55% decline to 6,161.21 points. The index briefly fell below the psychological level of 6,000 before recovering, ending the trading session with a moderate loss.

title: Government Announces New Board Members of Danareksa Investment Management Body
body: The Indonesian government officially announced the composition of the management of Danareksa (no ticker), a state-owned investment management company, with two former presidents, Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono and Joko Widodo, appointed as members of the supervisory board. The announcement was made by Danareksa's CEO, Rosan Roeslani, at the Cimb Niaga building in South Jakarta.

title: Bank Credit Flow to Coal Industry Remains Strong with 24.29% Annual Growth
body: Bank credit to the coal industry in Indonesia shows no signs of decline, with corporate credit growing 15.88% year-over-year and mining sector credit surging 24.29% year-over-year. This indicates a strong demand for credit from the coal industry, which has been dubbed "black gold".

title: Indonesian Life Insurance Industry Faces Challenges in 2025, Premium Growth Expected to be Limited.
body: Indonesia's life insurance industry is expected to face challenges in the first quarter of 2025, making it difficult for premium revenue to grow significantly. Despite this, the industry's efforts to adapt to economic dynamics and raise public awareness of the importance of life insurance could help maintain premium revenue.

title: Indonesia's Central Government Debt Reaches Rp 8.909 Trillion, Sparking Concerns of Economic Crisis
body: Indonesia's central government debt reached Rp 8.909,14 trillion as of January 31, 2025, a 1.21% increase from December 2024, with the government expected to continue borrowing to pay off debts worth Rp 800,33 trillion due in 2025. Meanwhile, the stock market has been affected, with PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) shares plummeting 42.24% year-on-year, causing over 500,000 retail investors to incur losses.

title: Renewable Energy Developers in Indonesia Report Mixed Financial Performance in 2024
body: PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BARE) reported a 13.67% year-over-year increase in net profit to $122.20 million in 2024, while PT Arkora Hydro Tbk (ARKO) and PT Kencana Energi Lestari Tbk (KELE) saw their net profits decline by 20.02% to IDR 41.80 billion and 51.74% to $6.23 million, respectively, in the same period.

title: BI-Fast transactions surge 25% annually, boosting commission revenue for banks.
body: Bank Indonesia's fast payment service, BI-FAST, has seen significant growth, with PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BBTN) reporting over 7.9 million transactions in the first two months of 2025, a 25% year-over-year increase, resulting in a 7% annual increase in commission revenue. This growth is consistent across most banks, indicating a shift towards digital payment systems.

title: PT Vale Indonesia to Develop Two High-Pressure Acid Leach Smelter Projects with Total Production Capacity of 180,000 Tons of Nickel by 2027.
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk is developing two high-pressure acid leach smelter projects in Bahodopi and Morowali, expected to produce a total of 180,000 tons of HPAL nickel by 2027, with an investment of USD 9 billion (IDR 130 trillion). The Bahodopi smelter, already 80% complete, is expected to be fully operational by the end of this year, while the Morowali smelter, currently 18% complete, is projected to be finished by Q4 2026.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold's Pani Gold Mine in Gorontalo to Begin Operations in Q1 2026 with Expected Annual Production of 80,000-100,000 Ounces.
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) aims to start operations at its Pani gold mine in Q1 2026, with initial production expected to contribute around 80,000-100,000 ounces of gold per year, significantly boosting the company's gold production. The mine, projected to become one of Indonesia's largest primary gold mines, contains an estimated 303.1 million tons of ore with a total gold content of 6.9 million ounces, according to feasibility studies and drilling results since 2022.

title: Amman Mineral to Commence Copper Cathode Production by End of March 2025
body: PT Amman Mineral Internasional's subsidiary, PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara, is set to commence its first copper cathode production by the end of March 2025, following a successful production of copper anode on February 12, 2025. Throughout 2024, the company recorded significant increases in mining productivity and production of copper, gold, and concentrate, exceeding performance guidance by 6%, 7%, and 6%, respectively, and maintained its position as one of the world's lowest-cost copper producers.

title: Indonesia sees opportunity to export coal to US following Trump's fossil fuel push
body: Indonesia has an opportunity to export coal to the United States after President Donald Trump announced plans to increase electricity production from fossil fuels, with US coal exports to Indonesia rising 149% to 1.46 million tons in January-September 2024. Meanwhile, US coal production declined to 384,131 tons in January-September 2024, down from 437,122 tons in the same period last year, with coal accounting for about 15% of electricity generation in the US.

title: Indonesia Expects $31.82 Billion Investment in Coal Downstreaming to Reduce LPG Imports and Boost Economy
body: Indonesia's downstream coal industry is expected to reach USD 31.82 billion in potential value, generating USD 2.26 billion in GDP and increasing exports by USD 11.3 billion, while also creating 23,160 jobs. The government's strategy to reduce dependence on liquefied petroleum gas imports aims to substitute with domestic products, such as dimethyl ether, methanol, and coke/semi-coke, to cut imports and boost the economy.

title: Antam to Strengthen Digitalization Strategy for Gold Amid Soaring Prices and Global Uncertainties
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) is increasing its digitalization strategy for gold amidst soaring prices, driven by global uncertainties and inflation, with the price of 1 gram of Antam gold reaching IDR 1,745,000/gram, a new record. The company is developing a mobile application platform for its Brankas program, a digital physical gold investment service, to offer ease and convenience in managing gold assets and transactions.

title: Indonesia to Build Two Copper Derivative Industries in Java with IDR 6-7 Trillion Investment
body: PT Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) has inaugurated a gold refining facility and a copper smelter in the Java Integrated Industrial Port Estate Special Economic Zone, with a cumulative investment value of USD 3.7 billion (IDR 58 trillion). Two new copper derivative industries will be built in the same location, with a total investment of approximately IDR 6-7 trillion, to process copper cathodes into copper foil cables and optimize copper downstreaming in the special economic zone.

title: Indonesia's Merah Putih Cabinet to Launch 30 Large-Scale Downstream Projects, Creating 8 Million Jobs
body: The Indonesian government has agreed to increase the number of first-phase downstream projects from 21 to 30, with a total investment of USD 40 billion, aiming to create 8 million jobs and generate substantial foreign exchange. By 2040, the government expects to attract investments worth USD 618.1 billion, generate USD 857.9 billion in export revenues, and contribute USD 235.9 billion to national GDP, with a potential economic impact of IDR 9,000 trillion if managed effectively.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 6.12% Amid Economic Pressures and Global Uncertainty
body: Indonesia's benchmark stock index, Jakarta Composite Index, plummeted 6.12% to 6,076.08, driven by sharp losses in heavyweight stocks, with foreign investors increasingly cautious and net foreign outflows reaching Rp 26.04 trillion year-to-date. The index has fallen 8.59% year-to-date, with rising debt burdens, declining tax revenue, and weakening consumer purchasing power contributing to the economic strain.

title: PT Confectionery Consumer Products Indonesia acquires 90% shares of PT Yupi Indo Jelly Gum.
body: PT Confectionery Consumer Products Indonesia (CCPI) has acquired 90% of PT Yupi Indo Jelly Gum Tbk's shares, previously owned by PT Sweets Indonesia and Daniel Budiman, with the transaction valued at IDR 2.04 trillion. Following the acquisition, Yupi's shareholders appointed two new commissioners, and the company successfully raised fresh funds through its initial public offering (IPO) of 854.44 million shares at IDR 2,390 per share.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold to Repay Principal and Interest on Bonds Maturing in 2025
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) is set to repay its principal and interest bonds maturing on April 28, 2025, with an interest rate of 7.80% per annum, having allocated funds for the payment. The company's stock performance has been positive, with a 7.78% increase to IDR 1,455 per share during the second trading session on Wednesday, and a 1.39% rise over the past week.

title: Harita Nickel Reports 13.5% Increase in Net Profit to IDR 6.4 Trillion in 2024
body: Harita Nickel (Tbk) reported a 13.5% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR 6.4 trillion in 2024, driven by a 13% revenue growth to IDR 27 trillion, with nickel processing and mining businesses contributing to the growth. Despite a 2% growth in gross profit to IDR 8.5 trillion, the gross profit margin slipped to 31.3% from 34.7% due to an 18.8% increase in cost of goods sold, while EBITDA grew 11.3% to IDR 11.2 trillion.

title: PT Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Records 10.8% Increase in Net Profit in 2024
body: PT Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Tbk (MPMX) reported a 10.8% increase in net profit to IDR 582.49 billion in 2024, driven by a 13.8% increase in revenue to IDR 15.77 trillion, with growth in its two-wheeler distribution, retail, and spare parts businesses. The company's used car sales segment, however, faced challenges due to an abundance of stock, and MPMX aims to increase passenger car contributions by maximizing its auction location network.

title: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada increases stake in PT Petrosea TBK with IDR 36.76 billion investment.
body: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada (KJP) has increased its investment in PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO) by IDR 36.76 billion, acquiring 15.19 million shares at an average price of IDR 2,419 per share, maintaining its controlling stake. Following the transaction, KJP's total shares in PTRO increased from 4.46 billion to 4.47 billion, with PTRO's share price dropping 7.89% over the past week but rising 4.27% in the second trading session on Wednesday.

title: BCA and BRI's brand values surge, driven by customer satisfaction and marketing efforts, with Bank Mandiri also seeing significant growth.
body: BCA's brand value surged 42% to $4.4B, retaining its position as the world's strongest banking brand with a Brand Strength Index score of 97.1, driven by strong customer satisfaction and impactful marketing. Meanwhile, BRI's brand value increased 36% to $7.3B, and Bank Mandiri jumped 16 places in the ranking, with both banks retaining their AAA and AAA+ brand strength ratings, respectively.

title: Digital transactions on PT Bank Central Asia Tbk's superapp surge to 6.9 billion in 2024, driven by increased smartphone penetration and e-commerce growth in Indonesia.
body: Digital transactions through PT Bank Central Asia Tbk's (BBCA) superapp more than doubled to 6.9 billion in 2024, driven by increased smartphone internet penetration and the rise of e-commerce in Indonesia, with inter-account transfers and virtual payments being the most widely used services. BCA's digital arm saw its net income more than double to $6.5 million in 2024, with its pay later service reaching an outstanding balance of $20 million and its virtual account for teens, bluaccount, surpassing 2.4 million users by the end of 2024.

title: Danareksa to Receive Fresh Funds of Tens of Trillions of Rupiah from State-Owned Enterprise Dividends
body: Danantara, Indonesia's investment management agency, is set to receive a fresh injection of tens of trillions of rupiah from dividends of state-owned enterprises whose ownership has been transferred to Danantara. This significant funding is expected to boost Danantara's capabilities and influence in the country's investment landscape.

title: Rupiah strengthens slightly to Rp 16,588 per dollar, driven by dollar correction and rebound in domestic stock market.
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.15% to RP 16,588 per dollar, driven by a correction in the US dollar and a rebound in the domestic stock market index. Analysts predict the rupiah's movement on Thursday will be consolidated, with a potential to strengthen or weaken, with forecasts ranging from RP 16,500 to RP 17,000 per dollar.

title: PT Energi Mega Persada's Operational Performance Prospects Remain Positive for This Year
body: PT Energi Mega Persada Tbk's operational performance prospects are still considered positive for this year, driven by the company's positive performance throughout 2024. This is expected to continue driving growth projections for the year, with the company's financial metrics showing promising signs of improvement.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Surges 3.8% to 6,472.36 on Foreign Investment and Banking Sector Rebound
body: The Indonesian stock market surged 3.8% to 6,472.36, driven by a net foreign buy of IDR 2.58 trillion and a rebound in four major banking stocks. Investors are seeking momentum in dividend payments, particularly from large banks, and are also monitoring the development of the Danareksa program.

title: XL Axiata Shareholders Face Two Options: Sell Shares through Buyback or Retain Ownership and Potentially Receive Dividend
body: PT XL Axiata Tbk (EXCL) shareholders are faced with two options: selling their shares through a buyback scheme at IDR 2,350 per share, or maintaining their ownership and potentially receiving dividends. The buyback scheme comes with three conditions for participating shareholders, amidst the merger with PT Smartfren Telecom Tbk and PT Smart Telecom.

title: Paradise Indonesia to Expand Business with Two New Projects and Enhanced Customer Services
body: PT Indonesia Paradise Property Tbk (INPP) is set to reap the benefits of its business expansion this year, with plans to add two new projects, including Antasari Place, a modern apartment complex with retail space and serviced apartments, which will operate in semester I-2025. The company aims to strengthen its property portfolio and enhance customer services, according to CEO Anthony P. Susilo.

title: PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara Reports Significant Increase in Elang Mineral Reserves and Resources.
body: PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara (AMNT) released a new Joint Ore Reserves Committee report as of December 31, 2024, showing a significant increase in mineral reserves and resources at the Elang mine, which could potentially boost production and extend the mine's lifespan. The increase in reserves is expected to provide significant opportunities for various parties, according to Kartika Octaviana, Vice President of Corporate Communications at PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMNT).

title: Idul Fitri Celebrations Expected to Boost Sales for Packaged Beverage Industry
body: The Idul Fitri celebration is expected to positively impact the packaged beverage industry, with traditional holiday sales contributing significantly to the industry's annual revenue. According to Triyono Prijosoesilo, Chairman of the Indonesian Beverage Industry Association, the holiday season typically generates the largest volume of packaged beverage sales throughout the year.

title: Indofood Sukses Makmur and Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Report Impressive Performance in 2024 with Increased Revenue and Net Profit.
body: PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) reported impressive performances in 2024, with net income and revenue growth compared to the previous year. INDF's net income reached IDR 8.64 trillion, a 6.07% year-over-year increase, driven by a 3.65% year-over-year increase in net sales to IDR 115.78 trillion.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rebounds with 3.8% Gain Amid Capital Inflow
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rebounded after an initial decline, closing at 6,235.62 on Tuesday with a 1.21% gain, and continued to strengthen on Wednesday, surging 3.8% to 6,472.36, driven in part by the return of capital inflows to the domestic stock market.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Rises 3.8% to 6,472.35 Ahead of Eid al-Fitr Holiday
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 3.8% to 6,472.35 at the close of Wednesday's trading, driven by foreign investors' net buy of IDR 2.58 trillion. Analysts provided recommendations for stocks ahead of the Lebaran holiday, with investors encouraged to consider their suggestions before the break.

title: Government Ensures Adequate Fuel Supply Ahead of Idul Fitri Celebrations
body: The Indonesian government ensures a stable supply of fuel, with Pertamina's stock levels covering 20-21 days, and other types of fuel such as RON 90, RON 92, and Avtur having coverage days of 22, 29, and 32 days, respectively. During the Ramadan and Idul Fitri period, fuel consumption is expected to increase, with Pertamax consumption rising 16.9% to 21,745 kiloliters per day, Pertamax Turbo up 15% to 844 kiloliters per day, and Pertalite up 11.4% to 82,969 kiloliters per day.

title: Directorate General of Taxation Extends Deadline for Annual Income Tax Reporting for Individuals to April 11, 2025
body: The Indonesian Directorate General of Taxes has extended the deadline for individual taxpayers to submit their annual tax returns for 2024 from March 31 to April 11, 2025, without administrative penalties, to avoid potential delays due to national holidays and collective leave. This decision is expected to ease the burden on taxpayers, allowing them to focus on their holiday plans and allocate their funds to stimulate local economies, particularly in the micro, small, and medium enterprises (UMKM) and tourism sectors.

title: Prabowo Subianto's Government Forms Multiple Task Forces to Address Various Issues
body: The Indonesian government, under President Prabowo Subianto, has formed several task forces (satgas) in the last month to address various issues, including the Satgas Transisi Energi dan Ekonomi Hijau (Satgas TEH). The formation of these task forces is based on the decision of the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, with no specific financial metrics or outcomes mentioned.

title: Bank Tabungan Negara Obtains Shareholder Approval to Acquire Bank Victoria Syariah
body: Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BBTN) has obtained shareholder approval to acquire Bank Victoria Syariah as part of its plan to spin off its shariah business unit, which will become BTN Syariah. The bank will now proceed with the acquisition permit process with the Financial Services Authority, marking a significant step in its restructuring plan.

title: Credit Growth for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Slows Down in Indonesia
body: Bank credit to micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in Indonesia has slowed down, with outstanding MSME credit growing only 2.1% year-on-year to IDR 1.393.4 trillion in February 2025, driven by high credit risk and weak consumer purchasing power, with micro credit declining 0.9% and medium credit growing only 0.5% year-on-year.

title: Number of Commuters Using Public Transportation Increases by 10.3% Ahead of Eid Al-Fitr in 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Transportation reported that 4.51 million passengers used public transportation from March 21-25, 2025, a 10.3% increase compared to the same period in 2024. This surge in passengers is expected to have a positive impact on the transportation sector's revenue during the Lebaran holiday season.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Still Weak in Early 2025 Despite Recent Gains
body: The Indonesian stock market has shown strengthening in the last two days, but its overall performance in early 2025 remains unimpressive, with the composite stock price index weakening 8.58% since the start of the year. This decline presents an opportunity for non-bank financial industries to hunt for cheap stocks.

title: Indonesian Food and Beverage Producers Express Concern Over Industrial Salt Shortage Following Import Ban
body: The Indonesian Food and Beverage Producers Association expressed concern over the industrial salt shortage crisis affecting several companies in the food sector, following the implementation of a salt import ban in early 2025. The Director General of Agro Industry at the Ministry of Industry, Putu Juli Ardika, acknowledged that industrial salt stocks are dwindling, posing a threat to the industry's operations.

title: State-owned banks in Indonesia increase dividend payout ratio from 2024 profits, boosting their stock prices.
body: State-owned banks in Indonesia have announced an increase in their dividend payout ratio for 2024, boosting the shares of banks under the Investment Management Institution of Nusantara (IPDN), with Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) being the most generous, distributing 85% of its previous year's profit as dividends, worth IDR 51.74 trillion or IDR 343.4 per share. This move has lifted the shares of banks that have been struggling, with Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) leading the way.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Surges 3.8% to 6,472.36 on Wednesday.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 3.8% to 6,472.36 on Wednesday, marking a 2.55% gain over the past week, despite still being down 8.58% since the start of the year.

title: Global Economy Faces Stagflation Risk in Next 12 Months, Experts Warn
body: A potential stagflation threat is looming over the global economy in the next 12 months, with 71% of fund managers surveyed by Bank of America (BAC) expecting it to occur, which could negatively impact Indonesia's economy. The country's economic growth is already stagnant, and if stagflation occurs, it could lead to higher refinancing costs, a weaker rupiah, and increased unemployment, highlighting the need for the government to take measures to mitigate the impact.

title: Samudera Indonesia Reports 32% Year-on-Year Decrease in Net Profit to $50.7 Million in 2024.
body: PT Samudera Indonesia Tbk (SAMU) reported a significant decline in net profit, with a 32% year-on-year decrease to $50.7 million in 2024, down from $74.6 million in 2023. The company's financial performance was affected, resulting in a substantial drop in net profit, according to Director Bani M. Mulia.

title: Indonesian Engineering Insurance Business Predicted to Face Challenges in 2025 Due to Sluggish Economic Prospects.
body: Indonesia's engineering insurance business is expected to face challenges in 2025 due to the uncertainty of domestic economic prospects, which may slow down infrastructure development projects. In 2024, the Indonesian General Insurance Association reported that engineering insurance premiums only reached IDR 4.27 trillion, a 18.2% contraction from the previous year, mainly due to fewer government and private sector projects.

title: Government and Private Sector Begin Disbursing Holiday Allowance to Boost People's Purchasing Power Amid Economic Challenges
body: The Indonesian government has started disbursing holiday allowances to civil servants, military, and police personnel, as well as some private companies, which is expected to boost people's purchasing power amidst economic difficulties. The allowances, although equivalent to only one month's salary, are anticipated to help extend people's financial resilience, particularly for those who have been struggling with dwindling savings.

title: Uang Mencari Tempat Paling Nyaman untuk Berbiak, IHSG Ambrol dan Rupiah Rontok
body: The Indonesian stock market (IHSG) has plummeted and the rupiah has weakened as investors seek more attractive investment opportunities abroad, indicating that they perceive the Indonesian market as less appealing. This shift in investor sentiment is driven by a desire for certainty and stability, rather than just seeking cheaper prices, as investors prioritize returns over low prices.

title: Foreign Capital Inflow Boosts Indonesian Stock Market Index
body: Foreign capital inflows reached Rp 2.57 trillion on Wednesday, driving a rebound in the composite stock price index, as investors responded to dividend distributions by major banks. Despite this, foreign investors still recorded a net sell of Rp 30.55 trillion since the beginning of the year, leaving uncertainty about whether they will continue to invest in the stock market.

title: PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk Expected to Continue Positive Performance Growth in 2025 Despite Challenges
body: PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk is expected to continue its positive performance growth in 2025, following a 16% year-over-year increase in revenue to Rp 6.7 trillion and a 23% year-over-year increase in net profit to Rp 536 billion in 2024. However, the company faces challenges that may pressure its margin, according to Bahana Sekuritas analyst Arvin Lienardi.

title: High Demand for Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014 with Sales Reaching IDR 12 Trillion in 20 Days
body: The Indonesian government's sukuk tabungan seri ST014 has seen high demand, with approximately Rp 12 trillion sold in 20 days, driven by its high yield and safe nature. As of Wednesday, the 2-year tenor ST014T2 has sold Rp 9.7 trillion, or 88.9% of the national quota, while the 4-year tenor has sold Rp 2.3 trillion.

title: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi TBK Records Impressive Performance in 2024 Despite Declining Coal Prices
body: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk. reported a remarkable performance in 2024, with revenue increasing by 718.58% to $801.72 million from $97.94 million in 2023, despite declining coal prices. Analysts project that the company's outstanding performance will continue in the future, driven by its strong financial metrics.

title: QJ Motor to Invest $10 Million in New Assembly Plant in West Java, Indonesia
body: QJ Motor is investing $10 million in an assembly plant in West Java, Indonesia, with an initial investment of $5 million, aiming to increase its dealership network from 8 to 20 outlets by the end of the year. The company plans to launch four new models in Indonesia, targeting the 250cc and above segment, where competition is relatively limited, and has seen promising sales performance with 130 units sold at the Indonesian International Motor Show.

title: France and EU partner to enhance safety and security at Indonesia's busiest ports through capacity-building activities.
body: The European Union and France are partnering to invest €8.5 million in the Global Ports Safety Project, aiming to enhance safety and resilience at 12 ports in 8 South and Southeast Asian countries, including Indonesia's Tanjung Priok and Tanjung Perak ports. The project, which will run for four years, is expected to boost trade between Indonesia and the EU, with bilateral trade currently valued at $30.8 billion and Indonesia seeking to strike a free trade agreement with the EU.

title: Financial Authority Tightens Regulations on Peer-to-Peer Lending to Ensure Healthy Online Financing Ecosystem
body: The Financial Services Authority (OJK) has tightened regulations on peer-to-peer lending financial technology (fintech) companies, issuing several rules to ensure a healthy and competitive online lending ecosystem. One of the most challenging regulations for fintech P2P lending companies is the limitation on loan disbursement to borrowers, where they can only receive funding from a maximum of three lenders, according to OJK Circular Letter No. 19/SEojk.06/2023.

title: Indonesian Government Bond Yield Continues to Rise as Price Falls for 12 Consecutive Trading Days
body: The yield of Indonesia's 10-year government bond, Series FR0103, continues to rise as its price falls, with the latest price at 96.82, marking a 12-day consecutive decline or over two weeks, resulting in a 2.43% drop.

title: State-owned companies including Krakatau Steel, Waskita Karya, and Garuda Indonesia announce share transfer to PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia.
body: Several state-owned companies, including PT Krakatau Steel Tbk, PT Waskita Karya Tbk, and PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk, have announced the transfer of shares to PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia, a holding operational company under the Investment Management Agency of the State of the Republic of Indonesia. This move is in line with the Indonesian government's regulation No. 15/2025, which aims to increase state capital participation in PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia.

title: Many People Beautify Their Homes Ahead of Eid Celebration
body: As Ramadan approaches, many people are motivated to beautify their homes, leading to increased demand for home decoration and renovation services. This trend is expected to boost sales for companies in the home improvement industry, with consumers willing to spend to create a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere for their guests.

title: Barito Pacific to Divest Entire Stake in Logistics Subsidiary Barito Investa Prima
body: PT Barito Pacific Tbk (BARA) is reportedly planning to divest its entire stake in its logistics subsidiary, PT Barito Investa Prima. The move is expected to have significant implications for the company's financial metrics and future growth prospects.

title: Bumi Resources and Bank Rakyat Indonesia Hold Top Spots in Net Foreign Buying on Indonesian Stock Exchange.
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) surged to the top spot with a net foreign buy of 138.41 million shares, driving its stock price up 3.33% to IDR 93 per share, while PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) held steady at the runner-up spot with a net foreign buy of 88.55 million shares, pushing its share price up 1.25% to IDR 4,050 per share. The trading volumes for BUMI and BBRI reached 508 million shares and 322.55 million shares, respectively, with total values of IDR 47.69 billion and IDR 1.29 trillion.

title: Indonesian Government Transfers Majority Stake in Wika to State-Owned Operational Holding Company BKI
body: The Indonesian government has transferred 91.018% of its Series B shares in PT Wijaya Karya Tbk (WIKA) to PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia (BKI), equivalent to 36.29 billion shares with a nominal value of IDR 100 each. This transfer is part of the government's effort to increase state equity participation in BKI's share capital, with other state-owned enterprises (SOEs) such as PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM), PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), and PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) also receiving share transfers from the government.

title: MTDL Achieves Highest Revenue in Company History, Reaching IDR 25 Trillion in 2024.
body: MTDL (no ticker provided) reached IDR 25 trillion in revenue in 2024, the highest in the company's history, driven by effective business strategies and synergies between its distribution solutions and consulting business units. The company's focus on operational efficiency and market expansion, particularly in telecommunications, digital consulting, and AI-based solutions, contributed to its growth, with telecommunications products being the largest contributor to its distribution revenue.

title: Bank Central Asia to Repurchase Up to IDR 1 Trillion Worth of Shares Over Three Months
body: PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) has announced a plan to repurchase shares, allocating IDR 1 trillion for the effort, with a maximum share price of IDR 9,200 per share, and the total buyback will not exceed 20% of the company's paid-up capital. The share buyback will take place from March 26, 2025, to June 24, 2025, on the Indonesia Stock Exchange regular market, with PT BCA Sekuritas acting as the intermediary.

title: PT Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal Records 11.19% Net Profit Growth in 2024
body: PT Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal Tbk (IPCC) reported a net profit of IDR 212.22 billion in 2024, up 11.19% year-on-year, driven by a 12.16% increase in revenue to IDR 824.60 billion, primarily contributed by Tanjung Priok terminal and completely built-up vehicle cargo services. The company's total assets stood at IDR 1.85 trillion, with cash and cash equivalents of IDR 810 billion, and total equity of IDR 1.28 trillion, as it plans to focus on the multi-terminal sector aligned with its parent company PT Pelindo's master plan.

title: Number of Homebound Travelers Using Public Transportation Increases by 10.3% During 2025 Eid Period.
body: According to the Ministry of Transportation, the number of people using public transportation during the 2025 Lebaran period (21-25 March) reached 4.51 million, a 10.3% increase compared to the same period in 2024. This growth is significant, with no specific company mentioned in the article.

title: National Zakat Fitrah Potential in 2025 Estimated to Reach IDR 8 Trillion
body: The National Amil Zakat Agency (BAZNAS) estimates that the potential for zakat fitrah in 2025 will reach IDR 8 trillion, equivalent to 604.8 million tons of rice, based on the average price of medium-quality rice in each province. Meanwhile, the Institute of Demographic Affluence Studies predicts the potential for zakat fitrah to be between IDR 6.8 trillion and IDR 7.5 trillion, which could increase rice consumption per capita for beneficiaries and provide additional social assistance.

title: PT Acset Indonusa to Issue 5 Billion New Shares Through Private Placement to Revamp Capital Structure
body: PT Acset Indonusa Tbk (ACSET), a construction services company under the Astra Group, plans to issue 5 billion new shares through a private placement scheme to revamp its capital structure. This move aims to strengthen the company's financial position, with details of the plan to be disclosed in the future.

title: PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa's Revenue Grows but Net Profit Drops in 2024.
body: PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa Tbk (MAPA) reported a 26.78% year-over-year increase in revenue to Rp 17.18 trillion in 2024, driven by retail sales of Rp 14.44 trillion and non-retail sales of Rp 1.73 trillion. However, the company's net profit declined, falling short of analysts' expectations, despite the revenue growth.

title: State-owned company PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara emerges as a new player in the palm oil industry with the largest land area.
body: PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara, a government-backed company, is poised to become a major player in the palm oil industry with the largest land area, having been appointed to manage 216,997.75 hectares of land seized by the government. This development enables Agrinas to surpass established players in the industry, marking a significant shift in the market landscape.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 0.59% Ahead of Long Weekend
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) strengthened by 0.59% or 38.26 points to 6,510.62 on Thursday, driven by a total transaction volume of 14.11 billion shares worth IDR 11.02 trillion. The market saw 359 stocks rise, 230 fall, and 206 remain flat, ahead of the long holiday at the end of the first quarter of 2025.

title: Government Policies Surprise Foreign Investors, Causing Them to Adopt Wait-and-See Approach
body: CGS Internasional Sekuritas Indonesia met with investors in Singapore on March 17-18, 2025, to discuss the government's surprising policies, including the formation of Danantara, a free nutritious meal program, a 3 million housing initiative, and the Red-White Village Cooperative program. These policies have made foreign investors adopt a wait-and-see approach when considering investments in the country.

title: Gem Hong Kong International Acquires Majority Stake in PT Bahodopi Nickel Smelting Indonesia
body: Gem Hong Kong International Co., Ltd has officially acquired a majority stake in PT Bahodopi Nickel Smelting Indonesia, a company building a nickel smelter in Morowali with PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO). This acquisition marks a significant development in the nickel smelting industry, with potential implications for the companies involved and the broader market.

title: Rizki Sinaga's Passion for Mountain Climbing Brings Health Benefits and New Friends
body: Temenin Trip, a provider of open trip services for mountain climbing, has seen a significant increase in demand, with monthly revenue reaching IDR 100 million during peak season, while Falisha Journey, another provider, has reported a monthly revenue of IDR 500 million to IDR 1 billion. The owners of these businesses, Intan Nurhayat and Purwo Hajar Prasetya, respectively, have invested IDR 600,000 and IDR 30 million to start their ventures, which have yielded a net margin of around 5% after operational costs.

title: BlackRock and Invesco Increase Their Stake in Bank Rakyat Indonesia After Annual Shareholders Meeting
body: BlackRock Inc. (BLK) and Invesco Ltd. (IVZ) increased their stakes in PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) after the annual general meeting of shareholders, with BlackRock buying 4.3 million shares and Invesco purchasing 5.1 million shares. Following the transaction, BlackRock's total ownership in BBRI increased to 2.45 billion shares, while Invesco's stake rose to 512.7 million shares.

title: Government Transfers State-Owned Enterprise Shares to PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia Outside of Indonesian Stock Exchange.
body: The Indonesian government has transferred ownership of several state-owned enterprises to PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia, a process that took place outside of the Indonesia Stock Exchange. The transaction, which used physical certificates, is not electronically recorded at the Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia, but the shareholder list has been updated, allowing investors and market participants to access the information.

title: Government Aims to Reach Ambitious 23% Tax Ratio Target This Year
body: The Indonesian government is striving to achieve an ambitious tax ratio target of 23% this year, exceeding the 10.24% target set in the 2025-2029 National Medium-Term Development Plan. The government is also discussing the possibility of increasing the tax ratio to 11.8%, in line with the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development's criteria.

title: Pertamina Geothermal Energy Expects Improved Performance in 2025 Following 2024 Financial Results
body: PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGE) is optimistic about achieving better performance in 2025, driven by its 2024 financial performance, which saw revenue increase by 0.20% year-over-year to $407.12 million. However, the company's net profit decreased by 1.89% year-over-year to $160.49 million in 2024.

title: Indonesia to Invest in BRICS-Backed New Development Bank to Secure Membership
body: Indonesia is set to invest in the BRICS-backed New Development Bank (NDB) to secure membership, with the bank requiring Jakarta to make financial contributions as part of its "formula" for joining, which includes an initial authorized capital of $100 billion. The NDB has already greenlit $39 billion in financing for 120 projects, with five founding members having borrowed from the bank, while Indonesia's investment amount remains undisclosed.

title: French President Macron to Bring Investment Deals to Indonesia During Upcoming Visit
body: French President Emmanuel Macron's upcoming visit to Indonesia in late May is expected to bring investment deals, with French companies planning to invest in food production, transportation, digital technology, and critical minerals, following a "very positive trend" of $328 million in French foreign direct investment inflows to Indonesia last year. The visit aims to increase investment in various sectors, including renewable energy and green infrastructure, with major French investors such as Eramet (ERamet) and Danone (DANOY) already present in Indonesia.

title: Alkindo Naratama Allocates IDR 10 Billion to Buy Back Shares for Price Stability
body: PT Alkindo Naratama Tbk (ALKD) has allocated IDR 10 billion to buy back shares over three months starting from April 8, 2025, aiming to maintain a fair price and provide share price stability, which is expected to add value to shareholders and potential investors. The buyback plan, which does not require shareholder approval, is expected to take place at a price lower than or equal to the previous closing price, with the company's share price already rising 2% to IDR 498 at the close of trading yesterday.

title: PT Hartadinata Abadi TBK Sees 44.59% Increase in Net Profit to IDR 442.18 Billion in 2024
body: PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) reported a net profit of IDR 442.18 billion in 2024, a 44.59% increase from the previous year, driven by a 41.76% rise in sales to IDR 18.22 trillion. The company's jewellery sales were primarily driven by wholesalers, contributing IDR 11.34 trillion, while its total assets and equity stood at IDR 5.95 trillion and IDR 2.34 trillion, respectively, at the end of 2024.

title: Controlling shareholders of PT Jayamas Medica Industri increase their stake through recent share purchases.
body: Yacobus Jemmy Hartanto, President Commissioner of PT Jayamas Medica Industri Tbk (OMED), and Siane Soetanto, Commissioner of Omed, increased their shareholdings through purchase transactions, with Hartanto buying 466,000 shares and Soetanto buying 299,300 shares, raising their ownership stakes to 245.83 million shares and 242.68 million shares, respectively. As a result, controlling shareholders now hold 85.094% of Omed's total shares, with non-controlling shareholders holding 14.906%.

title: PT Multipolar's Net Profit Drops 7.47% to IDR 159.19 Billion in 2024 Despite 4% Increase in Sales.
body: PT Multipolar Tbk (MLPL) reported a 7.47% decline in net profit to IDR 159.19 billion in 2024, despite a 4% increase in sales to IDR 11.40 trillion, driven by growth in retail distribution and information technology segments. The company's gross profit margin decreased to 17.32% from 19.04% in the previous year, due to a 6.2% increase in cost of goods sold and services to IDR 9.42 trillion.

title: Indonesians prioritize fraud detection, trust real-time payment security as scam losses rise.
body: In Indonesia, 99% of consumers have sent and 97% have received real-time payments (RTP), with 59% expecting to increase their RTP usage in the next 12 months, above the global average of 44%. Meanwhile, scam losses in Indonesia are rising, with nearly 1 in 4 consumers reporting losses in 2024, and high-value scam losses exceeding RP 70 million growing 8% in 2024, underscoring the growing financial toll on households.

title: XL Axiata Receives Shareholder Approval for Merger with Smartfren Telecom and Smart Telecom
body: PT XL Axiata Tbk (EXCL) has received approval from its shareholders to merge with PT Smartfren Telecom Tbk (FREN) and PT Smart Telecom, with the merger expected to form a new company called PT XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera Tbk, which will officially stand on April 16, 2025. The Financial Services Authority has given an effective statement regarding the merger on March 21, 2025, marking a significant milestone in the deal.

title: PT Kereta Api Indonesia Prepares 4.6 Million Seats for Lebaran 2025, 70% Already Sold.
body: PT Kereta Api Indonesia (no ticker) has prepared a total capacity of 4,591,510 seats for the 2025 Lebaran period, with 3,193,412 tickets sold as of March 28, 2025, accounting for around 70% of available capacity. The company's ticket sales have reached a significant milestone, indicating strong demand for its transportation services during the holiday period.

title: Antam's 24-Karat Gold Price Remains Unchanged at Rp 1.806 Million per Gram.
body: The price of 24-karat gold at Logam Mulia remained steady at IDR 1,806,000 per gram, while the buyback price also remained unchanged at IDR 1,657,000 per gram. This news is part of a premium content offering, available for subscribers who can sign up for a 7-day free trial and pay IDR 20,000 per month using their Google account.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange to Close for Idul Fitri Holiday, Raising Volatility Risks
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) will be closed for approximately a week during the Idul Fitri holiday from March 28, 2025, to April 7, 2025, which may lead to increased market volatility due to external sentiment. Trading will resume on Tuesday, April 8, 2025, following the government-declared joint holiday.

title: Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Optimistic About Positive Growth of Sharia Banking in 2025
body: The Indonesian Financial Services Authority (OJK) is optimistic about the growth of sharia banking in 2025, driven by an increase in assets, third-party funds, and financing, with a market share of 7.72% and a 10.09% growth in third-party funds. The OJK expects the growth of sharia banking to continue, with a focus on developing unique products and reducing domestic interest rates, which will positively impact funding costs and liquidity.

title: Otto Toto Sugiri's Founding of PT DCI Indonesia TBK in 2011 Propels Him to Become One of Indonesia's Richest Individuals.
body: Otto Toto Sugiri, founder of PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCI), has become one of the richest people in Indonesia, with his wealth surging in line with the rising stock price of the company he founded in 2011. Sugiri's net worth has skyrocketed, earning him the nickname "Bill Gates of Indonesia".

title: OJK to Simplify Bank Reporting Using Digital Application to Enhance Supervision
body: The Financial Services Authority (OJK) will simplify bank reporting using the OJK's reporting application, Apolo, and will establish a regulation to govern bank reporting through this system, supporting OJK's supervisory function in the banking sector. This move aims to digitalize and simplify reporting, which is currently submitted in print form, and is part of OJK's efforts to enhance its oversight of the banking industry.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Production and Export Volume Decrease in January 2025
body: Indonesia's palm oil production in January 2025 decreased by 1.25% to 4,184 million tons compared to the previous month, and by 9.7% compared to the same period last year, resulting in a decline in export value to $2.274 billion from $2.379 billion in December 2024. The country's palm oil export volume also dropped by 100,000 tons to 1.96 million tons in January 2025, contributing to a 10.9% share of Indonesia's total non-oil and gas exports of $20.84 billion.

title: Indonesian Industrial and Commercial Gas Prices Surge 60% Due to Supply Shortage
body: The price of gas for industrial and commercial non-PGBT sectors in Indonesia has surged, increasing from $10.2 per MMBTU to $14.27 per MMBTU in Q1 2024, and is expected to further rise to $16.89 per MMBTU in April 2025, according to PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS). This 60% price hike is attributed to the government's policy imbalance, which favors PGBT customers, and the decline in domestic gas production, particularly from PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk's (MEDC) Koridor block.
