title: Opportunities to hunt for dividends from PT Bank Central Asia Tbk for 2024 have closed, but several other issuers still offer dividend distributions.
body: The opportunity to hunt for dividends from PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) for the 2024 fiscal year has closed, but several other issuers have announced dividends before the long holiday, with large dividends mainly distributed by state-owned banks. Investors can still take advantage of these dividend opportunities, with a focus on financial metrics and significant outcomes.

title: Indonesian Parliament Passes Revised State-Owned Enterprise Law, Introduces 1% Special Share Provision
body: The Indonesian House of Representatives has passed a revised law, UU No. 1/2025, which establishes the legal framework for the formation of Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, a state-owned investment management body. The law also introduces a 1% "dwiwarna" share, which grants the Indonesian government special rights through the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises, with implications for the country's state-owned enterprises.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Closes Higher Ahead of Eid al-Fitr Holiday
body: The Indonesian stock market closed on a high note on Thursday, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rising 4.03% to 6,510.62, marking its third consecutive day of gains, ahead of the Idul Fitri holiday from March 28 to April 7, 2025.

title: Indofood Records Strong Financial Performance in 2024 with 6.07% Increase in Profit.
body: PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and its subsidiary, PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk, reported strong financial performance in 2024, with net profit increasing 6.07% to Rp 8.64 trillion and net sales rising 3.65% to Rp 115.78 trillion. The company's financial metrics showed significant growth compared to the previous year, with net profit increasing from Rp 8.14 trillion and net sales from Rp 111.7 trillion in 2023.

title: Gold Price Rises by Rp 14,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of Antam's 24-karat gold at Logam Mulia increased by Rp 14,000 per gram to Rp 1,806,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 14,000 per gram to Rp 1,657,000 per gram.

title: Dimensional Fund Advisors LP Invests in High-Liquidity Stocks with Large Market Capitalization in Indonesian Stock Market
body: Dimensional Fund Advisors LP, a Texas-based investment manager, has invested in 28 out of 30 stocks in the IDX30 index, with its top five holdings being PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), PT Alam Satria Resources Indonesia Tbk, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), PT Astra International Tbk (ASII), and PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA). The investment focuses on high-liquidity and large market capitalization stocks in the Indonesian stock market.

title: Jakarta Stock Exchange Index Weakens 8.04% Since the Beginning of the Year Despite a 4.03% Gain in the Last Week of Q1 2025.
body: The Indonesian stock market's Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) weakened by 8.04% since the beginning of the year, despite a 4.03% gain in the last week of the first quarter of 2025, closing at 6,510.62 on Thursday. Almost all indices listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange have declined since the start of the year.

title: Seven Banks to Distribute Dividends with High Yields
body: Seven banking emitters, including PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), and PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI), will distribute dividends with yields ranging from 4.6% to 8.97%, with BMRI offering the highest yield. The total dividend payout from these banks is expected to be substantial, with BBRI distributing IDR 51.74 trillion and BMRI distributing IDR 43.51 trillion, providing a positive outlook for investors ahead of the Eid holiday.

title: Pawnbroking Services Remain Popular Ahead of Eid Holiday in Indonesia
body: As the Eid holiday approaches, pawnbroking services remain a popular alternative for Indonesians to access funding, driven by high financing needs, which is expected to boost the performance of pawnbroking businesses. This increased demand for pawnbroking services is likely to benefit companies like Perusahaan Pergadaian (no ticker available), which provides pawnbroking services to individuals.

title: Wealth of Indonesia's richest siblings Robert Budi Hartono and Michael Bambang Hartono drops by 17.5% in three months.
body: The combined wealth of Robert Budi Hartono and Michael Bambang Hartono, Indonesia's richest siblings, decreased by $8.8 billion (17.5%) to $41.5 billion in the first three months of 2025, with Robert's wealth valued at $21.2 billion and Michael's at $20.3 billion. As a result, they dropped to 96th and 98th richest people in the world, but remained 2nd and 3rd richest in Indonesia.

title: Funding Needs Increase During Ramadan and Lebaran, But Economic Conditions May Affect Loan Disbursement.
body: During Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr, financing needs typically increase, making it a peak season for the financing industry to disburse financing, but the current economic conditions may lead to an increase in non-performing loans if not managed carefully. The industry must be cautious in disbursing financing to avoid a surge in bad debts after the holiday season.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Surges 4.03% in the Last Week of Q1 2025
body: The Jakarta Composite Index surged 4.03% in the last week of the first quarter of 2025, reaching 6,510.62, driven mainly by state-owned enterprise (BUMN) stocks, with the IDX BUMN20 index recording the largest gain of 9.57% among the 14 Indonesian Stock Exchange indices.

title: Low Tuck Kwong Remains Indonesia's Richest Person in Coal Industry Despite Falling Prices
body: Dato' Low Tuck Kwong, founder of PT Bayan Resources Tbk (BYAN.JK), remains at the top of Forbes' list of 50 richest people in Indonesia, with a net worth of $27.2 billion, ranking 76th globally. Despite the decline in coal prices, Low Tuck Kwong's 28-year experience in the coal business has enabled him to maintain his position as the "King of Coal" in Indonesia.

title: International Figures Appointed to Investment Board, Raising Concerns Over Potential Conflicts of Interest
body: Several well-known figures have been appointed to the advisory board of Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, sparking concerns about potential conflicts of interest. The appointment of these international figures has raised eyebrows, with many questioning the potential impact on the organization's decision-making process.

title: Indonesia's Energy Transition Funding Remains Unchanged Despite US Withdrawal from JETP Climate Partnership
body: Indonesia's energy transition partnership, JETP, remains committed to its $20 billion funding package despite the US withdrawal, with Japan and Germany co-leading the initiative, but only $1.1 billion has been received so far, earmarked for 54 projects. The government is planning to set up a green economy transition taskforce to accelerate the funding process, with $1 billion in multilateral development bank guarantees already secured.

title: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Commissioner Buys and Sells AMRT Shares in Separate Transactions
body: Feny Djoko Susanto, a commissioner of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk, bought 476,100 shares of Alfamart (AMRT) for IDR 1 billion, increasing his stake to 266.33 million shares or 0.64% ownership. Meanwhile, Budiyanto sold 7.33 million shares of Alfamart (AMRT) for IDR 15.21 billion, decreasing his stake to 97.24 million shares or 0.23% ownership.

title: Christopher Sumasto buys 4.2 million shares of PT Pam Mineral Tbk for IDR 1.27 billion.
body: Christopher Sumasto, controller of PT Pam Metalindo, purchased 4.2 million shares of PT Nicel Indonesia (NICL) on March 26-27, 2025, equivalent to 0.039% of NICL shares, at a price of IDR 302 per share, totaling IDR 1.27 billion. This investment brings Sumasto's direct ownership in NICL, where Pam Metalindo holds a 43.23% stake, and NICL's share price has risen 2.05% to IDR 298 per share, with a 10.37% gain over the past month.

title: Bank Mega's Annual General Meeting Approves New Director and Distributes IDR1.05 Trillion in Dividends
body: PT Bank Mega Tbk (unknown ticker) approved the appointment of Heriwan Gazali as director, replacing C. Guntur Triyudianto, and also approved the distribution of dividends totaling IDR1.05 trillion, equivalent to 40% of the company's net profit in 2024. The bank posted a net profit of IDR2.63 trillion in 2024, down 25.07% from the previous year, with the remaining IDR1.58 trillion recorded as retained earnings.

title: Cemindo Gemilang to Expand Market Coverage in Indonesia and Overseas by 2025 Amid Strengthening Demand.
body: PT Cemindo Gemilang Tbk (CMNT) expects to expand its market coverage in domestic and overseas markets by 2025, driven by strengthening demand, with sales projected to reach Rp8.85 trillion in 2024. The company plans to deepen its penetration in key markets, both at home and abroad, and has already seen promising growth in sales volume and price, with exports to Vietnam resuming after a year's hiatus.

title: Gold Continues to Outperform as Cryptocurrency Struggles Amid Economic Concerns
body: Gold remains the top-performing portfolio asset in March 2025, with spot gold prices rising 10.81% to $3,156.4 per ounce and 11.34% year-to-date, while Antam's gold bar prices surged 8.82% monthly and 12.72% year-to-date to IDR 1,826 per gram.

title: Antam's Gold Price Drops by Rp 7,000 per Gram
body: The price of gold at Antam (ANTM) has decreased by Rp 7,000 per gram, with the current selling price at Rp 1,819,000 per gram and the buyback price at Rp 1,671,000 per gram, resulting in a difference of Rp 148,000 per gram. If an investor had bought gold from Antam a year ago, they would have gained a profit of 33.04% if they sold it today, highlighting the potential for long-term gains despite the current price difference.

title: Ramadan and Idulfitri Fails to Boost Indonesia's Economic Growth as Household Consumption Weakens
body: Indonesia's economy is expected to grow at a slower pace during Ramadan and Idulfitri, contrary to previous years, as household consumption, which accounts for over 50% of the country's GDP, has weakened in the first quarter. Key indicators such as the number of travelers, consumer confidence index, real sales index, and industrial production index have all shown declines or slowdowns, signaling a weaker economic growth momentum.

title: Medco Power Indonesia Reports Consecutive Losses for Three Years, with 2024 Losses Surging 57.42% to IDR 262.93 Billion.
body: PT Medco Power Indonesia, a subsidiary of Medco Group, has reported consecutive losses for three years, with a 57.42% year-over-year increase in losses to IDR 262.93 billion in 2024. The company's losses have been rising steadily, from IDR 160.83 billion in 2022 to IDR 167.02 billion in 2023, and finally to IDR 260 billion in 2024.

title: Goldman Sachs and Fidelity International Invest in Indonesian Banking Stocks
body: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS) and Fidelity International, two US-based investment and financial services companies, have invested in Indonesian banking stocks, with Goldman Sachs holding shares in PT Bank Central Asia Tbk and PT Bank Mandiri Tbk, as well as PT Bukit Asam Tbk, a mining company. This investment is reflected in the IDX30 constituent, with two out of three shares held by Goldman Sachs being from the banking sector.

title: Dewi Kam's Wealth Remains Unaffected Amidst Stock Market Downturn
body: The Indonesian stock market closed weak on Thursday, with the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) falling 8.04% year-to-date to 6,510. Meanwhile, Dewi Kam's wealth remains strong at $4.8 billion or IDR 79.49 trillion, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, solidifying her position as the richest woman in ASEAN.

title: Martua Sitorus, Indonesian Businessman, Ranks 18th on Forbes' 2024 Rich List with Net Worth of $3.5 Billion
body: Martua Sitorus, a 65-year-old Indonesian businessman, has a net worth of $3.5 billion, ranking 18th on Forbes' 2024 list, with his wealth increasing by 88.88% over the past 5 years from $1.8 billion to $3.4 billion. His company, Wilmar International Limited (WIL), listed on the Singapore Exchange in 2006, has over 500 factories and a vast distribution network across more than 50 countries, including China, India, and Indonesia.

title: Wealth gap in Indonesia reflected in banking data, with 1.15% of accounts holding 88.01% of total funds.
body: In Indonesia, only 1.15% of bank accounts, totaling 7.08 million, have a balance of over IDR 100 million, yet they control 88.01% of the total third-party funds in the banking system, valued at IDR 7.921 trillion. As of February 2025, there are 615.41 million bank accounts in Indonesia, with the majority holding significantly lower balances.

title: Dato Sri Tahir's Family Wealth Drops by IDR 6.6 Trillion in First Three Months of 2025.
body: Dato Sri Tahir and his family's wealth has decreased by approximately IDR 6.6 trillion (USD 400 million) to USD 4.9 billion as of March 27, 2025, according to Forbes. This decline has pushed Tahir's ranking to 8th richest person in Indonesia, down from his previous net worth of USD 5.3 billion at the end of 2024, as the founder of Mayapada Group (no ticker symbol mentioned).

title: Antam Gold Price Rises by Rp 20,000 per Gram
body: The price of gold at Antam (ANTM) has increased by Rp 20,000 per gram to Rp 1,826,000 per gram, while the buyback price has also risen by Rp 21,000 per gram to Rp 1,678,000 per gram, resulting in a difference of Rp 148,000 per gram. If an investor had bought gold from Antam a year ago, they would have gained 33.86% if they sold it today, highlighting the potential profit for long-term investors.

title: Bumi Resources' Net Profit Soars 517.76% to $67.47 Million in 2024 Despite 19.05% Drop in Revenue.
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) reported a net profit of $67.47 million in 2024, a 517.76% year-over-year increase from $10.92 million in 2023. Meanwhile, the company's revenue in 2024 reached $1.35 billion, a 19.05% year-over-year decrease from $1.67 billion in 2023.

title: JPMorgan Chase and other major investors experience unrealized losses in Indonesian stock market.
body: The correction in Indonesia's stock market has not only affected retail investors but also large-scale investors, including foreign investors, who have recorded unrealized losses in their investments, albeit temporarily. JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) is among those experiencing a decline in the value of its Indonesian stock portfolios.

title: Rupiah Weakens to Lowest Level Since 1998 Crisis Amidst Financial Market Pressure
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened due to pressure on the domestic financial market, particularly ahead of the Idul Fitri holiday, with the currency touching a low of Rp 16,642 per US dollar, its lowest level since the 1998 monetary crisis. The rupiah later strengthened 0.16% to close at Rp 16,562 per dollar on Thursday, following a decline in foreign exchange reserves, which is expected to continue its downward trend since February 2025.

title: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya's Stock Plunges 28% in 2025 Amid Declining Net Profit.
body: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (AMRT) has been one of the stocks that dragged down the Jakarta Composite Index in Q1 2025, with its stock price plummeting 28.07% since the beginning of the year, contributing 34.94 points to the index's decline. The correction is in line with the company's declining net profit, which fell 7.5% to Rp 3.16 trillion in 2024 compared to Rp 3.4 trillion in 2023.

title: Chairul Tanjung's Wealth Decreases by $1 Billion in First Three Months of 2025
body: Chairul Tanjung's (CT) wealth decreased by $1 billion in the first three months of 2025, with his current net worth standing at $4.2 billion as of March 27, 2025, according to Forbes data.

title: Market capitalization of top Indonesian stocks decline in first quarter of 2025 despite changes in market cap rankings.
body: The market capitalization of major Indonesian companies, including PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN), declined in the first three months of 2025, with BREN's market cap dropping 40.69% to IDR 736 trillion from IDR 1,240.87 trillion at the end of 2024, amidst an 8.04% year-to-date decline in the composite stock price index.

title: Antam's 24-Karat Gold Price Remains Unchanged at Rp 1.806.000 per Gram Due to Idul Fitri Holiday.
body: ANTAM (ANTM) did not update its 24-karat gold price data due to the Idul Fitri holiday, leaving the price unchanged at Rp 1,806,000 per gram. The company's gold price remains steady, with no changes reported during the holiday period.

title: Indonesian Financial Authority Targets Six More Banks to Reach Core Capital of IDR 70 Trillion by 2025
body: In the next two years, Indonesia's banking industry is expected to see a wave of consolidation, with potential mergers and acquisitions involving banks with core capital of over IDR 70 trillion, aiming to increase the number of KBMI 4 banks from four to ten. Currently, the four KBMI 4 banks are Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Central Asia (BBCA), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI).

title: Credit Agricole Group, a French banking giant, still faces losses despite investing in IDX30 constituent stocks.
body: Credit Agricole Group, a French banking giant, holds significant stakes in 17 out of 30 constituent companies of the IDX30 index, with ownership volumes ranging from tens to hundreds of millions of shares per company. Despite its institutional investor status, Credit Agricole Group is not immune to potential losses, highlighting that investing in IDX30 constituent companies does not guarantee profits.

title: Fidelity Investments acquires 4.22 billion shares of GoTo, a Indonesian tech company, with an average cost basis of IDR 105 per share.
body: FMR LLC, also known as Fidelity Investments, has accumulated 18 high-liquidity stocks from various sectors, including banking, mining, consumer, livestock, and technology, in the IDX30 index, with a significant interest in PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) with 4.22 billion shares. The company's shares have seen a 18.57% increase in the last 3 months, 18.57% growth year-to-date, and 36.07% growth in the last 6 months, with a cost basis average of IDR 105 per share.

title: Vanguard Group shows significant interest in Indonesian stocks, including GoTo and banking shares.
body: Vanguard Group, Inc. (Vanguard) has shown significant interest in PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk shares, holding up to 39.25 billion shares as of March 3, 2025, with an average cost basis of IDR 100 per share. The multinational investment company also has a substantial stake in several Indonesian banking stocks, as reflected in its holdings of IDX30 constituents.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Plunges 8.04% in First Quarter of 2025
body: The Indonesian stock market's Composite Index (IHSG) has weakened by 8.04% in the first three months of 2025, settling at 6,510.62 on Thursday, making it one of the worst-performing indices in the Asia-Pacific region. As a result, the market capitalization of the Indonesia Stock Exchange has decreased by 11.06% or IDR 1.37 trillion to IDR 11.019 trillion as of March 27, 2025, from IDR 12.389 trillion at the end of 2024.

title: PT Daya Intiguna Yasa's Stock Price Drops 25.84% Despite Stable Financial Performance
body: PT Daya Intiguna Yasa Tbk (MDIY) has seen its stock price decline by 25.84% to IDR 1,320 per share since the beginning of 2025, despite its financial performance. The current price represents a 20% decrease from its initial public offering price of IDR 1,650 per share.

title: Agoes Projosasmito's Net Worth Drops by Almost Half in Three Months Due to Decline in PT Amman Mineral's Stock Price.
body: Agoes Projosasmito's net worth has decreased by nearly half to $3.6 billion as of Wednesday, down from $7 billion at the end of 2024, according to Forbes Real-Time Net Worth data. The decline is partly attributed to the 38.05% drop in PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN) shares, which fell to IDR 5,250 per share from IDR 8,475 in January 2025.

title: Prajogo Pangestu's Wealth Increases to $16.9 Billion Amid Recent Stock Market Correction.
body: Prajogo Pangestu, founder of Barito Group, saw his wealth increase to $16.9 billion, up from $14.6 billion a week ago, according to Forbes Real Time Billionaires. However, his net worth has significantly decreased from $43.4 billion as of December 31, 2024, over the course of 2025.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Shows Fluctuating Trend with Weakening Tendency in Q1 2025.
body: The Indonesian rupiah has shown a fluctuating trend with a weakening tendency in the first quarter of 2025, reaching its lowest level since the 1998 monetary crisis at Rp 16,641, before closing slightly higher at Rp 16,622. This situation presents an opportunity for investment products that are not dependent on the rupiah, such as cryptocurrencies.

title: State-Owned Enterprises Transfer Shares to Sovereign Wealth Fund Indonesia
body: The Indonesian government is transferring shares of state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to the Sovereign Wealth Fund Indonesia, with PT PLN (PTPLF) already transferring 150.536 million shares worth IDR 150.536 trillion, which will increase the state's capital participation in PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia (BKI). This move is part of the government's efforts to optimize the management of SOEs and improve their performance.

title: Ramadan and Lebaran Celebrations Expected to Contribute Less to Indonesia's Economic Growth This Year
body: BSI Institute projects that the Ramadan and Lebaran period in Indonesia will generate around Rp 1.024,97 trillion in economic activity, a significant but potentially less-than-maximal contribution to domestic economic growth. This amount is substantial, especially considering the current economic conditions, according to Priyesta Rizkiningsih, Senior Resident Researcher at BSI Institute.

title: Indonesia's Eid Homecoming Travelers to Drop 24% This Year Amid Economic Pressures
body: Indonesia's Eid homecoming tradition is expected to see a 24% decline in travelers this year, resulting in a 12.28% contraction in economic circulation, with estimated revenue dropping from Rp 157.3 trillion to Rp 137.98 trillion. The decline in consumer spending, driven by economic pressures, job losses, and cautious spending among middle-class Indonesians, is expected to have broader consequences, including a 16.5% drop in additional GDP contributions and a lower GDP growth rate of 5.03% in Q1 2025.

title: Australian health tech company BrainEye targets Indonesia's sports industry with AI-driven concussion detection technology.
body: Australian health tech company BrainEye (no ticker) is eyeing Indonesia's sports industry, particularly the country's football association PSSI, with its AI-driven eye-tracking technology that can help detect brain injuries, potentially tapping into a huge market with 280 million people. While no deal has been made with PSSI yet, BrainEye has partnered with FIFPro, a worldwide representative organization of over 65,000 professional footballers, and has made its app available to the general public, with potential for significant revenue growth.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Revocation of Kresna Life's Business Licence to Protect Consumers and Strengthen Investor Confidence
body: The Supreme Court of Indonesia has upheld the Financial Services Authority's (OJK) decision to revoke PT Asuransi Jiwa Kresna's business license due to its inability to meet the solvency ratio, ensuring consumer protection and strengthening investor confidence in the financial services industry. The revocation remains valid, and the process of settling policyholders' obligations will continue, with OJK aiming to increase public confidence in the industry.

title: PT Pakuwon Jati Records 14% Increase in Net Profit to IDR 2.62 Trillion in 2024
body: PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk (PWON) recorded a net profit of IDR 2.62 trillion in 2024, a 14% increase from the previous year, driven by an 8% rise in revenue to IDR 6.67 trillion and an 11% increase in recurring revenue to IDR 5.19 trillion. The company's marketing sales also surged 16% to IDR 1.55 trillion, with 59% of total marketing sales coming from the government-borne value-added tax incentive program, contributing to an 11% increase in gross profit to IDR 3.77 trillion.

title: PT Sumber Global Energy TBK Sees 18.89% Revenue Growth but 4.25% Profit Decline in 2024
body: PT Sumber Global Energy Tbk (SGER) reported an 18.89% revenue growth to IDR 14.76 trillion in 2024, driven by increases in coal, nickel, and palm oil sales, but its profit slid 4.25% due to higher general administrative expenses and financial expenses. The company's gross profit margin decreased to 6.97% from 8.59% in the previous year, with profit before income tax and profit attributable to the parent entity also declining by 3.56% and 4.25%, respectively.

title: PT Bank Tabungan Negara to Distribute IDR 751.83 Billion in Cash Dividends to Shareholders for Fiscal Year 2024.
body: PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BBTN) will distribute cash dividends worth IDR 751.83 billion to shareholders for the 2024 fiscal year, with a dividend per share of IDR 53.57, representing 25% of its total net profit of IDR 3 trillion. The remaining 75% of the net profit, IDR 2.25 trillion, will be used as retained earnings to support the company's business development.

title: PT Teladan Prima Agro Realizes 29.41% of IPO Funds, to Report at Annual General Meeting
body: PT Teladan Prima Agro Tbk (TLDN) has realized 29.41% of its IPO funds, amounting to IDR285.60 billion, which will be reported at the annual general meeting of shareholders on April 24, 2025. The company had raised IDR285.60 billion in its IPO on March 31, 2022, with plans to allocate 71% for acquiring palm oil companies and the remaining funds placed in PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) with a 6% annual interest rate.

title: PT Akr Corporindo's Controllers and Management Buy Back 54.72 Million Shares of the Company.
body: PT Akr Corporindo Tbk's (AKRI) controlling shareholders and management have been actively buying back the company's shares, purchasing 54.72 million shares since early January 2025. This significant buyback activity may indicate the company's confidence in its future performance and potential upside for investors.

title: Antam Gold Price Rises by Rp 17,000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased the price of its gold by Rp 17,000 per gram, from Rp 1,819,000 to Rp 1,836,000, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 17,000 per gram, from Rp 1,671,000 to Rp 1,688,000. This price hike is likely to impact the gold market and investors in Indonesia.

title: Foreign Investors Resume Accumulation of Indonesian Stocks in Q1 2025
body: Foreign investors started accumulating buying again in the last week of the first quarter of 2025, recording a net foreign buy value of Rp 3.25 trillion. This indicates a positive trend in the market, with foreign investors increasing their buying activity in the Indonesian market.

title: Barito Renewables Announces Rp 1.03 Trillion Affiliate Transaction for Geothermal Development
body: PT Barito Renewables Tbk (BART) announced a transaction worth Rp 1.03 trillion through its subsidiary for geothermal development. This significant investment is expected to have a substantial impact on the company's financial metrics and future growth prospects.

title: Global Economic Calendar Packed with Data Releases Potentially Impacting Major Currencies
body: The global economic calendar is packed with data releases today, which may impact the movement of major currencies such as USD, EUR, GBP, JPY, AUD, CAD, NZD, and CHF. The key agenda includes the release of March's CPI and CPI data at 13:30 WIB, which may influence market trends.

title: PT Ancora Indonesia Resources Tbk Plans to Change Share Ownership Structure through Private Placement.
body: PT Ancora Indonesia Resources Tbk (OKAS) plans to hold an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders to seek approval for a private placement of 656,324,873 new shares, equivalent to 27.65% of the company's fully paid and deposited capital, to increase capital without preemptive rights. This move is expected to change the company's share ownership structure.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rises 3.83% in March 2025 Despite Foreign Investors' Net Sell of IDR 8.02 Trillion
body: The Indonesian Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) strengthened by 3.83% in March 2025, closing at 6,510.62 on March 27, 2025, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 8.02 trillion throughout the month.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Sell in Indonesian Stock Market in March 2025
body: In March 2025, foreign investors recorded a net sell of 2.59 billion shares in the Indonesian stock market, but the total value of their assets increased by Rp 61.07 trillion. As of March 2025, foreign investors held Rp 3.144 trillion worth of shares in the Indonesian stock market, according to data from the Central Custodian of the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper's Performance Remains Prospective Amid Global Pulp Market Fluctuations
body: PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper Tbk (INKP) is expected to maintain its prospective performance despite global pulp market fluctuations, driven by its planned factory expansion in 1H 2025. In 2024, INKP recorded a net profit growth despite an 8.06% decline in revenue to $3.19 billion from $3.47 billion in 2023.

title: Government Pushes for Coal-Based Dimethyl Ether Production to Reduce LPG Imports
body: The Indonesian government is pushing to promote the development of dimethyl ether (DME) from coal as a substitute for imported liquefied petroleum gas, with the global DME market expected to grow from $9.41 billion in 2023 to $20.32 billion by 2032. The market growth is driven by the Asia Pacific region, where DME is already being utilized in the industrial sector, according to Fortune Business Insights.

title: US President Donald Trump Imposes 32 Percent Tariff on Indonesian Imports in Response to Alleged Unfair Trade Practices
body: US President Donald Trump announced a 32% "reciprocal" tariff on imports from Indonesia, citing unfair bilateral trade practices, with Indonesia having imposed a 64% tariff on US goods, resulting in a $19.3 billion trade deficit for the US in 2024. The new tariffs aim to address the trade imbalance, with the US set to charge Indonesia approximately half of what it has been charging the US, with Indonesia being the 15th-largest contributor to the US trade deficit.

title: Global Gold Prices Reach Record High Amidst US-China Trade War and Economic Uncertainty
body: Global gold prices have reached a record high of $3,159 per troy ounce, surpassing the previous record of $3,123.05, driven by the US-China trade war, weakening US dollar, and declining US treasury yields, with Pt Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) gold prices in Indonesia also hitting a new record high of IDR 1,836,000 per gram.

title: Asian Stock Markets Plummet After Trump Announces Universal Import Tariff Policy
body: Asian stock markets plummeted after US President Donald Trump announced a 10% universal import tariff policy, with South Korea's KOSPI declining 0.76%, Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh Index dropping 6.63%, and Indonesia's market vulnerable to a 32% tariff. Asian currencies also weakened, with the Thai Baht experiencing a 0.64% decline, while the Japanese Yen strengthened 0.76% against the US Dollar.

title: PTPP Completes 91.7% of Samarinda's Sultan Alimuddin-Kakap Road Tunnel Project in East Kalimantan
body: PT Pembangunan Perumahan Tbk (PTPP) has completed 91.70% of the Sultan Alimuddin-Kakap road tunnel project in Samarinda, East Kalimantan, with an investment of IDR 395.9 billion. The project, expected to be operational in the first semester of 2025, will enhance public accessibility in Samarinda city, funded by the regional revenue expenditure budget of Samarinda city.

title: Rupiah weakens against US dollar following implementation of US reciprocal tariffs.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened to IDR 16,760 per US dollar on Thursday, down 0.33% from the previous day's closing rate, following the implementation of reciprocal tariffs by the US. The rupiah's depreciation was part of a broader trend, as other Asian currencies, including the Chinese yuan, South Korean won, and Malaysian ringgit, also weakened against the US dollar in response to the tariffs.

title: Antam Gold Price Drops by Rp 17,000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) lowered the price of its gold by Rp 17,000 per gram, from Rp 1,836,000 per gram to Rp 1,819,000 per gram, while the buyback price also decreased by Rp 17,000 per gram, from Rp 1,688,000 per gram to Rp 1,671,000 per gram. This move marks a significant change in the gold market, with potential implications for investors and market participants.

title: Norges Bank Takes Cautious Approach to Indonesian Stock Market Despite Q1 2025 Downturn
body: (Note: There are no company names mentioned in the article in the format 'Company Name (TICKER)', so none are included in the summary.)

title: Rupiah Plunges to Historic Low Amid US Tariff Policy and Global Market Pressure
body: The Indonesian rupiah plummeted to its worst level in the global market on Thursday, weakening 0.2% to RP 16,745 per dollar, driven by the US's tariff policy against importing countries, including Indonesia. The rupiah's performance in the offshore market also reached a record low of RP 16,771 per dollar, marking its worst performance ever.

title: PT Vale Indonesia Predicted to See Performance Growth in 2025 with Nickel Ore Sales and Smelter Projects
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO) is expected to see growth in 2025, driven by the start of nickel ore sales and the completion of three high-pressure acid leach smelters by 2025 and 2026. The company's management is targeting the completion of these projects, which are located in Pomalaa, Southeast Sulawesi, and Sorowako, South Sulawesi, to boost its performance.

title: Directorate General of Taxation Urges Taxpayers to Report Annual Income Tax Returns for 2024 Amid Government Relaxation
body: As of April 1, 2024, 12.34 million annual tax returns for the 2024 tax year have been reported, with 12 million being individual tax returns and 338,200 being corporate tax returns. The government has provided relaxation for tax reporting, urging taxpayers to report their annual tax returns promptly.

title: Telkom Indonesia Strengthens Business Segment with New Brand Telkom Solution
body: PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM) is strengthening its position in the business-to-business (B2B) market through its new brand, Telkom Solution, aiming to solidify its role as a digital solution provider. This move is expected to further establish Telkom Indonesia as a key player in the digital solutions market, catering to the needs of businesses.

title: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Achieves Positive Financial Performance in 2024 Despite Potential Challenges Ahead
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) reported a positive financial performance in 2024, with a 3.84% year-over-year increase in revenue to $3.79 billion and a 22.06% year-over-year growth in net profit to $339.43 million. However, the company may face challenges in 2025, including the reimplementation of certain natural gas pricing policies.

title: Consumer Spending in Indonesia Slows Down Ahead of Eid al-Fitr 2025
body: According to Mandiri Institute's spending index, consumer spending in Indonesia grew only 3.8% in the second week of Ramadan 2025, significantly lower than the same period in 2023 and 2024, which saw growth of 7.6% and 4.6%, respectively. This subdued growth is unusual for the Ramadan and Idulfitri period, which typically sees a significant increase in consumer spending.

title: US Imposes 32% Tariff on Indonesian Imports, Threatening Labor-Intensive Industries
body: The new 32% reciprocal tariff imposed by the US on Indonesia is expected to significantly impact Indonesia's labor-intensive industries, including footwear manufacturers. This policy is likely to have a substantial effect on the industry's financial performance, potentially leading to increased costs and reduced competitiveness.

title: US Imposes 10% Tariff on Indonesian Goods, Effective April 5, 2025, with Additional 32% Reciprocal Tariff on Certain Products
body: The US has imposed a 10% tariff on all goods entering the country starting April 5, 2025, with reciprocal tariffs taking effect on April 9, 2025, affecting Indonesia with a 32% tariff on certain products. This move is based on calculations of trade barriers, currency manipulation, and market access, and is seen as a escalation of the trade war.

title: PT Sarimelati Kencana Tbk, Parent Company of Pzza, Seeks Strategic Partner Amid Shifting Food and Beverage Industry Dynamics
body: PT Sarimelati Kencana Tbk, the parent company of PZZA, is reportedly seeking a potential strategic partner, including considering options to exit its shareholding structure, driven by investor demand to monetize its holding or bring in new supporters amidst shifting dynamics in Indonesia's food and beverage sector. This move aims to capitalize on the sector's growth, aligning with investor interests in the company.

title: Indonesian Businessmen See Opportunity in Trump's Reciprocal Tariffs Policy
body: After the US President Donald Trump imposed reciprocal tariffs on several countries, including Indonesia with a 32% import tariff, Indonesian entrepreneurs see this as an opportunity for domestic industries to grow. However, the policy is also expected to pose challenges and have a domino effect on the global and Indonesian economies.

title: PT Sarana Menara Nusantara's Net Profit Reaches IDR 3.33 Trillion in 2024 with 2.53% Annual Growth.
body: PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk (TOWR) reported a strong performance in 2024, achieving a net profit of Rp 3.33 trillion, a 2.53% year-over-year increase from Rp 3.25 trillion in 2023. The company's revenue and net profit growth reflect its successful performance in the telecommunications infrastructure sector.

title: Energi Manyar Sejahtera to Distribute Wealth from Liquidation Results.
body: PT Energi Manyar Sejahtera, a subsidiary of PT Akr Corporindo Tbk (AKR), will distribute the wealth from its liquidation, following the decision to dissolve the company announced in January 2025. The liquidation process is expected to bring significant financial outcomes, although the exact figures have not been disclosed.

title: Potential Decrease in Number of Homebound Travelers During 2025 Eid Holiday
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Transportation projects a 20% decrease in the number of travelers during the 2025 Eid holiday season, following a similar trend this year. This decline is expected to have a significant impact on the transportation industry, with potential revenue losses for companies operating in the sector.

title: Indonesian Exporters to the US Face 32% Tariff Hike Starting April 9, 2025
body: Indonesia's exports to the US, worth $26.31 billion in 2024, are expected to be heavily impacted by the new 32% import tariff, potentially leading to a decline in demand and a surge in prices in the American market. The tariff hike may also lead to a weakening of the rupiah, which is already under pressure, and could disrupt the country's trade surplus, which reached $9.5 billion in 2024.

title: Consumer Credit Quality May Deteriorate After Eid Holiday Due to Increased Spending.
body: Bank Indonesia's data shows that the quality of consumer credit has been deteriorating since the beginning of the year, with the non-performing loan ratio increasing, particularly in the consumer credit segment. This trend is expected to worsen after the Eid holiday, as increased spending during the long break may disrupt loan repayment schedules, affecting the overall credit quality.

title: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada to Conduct Share Buyback Without Holding General Meeting of Shareholders
body: PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Tbk (CMNP) plans to conduct a buyback of up to 543.74 million shares without holding a general meeting of shareholders. This move is aimed at reducing the company's outstanding shares, which could potentially boost its stock price and increase shareholder value.

title: US Imposes 32% Tariff on Indonesian Exports, Experts Warn of Significant Impact on Trade Balance and Rupiah.
body: The US President, Donald Trump, announced a new tariff of 32% on various imported goods from Indonesia, which could significantly impact Indonesia's balance of payments and the long-term fundamentals of the Rupiah currency. This move is expected to have a significant impact on Indonesia's exports to the US, with potential consequences for the country's economy and investment landscape.

title: US Imposes Higher Tariffs on Multiple Countries, Including Indonesia, in Trade Dispute.
body: The US government's decision to impose high tariffs on imports poses risks and challenges not only to Indonesia but also to all countries with a trade surplus, with President Donald Trump officially raising retaliatory tariffs on several trading partner countries. The tariffs range from 32% on Indonesia and Taiwan to 49% on Cambodia, with other countries including China, the European Union, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, and Thailand also affected.

title: Debate Reignites Over Music Royalty System in Indonesia, with Some Supporting Direct Licensing and Others Advocating for Collective Management.
body: The debate over music royalties has resurfaced in Indonesia, with some musicians supporting direct licensing, which allows creators to issue licenses directly to users, bypassing collective management organizations, while others argue that only these organizations have legal legitimacy. The dispute revolves around the distribution of royalties, which are increasing in value due to the growth of the digital music industry, and touches on issues such as creators' sovereignty over their work and contractual flexibility.

title: US President Imposes Retaliatory Tariffs on Over 180 Countries, Including Southeast Asia.
body: The US President has announced a retaliatory import tariff policy for over 180 countries and regions, with several Southeast Asian nations, including Indonesia, facing significant import tariffs. Cambodia tops the list with a 49% import tariff, as part of the new policy announced by Trump.

title: Financial Services Authority to Impose New Regulations on Fintech Lending Industry Requiring Collateral for Loans Above IDR 2 Billion.
body: The Financial Services Authority is drafting new regulations for the fintech lending industry, requiring collateral for loans above IDR 2 billion. The proposed rules aim to ensure that fintech lending providers secure guarantees for loan disbursements exceeding the specified amount.

title: Chandra Asri Group and Glencore Complete Acquisition of Shell Energy Chemicals Park in Singapore
body: Chandra Asri Group and Glencore have completed the acquisition of Shell Singapore Pte. Ltd.'s stake in Shell Energy Chemicals Park, now renamed Aster Energy Chemicals Park in Singapore, through their joint venture company CapGC Pte. Ltd. The acquisition marks a significant milestone for Chandra Asri Group (TIIK) and Glencore, but financial metrics of the deal were not disclosed.

title: US Imposes New Tariffs on Indonesian Exports in Retaliation for Higher Tariffs on American Goods
body: US President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on various imported goods, with Indonesia facing a 32% tariff on its exports to the US, while Indonesia currently imposes a 64% tariff on US goods. This move is part of a retaliatory tariff policy targeting several countries, including Indonesia.

title: IDX30 Label Does Not Guarantee Profit for Investors
body: Investing in IDX30, a big-cap index, does not guarantee profits for investors, including institutional investors like Invesco Ltd (IVZ), as they can still incur losses if they are not cautious. The IDX30 label does not ensure returns, and investors must remain vigilant to avoid losses, even when investing in large-cap stocks within the index.

title: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara Sets Ambitious Dividend Target of USD 8 Billion Per Year.
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara has set a target dividend of at least US$8 billion per year, equivalent to IDR132 trillion, assuming an exchange rate of US$1 to IDR16,500. This ambitious target is a significant milestone for the investment management firm, highlighting its growth prospects and potential returns for investors.

title: Indonesia urged to strengthen trade ties with China-led BRICS amid US tariffs.
body: Indonesia faces 32% reciprocal tariffs from the US, effective April 9, amidst the ongoing trade war sparked by President Trump's sweeping tariffs on nearly all trading partners, with other BRICS nations facing tariffs ranging from 10% to 49%. To mitigate the impact, Indonesia is advised to strengthen its intra-trade investment cooperation with BRICS nations, which could provide an alternative market, and explore other options like the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) to reduce its reliance on the US market.

title: US Imposes 32 Percent Tariff on Indonesian Imports to Address Trade Deficit and Unfair Tariff Disparities
body: The US has imposed a 32% tariff on imports from Indonesia, citing a $16.84 billion trade surplus in 2024 and a $3.14 billion surplus in the first two months of this year, making the US the largest contributor to Indonesia's overall trade surplus. The tariffs aim to address unfair tariff disparities and non-tariff barriers, including local content requirements and complex import licensing systems, which hinder market access for American exporters.

title: US Tariffs on Indonesian Imports to Significantly Impact Automotive and Electronics Exports
body: The newly imposed 32% tariffs on Indonesian imports by the United States are expected to significantly impact Indonesia's automotive and electronics exports, with potential losses of $280.4 million in automotive exports to the US in 2023. The tariffs could lead to reduced production capacity, layoffs, and a 0.08 percentage point slowdown in Indonesia's GDP for every 1 percentage point decline in US economic growth.

title: Trump Imposes Reciprocal Tariffs on ASEAN Countries, with Cambodia and Vietnam Facing Highest Rates
body: US President Donald Trump has imposed reciprocal tariffs on ASEAN economies, with Cambodia facing the highest rate of 49%, followed by Laos and Vietnam, while Myanmar, recently hit by an earthquake, will be subject to a 44% tariff. Indonesia will face a 32% tariff, with other ASEAN members including Malaysia, Philippines, and Singapore facing rates ranging from 10% to 24%, in response to what Trump calls "unfair" trade practices.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Falls for Second Consecutive Day Amid Global Economic Uncertainty
body: Indonesia's Jakarta Composite Index fell 1.55% to 6,161.2, with widespread losses across nearly all sectors, as investors grew uneasy over global economic uncertainty, while technology was the sole bright spot, climbing 3.6%. Meanwhile, demand for sovereign debt increased, leading to rising bond prices and declining yields, as investors sought lower-risk instruments amid market turbulence.

title: PT Samudera Indonesia receives IDA+ rating with stable outlook from Pefindo due to strong market position and diversified shipping business.
body: PT Samudera Indonesia Tbk (SMDR) has been awarded an IDA+ rating with a stable outlook by PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia, citing the company's strong market position and diversified shipping business portfolio, as well as solid financial flexibility. However, the rating could be improved if SMDR strengthens its non-container shipping business, or decreased if there is a significant decline in shipping volume, lower freight rates, or uncontrolled increases in bunker fuel prices.

title: Bayan Resources and its subsidiary cleared of legal issues after plaintiffs withdraw civil lawsuit in East Kalimantan court.
body: PT Bayan Resources Tbk (BYAN) and its subsidiary are no longer entangled in legal issues after plaintiffs withdrew a civil lawsuit at the Tenggarong District Court, East Kalimantan, resolving all legal disputes between the parties. The withdrawal of the lawsuit has no impact on the company's operations, and this resolution follows a series of legal proceedings in East Kalimantan that were resolved through withdrawals, including an appeal against PT Brian Anjat Sentosa and PT Fajar Sakti Prima last month.

title: Metrodata Electronics Expects Weakening Rupiah to Impact IT Product Prices in Next Three Months
body: PT Metrodata Electronics Tbk (MTDL) expects a weakening rupiah against the US dollar to impact its business in the next three months, potentially affecting prices of IT and smartphone products, with a direct impact on the company's revenue and profit. Despite the global economic turmoil, MTDL remains committed to its strategy, having generated IDR25 trillion in revenue in 2024, a 13.9% growth from 2023, with a net profit of IDR739.8 billion, a 13.7% increase from the previous year.

title: Lippo Karawaci's net profit surges 31 times in 2024 despite revenue decline due to healthcare segment divestment.
body: PT Lippo Karawaci Tbk (LPKR) reported a 31-fold surge in net profit to IDR 18.75 trillion in 2024, despite a 32% year-on-year decline in revenue to IDR 11.5 trillion, primarily due to the deconsolidation of PT Siloam International Hospitals Tbk. The company's real estate segment revenue grew 14% to IDR 5.03 trillion, while lifestyle segment revenue increased 13% to IDR 1.4 trillion, driven by mall and hotel revenue, with pre-sales reaching IDR 6.01 trillion, exceeding its target.

title: Indonesian Chamber of Commerce Chairman Warns of Significant Impact from Proposed 32% US Import Tariffs on Indonesian Goods
body: The proposed 32% US import tariffs on Indonesian goods could significantly impact Indonesia's balance of payments and trade balance, with the US being Indonesia's largest contributor to its trade surplus of USD 16.8 billion in 2024. The Indonesian government plans to dispatch an economic diplomacy envoy to negotiate with the US government regarding the proposed tariffs, and is also urged to diversify its trading partners beyond ASEAN and Asia-Pacific.

title: Director of PT Intra Golflink Resorts Prioritizes Low-Risk Investment Strategy for Stability and Security
body: PT Intra Golflink Resorts Tbk's Director, Dwi Febri Astuti, prioritizes low-risk investment strategies to maintain asset stability and security, opting for conservative instruments like gold and deposits over high-risk investments. This approach allows investors to safeguard their investments from market fluctuations, ensuring a stable return on investment.

title: Antam Gold Price Drops by Rp 38,000 per Gram
body: The price of gold at Logam Mulia Antam (ANTM) decreased by Rp 38,000 per gram, from Rp 1,819,000 per gram to Rp 1,781,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 38,000 per gram, from Rp 1,671,000 per gram to Rp 1,633,000 per gram.

title: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk, a new property issuer on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, focuses on developing facilities for meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions.
body: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (CBDK), a new property issuer on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, focuses on developing facilities for meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions, and listed on the exchange on January 13, 2025, as the sixth company to go public this year. CBDK is a subsidiary of PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PANI), which was acquired through a rights issue in August 2022.

title: PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Records Excellent Performance in 2024 with 15.78% Annual Net Profit Growth.
body: PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ASPI) reported a net profit of IDR 892.04 billion in 2024, a 15.78% year-over-year increase from IDR 770.4 billion in 2023. This significant growth highlights the company's strong performance in the retail sector.

title: Global Stock Markets Plummet as US-China Trade War Escalates
body: The ongoing trade war has led to a global stock market downturn, with the Dow Jones index plummeting over 3% and wiping out around $903 billion in market capitalization, with a total loss of around $1.16 trillion in just one week. The decline is attributed to President Donald Trump's tariff policy, which has made investors cautious, affecting stock markets in the US, Europe, and most of Asia Pacific.

title: Indonesian Government Maintains Electricity Tariffs for Non-Subsidized Customers in Q2 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has set the electricity tariff for the second quarter of 2025 (April-June) for 13 non-subsidized customer groups, which will remain unchanged to maintain people's purchasing power and business competitiveness. The tariff for the second quarter of 2025 will be the same as the first quarter, unless otherwise determined by the government.

title: Sinarmas Group's Performance Varied in 2024 with Property and Palm Oil Sectors Showing Positive Results
body: The performance of Sinarmas Group's issuers varied in 2024, with the property and crude palm oil sectors achieving positive results, according to their respective financial reports. The positive performance of these sectors contributed to the overall growth of the group, with further details available to subscribers.

title: PT Kereta Api Indonesia Optimizes Subsidized Fuel Quota to Support Smooth Lebaran Travel This Year
body: PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has secured a subsidized fuel quota of 209,809 kiloliters, a 6.7% increase from last year's 196,653 kiloliters, to support the smooth operation of train services during the Lebaran holiday season. The increased quota reflects the government's trust in the efficient and environmentally friendly transportation provided by KAI.

title: Businesses in Rest Area Segment Remain Optimistic Amid Increasing Traffic Volume on Toll Roads
body: PT Hutama Karya remains optimistic about the rest area business, driven by the increasing traffic volume on the Trans Sumatra toll road during the Eid al-Fitr holiday period, which is expected to boost business prospects. The company sees a positive outlook for the rest area segment, aligning with the growth in vehicle traffic on the toll road during the holiday season.

title: US Imposes 32% Tariff on Indonesian Exports, Affecting Multiple Industries
body: US President Donald Trump has announced a 32% reciprocal tariff on Indonesia, affecting various industries that export to the US, including footwear, textiles, furniture, tires, and electronics. The policy has sparked reactions from the Indonesian government and business players, who are concerned about the impact on the country's industries.

title: Most Asian Currencies Strengthen Against the US Dollar Amid Recession Fears
body: Most Asian currencies strengthened against the US dollar over the past week, with the USD/JPY pair falling 2.7% and USD/KRW and USD/INR declining 1.59% and 0.43%, respectively, amid recession fears. The decline in the US dollar against Asian currencies comes as investors worry about a potential recession in the US, leading to a shift in currency market dynamics.

title: PT Hero Global Investment Records 44.9% Increase in Net Profit in 2024
body: PT Hero Global Investment Tbk (HGII) reported a 44.9% year-over-year increase in net profit to IDR 37.87 billion in 2024, driven by operational efficiency and a 58% reduction in cost of goods sold. The company's pre-tax profit also surged 47.9% to IDR 49.35 billion, marking a significant improvement in its financial performance.

title: Superior Prima Sukses Targets Double-Digit Growth This Year Through Expansion Strategies
body: PT Superior Prima Sukses Tbk (BLES) aims to achieve double-digit growth this year through expansion strategies, including operational and business developments. The company plans to start operating its factory in Banjarnegara, Central Java, in the middle of this year and increase utilization at its existing factories 1 and 2 after adding new machinery last year.

title: PT Humpuss Maritim Internasional Records Positive Performance Growth in 2024
body: PT Humpuss Maritim Internasional Tbk (HMPU) reported a positive performance growth in 2024, with revenue from contracts with customers increasing by 20.02% year-over-year to US$127.68 million, up from US$106.38 million in 2023. This significant revenue growth highlights the company's strong performance in the shipping industry.

title: Several listed companies are aggressively expanding their business through the establishment of new subsidiaries to support their activities and increase revenue.
body: PT Charlie Hospital Semarang Tbk (CHARL) has established a new subsidiary, PT Charlie Konstruksi Indonesia, which operates in the construction business sector, with RSCH acquiring 990 shares of CKI worth IDR 990 million. This expansion is part of the company's efforts to support its business activities and boost revenue.

title: Garuda Metalindo to Maintain Export Sales in 2025 Despite US Import Tariff Policy
body: PT Garuda Metalindo Tbk (GMNT) remains committed to boosting sales in the export market in 2025, despite the US government's imposition of a 32% import tariff on Indonesian products. The company aims to continue its export sales growth, undeterred by the new trade policy introduced by President Donald Trump.

title: Asian Stock Markets Plummet Following Trump's Reciprocal Tariff Policy
body: The reciprocal tariff policy implemented by US President Donald Trump has put significant pressure on Asian stock markets, with most indices in the region falling into the red zone on Friday. The Nikkei 225 index in Japan plummeted 5.76% in a week, while the Hang Seng index in Hong Kong dropped 3.48%, and other major indices in the region, including the BSE Sensex, Kospi, and Shanghai Composite Index, also declined.

title: Indonesia Urged to Take Initiative in World Trade Organization to Promote Fair and Sustainable Global Trade System
body: Indonesia needs to take initiative in the global arena, particularly through the World Trade Organization, to promote a fair, non-discriminatory, and sustainable global trade system. The US, under Donald Trump's leadership, has expanded its tariff policies to neighboring countries like Canada and Mexico, highlighting the need for Indonesia to take action to protect its trade interests.

title: Ramadan and Lebaran Spending in 2025 Expected to be Slower Compared to Previous Years
body: The positive impact of Ramadan and Lebaran in 2025 is expected to be limited compared to previous years due to slowing consumer spending during this period. According to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata, the purchasing power during Ramadan this year is not as strong as last year, partly due to Indonesia's 0.09% annual deflation in February 2025, the country's first annual deflation since 2000.

title: US Imposes 32% Tariff on Indonesian Exports in Response to Trade Deficit
body: The US has imposed a 32% retaliatory tariff on Indonesian exports, effective April 9, 2025, citing a $17.9 billion trade deficit with Indonesia in 2024, which could impact Indonesia's key export products to the US. The move is expected to have significant implications for Indonesia's trade balance, with the country having recorded a $14.34 billion surplus in its trade with the US in 2024, according to Indonesia's Ministry of Trade.

title: US Trade Representative Highlights Intellectual Property Protection Issues in Indonesia
body: The 2025 National Trade Estimate Report by the United States Trade Representative highlights trade barriers faced by American businesses in Indonesia, including intellectual property rights violations, which hinder market access and competitiveness. The report notes that Indonesia remains on the priority watch list for intellectual property rights enforcement, with widespread counterfeiting and piracy, particularly in online and offline markets, affecting American companies' exports to the country.

title: Indonesian Automotive Insurance Industry Remains Sluggish in Early 2025
body: PT Asuransi Central Asia reported stagnant growth in its vehicle insurance business in the first three months of 2025, reflecting the sluggish automotive market, which has yet to show signs of recovery. The weak vehicle sales have also impacted the vehicle insurance business, leading to stagnant performance in the sector.

title: Digital banks in Indonesia consistently record significant profit growth in early 2025.
body: Bank Neo Commerce Tbk (BNCM) reported a significant 902.8% year-over-year increase in profit to IDR 110.91 billion as of February 2025, indicating a consistent trend of profitability among digital banks in Indonesia. This trend is expected to continue in 2025, with several digital banks in the country experiencing significant profit growth during the January-February 2025 period.

title: Global Economic Uncertainty Prompts Life Insurance Industry to Reassess Investment Strategies
body: The global economic uncertainty is prompting Indonesia's life insurance industry to be more cautious in their investments, particularly with the decline in government bond prices due to rising yields. As of 2024, government bonds accounted for 37.9% of total life insurance investments, valued at Rp 205 trillion, making them the largest investment destination for the industry.

title: Indonesian Credit Quality May Deteriorate After Eid Holiday Due to Increased Consumer Spending.
body: Bank Indonesia's data shows that the quality of consumer credit has started to deteriorate since early 2025, with non-performing loan (NPL) ratios increasing, particularly in the consumer credit sector, such as housing loans (2.94% in February 2025, up from 2.61% in December 2024) and multi-purpose loans (1.55% in February 2025, up from 1.44% in December 2024). This decline in credit quality is likely due to increased spending during the long holiday period, which often affects loan repayment after the holiday ends.

title: Indonesia Faces New Trade Challenges as US Imposes 10% Tariff and Reciprocal Tariffs on Various Export Products.
body: The US has imposed a 10% tariff on all imported goods starting April 5, 2025, and a reciprocal tariff of 32% on various Indonesian export products starting April 9, 2025, citing trade barriers, currency manipulation, and market access issues. This move is expected to pose a significant challenge to Indonesia's economy, with potential impacts on its export sector and overall trade relations with the US.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Faces Further Pressure in Q2 2025 Amid Ongoing Trade War Concerns
body: As the second quarter of 2025 begins, Indonesia's stock market is threatened by the ongoing trade war triggered by US President Donald Trump's tariffs, which may lead to further pressure on the Indonesian stock market after the long holiday since the end of the first quarter. The Jakarta Composite Index has already fallen 8.04% year-to-date, closing at 6,510.62, reflecting the uncertainty still looming over the market, both globally and domestically.

title: Indonesia Urged to Appoint New Envoy to US Amid Imminent Retaliatory Tariffs
body: The US has imposed a 32% retaliatory tariff on Indonesian imports, effective April 9, amid accusations of unfair bilateral trade, with Indonesia's trade with the US valued at $38.3 billion in 2024, up from $34.5 billion in 2023. The vacant Indonesian envoy position in the US has sparked concerns, with experts urging President Prabowo to appoint a seasoned diplomat to negotiate with the Trump government and mitigate the impact of the tariffs on Indonesia's economy.

title: Garuda Indonesia Aims to Add 100 Aircraft by 2025 to Improve Operational Efficiency and Competitiveness
body: PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) aims to add 100 aircraft by the end of 2025, expecting to improve operational efficiency and competitiveness, after reporting a 15.32% increase in scheduled flight revenue to $2.74 billion and a 101.06% surge in charter service revenue in 2024. Despite a net loss of $69.78 million due to aircraft maintenance costs, the airline remains optimistic and is undertaking strategies such as adding aircraft to increase service capacity.

title: PT Solusi Tunas Pratama's Profit Drops 13.65% to IDR974.31 Billion in 2024
body: PT Solusi Tunas Pratama Tbk (SUPR) reported a profit of IDR974.31 billion in 2024, a 13.65% decline from the previous year, with revenue reaching IDR1.81 trillion, down 3.95% from IDR1.89 trillion in the previous year. The company's revenue contributions came from tower leases with PT XL Axiata Tbk, PT Indosat Tbk, PT Telekomunikasi Selular, and PT Smart Telecom, while a rise in cost of goods sold and net other expenses contributed to the decline in profit.

title: State Street Corporation Invests in 25 Stocks from IDX30, Focusing on Banking, Telecommunication, and Energy Sectors
body: State Street Corporation has invested in 25 out of 30 stocks listed on the IDX30, with a focus on sectors such as banking, telecommunications, and energy, as of March 10, 2025, according to Bloomberg data. The American financial services and banking company has made significant investments in various Indonesian companies, highlighting its confidence in the country's economy.

title: President Prabowo coordinates with ASEAN leaders to respond to US tariff hikes that disproportionately affect Southeast Asian countries.
body: ASEAN leaders, including Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines, are coordinating a collective response to the latest US tariff hikes, which have disproportionately affected Southeast Asian countries, with tariffs ranging from 17% to 49% and a total two-way goods trade of $520.3 billion in 2023. The tariffs could strain ASEAN-US trade relations, undermine regional supply chains, and shift economic momentum toward other major economies unless a mutually beneficial resolution is found.

title: Indonesian Government to Formulate Strategic Policies in Response to US Tariffs
body: The Indonesian government is formulating strategic policies to respond to the US-imposed reciprocal tariffs, which may impact Indonesia's export-oriented labour-intensive industries such as textiles and footwear. A meeting with business associations is scheduled for Monday to gather input on the tariff policy, with the goal of protecting labour-intensive sectors and mitigating the impact of the 10% universal tariff on all imported products.

title: US Government Imposes 10% Universal Tariff on Imported Products with Some Exemptions
body: The US government has imposed a 10% universal tariff on all imported products, excluding certain items like crude oil and pharmaceuticals, effective from Saturday, with reciprocal tariffs also being levied on 57 major trading partners, including Indonesia. The move, deemed the biggest action taken by the US government on global trade, sent global markets reeling, with majority indices falling more than 5% over two consecutive days.

title: Antam's Gold Price Drops by Rp 23,000 per Gram.
body: Logam Mulia Antam's gold price decreased by Rp 23,000 per gram to Rp 1,758,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 25,000 per gram to Rp 1,608,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices for the company, with significant implications for investors and the market.

title: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua's Stock Price Rises 5.54% in a Week, Becomes Top Leader in Jakarta Stock Exchange.
body: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIK) shares closed at IDR 10,000 per share on March 27, 2025, a 5.54% increase from the previous week, making it one of the top 10 price index movers in the last trading week of Q1 2025. This significant price surge propelled Pani shares to become a top leader in the composite stock price index during the period of March 24-27, 2025.

title: Surya Citra Media Allocates IDR 250 Billion for Capital Expenditure in 2025
body: PT Surya Citra Media Tbk (SCMA) has allocated IDR 250 billion for capital expenditure in 2025 to strengthen the digital transmission of its media entity, Emtek Group. The allocation aims to enhance the company's digital capabilities, marking a significant investment in its media business.

title: Indonesian Stock Market to Reopen Amid Rising Global Uncertainty Due to US Trade Tariffs
body: The Indonesian stock market will reopen on April 8, 2025, after the Eid holiday, but investors are expected to face new pressure from increased global uncertainty, particularly due to the US's new trade tariffs on several countries, including Indonesia. The tariffs, set at 32% on top of the 10% base rate, will take effect on April 9, 2025, and are likely to impact the market.

title: Asian Currencies Expected to Remain Volatile This Week Amid Global Economic Uncertainty
body: Asian currencies are expected to remain volatile this week, with most valutas weakening against the US dollar on Friday, although some showed slight strengthening. The market is cautious due to global economic uncertainty and trade tensions, causing investors to closely monitor market movements.

title: Humpuss Maritim Records 10.66% Year-on-Year Net Profit Growth to $11.52 Million in 2024.
body: PT Humpuss Maritim Internasional Tbk (HUMP) reported a 10.66% year-over-year increase in net profit to $11.52 million in 2024, driven by a 20.02% rise in revenue to $127.68 million. The company also saw a 6.93% increase in gross profit to $31.16 million, marking a strong financial performance for the year.

title: Gold price corrects after reaching new record high due to profit taking by investors.
body: Gold prices corrected at the end of the week due to profit-taking by investors amidst a sluggish global financial market, falling 4.13% to $3,035.4 per ounce on Friday from a record high of $3,166 per ounce on Wednesday, which was driven by the implementation of tariffs by US President Donald Trump.

title: Property Sector's Performance This Year to be Supported by Government Policy Despite Macro-Economic Concerns
body: The property sector's performance this year is expected to be supported by the government's relaxation policies, but liquidity conditions and macroeconomic uncertainty may hinder project developments and revenue growth for property companies. As a result, property companies' projects that are expected to drive revenue may face obstacles, potentially impacting their financial performance.

title: PT Paperocks Indonesia Sees Decline in Sales During Ramadan and Lebaran 2025
body: PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk (PPRI) experienced a decline in sales during the Ramadan and Lebaran period in 2025, a time when sales typically increase. According to Director and Owner Catur Jatiwaluyo, the contribution of sales during this period decreased compared to previous years.

title: National Food Agency Urges Local Governments to Prepare Food Subsidies Ahead of Major Holidays
body: The National Food Agency is urging local governments to prepare food subsidies to mitigate the impact of commodity price hikes during major holidays, with the subsidy scheme funded by regional budgets. As of now, the agency has achieved 70,000 tons of rice distribution out of a 150,000-ton target, and has implemented 2,634 affordable food programs and 3,751 cheap market operations across Indonesia.

title: Indonesia to Introduce Local Digital Coin to Support Palm Oil Industry Development
body: PT Palm Oil Indonesia, owned by Samuel Group, is set to launch an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) for its digital coin, $Palm, to support the development of the palm oil sector, with the coin serving as a utility token for community engagement and industry support. The ICO aims to raise funds by offering digital tokens or cryptocurrency to the public, marking a significant move in the Indonesian financial landscape.

title: Indonesian Exports of Crustaceans and Mollusks to the US May be Impacted by Trump's Tariff Policy
body: The US tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump may impact Indonesia's top 10 export commodities to the US, with crustaceans and mollusks being the most affected, as 78.5% of these exports are destined for the US market by 2024. This could have significant implications for Indonesia's economy, particularly for the crustacean and mollusk industry, which heavily relies on the US market.

title: Bank Agent Business Sees Significant Growth with Increasing Number of Agents and Transactions.
body: PT Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) has seen a 13.95% annual increase in its agents, reaching 217,000 by the end of February 2025, with around 16,000 agents operating in remote and underdeveloped areas. This growth has led to a significant increase in transactions, contributing to the bank's financial performance.

title: National Banking Liquidity Raises Concerns as Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Exceeds Healthy Limit
body: The liquidity of national banks in Indonesia is becoming increasingly concerning, with several banks, including large ones, experiencing pressure, as their loan-to-deposit ratios (LDRs) have exceeded the healthy limit of 92%. Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) has the highest LDR at 95.7% as of February 2025, although it has decreased from 98.8% in the previous month.

title: Indonesian Consumer Price Index Expected to Record Inflation in March with Monthly Rate Possibly Exceeding 1.5%.
body: Economists predict that Indonesia's monthly inflation rate will surge significantly in March 2025, exceeding 1.5%, but the annual inflation rate is still expected to remain within the lower bound of Bank Indonesia's 1.5% target. This forecast suggests a potential shift in the consumer price index, which could have implications for the country's economic outlook.

title: Financial Industry Expects Rise in Bad Credit Ratio Post-Idul Fitri Amid Economic Uncertainty
body: As the economy remains weak, financial industry players are becoming more cautious to mitigate the potential increase in non-performing loans, particularly in the multifinance sector, which has a history of poor performance in non-performing financing (NPF) after holidays. PT Pefindo Biro Kredit (IDScore) Director Tan Glant Saputrahadi warned that the "buy now pay later" business model has a high risk of NPF, prompting industry players to exercise caution.

title: Indonesian Business Community Urges Government to Address US Tariff Policy Impacting Exports
body: Indonesia's business community is urging the government to quickly address the reciprocal tariff policy imposed by US President Donald Trump, which has resulted in a 32% import tariff on Indonesian products, potentially impacting the country's shoe exports to the US. Despite a 24% increase in local shoe exports to the US in 2024, the tariff could hinder future growth, according to the Indonesian Footwear Association.

title: PT Bukit Asam Targets 50.05 Million Tons of Coal Production in 2023 Amidst Anticipated Price Trends.
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) aims to increase its coal production to 50.05 million tons in 2025, a higher target compared to last year's realization of 43.3 million tons. The company is preparing to boost production while anticipating the trend of coal prices for 2025.

title: Rise of Nationalism and Protectionism Challenges International Trade and Global Economic Interdependence
body: The shift from multilateral trade to economic nationalism and protectionism has been evident in the last decade, particularly since Brexit and the protectionist policies of the Trump administration, challenging the concept of interdependent economies. This trend has led countries to re-evaluate their trade relationships, resulting in new tariffs, export restrictions, and adjustments to global supply chains, highlighting that international trade is no longer determined solely by market mechanisms, but also by political decisions and national security strategies.

title: Global Stock Markets Plummet Amid Fears of US Tariff Policy
body: Global stock markets, including those in Asia and Europe, have plummeted into the red zone over the past week due to the US President Donald Trump's import tariff policy, sparking investor anxiety. The Indonesian domestic stock market, which reopens on Tuesday after a long holiday, may experience a massive sell-off, potentially triggering a trading halt and a decline in the IHSG index.

title: Nikel Mining Sector Faces Challenges Amid Global Price Volatility
body: Nikel mining sector companies, including PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO), are facing significant challenges due to the volatility of global nickel commodity prices, leading to a decline in performance, with PT Vale Indonesia Tbk's net profit dropping 78.94% year-over-year in 2024. The sector's struggles are expected to continue, posing risks to the companies' financial metrics.

title: US Tariff Hike on Indonesian Goods to Impact Indonesia's Tax Revenue
body: The Indonesian government's efforts to meet tax revenue targets are expected to be hindered by the higher import tariffs imposed by the US on goods from several countries, including Indonesia, with a reciprocal tariff of 32% set by President Donald Trump. This policy is predicted to reduce Indonesia's export competitiveness, according to economist Syafruddin Karimi from Andalas University.

title: US Tariff Policy Implemented by Donald Trump Affects Global Economy, Including Indonesia with 32% Reciprocal Tariff.
body: The implementation of import tariffs by US President Donald Trump has caused global turmoil, threatening to slow down the performance of export-oriented companies, with Indonesia facing a 32% reciprocal tariff, making Indonesian products more expensive in the US market. This tariff hike is expected to negatively impact the sales of Indonesian products exported to the US, affecting the country's export-oriented companies' financial performance.

title: Victoria Care Indonesia's Q1-2025 performance boosted by Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr sales surge.
body: PT Victoria Care Indonesia Tbk's performance in Q1-2025 was driven by a significant increase in sales during Ramadan and Idul Fitri, particularly in the skincare category. The company's operational director, Sumardi Widjaja, noted that the Ramadan and Idul Fitri period is historically an important momentum for the fast-moving consumer goods sector, including beauty products.

title: Indonesian Government Prepares to Counter US Reciprocal Tariffs with Tariff and Non-Tariff Measures
body: The Indonesian government is preparing to respond to the US's reciprocal tariff policy, with the National Economic Council recommending a combination of tariff and non-tariff measures to mitigate the impact. The council suggests identifying potential tariffs to be reduced for main imported products and relaxing technical regulations to reduce barriers for domestic products.

title: Sentul City's Revenue and Profit Plummet in 2024, But Company Prepares Strategy for Business Growth.
body: PT Sentul City Tbk (BKS) reported a sharp decline in revenue and profit in 2024, with revenue dropping 56.74% year-over-year to Rp 744.06 billion from Rp 1.72 trillion in the previous year. Despite this, the company is preparing a strategy to develop its business further by targeting higher marketing sales.
