title: Morgan Stanley and PT Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia actively trade PT MD Entertainment shares in March 2025.
body: Morgan Stanley & Co International Plc (MS) and PT Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia actively traded shares of PT MD Entertainment Tbk in March 2025, with Morgan Stanley & Co purchasing 1,355,400 shares on March 3, 2025. The transactions were recorded by the Indonesian Central Securities Depository, highlighting the two companies' significant activity in the stock market during the month.

title: ASEAN Leaders Unite to Coordinate Response to US Tariff Blitz Amid Trade Tensions
body: The US has imposed "reciprocal" tariffs on all 10 ASEAN member countries, with rates varying from 10% to 49%, affecting a total trade value of $476.8 billion in 2024, with a trade deficit of $227.7 billion. ASEAN countries, led by Malaysia, are coordinating a unified response, with Indonesia planning to send a high-level delegation to Washington DC to negotiate tariffs, while others like Cambodia and Singapore are taking different approaches to mitigate the impact.

title: Abrupt Shutdown of Yihong Novatex Indonesia Leaves 1,126 Workers Jobless Amidst Growing Crisis in Labor-Intensive Manufacturing Sector
body: The abrupt shutdown of Yihong Novatex Indonesia has left 1,126 workers jobless, highlighting the growing crisis in Indonesia's labor-intensive manufacturing sector, which is struggling with falling export demand, increasing operational costs, and stiffer competition from Vietnam and Bangladesh. The Indonesian government has launched a Rp 20 trillion credit facility to support industries such as textiles, garments, and footwear, but many workers have already been laid off, with companies like Sri Rejeki Isman and Victory Chingluh Adis Dimension Footwear also ceasing operations, impacting over 10,000 workers.

title: Indonesia to Expand Oil Palm Plantations to Meet Increasing Demand for Biodiesel Programs
body: Indonesia aims to increase its palm oil supply to support the implementation of mandatory biodiesel programs, with estimated palm oil needs of 17.9 million tons for B50, 21.5 million tons for B60, and 35.9 million tons for B100, requiring additional land areas of 2.3 million, 3.5 million, and 4.6 million hectares, respectively. The implementation of these programs is expected to reduce oil fuel imports, strengthen national energy resilience, and generate higher economic growth, while also reducing carbon emissions.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Association Supports Government's Efforts to Discipline Oil Palm Plantations, Urges Consideration of Historical Land Permits.
body: The Indonesian Palm Oil Association (Gapki) supports the government's policy to discipline oil palm plantations, with 230 member companies facing legal status issues, including 126 in Kalimantan, due to unclear land permits. The government has agreed to implement policies to ensure land management compliance with prevailing regulations, including adjusting policies for lands used for oil palm plantations, to strike a balance between environmental, economic, and community welfare interests.

title: Indonesia's 2024 Deforestation Rate Reaches 175,400 Hectares, Mostly Caused by Forest Fires and Illegal Logging
body: Indonesia's Ministry of Forestry reported that deforestation in 2024 reached 175,400 hectares, with a net deforestation rate of 175.4 thousand hectares, resulting in a total forest area of 95.5 million hectares or 51.1% of the country's total land area. The ministry has been pursuing efforts to reforest and rehabilitate forests, with a target of 217,900 hectares in 2024, and has implemented various measures to reduce deforestation, including a moratorium on new licenses and improvement of primary forest peatland governance.

title: Antam Gold Price Drops by Rp 4,000 per Gram.
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) lowered the price of its gold by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,758,000 per gram to Rp 1,754,000 per gram, while the buyback price also decreased by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,608,000 per gram to Rp 1,604,000 per gram. This move affects the gold market, with the new prices taking effect immediately.

title: Global Oil Prices Weaken, Affecting Oil and Gas Sector Stocks
body: The uncertainty surrounding oil and gas sector companies has increased due to the decline in global oil prices, with West Texas Intermediate crude oil prices dropping to $61.17 per barrel, an 8% decrease in a month. The decline is also influenced by the US import tariff policy, causing concerns for companies in the sector.

title: Consumer Sector Companies Release 2024 Financial Reports with Mixed Results
body: Majority of consumer sector emitters, including Indofood Sukses Makmur TBK (INDF) and Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur TBK (ICBP), reported revenue growth in 2024, with some also achieving net profit growth. However, Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company TBK (ULTJ) saw a 2.79% decline in net profit despite an increase in revenue.

title: Jasa Marga Sees Surge in Traffic During Lebaran 2025, Records 1.17 Million Vehicles Leaving Jabodetabek.
body: PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) is expected to reap the biggest benefits from the 2025 Eid al-Fitr holiday traffic, with 1.17 million vehicles leaving the Jabodetabek area from March 21-27, 2025, a 20.3% increase from normal traffic. For the return traffic, 685,079 vehicles have returned to Jabodetabek from March 31, 2025, to April 3, 2025, indicating a significant surge in traffic during the holiday period.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange to Reopen Broker Codes and Investor Domiciles to Boost Domestic Stock Market.
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) will reopen broker codes and investor domicile at the end of each trading session to revitalize the domestic stock market, as part of its efforts to stimulate the market. The exchange, along with the Financial Services Authority, has also introduced a buyback policy without a general meeting of shareholders to balance liquidity.

title: Personal Color Consulting Gains Popularity in Indonesia as More Women Seek to Enhance Their Natural Beauty
body: Personal color consulting services in Indonesia have seen a surge in demand, with companies like Color Lab and Magicolorstyle.by Rara reporting increased revenue, with Rara's monthly revenue reaching IDR 15-30 million (approximately USD 1,000-2,000) and Tracy's service pricing ranging from IDR 999,000 to IDR 1.2 million (approximately USD 67-80) per package. The initial investment to start a personal color consulting business can be substantial, with Rara and Meiske, founder of Color Harmony, citing initial investments of IDR 50 million (approximately USD 3,500) and hundreds of millions of rupiah, respectively.

title: Rupiah Weakens to 16,822 per US Dollar Amid Global Pressure and Rising Corporate Demand for Foreign Currency.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 1% to close at 16,822 per US dollar on Monday, driven by global pressure and strong US labor data, which may lead to a stronger dollar and further pressure on the rupiah. Bank Indonesia is expected to intervene aggressively in the domestic market on Tuesday to support the rupiah, with analysts predicting the currency to trade between 16,680-16,850 and 16,970-17,050 per US dollar.

title: Indonesia's 5-year credit default swap surges, indicating rising investment risk perception and potential pressure on domestic financial markets.
body: Indonesia's 5-year credit default swap (CDS) has surged to 127.11, indicating a heightened perception of investment risk, which may put pressure on the domestic financial market. The CDS has been rising steadily since February 19, 2025, according to World Government Bonds and Bloomberg data, signaling a potential increase in investment risk.

title: Indocement's 2025 Sales May Weaken Due to Oversupply and Decreased Retail Demand, But Energy Efficiency Efforts Bring Hope for Profit Growth.
body: PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa's 2025 sales are expected to weaken due to declining demand from the retail market and ongoing oversupply in the cement industry, but the company's energy efficiency efforts in Grobogan could boost profits. In 2024, the company reported revenue of Rp 18.5 trillion, up 3.3% year-over-year, and net profit of Rp 2 trillion, a 2.9% increase.

title: PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa's Net Profit Decreases by 2.48% to Rp 1.35 Trillion in 2024.
body: PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa Tbk (MAPA) reported a net profit of IDR 1.35 trillion in 2024, a 2.48% decrease from IDR 1.38 trillion in 2023. The company's net profit decline was reflected in its financial performance, with MAPA being one of the top losers in the LQ45 index.

title: PT Merdeka Copper Gold's Revenue Increases 30.99% to $2.24 Billion in 2024
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) reported revenue of US$2.24 billion at the end of 2024, a 30.99% year-over-year increase from US$1.71 billion in the previous year. The majority of MDKA's revenue, US$1.49 billion, came from the sale of gold, silver, copper cathode, nickel pig iron, nickel matte, and limonite ore to third parties in the domestic market.

title: Trump's Tariff Policy Sparks Global Financial Market Volatility
body: President Donald Trump's tariff policy has triggered global financial market turmoil, causing many countries' currencies, including the Indonesian rupiah, to come under pressure, particularly in the emerging market valuta. The pressure on the rupiah has been seen in the off-shore non-deliverable forward market, amidst a long domestic market holiday for Idulfitri.

title: Bank Mandiri Sees 24% Annual Increase in Electronic Data Capture Transactions
body: PT Bank Mandiri (BMRI) has seen a 24% year-over-year increase in electronic data capture (EDC) transactions, reaching 60 million transactions by February 2025, driven by the growing popularity of non-cash payments. The bank has been offering promotions to attract customers to use its EDC machines, contributing to the significant growth in transaction frequency.

title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Increases Kerosene Quota for Maluku Province Starting April 2025
body: The Indonesian government has increased the kerosene quota for Maluku Province by 3,000 kiloliters, effective from the second quarter of 2025, in response to the province's reliance on kerosene for household and transportation needs. The additional quota will be implemented gradually, with 3,000 kiloliters added from the first quarter, following a visit by Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia to Ambon, where he witnessed the province's dependence on kerosene firsthand.

title: Global Economy on Edge as Trade War Escalates, Indonesia's Economy at Risk
body: The Indonesian rupiah has weakened to RP 17,006 per dollar, its lowest level, amid the escalating trade war between the US and other countries, with the country's credit default swap (CDS) reaching 122.82, its highest level since September 2022. The government is urged to take concrete actions to address the economic crisis, rather than just making rhetorical statements, as the country's investment risk is higher than that of Malaysia and the Philippines.

title: Indonesian Business Community Urges Government to Protect Local Manufacturing Industry from Potential Flood of Imported Goods.
body: Indonesian businesspeople are concerned about the potential impact of high tariffs imposed by the US government on Indonesia's economy, which could lead to a trade war and a flood of imported products. They are urging the government to protect the domestic manufacturing industry from the potential influx of imported goods, with various industry associations calling for action to safeguard their sectors.

title: Government Delays Release of 2025-2034 Electricity Supply Business Plan
body: The Indonesian government has yet to launch the 2025-2034 Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL), which aims to develop 71 gigawatt of power plants over the next 10 years, despite initial promises to publish it by the end of January 2025. The delay is attributed to three possible factors, including the impact of macroeconomic and fiscal conditions on new power plant development plans.

title: Indonesia Explores Three-Pronged Approach to Negotiate 32% Tariff with the US.
body: The Indonesian government is negotiating with the US to reduce the 32% reciprocal tariff imposed on Indonesian goods, and has prepared three plans, including deregulating non-tariff measures, which will affect companies like General Electric Company (GE), Apple (AAPL), Oracle (ORCL), and Microsoft (MSFT). The government will also evaluate policies, including limited bans and halal certification, to mitigate the impact of the tariffs.

title: KCIC's Whoosh Train Sets New Record with 23,500 Passengers in One Day During Lebaran 2025.
body: PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China (KCIC) set a new record during the 2025 Eid al-Fitr holiday period, serving 23,500 passengers in a single day, the highest daily passenger volume to date. Since April 3, 2025, passengers from Tegalluar Summarecon and Padalarang to Halim have dominated daily Whoosh passengers, with 65% of total passengers coming from Bandung to Jakarta.

title: National Food Agency reports decrease in staple food prices after Eid al-Fitr 2025.
body: Badan Pangan Nasional (National Food Agency) claims that prices of staple foods have decreased after the 2025 Eid al-Fitr celebrations, citing the example of red chili peppers which previously experienced a drastic price increase due to supply shortages and bad weather in production centers. The agency notes that the price decrease is a result of the post-holiday momentum, indicating a potential return to normalcy in food prices.

title: Indonesian Nickel Production Expected to Reach 3.74 Million Tons by 2030, a 95% Increase from Previous Years
body: The Indonesian Nickel Miners Association projects national nickel production to reach 3.74 million tons by 2030, a 95% increase from previous years, solidifying Indonesia's dominance in the global nickel market. By 2023-2024, Indonesia is expected to control around 65% of the global nickel market, making nickel a crucial source of revenue for the country.

title: Indonesian business owners urge government to protect domestic manufacturing industry from potential surge of imported goods due to high US tariffs.
body: Indonesian businesses are concerned about the potential impact of high tariffs imposed by the US government on Indonesia's economy, which could lead to a trade war and a flood of imported products. Business associations, including Gabungan Pengusaha Elektronik and Asosiasi Pertekstilan Indonesia, are urging the government to protect the domestic manufacturing industry from the potential influx of imported goods.

title: US Tariff Policy Threatens to Disrupt Marine Cargo Insurance Business
body: The escalating global trade war is expected to negatively impact the marine cargo insurance business, with the US's tariffs on nearly all countries, including Indonesia, potentially creating a negative sentiment for the industry. This could lead to significant financial implications for companies operating in the marine cargo insurance space, highlighting the need for close monitoring of the situation.

title: Primaya Hospital Group to Expand Business by Opening Two New Hospitals in Jabodetabek Area
body: Primaya Hospital Group (PT Famon Awal Bros Sedaya Tbk) is expanding its business by opening at least two new hospitals in the Jabodetabek area, targeting the middle to upper segment market in high-growth regions. The two new hospitals, located in Sedayu City and BSD, are scheduled to operate in Q2 2025 and late 2025, respectively.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Braces for Sharp Correction Amid Global Trade War Fears
body: The Jakarta Composite Index is expected to fall 2-3% when trading resumes after a weeklong holiday break, as the US tariff hike triggers a broader flight from risk assets, with regional markets plunging on Monday. The tariff fallout is being closely watched across Asia, where many economies rely heavily on exports to the US, with economists warning of prolonged economic uncertainty and potential crises for small trade-dependent economies.

title: National Business Owners Face Increasing Pressure from Fiscal Risks, Weakened Purchasing Power, and Trade War Effects.
body: The Indonesian economy is expected to face significant challenges this year, with the threat of a trade war, fiscal risks, and declining consumer purchasing power, which has led to decreased optimism among top executives in Indonesia, as reflected in the Indonesia CEO Confidence Index for Q2-2025. The combination of pressures from President Donald Trump's tariff policies, sluggish consumer demand, fiscal risks, and rising political temperatures has created a gloomy outlook for national economic growth.

title: President Prabowo Subianto to Meet with Investors and Economists to Address Market Jitters Amid US Tariff Hike
body: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is set to meet with investors and market players on Tuesday to address the country's economic outlook and response to the US's 32% import tariff on Indonesian goods, which has spooked markets and is expected to prompt a 2-3% decline in the Jakarta Composite Index (JCI). The tariff hike threatens to undermine Indonesia's export competitiveness, particularly in textiles and electronics, and Prabowo has announced plans to send a high-level delegation to Washington for trade talks, preferring engagement over confrontation.

title: Indonesia Ready to Open Trade Negotiations with US After Tariff Imposition
body: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto announced that the country is ready to open trade negotiations with the United States, following the imposition of a 32% tariff on Indonesian imports, and will send a high-level delegation to Washington to explore a constructive path forward. The government plans to push for an overhaul of the trade investment framework agreement with the US, which was signed in 1996, and will prioritize negotiations with ASEAN member states to finalize a joint response to the tariffs.

title: Indonesian Government Offers Concessions to Facilitate Company Mergers and Acquisitions Amid Economic Downturn
body: The Indonesian government is providing concessions to facilitate company mergers and acquisitions, hindered by tax implications, to boost businesses amid the economic downturn, with the government open to input from businesses on taxation aspects. Indonesia's non-oil and gas exports to the US rose 0.74% to $2.34 billion in February 2025, while import realization from the US increased 7.11% to $1.54 billion in January-February 2025.

title: Arwana Citramulia to Expand Plant 4D Facility in South Sumatra with IDR 300 Billion Investment
body: PT Arwana Citramulia Tbk (ARNA) is targeting a 19% revenue growth to IDR 3.1 trillion in 2025, driven by a 7% increase in average selling price and a 10% increase in net profit to IDR 470 billion, despite a forecasted decline in gross margin from 34.4% to 32%. The company's expansion of its Plant 4D facility in South Sumatra, with a capital expenditure budget of IDR 300 billion, is expected to increase porcelain tile production capacity to 75.8 million square meters annually by 2025.

title: Goldman Sachs predicts oil prices to fall to $62 and $58 per barrel by December 2025 and $55 and $51 by December 2026 based on certain economic assumptions.
body: Goldman Sachs (GS) expects Brent oil prices to fall to $62 per barrel and WTI oil prices to $58 per barrel by December 2025, and further to $55 and $51 per barrel by December 2026, respectively, based on assumptions of a tariff-cut-driven economic boost and moderate OPEC+ supply increases. However, the bank outlines various scenarios where oil prices could deviate from these projections, including a potential fall to $40 per barrel by 2026 in an extreme scenario of global GDP slowdown and halted OPEC+ production cuts.

title: PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional Records 2.66% Revenue Growth and 48.68% Net Profit Increase in 2024.
body: PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional Tbk (INDR) reported a 2.66% increase in revenue to IDR 1.42 trillion and a 48.68% surge in net profit in 2024 compared to 2023, driven by a 16.91% growth in corporate segment revenue to IDR 777.32 billion. The company's operating profit rose 24.70% to IDR 1.16 trillion, and profit before income tax increased 33.76% to IDR 1.14 trillion, despite a 0.82% decline in its share price to IDR 9,125.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Pledges to Improve Transparency and Communication Starting October 20
body: President Prabowo Subianto, after serving six months as Indonesia's head of state, pledged to improve transparency and communication, starting from October 20, 2024, acknowledging that his government's communication has been lacking. He emphasized the importance of evidence-based performance, evaluating his colleagues and himself based on tangible results and achievements, rather than just words.

title: Indonesian consumers expect banks to protect them from fraud, but have low expectations for refunds.
body: A FICO study found that 15% of Indonesian consumers blame their sending bank and 19% blame their receiving bank when they fall victim to scams, highlighting the need for banks to strengthen their defenses against fraud. Indonesian consumers have low expectations for refunds, but they do expect their banks to protect them, with 69% feeling positive about their bank if it proactively declines a scam payment.

title: US Becomes Indonesia's Largest Soybean Supplier Amid Depreciating Rupiah.
body: The United States is the largest soybean supplier to Indonesia, with 2.27 million tons supplied in 2023 and an expected increase to 2.67 million tons in 2024, according to data from the Central Statistics Agency. With the rupiah's depreciation against the US dollar, there is a possibility that the price of imported soybeans in Indonesia will increase.

title: Palm Oil Emerges as a Rich Source of Vitamin to Combat Deficiency in Indonesia
body: Indonesia, with a population of over 270 million, requires around 86.5 tons of vitamin A per year, with a significant amount still being imported, highlighting the need to utilize local resources like palm oil to tackle vitamin deficiency. By leveraging palm oil's high vitamin A content, Indonesia can reduce its reliance on imports, support the development of its pharmaceutical industry, and achieve nutrition and health independence, ultimately benefiting the country's economy and competitiveness.

title: Antam Gold Price Rises by Rp 23,000 per Gram
body: Logam Mulia Antam (ANTM) increased the price of gold by Rp 23,000 per gram to Rp 1,777,000 per gram, and the buyback price also rose by Rp 23,000 per gram to Rp 1,627,000 per gram. This price hike marks a significant change in the gold market, with Antam being a major player in the industry.

title: Industrial Gas Price Hike to Affect Thousands of Customers Across Various Sectors
body: The increase in industrial gas prices will affect thousands of gas customers from various industrial and commercial sectors outside of the specific industries receiving special gas prices (PGBT). The PGBT industries, which include seven sectors such as fertilizer, petrochemical, oleochemical, steel, ceramics, glass, and rubber gloves, will continue to receive special gas prices this year.

title: Indosat's Revenue and Net Profit Rise in 2024 Amid Increasing Demand for Fast Internet and Intensifying Telecom Competition
body: PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT) is expected to continue its positive performance in 2024, driven by increasing demand for fast national internet, with revenue rising 9.1% year-over-year to Rp 55.88 trillion and net profit increasing 11.41% year-over-year to Rp 5.27 trillion. Despite intensifying competition in the telecommunications sector, Indosat's financial metrics indicate a strong outlook for the company.

title: Arwana Citramulia to Boost National Production Capacity with New Plant 4D in South Sumatra.
body: PT Arwana Citramulia Tbk (ARNA) is expanding its business by relying on its Plant 4D to increase national production capacity, with a target to start production in Q4 this year. The company's expansion in 2025 will focus on completing the construction of Plant 4D in Ogan Ilir, South Sumatra, to boost its production capacity.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Tests Trading System and Adjusts Rules Amid Global Market Volatility
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) conducted a system testing on Monday to assess the pressure on the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) amid global financial market turmoil, resulting in changes to rules limiting stock price corrections. The changes, announced on Tuesday morning, aim to mitigate potential market volatility and ensure a stable trading environment.

title: Government Launches Food Resilience Program to Provide Affordable Food Supplies and Stabilize Prices
body: The Indonesian government, under President Prabowo Subianto, has launched a food resilience program to provide affordable food supplies to the public, stabilizing food prices, especially during major holidays like Lebaran. Through the National Food Agency, the government conducts regular market operations to ensure stable food prices, with no specific financial metrics or outcomes mentioned in the article.

title: PT DFI Retail Nusantara Sees Better Sales During Lebaran Period This Year
body: PT DFI Retail Nusantara Tbk (HERO) reported better sales during the 2025 Lebaran period compared to last year, driven by increased online shopping activities. The company's Head of Communications, Diky Risbianto, attributed the sales growth to the rising trend of online shopping among consumers during the holiday period.

title: Rupiah Weakens Following US Import Tariff Announcement, Banking Liquidity Remains a Concern
body: The Indonesian rupiah continues to weaken following the announcement of new US import tariffs, sparking concerns about liquidity in the banking sector, with foreign exchange credit growth reaching 17.35% year-on-year in February. Despite this, banking regulators and executives, including those from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Central Asia (BCA), remain confident about their ability to manage foreign exchange liquidity, citing various strategies to mitigate risks and maintain stability.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges Over 7% on First Trading Day After Eid Holiday Amid US Tariff Policy Concerns
body: The Indonesian stock market plummeted on the first trading day after the Eid holiday, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) dropping 7.90% to 5,996.14, triggered by the US's reciprocal tariff policy, resulting in foreign investors withdrawing IDR 3.87 trillion. The market opened 9% lower, prompting a 30-minute trading halt, with selling pressure persisting until the end of the trading day.

title: PT Intra Golflink Resorts Allocates IDR 323.3 Billion for Capital Expenditure in 2025
body: PT Intra Golflink Resorts Tbk (IGRS) has allocated IDR 323.3 billion for capital expenditure in 2025, which will be used for four main projects: building a golf villa, renovating a golf course in Bali, constructing a luxury boutique hotel, and expanding Belitung Golf Resort. The company's total capital expenditure for the year is expected to reach IDR 323.2 billion, with individual project costs ranging from IDR 60 billion to IDR 160 billion.

title: Global Commodity Prices Plummet Amid US Import Tariff Policy Uncertainty
body: Since President Donald Trump announced tariffs on various countries on April 2, 2025, global commodity prices have plummeted, with energy commodities such as West Texas Intermediate and Brent crude oil dropping 14.27% and 13.34%, respectively, in the last week. As a result, companies in the energy and mineral sectors, including coal, are anxious about the uncertainty of commodity prices in the global market.

title: President Prabowo Subianto to Establish Tens of Thousands of Red and White Village Cooperatives Across Indonesia
body: President Prabowo Subianto plans to establish tens of thousands of Red and White Village Cooperatives across rural areas, aiming to achieve food self-sufficiency and economic equality through his "Asta Cita" program. The plan is outlined in Presidential Instruction No. 9 of 2025, signed on March 27, 2025, which is expected to drive economic growth and development in rural areas.

title: Indonesia to Diversify Trade Partners Amid US Tariff Imposition.
body: Indonesia's government plans to increase trade with countries outside of the US, following President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 32% tariff on imported goods from Indonesia. The government aims to capitalize on the 83% of the global economy that is non-US, and will closely monitor the situation with entrepreneurs to accelerate economic growth.

title: Apexindo Pratama Duta Targets Continued Growth with Increased Rig Utilization and New Contracts.
body: PT Apexindo Pratama Duta Tbk (APEX) aims to continue its positive performance growth this year, targeting to increase rig utilization and secure new contracts, after reporting a net profit of US$542,825 in 2024, a significant improvement from a net loss of US$1.34 million in 2023. The company is focused on sustaining its growth momentum, driven by its efforts to optimize rig utilization and pursue new business opportunities.

title: Rupiah Weakens to Rp 16,891 per US Dollar, Down 0.46% Daily.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened on Tuesday, closing at Rp 16,891 per US dollar, a 0.46% daily decline, and down 1.7% from its last trading day before the Eid al-Fitr holiday on March 27. The currency's value also fell to Rp 16,849 in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) of Bank Indonesia.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Clarifies Intentions Behind Revised National Army Law Amid Protests
body: President Prabowo Subianto clarified that the revised National Defense Law aims to extend the retirement age of high-ranking military officers, with no intention of reviving the dual function of the military as in the New Order era. The law also allows for military personnel to hold civilian positions in specific institutions, such as intelligence and disaster management, with no indication of militarism or threat to civilian supremacy.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 7.9% as US Import Tariff Effect Kicks In
body: The Indonesian stock market plummeted 7.90% to 5,996.14 on Tuesday, following the US's imposition of import tariffs, with the composite stock price index experiencing a sharp decline. Meanwhile, public fund managers, such as PT Taspen, are seeing this as an opportunity to buy fundamentally sound stocks at discounted prices.

title: Alamtri Resources Indonesia to Conduct Share Buyback with Maximum Budget of IDR 4 Trillion
body: PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (ADRO) plans to buy back its shares with a maximum budget of Rp 4 trillion, with the number of shares to be repurchased not exceeding 10% of the company's placed and paid-up capital. This move is part of the ongoing corporate action wave of share buybacks among Indonesian issuers.

title: Inflation Rate in March 2025 Surges to 1.65% Monthly and 1.03% Annually After Two Consecutive Months of Deflation.
body: Indonesia's inflation rate surged to 1.65% month-on-month and 1.03% year-on-year in March 2025, reversing the deflation trend seen in January and February, driven by increases in electricity tariffs and red onion prices. This marks a significant shift from the previous two months, which saw deflation rates of 0.76% and 0.48%, respectively.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges at Opening Due to Domestic and Global Factors
body: The Indonesian stock market plummeted at the opening of trading after the long Lebaran holiday, driven by domestic factors and the US-China trade war sparked by President Donald Trump's tariff policies, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 3.87 trillion. Amidst the panic, analysts have provided recommendations for stocks to watch, which investors can consider in this volatile market.

title: Government Accelerates Debt Financing to Anticipate Global Uncertainty
body: The Indonesian government has accelerated its debt financing strategy to anticipate global uncertainty, including the reciprocal tariff imposition by the US President, with a realization of Rp 250 trillion in debt financing by March 31, 2025, which is 40.6% of the target in the 2025 State Budget of Rp 616.2 trillion. This move aims to mitigate the impact of global economic uncertainty on the country's economy.

title: Indonesia considers partnering with US investors to support oil refinery development in response to Trump's reciprocal tariff policy.
body: The Indonesian government is considering partnering with US investors to support the development of oil refineries in the country, a response to President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff policy. This strategic national project could involve the use of US components, potentially increasing Indonesia's import volume.

title: Indonesia Prepares to Offer Incentives to the US Government in Response to 32% Tariff on Indonesian Goods.
body: The Indonesian government is preparing to offer concessions and incentives to the US government in response to the 32% reciprocal tariff imposed on Indonesian goods, with the aim of balancing trade with partner countries, including the US. The government will engage in negotiations with the US to resolve the issue, as stated by Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto.

title: Merdeka Group's Mining Subsidiaries Face Uncertainty Amid Global Commodity Price Volatility
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) and PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk (MBMA) face uncertainty in global mineral commodity prices, which may impact their performance prospects in 2025, following a negative performance in 2024. Despite a 30.99% year-over-year revenue increase to $2.24 billion in 2024, the companies' future performance remains uncertain due to global market fluctuations.

title: PT Sampoerna Agro Records 1.31% Annual Growth in Sales and 54.75% Increase in Net Profit in 2024.
body: PT Sampoerna Agro Tbk (SGRO) reported a 1.31% year-over-year increase in sales to Rp 5.69 trillion in 2024, driven by its palm oil business, resulting in a 54.75% surge in net profit to Rp 748.56 billion. The company's financial performance improved significantly in 2024, with net profit more than half a trillion rupiah higher than the previous year.

title: US Imposes 32% Tariff on Indonesian Exports Amid Rising Trade Surplus
body: The US imposed tariffs of up to 46% on over 20 trading partners, including Indonesia, with Indonesia's main export products such as textiles, furniture, and footwear facing an additional 32% tariff, following President Donald Trump's announcement on April 2, 2025. Indonesia's trade surplus with the US reached $17.88 billion in 2024, with a growing trend in recent years, including $16.96 billion in 2023 and $24.7 billion in 2022, justifying Trump's protectionist policies to limit access to the US market for developing countries.

title: PT Ceria Targets First Commercial Production of Ferronickel from Merah Putih Smelter Line 1 by End of April 2025
body: PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (no ticker) targets its first commercial production of ferronickel from its Merah Putih smelter line 1 to begin at the end of April 2025, with a production capacity of 252,800 tons per year, equivalent to 55,600 tons of nickel metal. The company's use of green energy and energy-efficient technology is expected to produce high-quality ferronickel products with a low carbon footprint, making them competitive in the international market and supporting the electric vehicle supply chain.

title: President Approves USD 40 Billion Downstreaming Plan to Boost Energy and Mining Sectors
body: Indonesia's President has approved a USD 40 billion downstreaming plan, prioritizing 21 projects across 26 mining commodity sectors, aiming to increase domestic crude oil supplies by 30 days and boost energy security. The project includes constructing an oil refinery with a capacity of 500,000 barrels, restarting a coal gasification project, and adding value to copper, nickel, and bauxite commodities, with Daya Anagata Nusantara investment management agency set to support the projects with financing.

title: Indonesia to increase US oil, gas, and agricultural imports to ease trade tensions.
body: Indonesia plans to increase imports of US oil, gas, and agricultural commodities, such as soybeans and wheat, as part of ongoing negotiations to ease Washington's reciprocal tariff measures on Indonesian exports, with the goal of reallocating existing import volumes rather than increasing overall procurement. The move is seen as a gesture to ease trade tensions, with Indonesia-US trade totaling $38.3 billion in 2024, and the country running a $14.3 billion surplus, with potential for increased cotton imports worth up to $600 million.

title: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto urges country to be self-reliant amid US tariff hike.
body: Indonesia faces a 32% duty on its goods entering the US market starting April 9, in addition to a 10% universal tariff, as part of the US' reciprocal tariffs against countries accused of unfair trading practices. Despite this, Indonesia's Chief Economic Affairs Minister Airlangga Hartarto believes the impact will not be severe, citing that US exports only account for 2.2% of Indonesia's GDP, and that the country can tap into other markets, such as China, India, and others.

title: Indonesian Diplomat Downplays Impact of Vacant US Ambassador Post on Ongoing Trade Negotiations
body: Indonesia is trying to negotiate with the US to revise the 32% reciprocal tariff, which is scheduled to take effect, amidst concerns over the country's complex import licensing regimes and local content requirement, causing a major trade imbalance. The absence of an Indonesian ambassador to the US, a position left vacant for almost two years, may impact the country's bargaining power in negotiations, with a high-level delegation led by Senior Minister Airlangga Hartarto planned to be sent to the US to address the issue.

title: Indonesian Finance Minister Criticizes US Tariff Hikes as Lacking Scientific Basis and Defying Economic Principles
body: Indonesian Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati criticized the US tariff hikes, stating that the 34% tariff imposed on Indonesia lacks scientific grounding and defies fundamental economic principles, as it is calculated based on a controversial formula that many economists struggle to comprehend. The tariffs, aimed at reducing the US trade deficit, have rattled global financial markets due to their sudden and uncoordinated nature, with Sri Mulyani warning that a unified global response is needed to address the situation.

title: PT Megakreasi Cikarang Permai targets to hand over 6,100 units of Meikarta Superblock apartment project by end of 2025.
body: PT Megakreasi Cikarang Permai (MCKP) aims to hand over 6,100 units of the Meikarta superblock apartment project in South Cikarang, West Java by the end of 2025, with a total of 14,266 units expected to be completed by 2027. The company plans to raise IDR 1.48 trillion through a rights issue to fund the project, with around 95% of the proceeds allocated to its subsidiary, PT Mahkota Sentosa Utama, the developer of the Meikarta apartment project.

title: Antam Gold Price Surges by Rp 69,000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) saw its gold price surge by Rp 69,000 per gram to Rp 1,846,000 per gram, while the buyback price also jumped by Rp 69,000 per gram to Rp 1,696,000 per gram. This significant price increase is likely to impact the company's financial metrics and investors' decisions.

title: Midi Utama Indonesia sells 70% stake in Lancar Wiguna Sejahtera to Sumber Alfaria Trijaya for IDR 200.45 billion.
body: PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk (MIDI) has sold a 70% stake in PT Lancar Wiguna Sejahtera (LWS) to PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (AMRT) for IDR 200.45 billion, with the transaction price exceeding the asset valuation of IDR 194.74 billion as of December 31, 2024. Following the sale, AMRT now directly owns 77.09% of MIDI and 70% of LWS, which operate a combined 2,368 Alfamidi outlets, 62 Alfamidi super stores, five Midi fresh fruit stalls, and 374 Lawson convenience stores.

title: China Intensifies Cooperation with Key Trading Partners in Response to US Tariffs
body: China is deepening supply chain partnerships with its key trading partners in response to the US' 104% tariff on Chinese exports, with President Xi Jinping committing to foster a shared future with global economic partners. The escalating tariff war has begun to affect the broader global economy, particularly impacting developing economies in Asia and Southeast Asia, with several Asian stock indices experiencing notable corrections in recent trading sessions.

title: Ministry of Social Affairs Distributes IDR 18.64 Trillion in Social Assistance to 20.82 Million Beneficiary Families.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Social Affairs reported that social assistance disbursements reached IDR 18.64 trillion (24.95% of the IDR 74.76 trillion budget) in Q1 2025, benefiting 20.82 million families. The assistance included IDR 10.96 trillion for the Sembako program, which supported 18.27 million families.

title: Indonesia to Send Negotiation Team to Discuss Reciprocal Tariff with US Government
body: The Indonesian government is set to meet with the US government to negotiate the 32% reciprocal tariff imposed by President Donald Trump, with a team led by Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto scheduled to depart by April 17, 2025. One of the key points of negotiation is Indonesia's plan to offer incentives to US investors through a non-tariff scheme, including relaxation of local content policies in the information communication technology sector.

title: Global Economic Turmoil Caused by US Trade Policy Affects Indonesian Construction Business
body: The trade war sparked by US President Donald Trump's high tariffs on all trading partner countries has caused global economic turmoil, affecting various sectors, including Indonesia's construction business, where companies are mitigating the impact of the economic downturn and weakening rupiah. The rupiah's value has dropped to IDR 16,943 per dollar, prompting construction companies to take measures to counter the effects of the economic instability.

title: Inalum claims US tariffs on aluminum and steel imports have no significant impact on Indonesian industry.
body: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (INALUM) stated that the import tariff policy on steel and aluminum implemented by US President Donald Trump since March 4, 2025, has no significant impact on the company. However, the tariffs may affect demand due to the trade war between countries, despite not having a significant impact on Indonesia's aluminum industry, particularly for INALUM.

title: Indonesia and US Have Opportunity to Collaborate on Critical Mineral Sector
body: Indonesia has the potential to collaborate with the United States in the mineral sector, particularly in critical minerals, which are essential for the US electronics and technology industries. The country has geological reserves of critical minerals, such as those used in handphone components, which presents an opportunity for cooperation between the two nations.

title: Inpex Masela Ltd Initiates Onshore LNG Front-End Engineering Design for Abadi Gas Project
body: Inpex Masela Ltd, a subsidiary of Inpex Corporation, has initiated the front-end engineering design for the onshore LNG facility of the Abadi gas project in the Masela block, focusing on selecting main technologies such as liquefaction and gas turbines to accelerate the engineering process. This milestone is expected to pave the way for a final investment decision next year, with the project's technical design aligning with commercial and environmental needs.

title: Financial Performance of Indonesian Stock Exchange Listed Companies Shows Positive Growth in 2024
body: In 2024, 703 out of 738 listed companies in the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) reported positive financial performance, with a 6.31% increase in asset value and a 7.91% increase in equity. This growth indicates a positive trend in the financial performance of listed companies in Indonesia, according to IDX Director Jeffrey Hendrik.

title: Indonesia to Implement Royalty Tariff Hike for Mineral and Coal Commodities Starting April 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has confirmed that the policy to increase royalty tariffs for certain mineral and coal commodities, including nickel and gold, will take effect in April 2025. The tariff hike will be implemented through revisions to two regulations, namely Government Regulation No. 26/2022 and PP No. 15/2022, which govern non-tax state revenue and taxation in the mining sector.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Closes in Red Zone for Second Day Amid External Factors
body: The Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 5,967.99, down 0.47% or 28 basis points from the previous day, driven by external factors such as the US import tariff policy and ongoing negotiations between the Indonesian government and the US. The index remained in the red zone on the second day of trading after the Eid al-Fitr holiday, with analysts citing external sentiment as the main driver of the market's movement.

title: Government Issues Presidential Instruction to Optimize Rice Absorption and Ensure National Food Self-Sufficiency
body: The Indonesian government aims to achieve food self-sufficiency by 2028, with President Prabowo Subianto issuing an instruction to ensure optimal absorption of rice from farmers, targeting 3 million tons of rice procurement in 2025 at a purchase price of IDR 6,500 per kilogram. Meanwhile, Tower Bersama's 2024 revenue increases, but its net profit declines by two digits.

title: Indonesia to Send Negotiation Team to US in Response to 32% Tariff Imposition by President Trump.
body: The Indonesian government is planning to negotiate with the US government in response to President Donald Trump's 32% reciprocal tariff imposition on Indonesia, with a negotiation team led by Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto set to depart by April 17, 2025. The goal of the negotiation is to mitigate the impact of the tariffs on Indonesia's economy and trade relations with the US.

title: PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure's 2024 Financial Performance Remains Varied with Revenue of Rp 6.86 Trillion.
body: PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure Tbk (TBIG) reported revenue of Rp 6.86 trillion in 2024, according to its 2024 financial report. The company's performance varied throughout the year, with the reported revenue being a key highlight of its financial metrics.

title: Jasa Marga's Revenue Grows 35% but Net Profit Drops 33% Due to Stagnant Toll Road Traffic.
body: PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) reported a 35% year-over-year increase in revenue to Rp 28.70 trillion in 2024, but its net profit declined 33% to Rp 4.5 trillion due to stagnant toll road usage. The company faces risks of slowing performance growth, highlighting the need for strategic adjustments to improve its financial metrics.

title: PT Sunindo Pratama Tbk Achieves Highest Net Profit in Company History in 2024.
body: PT Sunindo Pratama Tbk (no ticker provided) achieved its highest net profit in history, reaching Rp 205.1 billion in 2024, a 103.6% year-over-year increase in Q4-2024, exceeding its target of 102.7%. This remarkable performance marks a significant milestone for the infrastructure and oil and gas company, which has been in operation since 2002.

title: Sinarmas Group's Paper Companies Report Profit Growth Despite Declining Revenue in 2024
body: PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper Tbk (IKPP) reported a 3.12% year-over-year increase in net profit to US$424.3 million in 2024, despite a decline in revenue. This growth in profit is a positive sign for the company, which is part of the Sinarmas group, amidst a challenging market environment.

title: Rupiah exchange rate against US dollar remains concerning, weakening 0.55% despite daily gain of 0.11%.
body: The Indonesian rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar remains concerning, closing at IDR 16,872 per dollar in the spot market on Wednesday, with a 0.11% daily gain, but weakening 0.55% to IDR 16,943 according to Bank Indonesia's Jisdor. External sentiment continues to dominate the rupiah, with tensions rising due to China's retaliatory actions, impacting the currency's value.

title: XL Axiata reports 21% increase in data traffic during Ramadan period.
body: PT XL Axiata Tbk (EXCL) reported a 21% increase in data traffic from March 28 to April 6, 2025, compared to normal days before the Ramadan period, driven by high demand for video streaming services. Compared to the same period last year, the company saw a 5% increase in data traffic, according to Direktur & Chief Technology Officer I Gede Darmayusa.

title: Government Plans to Remove Import Quotas on Several Products to Improve Business Climate
body: The Indonesian government plans to remove import quotas on several products, aiming to simplify the business climate, as announced by President Prabowo Subianto during an economic discussion on Tuesday. This move is expected to boost economic growth and investment, with no specific financial metrics or company names mentioned in the article.

title: US Imposes Reciprocal Tariff Policy on 180 Countries, Including Indonesia, with 32% Import Duty.
body: The US has implemented reciprocal tariffs on 180 trading partner countries, including Indonesia, which will be subject to a 32% import tariff, potentially negatively impacting Indonesia's export performance, particularly in the automotive parts sector. This policy, initiated by President Donald Trump, is expected to have a significant impact on Indonesia's economy and trade.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Urges Banks to Continue Supporting Textile Industry Despite Recent Setbacks
body: President Prabowo Subianto emphasized the importance of supporting the textile industry, which employs millions of workers, and urged state-owned banks to continue providing credit to the sector, citing Indonesia's large domestic market, particularly for school uniforms. Bank Mandiri (BMRI) reported that it has disbursed IDR 182.9 trillion (14% of its total portfolio) in credits to the manufacturing sector, including textiles, as of February 2025, while Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) saw a high single-digit growth in its textile credit portfolio.

title: Jasa Armada Indonesia Prepares Expansion Strategy to Maintain Growth Momentum
body: PT Jasa Armada Indonesia Tbk (IPCM) reported a 18.58% year-on-year increase in revenue to Rp 1.34 trillion in the last year, driven by its ship service business which contributed Rp 1.30 trillion, a 22.64% annual growth. The company is preparing an expansion strategy to maintain its growth momentum, building on its positive performance last year.

title: BUMN Stocks Continue to Slump with IDX BUMN20 Index Rising Slightly
body: The majority of state-owned enterprise (BUMN) stocks in Indonesia have been performing poorly since the beginning of the year, with most of them still in the red zone, particularly those that are constituents of the BUMN20 index. Despite this, the IDX BUMN20 index managed to rise slightly by 1.17% compared to the previous day, closing at the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Wednesday.

title: Eight banks to distribute massive dividends worth Rp 125 trillion in April.
body: Eight banks are set to distribute dividends worth a total of Rp 125 trillion in April, providing a welcome respite for shareholders amidst the current market pressure. This dividend payout comes at a time when banking sector stock prices are plummeting, offering a silver lining for investors.

title: PT Bukit Asam's revenue increases 11% to Rp 42.76 trillion in 2024 driven by rising coal exports and domestic sales.
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) recorded revenue of IDR 42.76 trillion in 2024, an 11% year-over-year increase, driven by a 30% increase in export sales to 20.26 million tons and a 6% increase in domestic sales to 22.64 million tons. The company's total sales reached 42.89 million tons, a 16% year-over-year growth, with domestic sales still dominating at 53% and exports accounting for 47%.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Volatility Continues to Affect Investment Portfolios
body: The Indonesian stock market is experiencing high volatility, causing investors to worry as their investment portfolio returns are dwindling, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) still stuck at 5,967.99, down 0.47% from the previous day's close. This decline in performance is a concerning signal for investors, who are likely to face more frequent losses in the domestic stock market.

title: Astra Group's Mining Issuer, PT United Tractors, Sees Increase in Gold and Nickel Sales Volume in January-February 2025.
body: PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR) reported a surge in gold sales volume, reaching 37,770 geos in January-February 2025, with a 121.16% year-over-year increase in nickel sales to 360,589 wet metric tons. The company attributed the gold price increase to geopolitical tensions and central bank demand, while nickel prices fell 4.1% in 2024 due to oversupply from Indonesian nickel smelters.

title: Indonesian Government Prepares Five Incentives for Importers of US Products
body: The Indonesian government is set to offer incentives, including tariff discounts and tax breaks, for imported products from the United States, in response to President Donald Trump's 32% reciprocal tariff on Indonesian goods. The incentives include improvements to the tax and customs administration system, which is equivalent to a 2% reduction in tariff burdens, among other benefits.

title: Indonesian Economy to Face Multiple Impacts from US Tariffs Imposed by President Trump
body: The Indonesian economy is expected to be severely impacted by the reciprocal tariffs set by US President Donald Trump, which will not only have direct effects but also indirect consequences from the weakening of partner countries' economies. According to Bank Mandiri, Trump's tariffs risk weakening global growth prospects by reducing trade activities, particularly in large countries like China, the European Union, Canada, and Mexico.

title: Copper Mining Sector Shifts Focus to Increasing Production Amid Growing Demand and Changing Investment Trends
body: According to Wood Mackenzie's analysis, the copper mining sector is shifting its capital allocation strategy, driven by increasing non-discretionary capital expenditure requirements, strong balance sheet needs, and a growing focus on copper growth diversification strategies, with greenfield copper projects offering the most attractive returns on capital investment. Major copper companies are expected to accelerate their reinvestment efforts over the next three years, exceeding 100% of their operating cash flow, as demand for copper from electrification is expected to increase significantly, driving copper prices to all-time highs.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold Provides Updates on Pani Gold Project and Tujuh Bukit Mine, Targets First Gold Pouring in 2026
body: PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) reported a 31% year-on-year increase in consolidated revenue to USD 2.24 billion in 2024, driven by strong performance in its nickel sector, with EBITDA growing 36% to USD 329 million. The company's Pani Gold Project is on track to become one of Indonesia's largest primary gold mines, with peak production targeted at 500,000 ounces per year, and its Tujuh Bukit Copper Project has made significant progress, with an updated pre-feasibility study expected in Q2 2025.

title: Indonesia's State-Owned Mining Company Strengthens National Aluminium Supply Chain with New Smelter Grade Alumina Refinery
body: PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (INALUM) is expanding its smelter grade alumina refinery, SGA Phase II, which will increase total alumina production capacity to 2 million tons per year by 2025, supporting the national aluminum industry supply chain and contributing up to 5.5% to Indonesia's economic growth. The project is expected to strengthen the country's mineral resilience, meet growing domestic aluminum needs of 1.2 million tons per year, and create jobs, with the first shipment of alumina expected by the end of April 2025.

title: President Prabowo Subianto meets UAE counterpart Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan amid global efforts to mitigate US tariff rollout.
body: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is meeting with UAE's Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan to discuss geoeconomic developments amidst the US tariff rollout, with Indonesia facing a 32% reciprocal tariff on its goods, while the UAE has a 10% levy. Prabowo's Middle East tour will also include visits to Turkey, Egypt, Qatar, and Jordan, which have lower reciprocal tariffs ranging from 10% to 20%.

title: Indonesia's inflation rate rises to 1.65 percent in March due to electricity bill hikes and increased food prices during Ramadan.
body: Indonesia's month-to-month inflation rate rose to 1.65% in March, driven primarily by a 8.45% increase in the housing, electricity, and household fuel sub-group, which contributed 1.18% to overall inflation. The annual inflation rate reached 1.03% in March, still within the central bank's target range of 1.5% to 3.5%.

title: Foreign Investors Record Net Buy of 689.87 Million Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Foreign investors in the Indonesia Stock Exchange concluded a net buy of 689.87 million shares, with PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) leading the pack with a net buy of 684.43 million shares, followed by PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS) with a net buy of 91.46 million shares. On the other hand, PT Bukalapak.com Tbk (BUKA) was the biggest seller with a net sell of 156.16 million shares, followed by PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) with a net sell of 106.46 million shares.

title: Indonesia's Kadin Institute Supports Government's Decision to Negotiate with US on Export Tariffs.
body: Indonesia's decision to negotiate with the US over reciprocal export tariffs, rather than retaliating, is seen as a correct approach by the Kadin Institute, as it could shield Indonesia from higher tariffs and prevent an unending trade conflict. The negotiations will address US concerns on non-tariff barriers, including import quotas and local content requirements, with the goal of refining business facilitation policies and promoting job creation.

title: Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Urge Government to Reduce Export Tariffs to Stay Competitive in US Market
body: Indonesian palm oil producers are urging the government to reduce export tariffs to maintain competitiveness in the US market, as the current 34% tariff is higher than Malaysia's 24% tariff, resulting in a financial cost of $221 per metric ton compared to Malaysia's $140 per metric ton. The producers hope to secure Indonesia's 89% market share in the US, which has seen a rising trend in palm oil exports, with 2.5 million tons exported in 2023, but a decline to 2.2 million tons in 2024.

title: SoftBank Ventura Indonesia and other investors make significant changes to their stakes in various Indonesian companies.
body: SoftBank Ventura Indonesia acquired 7.82% of PT Nanotech Indonesia Global Tbk shares, purchasing 335 million shares through PT Mandiri Sekuritas, while Jora Nilam Judge boosted her stake in PT Menn Teknologi Indonesia Tbk to 23.71% by acquiring over 110.57 million shares. Other notable transactions included PT Sinar Mas Cakrawala increasing its stake in PT Sinar Mas Multiartha Tbk to 51.79%, and PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk raising its stake in PT Adaro Minerals Indonesia Tbk to 84.18%.

title: Goto Gojek Tokopedia tops list of net foreign purchases in Indonesia stock market.
body: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) recorded the highest net foreign buy of 684.43 million shares, with a share price increase of IDR 9 to IDR 76, and a total transaction value of IDR 349.79 billion. PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BUMI) ranked second on the net foreign buy list with 91.46 million shares, seeing a share price rise of IDR 24 to IDR 300, and a total transaction value of IDR 143.74 billion.

title: US Tariff Hike to Affect Indonesia's Export Competitiveness, Including Palm Oil
body: The US's 32% reciprocal import tariff policy, imposed by President Donald Trump, is expected to negatively impact Indonesia's export competitiveness, particularly in palm oil, with potential losses for millions of smallholders in the industry, and may push down prices of top commodities like palm oil and rubber. Indonesia's government plans to assess the economic impacts of the tariff policy and prepare mitigation steps to protect strategic sectors, including intensifying trade relations with China, to maintain stability in the national economy and protect its market share in East Asia.

title: US Government Delays Reciprocal Tariff Policy for 90 Days, Indonesia Included.
body: The US government has delayed the implementation of a reciprocal tariff policy for 90 days, benefiting Indonesian palm oil industry players, and instead will apply a minimum 10% import tariff to 75 countries, including Indonesia, which is lower than the planned 32% reciprocal tariff. This decision provides temporary relief to Indonesian palm oil exporters, allowing them to breathe a sigh of relief.

title: Government to Extend 0.5% Final Income Tax Policy for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Until This Year
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has confirmed that the 0.5% final income tax policy for micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises will be extended until this year, but the government has yet to issue the policy regulation, which is expected to be in the form of a government regulation, by April 2025. The Directorate General of Taxes at the Ministry of Finance has assured that the regulation is being processed according to the Minister of Finance's statement.

title: Annual Income Tax Reporting Reaches 12.65 Million as of April 10, 2025
body: The Indonesian Directorate General of Taxes reported that 12.65 million annual income tax returns were submitted by April 10, 2025, comprising 12.28 million individual taxpayers and 365,000 corporate taxpayers. This milestone marks a significant achievement in tax compliance, with no specific financial metrics or outcomes mentioned beyond the number of submissions.

title: US President Donald Trump Delays Imposition of Reciprocal Import Tariffs, Giving Indonesia 90-Day Breathing Room
body: Indonesia can breathe a sigh of relief as US President Donald Trump has decided to delay reciprocal import tariffs on most countries for 90 days, providing an opportunity for the country to devise a strategy. According to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, the tariffs could have reduced Indonesia's economic growth potential.

title: Government Debt Repayment Schedule to Affect Financial Market and Rupiah Exchange Rate
body: The Indonesian government's debt repayment schedule, which varies by month, is expected to impact the country's financial market, including the rupiah exchange rate, with a total of Rp 22 trillion in April and Rp 42.4 trillion in May. This debt repayment schedule is likely to influence market sentiment and affect the country's financial performance.

title: AKR Corporindo Targets 110 Hectare Industrial Land Sales in Java Integrated Industrial Port Estate This Year
body: PT Akr Corporindo Tbk aims to sell 110 hectares of industrial land in Java Integrated Industrial Port Estate, Gresik, East Java, this year, with its subsidiary PT Berkah Kawasan Manyar Sejahtera targeting an increase in industrial land sales. The growing number of investments in the area is expected to boost interest from potential tenants.

title: ANTAM Gold Price Rises by Rp 43,000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased the price of its gold by Rp 43,000 per gram to Rp 1,889,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 43,000 per gram to Rp 1,739,000 per gram. This change in gold prices may impact investors and businesses in the industry, particularly those involved in gold trading and investment.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Plunges 9.19% Causing 30-Minute Trading Halt
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 9.19% to 5,912.06, triggering a 30-minute trading halt, as investors failed to capitalize on cheap stocks. The deep correction in the index did not spark a buying momentum, indicating a lack of confidence in the market.

title: US Tariff Policy Poses Significant Challenge to Indonesia's Shrimp Export Sector
body: The high tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump have added challenges to Indonesia's fisheries sector, particularly for shrimp exports, as over 70% of Indonesia's shrimp exports target the US market, making it a crucial revenue source for local shrimp farmers. According to the Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries, Indonesia's shrimp exports to the US are expected to reach 135,000 tons in 2024, highlighting the importance of the US market and the significant challenges faced by the sector if protectionist policies continue.

title: Government Considers Reducing Export Tariffs for Crude Palm Oil to US Market
body: The Indonesian government is considering reducing export tariffs on crude palm oil (CPO) to the US market in response to import tariffs imposed by the US government on Indonesian products. The discussion is ongoing, involving multiple ministries and agencies, including the Ministry of Finance, which will ultimately issue the policy.

title: King Tire Indonesia Aims to Boost Performance through Production and Marketing Expansion
body: PT King Tire Indonesia Tbk aims to boost its performance this year by accelerating production and marketing expansion, driven by a 14.84% year-on-year increase in tire sales to Rp 592.24 billion in 2024. The revenue growth is attributed to the rise in sales of both outer and inner tires, with the company's financial performance expected to improve further.

title: Ramayana Lestari Sentosa Faces Challenges Amid Weakened Consumer Purchasing Power and US Tariff Policy Uncertainty.
body: PT Ramayana Lestari Sentosa Tbk (RALS) faces challenges due to weakened consumer purchasing power and negative sentiment surrounding the US government's reciprocal tariff policy, which may impact its performance this year. The company's management is taking a "wait and see" approach in planning its business strategy and expansion for 2025, pending the outcome of the tariff policy, which has been delayed for 90 days.

title: PLN Partners with Masdar to Develop 100MW Floating Solar Power Plant in West Java.
body: PT PLN (PLN) has partnered with Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company PJSC-Masdar to develop a 100-megawatt floating solar power plant in Jatigede, West Java, as part of eight bilateral agreements signed between Indonesia and the United Arab Emirates. This collaboration aims to drive renewable energy growth in Indonesia, with no financial metrics disclosed in the article.

title: Indonesia to Redirect Some Gas Exports from Sumatra to Domestic Market, Singapore's Needs to be Met from Natuna Supply.
body: The Indonesian government plans to redirect some of its gas exports from Sumatra to Singapore to meet the country's increasing energy demands, with exports to be reduced starting June 2025 and instead supplied to the domestic market. Meanwhile, Singapore's gas needs will be fulfilled by supplies from Natuna, as the government aims to maximize domestic LNG production and reduce reliance on foreign supplies.

title: Indonesian Government to Implement Royalty Tariff Hike for Mineral and Coal Commodities in April 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has confirmed that the policy to increase royalty tariffs for mineral and coal commodities, including nickel and gold, will take effect in the second week of April 2025, which has drawn criticism from mining industry players who argue it could be a disincentive to new investments. The increased royalty tariffs could further burden operational costs, which have already risen due to various policy changes, including the increase in value-added tax, diesel fuel prices, and coal prices.

title: Global Oil Prices Plummet to Four-Year Low Below $60 per Barrel
body: Global crude oil prices plummeted to a four-year low, trading below $60 per barrel on Wednesday, largely due to the government's high import tariff policy. This sharp decline has impacted the prices of non-subsidized fuel in the country, which started to drop at various gas stations in April 2025.

title: Lippo Cikarang to Raise IDR 1.48 Trillion Through Rights Issue
body: PT Lippo Cikarang Tbk (LPCK) is planning to conduct a rights issue worth IDR 1.48 trillion, issuing up to 2.97 billion new shares with a nominal value of IDR 500 per share. The property issuer, part of the Lippo Group, aims to raise capital through this rights issue.

title: Donald Trump's Import Tariff Announcement Causes Indonesian Stock Market to Plummet
body: Following President Donald Trump's announcement of import tariffs on April 2, the Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) plummeted 7.90% to 5,996.14, prompting market players to urge state-owned companies like Jamsostek and pension funds to enter the stock market, which could inject life into the market, given Jamsostek's massive Rp 790.8 trillion in managed funds, with only 6.41% currently invested in stocks.

title: Indonesian Companies Increase Share Buybacks Amid Relaxed Regulations
body: Several listed companies in Indonesia are taking advantage of the relaxed rules on share buybacks, which can now be done without a general meeting of shareholders, according to Inarno Djajadi, Head of the Financial Services Authority's Capital Market Supervision. This move is expected to have a significant impact on the market, with multiple companies already announcing their plans to conduct buybacks without holding a shareholders' meeting.

title: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchinson Sees 21% Increase in Data Traffic During Idul Fitri 2025
body: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchinson (ISAT) reported a 21% increase in data traffic during the 2025 Idul Fitri period compared to regular days, driven by high digital application usage by customers during Ramadan and Idul Fitri. This surge in data traffic highlights the growing demand for digital services in Indonesia, particularly during peak holiday seasons.

title: Government Promises Stabilization of Chili Prices Within Two to Three Weeks
body: The Indonesian government promises that chili prices will stabilize within two to three weeks, with prices expected to decrease as supply increases from major chili-producing areas. Currently, chili prices are still high, with red curly chili priced at Rp 56,511 per kg, above the government's reference price of Rp 37,000 - Rp 55,000 per kg.

title: Global and Regional Stock Markets Rebound After Trump Delays Tariff Imposition on Most Countries
body: Global and regional stock markets rebounded on Thursday, driven by US President Donald Trump's decision to delay the implementation of retaliatory tariffs on most countries, excluding China, for 90 days. The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 4.79% to 6,254.02, following the majority of Asian bourses, as investors welcomed the news.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Instructs Acceleration of Red White Village Cooperative Formation Targeting 80,000 Units
body: President Prabowo Subianto has instructed to accelerate the formation of 80,000 Red-White Village Cooperatives across Indonesia, with the Ministry of Finance and State-Owned Enterprises to prepare funding for the establishment of tens of thousands of these cooperatives. The initiative aims to promote economic growth and development in rural areas, with the cooperatives expected to play a significant role in improving the livelihoods of local communities.

title: PT Harum Energy's 2024 Performance Disappoints with 64.20% Drop in Net Profit Despite 39.97% Increase in Revenue.
body: PT Harum Energy Tbk (HRUM) reported a 64.20% year-over-year decline in net profit to $54.07 million in 2024, despite a 39.97% increase in revenue to $1.30 billion. The decline in profit was driven by a surge in the company's expense positions, negatively impacting its financial performance.

title: Alfamart's Parent Company Acquires 70% Stake in Lawson's Operator PT Lancar Wiguna Sejahtera
body: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (AMRT) has officially acquired a 70% stake in PT Lancar Wiguna Sejahtera, the operator of Lawson retail and restaurant networks, by purchasing 1.48 billion shares from PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk (MIDI) for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition marks a significant expansion of AMRT's retail business, adding to its existing Alfamart retail chain.

title: PT Aneka Tambang's Revenue Soars 68.55% to Reach All-Time High in 2024
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) reported a revenue of Rp 69.19 trillion in 2024, a 68.55% year-over-year increase, marking the highest achievement in the company's history. This strong performance was part of the varied results shown by the three issuers under the Mining Industry Indonesia (MIND ID) holding company.

title: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchinson sees 21% surge in data traffic during Idul Fitri 2025 period.
body: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchinson (ISAT) reported a 21% increase in data traffic during the Idul Fitri 2025 period compared to regular days, driven by high digital application usage by customers, with WhatsApp, TikTok, Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram being the top 5 apps with the highest digital activity. The company had prepared for the traffic surge by adding 9,600 new site capacities, 1,500 new base transceiver stations, and 53 mobile BTS in strategic locations, ensuring a smooth experience for its customers.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Surges 4.79% to 6,254.02, Supported by Local Investors.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index surged 4.79% or 286 points to close at 6,254.02, driven by local investor buying, despite foreign investors recording a net sale of IDR 751.42 billion. The index briefly rose as high as 5.7% during the trading session, marking a significant gain.

title: Ministry of Manpower to Review Regulations on Online Transportation Drivers' Protection
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Manpower is set to review regulations related to the protection of online transportation drivers, following a meeting with representatives from companies such as Gojek (GOJEK), Grab, Maxim, Indrive, Lalamove, Shopee (SHPE), and JNE. The review aims to evaluate the provision of bonuses to online drivers and couriers during the recent Eid holiday, with potential implications for the financial well-being of these workers.

title: China seeks to form united front with other nations against US tariffs, but faces partial success as many countries remain unwilling to take sides.
body: China has refused to negotiate with the US on tariffs, prompting Trump to increase the tax rate on Chinese imports to 145%, while China has retaliated with tariffs on US goods at 84%, affecting global markets. Meanwhile, China has reached out to other nations, including the EU and ASEAN, to form a united front against the US, with some countries like Australia and India hesitant to join, while others like Taiwan are preparing for talks on tariffs.

title: Emirati dairy giant Al-Ain Farms to invest in Indonesia to help meet country's milk demand.
body: Al-Ain Farms (no ticker) is set to invest in Indonesia to help the country meet its milk demand without relying on imports, with the government offering incentives such as exemptions from import duties and low-interest financing schemes. The investment value was not disclosed, but Indonesia aims to become fully self-sufficient in milk by 2029, and has recorded $32.7 million in foreign direct investment inflows from the United Arab Emirates in 2024.

title: Trump's Tariff Delay Gives Indonesia a 90-Day Window to Boost Footwear Exports to the US
body: US President Donald Trump's 90-day delay on reciprocal tariffs gives Indonesia a chance to boost its footwear exports, with the country being the third-largest footwear exporter to the US, selling $2.6 billion worth of shoes in 2024. The delay allows Indonesia to negotiate a revision of the 32% tariff rate and increase exports before the tariffs return in July, with the country's bilateral trade with the US standing at nearly $38.3 billion in 2024.

title: Indonesia should delay trade talks with US over tariffs, expert advises, citing uncertainty in US administration's policy.
body: Indonesia should delay negotiating with the US over its 32% "reciprocal" tariffs, as the US administration appears unprepared for serious bilateral talks, and instead, Indonesia should recalibrate its approach to trade strategy amid the unprecedented shift in global trade dynamics. The US tariffs, announced by President Donald Trump, have sent shockwaves through global markets, triggering losses and concerns over long-term impact, with analysts calling it a "self-inflicted wound" on the US economy.

title: Indonesian Government Considers Lifting Import Quotas on Key Commodities Amid Trade Tensions with US
body: Indonesia's government is considering removing import quotas on key commodities, a move that could boost investor confidence and streamline trade, but critics warn of potential risks to domestic producers. The proposed reform comes as the US imposes a 32% reciprocal tariff on Indonesian goods, and Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto also signals a more flexible stance on local content requirements, which could impact companies like Apple (AAPL).

title: Indonesia Secures Deals with UAE on Dairy Production and Renewable Energy Following President Prabowo's Meeting with Emirati Leader
body: Indonesia secured deals with the United Arab Emirates, including a memorandum of understanding with Al Ain Farms to invest in milk production, and a partnership with Masdar to build a 100-megawatt floating solar plant in West Java, with a total investment value of $145 million. The UAE has invested $32.7 million in Indonesia throughout 2024, with 476 projects, and the country aims to import 200,000 dairy cattle this year to boost milk production.

title: Indonesia and EU Eye Each Other's Markets Amid Trump's Trade War
body: The US's new tariffs have prompted Indonesia and the EU to diversify their export destinations, with Indonesia now subject to a 32% reciprocal tariff, while the EU gets a lower rate of 20%. Indonesia is eyeing the EU's $16.6 trillion economy as a potential market for its goods, with a trade surplus of nearly $4.5 billion in 2024, and is hoping to conclude a comprehensive economic partnership agreement with the EU soon.

title: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto plans to relax local content requirements to improve ease of doing business.
body: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto plans to relax the country's local content requirement, which has been a hurdle for companies like Apple (AAPL), to improve the ease of doing business and boost competitiveness. The move comes as Indonesia faces a 32% reciprocal tariff from the US, which was imposed in response to Jakarta's non-tariff barriers, including the domestic content rule, and is expected to negotiate with the Trump government to relax the tariffs.
