title: Indonesia's diversified trade portfolio to mitigate impact of US tariff hikes, says Coordinating Minister
body: Indonesia's economy is expected to weather the impact of recent US tariff hikes, with exports to the US contributing only 2.2% to its GDP, and the country can capitalize on new business opportunities as American investors explore relocation options to minimize costs. Indonesia's competitive pricing in the global market, with factory prices of $15-20 per pair of footwear and $20-25 per garment, can help mitigate the impact of tariffs, and the government will seek direct negotiations with US officials instead of pursuing retaliatory trade measures.

title: Yihong Novatex terminates 1,126 workers at Cirebon factory after mass strikes cause significant financial losses.
body: Yihong Novatex (no ticker), a Chinese footwear and garment manufacturer, terminated 1,126 workers at its Cirebon factory in West Java, Indonesia, following mass strikes that caused substantial financial losses, reportedly in the billions of rupiah. The strikes, which began in early March, disrupted operations, resulting in delayed production and cancelled orders from buyers, prompting the company to suspend operations at the facility and commit to paying severance packages and Eid al-Fitr bonuses to affected employees.

title: Asian Stock Markets Experience Mixed Results Amid Ongoing US-China Trade War
body: Asian stock market indices corrected on Friday, with Japan's Nikkei index falling 3.8% and South Korea's Kospi sliding 0.9%, while Taiwan's Taeix rallied 1.5% and Shanghai Composite rose 0.1%. The US dollar also declined 1.5% its highest drop in three years, as investor confidence in the US economy waned, prompting a shift to safe-haven assets such as Swiss francs, yen, euros, and precious metals.

title: Indonesia urges ASEAN nations to unite for collective negotiations against US reciprocal tariffs.
body: Indonesia is urging Asean nations to unite in collective negotiations against the US reciprocal tariff policy, which could significantly impact regional trade, and has agreed not to take retaliatory measures, instead prioritizing dialogue and diplomacy to maintain stable relations with the US. The Asean economic ministers' special meeting outlined five strategic steps to strengthen regional economic resilience, including reactivating the Asean-US investment framework and strengthening intra-Asean trade through the Asean Trade in Goods Agreement (ATIGA).

title: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia allocates IDR 1.62 trillion in dividends for 2024 fiscal year.
body: PT Japfa Comfeed Indonesia Tbk (JPFA) has distributed IDR 1.62 trillion in dividends for the 2024 fiscal year, equivalent to 53.90% of its 2024 net profit of IDR 3.01 trillion. The dividend consists of an interim dividend of IDR 813.93 billion and an additional cash dividend of IDR 813.93 billion, with the additional dividend to be paid to shareholders registered in the shareholder register based on the recording date determined by the board of directors.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Rises 0.22% to 6,267.71 on Gains in Banking Stocks
body: The Jakarta Composite Index rose 0.22% to 6,267.71, driven by gains in banking stocks such as Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) up 0.30%, Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) up 1%, and Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI) up 1.88%. Meanwhile, some stocks declined, including Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) down 4.4%, Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM) down 1.28%, and Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) down 1.06%.

title: CIMB Niaga Directors Collectively Purchase 762,200 Shares Ahead of Annual General Meeting
body: The board of directors at PT Bank CIMB Niaga Tbk (BNGA) collectively purchased 762,200 BNGA shares at IDR 1,600 per share, totaling IDR 1.22 billion, as part of the Material Risk Takers (MRT) program, which aims to align directors' interests with the company's risk profile. Following the transaction, BNGA shares by 0.89% to IDR 1,705 per share, marking a 1.49% increase over the past week and a 2.4% rise over the past month.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Closes Slightly Higher on Friday Despite Weekly Loss
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed 0.13% higher at 6,262.22 on Friday, despite a 3.25% decline over the week, with foreign investors recording a net outflow of Rp 2.49 trillion. Meanwhile, a daily inflow of Rp 44.61 billion was seen on Friday, highlighting the mixed sentiment in the market.

title: Antam Gold Price Rises by Rp 15,000 per Gram
body: Logam Mulia Antam's gold price increase by Rp 15,000 per gram to Rp 1,904,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 15,000 per gram to Rp 1,754,000 per gram. This marks a significant change in the gold market, with Antam (ANTM) being a major player in the Indonesian gold industry.

title: Indonesian Foreign Minister Claims Request for Bilateral Meeting Between President Prabowo and President Trump Was Made in Early 2025
body: Indonesia's Foreign Minister claimed that his office has requested a meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and US President Donald Trump since Trump's inauguration in early January 2025, aiming to discuss strategic issues, including the 32% reciprocal tariff policy on Indonesian commodities to the US market. The meeting is expected to address the tariff issue, according to the Foreign Minister.

title: Government to Review Toll Rate Adjustment Following Lebaran Holiday
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Public Works is considering adjusting toll road tariffs after Eid, with some toll road business entities already submitting proposals for tariff hikes. The Minister of Public Works, Dody Hanggodo, stated that the government is still verifying the minimum service standards to ensure the tariff increase meets the required quality standards.

title: Government's Efforts to Increase Foreign Exchange Liquidity May Be Disrupted Due to Global Uncertainty
body: The Indonesian government's efforts to increase liquidity may be disrupted due to the increasingly uncertain global conditions, particularly with the new export revenue policy requiring exporters to lock in 100% of their revenue in the domestic financial market for 12 months. This policy, regulated by Government Regulation No. 8/2025, applies to the mining, plantation, forestry, and fisheries sectors, and may impact the country's financial metrics.

title: Rupiah weakens to Rp 16,796 per US dollar amid escalating trade war tensions.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened throughout the week, pressured by escalating trade tensions, and closed at Rp 16,796 per US dollar on Friday, a 0.85% decline compared to the previous week. However, on a daily basis, the rupiah strengthened 0.16% on Friday, according to Bloomberg data.

title: Reksadana Seen as a More Measured Risk and Stable Investment Instrument Amidst Financial Market Volatility
body: In the midst of financial market volatility, mutual fund instruments are seen as having more measurable risks and stability, with potential for long-term growth, according to Direktur Infovesta Utama, Parto Kawito. In uncertain economic conditions, the prospect of mutual funds depends on the time horizon of investors, with fixed-income and money market funds being a suitable choice for short to medium-term investments.

title: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk plans to increase capital by issuing up to 2.94 billion shares.
body: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (SSDI) plans to increase its capital by issuing up to 2.94 billion new shares with a nominal value of IDR 100, equivalent to 55.56% of the company's fully paid and placed capital. This move aims to strengthen the company's financial position, with the exact financial metrics and outcomes pending further details.

title: PT Indo Tambangraya Megah to Distribute $243 Million in Cash Dividends for 2024
body: PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk (ITMG) is set to distribute a final dividend of $153 million, or Rp 2,245 per share, bringing the total cash dividend to $243 million, equivalent to a 65% payout ratio of its 2024 net profit of $374 million. This significant dividend payout demonstrates the company's financial performance and commitment to sharing profits with investors.

title: Coconut prices surge in Indonesia due to reduced domestic supply and high international demand.
body: The price of grated coconut and packaged coconut milk has surged, reaching IDR 25,000 per unit, due to a drastic decrease in coconut supply in the domestic market, as many traders opt to sell coconuts abroad at higher prices, causing a crisis in the coconut industry, with the Indonesian Coconut Farmers Association calling the situation an emergency. The government's plan to become a global leader in coconut downstream industry by 2045 is threatened by the current shortage, highlighting the need to increase coconut production and productivity to ensure a stable supply.

title: Indonesian Tourism Sector Faces Challenges Amid Government's Efficiency Measures
body: As the Indonesian government implements budget efficiency, the country's tourism sector is facing a fundamental question: how self-sufficient can it be? With reduced government spending on travel, events, and out-of-town activities, many tourism businesses are struggling to survive, testing their resilience and future direction.

title: Number of Companies Delisting from Indonesian Stock Exchange Expected to Increase This Year
body: The number of companies delisting from the Indonesia Stock Exchange is expected to increase this year, with PT Humpuss Intermoda Transportasi Tbk (HITS), owned by Tommy Soeharto, being the latest to announce its delisting plans. This trend is likely to continue, with more companies potentially following suit, marking a significant shift in the Indonesian stock market.

title: US Tariff Policy Poses Challenges for Steel Industry in 2025
body: The performance of steel issuers in 2025 is expected to face challenges due to the US import tariff policy affecting over 180 countries, including Indonesia. Although Trump has temporarily suspended reciprocal tariffs, the existing tariffs on imported cars, steel, and aluminum remain in place, posing a continued threat to the industry.

title: Jasuindo Tiga Perkasa Targets Double-Digit Growth in 2025 Amid Rising Demand for Digital Security and Printing Products.
body: PT Jasuindo Tiga Perkasa Tbk (Jasuindo) aims to continue its positive performance in 2025, targeting double-digit growth driven by the increasing demand for digital security and printing products both domestically and internationally. This optimism follows the company's two-digit profit growth in 2024, with the growing market demand expected to support its future performance.

title: PT PP's New Contract Receipts Down 32% to IDR 2.99 Trillion in January-February 2025.
body: PT Pembangunan Perumahan Tbk (PTPP) reported a decline in new contract value of IDR 2.99 trillion for January-February 2025, only 8.79% of its 2025 target, a 32% decrease. The new contracts were dominated by private sector projects (47.31%), followed by government projects (38.58%), and state-owned enterprises (14.11%).

title: Indonesian Capital Market Sees Significant Growth in Fund Collection Despite Sluggish IPO Activity
body: Indonesia's capital market has seen a growth in fund collection, reaching Rp 57.68 trillion as of March 27, 2025, according to the Financial Services Authority's data. This growth comes amid a quiet period for initial public offerings, highlighting the resilience of the country's capital market.

title: Bank Profitability in Indonesia Slows Down as Net Interest Margin Ratio Continues to Decline
body: The net interest margin (NIM) of Indonesian banks decreased to 4.39% in February 2025, down from 4.62% in December 2024 and 4.49% in February 2024, with major banks such as Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) and Bank Mandiri Tbk experiencing significant declines, with BCA's NIM dropping 51 basis points to 5.40% and Mandiri's NIM falling 43 basis points to 3.99%. Despite the decline, bank executives and regulators emphasized that NIM is only one component of profitability, and other factors such as non-interest income, credit growth, and liquidity will influence future performance.

title: QRIS Transactions in Indonesian Banks Surge During Ramadan and Lebaran
body: PT Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) reported a 50% increase in QRIS transactions, reaching over 3.8 million transactions with a value of more than IDR 380 billion during Ramadan and Lebaran 2025, resulting in a nearly two-fold growth in fee-based income. Meanwhile, PT Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) saw a 67% growth in QRIS transactions year-over-year, with a 203% annual growth in QRIS transactions and a 193% annual growth in fee-based income, driven by various strategies including festive promotions and merchant network expansion.

title: Multifinance Industry's Non-Performing Financing Ratio Improves to 2.87% in February 2025
body: The non-performing financing (NPF) ratio in Indonesia's multifinance industry improved to 2.87% in February 2025, down from 2.96% in the previous month, according to OJK data. Companies such as PT Cimb Niaga Auto Finance (1.3% NPF), PT Mandiri Utama Finance (1.42% NPF), and PT Adira Dinamika Multi Finance Tbk (2.2% NPF) reported lower-than-industry-average NPF ratios, thanks to their risk-based pricing, proactive risk mitigation, and effective collection strategies.

title: US President Donald Trump's Import Tariff Policy Shakes Financial Markets
body: The US President Donald Trump's import tariff policy has shaken the financial market, causing investors to reorganize their portfolios, and surprisingly, the US dollar, typically a safe-haven asset, has been abandoned, with the dollar index falling 1.19% to 99,666. This unusual market reaction has sparked uncertainty, prompting a shift in investor behavior.

title: Astra Otoparts Prepares to Counter Potential Increase in Automotive Import Flow to Indonesia.
body: PT Astra Otoparts Tbk (AUTO) has prepared several approaches to address the possible increase in imports of automotive component products to Indonesia, triggered by the high import tariff policy imposed by the American government on its trading partner countries, including China. This strategic move aims to mitigate the potential impact on the company's financial performance.

title: Southeast Asia's private equity market surges 60% to $16 billion in 2024, driven by Singapore and Indonesia.
body: The Southeast Asian private equity market saw a significant 60% increase in deal value, reaching $16 billion annually, driven by large investments in digital infrastructure assets in Singapore and Indonesia, according to the 2025 Southeast Asia Private Equity Report. This growth marks a substantial rise in the region's market value, highlighting the increasing attractiveness of Southeast Asia to private equity investors.

title: Bank Central Asia's stock price continues to rise, gaining 0.61% to IDR 8,275 per share.
body: PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) shares continued their positive trend on Friday, rising 0.61% to IDR 8,275 per share, marking a three-day rebound with a total gain of 6.43% since Wednesday. Prior to this, BBCA's share price had plummeted 8.53% to IDR 7,775 per share on Tuesday, following the decline in the Jakarta Composite Index.

title: Donald Trump's Unpredictable Decisions Create Uncertainty in Global Economy
body: Donald Trump's unpredictable decisions, such as imposing reciprocal tariffs on imports, have become a major source of economic uncertainty, making it difficult to anticipate his next move. This uncertainty has prompted many economic powers to take steps to reduce their dependence on the US, as they prepare for a potential expansion of the trade war beyond tariffs and export restrictions.

title: Alfamart and Indomaret Continue Expansion Amidst Economic Challenges
body: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (ALFA) continues to expand its Alfamart stores despite current economic challenges and weak consumer purchasing power, with plans to acquire Lawson from an affiliated issuer. This move is expected to further strengthen the company's retail presence in the Indonesian market.

title: International Maritime Organization Sets Ambitious Target to Reduce Carbon Emissions from Shipping Industry
body: PT Temas Tbk (TMAS) has allocated IDR 800 billion to purchase 8 liquefied natural gas (LNG) powered ships, aiming to reduce carbon emissions by 25% and sulfur content to 0%, with the goal of achieving net zero emissions by 2060. The company's commitment to reducing carbon emissions is expected to contribute to the global effort to combat climate change, with the International Maritime Organization (IMO) targeting a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from international shipping by 2050.

title: Global Economic Recession Fears Rise Amid Escalating Trade War and Tariffs
body: J.P. Morgan (JPM) has raised the probability of a global economic recession to 60% following President Donald Trump's imposition of tariffs on imports from 180 countries, which has disrupted the global economy. The tariffs have led to retaliatory measures from many countries, further threatening the global economy and sparking concerns among businesses about the potential for a second round of global trade war.

title: Antam Gold Price Remains Unchanged at Rp 1.904.000 per Gram
body: The price of gold at Antam (ANTM) changed to Rp 1,904,000 per gram, while the buyback price remained the same at Rp 1,754,000 per gram.

title: PT IMC Pelita Logistik Tbk to Expand into New Business Lines to Improve Financial Performance
body: PT IMC Pelita Logistik Tbk (PSSI) plans to expand into two new business lines, including holding company activities and management consultancy services, to ensure business sustainability and improve financial performance. Despite a 4.26% decline in net profit to IDR 630 billion in 2023 and a 63.65% plunge to IDR 229 billion in 2024, the company aims to revamp its financial metrics with this strategic move.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping Pledges to Deepen Strategic Partnership with Indonesia Amid Escalating Trade Tensions with US
body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has pledged to deepen his country's strategic partnership with Indonesia, aiming to strengthen bilateral cooperation amid escalating trade tensions with the US. Xi's upcoming visit to Southeast Asian countries, including Vietnam, Malaysia, and Cambodia, is expected to reinforce China's ties with its closest neighbors and potentially establish a standby line for rupiah stabilization.

title: Coconut Prices Remain High in Indonesia Due to Increased Exports and Low Domestic Supply
body: The price of coconut has surged to IDR 20,000 to IDR 25,000 per unit, up from IDR 10,000 previously, due to increased exports and low supply. The Indonesian government is promoting the downstream processing of coconuts domestically to address the issue, but prices remain high even after the Eid al-Fitr holiday.

title: Trump's Tariff Delay Brings Temporary Relief but Uncertainty Still Haunts Global Economy
body: The temporary relief from the reciprocal tariff delay announced by US President Donald Trump on April 9, 2025, is overshadowed by uncertainty due to Trump's unpredictable policy changes. The 90-day window is being utilized by governments, including Indonesia, to negotiate with the US government, amidst ongoing global economic uncertainty.

title: Indonesia Considers Importing US Oil and Agricultural Products to Counter Trump's 32% Tariff.
body: The Indonesian government has chosen to negotiate with the US after President Donald Trump imposed a 32% reciprocal tariff on Indonesian goods, with options including opening up imports of liquefied petroleum gas and liquefied natural gas from the US. Indonesia is also considering importing agricultural products such as soybeans and wheat as part of its negotiation strategy.

title: China's New Thermal Power Plant Standards to Impact Indonesia's Coal Exports
body: China's energy efficiency measures, including new standards for thermal power plants, are expected to directly impact Indonesia's coal exports this year, as China is Indonesia's second-largest coal buyer after India. The new standards, which aim to promote the use of more efficient power plants, were officially implemented on April 1, 2025, and are likely to affect Indonesia's coal exports.

title: Gold mining companies target production increase in 2025 amid positive gold price trend.
body: Several gold mining companies, including PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BUMI), are targeting production increases in 2025, driven by the positive trend in gold prices at the start of the year. PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk aims to boost gold production this year, building on its positive achievements in 2024.

title: Indonesia takes constructive approach to US trade war by planning to remove import quotas and deregulate.
body: In response to the US-China trade war, the Indonesian government plans to remove import quotas and implement deregulation, which could lead to structural reforms and improvements in the country's trade policies. This move is seen as a positive outcome, with President Trump's protectionist policies inadvertently providing an incentive for Indonesia to undertake long-overdue domestic reforms.

title: Antam's Gold Price Drops by Rp 8,000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) lowered the price of its gold by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,904,000 per gram to Rp 1,896,000 per gram, while the buyback price also decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,754,000 per gram to Rp 1,746,000 per gram. This move marks a decline in gold prices, affecting investors and market dynamics.

title: Indonesia's Diplomatic Approach to US Tariffs Raises Concerns Over National Interests
body: Indonesia's diplomatic approach to counter US President Donald Trump's tariffs is appreciated, but the government must be cautious in negotiations to avoid unbalanced trade agreements, as the country still faces non-tariff barriers from the US and has a significant trade deficit, including a $18.66 billion deficit in service trade in 2024. To mitigate this, Indonesia should prioritize strengthening its domestic industries, particularly labor-intensive sectors, and protect its national interests before opening up to foreign products.

title: PT Sido Muncul Commits to Environmental Sustainability Amid Climate Change Threats
body: PT Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) has reported a 23% increase in net profit to IDR 1.17 trillion in 2024, driven by a 12% increase in supply from partner farmers and a 10% increase in the use of renewable energy. The company aims to maintain a 10% growth rate in 2025, with plans to expand its international market and allocate IDR 150-175 billion for capital expenditures, while also focusing on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) aspects.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 3.82% in Second Week of April 2025
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) corrected 3.82% to 6,262.22 by the end of the second week of April 2025, despite strengthening in the last two trading days. This decline marks a significant drop in the index's value over the past week.

title: MPXL Prepares Strategies to Achieve Performance Growth by 2025
body: PT MPX Logistics International Tbk (MPXL) is preparing strategies to achieve performance growth by 2025, building on its positive momentum after reporting a 31.81% year-over-year increase in net profit to Rp 12.43 billion in 2024, up from Rp 9.43 billion in 2023. The company, which operates in the construction and infrastructure material transportation and trading sector, aims to continue its financial performance growth.

title: Morgan Stanley to Exclude Three Barito Group Stocks from Index Review in May 2025
body: Morgan Stanley Capital International Inc. has announced that it will not include three Barito Group stocks in its index review in May 2025, sparking negative sentiment in the Indonesian stock market. This news comes on the heels of the recent tariff tensions with Donald Trump, further exacerbating the market's volatility.

title: Rupiah Weakens Against US Dollar Amid Decline in US Dollar Index.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.15% to IDR 16,805 per dollar on Friday, following a 0.94% decline in the US Dollar Index (DXY), which was driven by the strengthening of major currencies such as the euro, yen, and pound sterling. Meanwhile, the rupiah closed 0.01% lower at IDR 16,797.2 per dollar, according to Investing.com data.

title: PT Maharaksa Biru Energi to Develop Waste-to-Energy Power Plant in Tangerang Selatan with Chinese Partner.
body: PT Maharaksa Biru Energi Tbk (MREI) is set to maximize its waste energy business by building a waste-to-energy power plant in Tangerang Selatan, partnering with China Tianying Inc. through its subsidiary, PT Indoplas Energi Hijau, to develop the Cipeucang waste-to-energy facility in Banten. The project aims to generate electricity from waste, marking a significant step in the company's waste energy business expansion.

title: Insiders at Indonesian companies Akr Corporindo, Map Aktif Adiperkasa, and Sariguna Primatirta engage in significant share buybacks.
body: AKR Corporindo's (AKRA) President Commissioner, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, purchased 7,100,500 shares on April 8, 2025, and 209,500 shares on April 9, 2025, at a price range of IDR 925 to IDR 967 per share, increasing his stake in the company from 0.67% to 0.71%. Meanwhile, MAP Aktif Adiperkasa's (MAPA) Director, Miquel Rodrigo Staal, acquired 900,000 shares at IDR 555 per share on April 9, 2025, raising his stake in the company from 0.049% to 0.052%, while Hermanto Tanoko, a conglomerate, also accumulated shares in PT Sariguna Primatirta Tbk through PT Tancorp Global Abadi, worth IDR 41 billion.

title: Government's Royalty Tariff Hike Policy to Affect Performance of Mineral and Coal Mining Companies
body: The Indonesian government's decision to increase royalty tariffs for coal, nickel, copper, gold, silver, and tin is expected to negatively impact the performance of mining companies, particularly producers, as higher production volumes will lead to higher royalty tariffs, increasing production costs and squeezing margins. This policy change is likely to affect the financial performance of mining companies, potentially impacting their bottom line.

title: IHSG Expected to Strengthen but with Limited Gains Amid Ongoing Trade War Sentiment
body: The Indonesian stock market is expected to be influenced by the ongoing trade war sentiment, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) potentially strengthening but with limited gains. The uncertainty surrounding the global economy, including Indonesia, is likely to persist as the US and China continue to impose additional tariffs on each other.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises for Third Consecutive Day Despite Foreign Investors' Net Sell.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) strengthened by 8.20 points or 0.13% to 6,262.22 on Friday, marking its third consecutive day of gains. Despite this, foreign investors continued to net sell, offloading Rp 214.36 billion worth of shares on Friday.

title: PT Surya Semesta Internusa Strengthens Industrial Business Line with Subang Smartpolitan as Long-Term Expansion Driver
body: PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk (SSIA) aggressively expands its industrial area business, with land sales reaching 162.4 hectares last year, a 703.96% increase from the previous year, driven mainly by sales from Suryacipta Karawang and Subang Smartpolitan areas. This significant growth indicates the company's long-term expansion strategy, with Subang Smartpolitan being a key driver of its future growth.

title: Long queues form at Antam's gold shop in Jakarta as people rush to buy gold amid economic uncertainty.
body: The recent surge in gold prices has driven public confidence in gold as a safe-haven asset, particularly during uncertain economic times, leading to long queues at Antam's gold bullion boutique in Jakarta, with hundreds of people waiting to buy gold. The high demand has resulted in a crowded boutique, with customers like Fahmi waiting anxiously to purchase gold, highlighting the strong interest in gold as a safe investment option.

title: Bus Karoseri Industry Experiences 20% Decline in Demand Ahead of Lebaran Holiday
body: The Indonesian automotive sector is experiencing a business slowdown, with demand for bus karoseri decreasing by 20% this year compared to last year, sparking concern among karoseri business owners for the rest of 2025. According to Delimajaya Group's Managing Director Winston Wiyanta, the decline in bus karoseri demand is in line with the decrease in inter-city and inter-provincial bus occupancy during the Lebaran period.

title: At least 12 Indonesian listed companies prepare to distribute large cash dividends to shareholders for the 2024 fiscal year.
body: Despite the sluggish Indonesian stock market, at least 12 listed companies in the Indonesia Stock Exchange are preparing to distribute large cash dividends to their shareholders for the 2024 fiscal year. This move is expected to benefit shareholders, with the companies aiming to reward their investors with significant dividend payouts.

title: Majority of Telecommunication Tower Operators Record Growth in 2024 Performance
body: PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk (MITRA) reported a 7.19% year-over-year increase in revenue to Rp 9.31 trillion in 2024, up from Rp 8.68 trillion in 2023. The majority of telecommunication tower issuers, including MITRA, experienced growth in their performance throughout 2024.

title: Four suspects named in alleged bribery case related to crude palm oil export permit in Jakarta court.
body: The Indonesian Attorney General's Office has named four suspects in a corruption case involving bribery and gratification in the handling of a crude palm oil export permit case, with alleged bribes of IDR 60 billion (approximately USD 4.2 million) paid to influence the court's decision. The suspects, including a judge and a lawyer, are accused of accepting bribes from three corporate defendants, Permata Hijau Grup, Wilmar Grup, and Musim Mas Grup, to secure a favorable verdict.

title: KPK Names Two Suspects in Alleged Gas Trading Corruption Case at PGN, State Losses Estimated at IDR 252.2 Billion.
body: The Corruption Eradication Commission has named two suspects, Danny Praditya, former director of PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS), and Iswan Ibrahim, former commissioner of PT Inti Alasindo Energi, in a corruption case involving gas trading, with estimated state losses of $15 million or IDR 252.2 billion. The suspects are alleged to have violated Article 2 paragraph 1 and/or Article 3 of the Corruption Eradication Law and Article 55 paragraph 1 of the Criminal Code.

title: Fintech Lending Industry Sees Rapid Growth in Indonesia Amid High Market Demand
body: The Indonesian fintech lending industry has seen a significant surge in loan disbursements, driven by high market demand, with the Financial Services Authority recording rapid growth in fintech lending debt in recent months. This growth has enabled fintech lenders to strengthen their expansion, capitalizing on the increasing demand for online loans.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Remains Under Pressure, Weakening 4.12% This Year Despite Slight Gain on Friday.
body: The Indonesian rupiah remains under pressure, closing at Rp 16,796 per dollar on Friday, up 0.16% from the previous day, but weakening 4.12% year-to-date. The rupiah's decline began in early October 2024, when it was at Rp 15,140, and has continued to weaken since then, with a 3.61% drop in just one week.

title: Multifinance Industry Faces Increasing Operational Burden Amid Sluggish Business Conditions
body: Indonesia's multifinance industry faces increasing operational burdens amidst sluggish business growth, with companies striving to stay efficient amid economic uncertainty. The Financial Services Authority reported that the multifinance industry's BOPO (Business Operational Profitability Ratio) reached 79.36% as of 2024, up from 77.91% in December 2023, highlighting the sector's operational challenges.

title: US Tariff Threatens National Crude Palm Oil Business Prospects This Year
body: The business prospects of Indonesian crude palm oil (CPO) emitters are threatened by various negative sentiments, primarily due to the US government's plan to impose a 32% reciprocal tariff on Indonesian products. This tariff is expected to significantly impact the financial performance of Indonesian CPO companies, affecting their business outlook for the year.

title: Indonesia's Financial Services Authority Introduces Stricter Circuit Breaker Mechanism to Maintain Market Stability Amid Volatility
body: The Jakarta Financial Services Authority has set a 15% lower auto-rejection limit for stocks to maintain capital market stability, following a sharp sell-off on the Indonesia Stock Exchange that triggered a 9.19% plunge in the Jakarta Composite Index. The revised circuit breaker mechanism aims to curb panic-driven selloffs, and temporary measures such as suspending short-selling and allowing share buybacks without shareholder approval will remain in effect for six months.

title: Amman Mineral Internasional begins operations at new copper smelter in West Sumbawa, targets 220,000 tons annual output.
body: Amman Mineral Internasional (no ticker) has commenced operations at its new smelter in West Sumbawa, Indonesia, with an annual production target of 220,000 tons of high-purity copper cathodes, and is seeking a temporary export permit to avoid potential oversupply. The company aims to process up to 900,000 tons of copper concentrate annually, but is taking a cautious approach to ramp up full production capacity, prioritizing safety and sustainability.

title: Palm oil industry plays crucial role in Indonesia's economy, contributing significantly to foreign exchange and trade balance.
body: Indonesia's palm oil industry has contributed significantly to the country's trade balance, with foreign exchange from palm oil exports reaching $31 billion in 2023, up from $1.08 billion in 2000, and saving the country from a potential trade deficit. The industry's mandatory biodiesel program has also reduced the country's oil-gas trade balance deficit, enabling Indonesia to achieve a trade surplus, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Indonesia Pursues Sugar Self-Sufficiency with Palm-Based Brown Sugar Alternative
body: Indonesia, the world's largest importer of sugar, is increasingly dependent on sugar imports, with a growing gap between domestic production and consumption, and the government is pushing for self-sufficiency through the production of palm brown sugar, a more sustainable and affordable alternative to sugarcane sugar. With a potential production capacity of 3.7 million tons per year, palm brown sugar could help Indonesia achieve sugar self-sufficiency, reducing its dependence on imports and promoting a more sustainable and competitive sugar industry.

title: Antam Gold Price Remains Unchanged, Buyback Price Drops by Rp 1,000 per Gram.
body: ANTAM (ANTM) gold prices remain steady at IDR 1,896,000 per gram, while the buyback price by Logam Mulia decreases by IDR 1,000 per gram to IDR 1,745,000 per gram. This adjustment in buyback price may impact investors and market dynamics, particularly in the gold trading sector.

title: Gold Price Reaches Record High, Boosting Optimism for Gold Producers
body: The recent surge in gold prices has not only set a new record but also brought optimism to gold producers, with Antam's gold price reaching IDR 1,904,000 per gram, a historic high. The upward trend in gold prices is expected to continue, with the global gold price having reached a record high of USD 3,277.23 per ounce on Friday.

title: Rupiah strengthens at the start of the week, potentially continuing its upward trend due to US dollar selling pressure.
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened at the start of the week, with the spot rate appreciating 0.05% to IDR 16,787 per US dollar, and the Jisdor rate rising 0.19% to IDR 16,773 per dollar. The rupiah's strengthening is expected to continue due to ongoing selling pressure on the US dollar.

title: Coal Mining Companies Struggle Amid Falling Commodity Prices and Trade War Uncertainty
body: PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk (ITMG) is expected to see an 8% decline in its average selling price to $84 per ton this year due to the ongoing correction in coal prices, exacerbated by the escalating trade war. This downward trend is likely to continue, negatively impacting the financial performance of coal mining companies like ITMG.

title: Mirae Asset Sekuritas Indonesia's Legal Case with 40 Clients, Including 'Sultan Subang', Reaches Verdict on April 9, 2025
body: A legal case involving Mirae Asset Sekuritas Indonesia (None) and 40 of its clients, including "Sultan Subang" Asep Sulaeman Sabanda, has reached a verdict on April 9, 2025. The article is only accessible to subscribers, with a 7-day free trial available for 20,000 IDR per month, offering exclusive business, economic, and investment news and analysis.

title: Heavy Equipment Businessmen Anticipate Economic Turbulence and Rupiah Fluctuation
body: The Indonesian heavy equipment business community is wary of potential economic turmoil and fluctuations in the rupiah exchange rate, which has weakened to around IDR 16,700-17,000 per US dollar. If the rupiah continues to depreciate and economic instability occurs, businesses fear a decline in demand, according to Yushi Sandidarma, Chairman of the Indonesian Heavy Equipment Sole Agent Association.

title: Indonesian Fishery and Maritime Businesses Prepare to Diversify Markets Amid US Tariff Hike.
body: Indonesian seafood and fisheries businesses are preparing to diversify their markets in response to the high tariffs imposed by the US government, but this effort is expected to be challenging. The Indonesian Association of Fish Processing and Marketing Businesses has been trying to develop non-US markets, but faces many obstacles in its implementation.

title: PT Global Sukses Solusi Tbk Maintains Performance Amidst Market Challenges Through Strategic Business Transformation.
body: PT Global Sukses Solusi Tbk (GSS) successfully maintained its performance last year despite market challenges, thanks to its strategic business transformation initiated in early 2024, which focused on products with a subscription-based business model. This strategic move helped the company to achieve its goals, marking a significant outcome for PT Global Sukses Solusi Tbk (GSS).

title: Electronic City Indonesia expands business by opening new store in Sentul, Bogor.
body: PT Electronic City Indonesia Tbk (ECII) continues its business expansion by opening a new store in Marktlane Sentul, West Java, as part of its strategy to get closer to customers and strengthen its customer base. This new store opening is expected to contribute to the company's growth, with ECII aiming to open more stores in new locations to reach a wider customer base.

title: Erajaya Sees Strong Sales of iPhone 16 Series in Indonesia Amid High Consumer Anticipation
body: PT Erajaya Swasembada Tbk (ERAA) is capitalizing on the launch of the iPhone 16 series to maximize profits, leveraging its position as an official Apple partner in Indonesia. The company has seen high consumer enthusiasm, with strong pre-orders and long queues at its stores on the first day of sales, indicating a positive market response to the new iPhone series.

title: PT Perdana Karya Perkasa Targets 1.1 Million Tons of Coal Production by 2025 Through Subsidiary PT Tri Oetama Persada.
body: PT Perdana Karya Perkasa Tbk (PKPK) aims to increase coal production through its subsidiary, PT Tri Oetama Persada, targeting 1.1 million tons of coal production and sales by 2025, a two-fold increase from last year's target of 550,000 tons. This synergy between PKPK and Tri Oetama Persada has expanded the company's business portfolio, improved financial resilience, and strengthened its market share in various sectors.

title: PT Aneka Tambang TBK Starts 2025 with Confidence After Solid Operational Performance in 2024
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) started 2025 with high confidence after recording solid operational performance in 2024, driven by increased production and sales of strategic commodities and accelerated mineral downstreaming projects. The company's diversification strategy and operational efficiency enabled it to optimize sales and production performance, ensuring its resilience in the face of global market dynamics.

title: Pertamina Awaits Government Direction on Impact of US Tariff Policy on Energy Imports.
body: PT Pertamina (PERTM) is waiting for official guidance from the government regarding the reciprocal tariff policy, which may impact the company's energy imports from the United States, including crude oil, LPG, and liquefied natural gas. The company's Vice President of Corporate Communication, Fadjar Djoko Santoso, stated that Pertamina is still awaiting the government's direction on the policy before making any decisions.

title: Indonesia Aims to Surpass the US as the World's Largest Geothermal Power Producer
body: Indonesia aims to surpass the United States as the country with the largest geothermal power generation capacity in the world, leveraging its abundant geothermal potential to achieve this target. With its vast geothermal reserves, Indonesia is poised to become a leader in renewable energy, supporting its ambitious goal.

title: US Federal Reserve May Raise Interest Rates in Response to Trump's Tariff Policy, Affecting Indonesia's Monetary Policy
body: Economists predict the Federal Reserve may raise interest rates in response to Trump's tariffs on 180 countries, which could influence Bank Indonesia's decision on setting the benchmark interest rate. Trump has temporarily delayed the tariffs for 90 days due to negotiations with 75 trading partner countries, including Indonesia.

title: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves reach $157.1 billion in late March 2025, up $2.6 billion from previous month.
body: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves reached $157.1 billion at the end of March 2025, a $2.6 billion increase from the previous month's $154.5 billion, bolstering Bank Indonesia's ammunition to stabilize the rupiah exchange rate. The increase was driven by tax and service receipts, as well as the government's foreign loan withdrawals, according to Executive Director of the Communication Department, Ramdan Denny Prakoso.

title: PT Hillcon Equity Management Sells 27.5 Million Shares of PT Hilcon Tbk at IDR 360 per Share.
body: PT Hillcon Equity Management, the controlling shareholder of PT Hilcon Tbk (HILC), sold 27.5 million shares of the mining company at IDR 360 per share. The sale was disclosed in an information transparency report, with the exact financial implications of the transaction not specified.

title: Indonesia to Negotiate with US on Reciprocal Tariffs Imposed by President Trump
body: The Indonesian government will start negotiations with the United States regarding the 32% reciprocal tariff imposed by President Donald Trump, with a delegation led by Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto, including Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati, set to visit Washington D.C. on April 16. The goal of the negotiation is to resolve the tariff issue, which affects Indonesia's economy.

title: Morgan Stanley Capital International to Revise Liquidity Criteria for Indonesian Stocks in Global Index.
body: Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) plans to change the criteria for Indonesian stocks related to liquidity issues, which may exclude some IHSG-driving stocks from its prestigious index. The new criteria, effective from April 11, 2025, will exclude stocks with unusual market activity in the past 12 months and those listed on a special surveillance board due to abnormal price movements.

title: Unit-Linked Products' Performance Slumps in Q1 2025 Amid Stock Market Downturn
body: In Q1 2025, the Indonesian stock market's poor performance, with the IHSG index dropping 8.04%, negatively impacted unit-linked products, particularly equity-linked ones, which saw an average return of -8.77%. However, in March, unit-linked products managed to post a positive monthly return of 0.77%.

title: PT Tunas Baru Lampung to Conduct Buyback of 300 Million Shares Worth Rp 200 Billion Without Holding a General Meeting of Shareholders.
body: PT Tunas Baru Lampung Tbk (TBLA) will conduct a buyback of its shares worth IDR 200 billion, purchasing 300 million shares or 4.97% of its issued shares without holding a general meeting of shareholders. This move is expected to have a significant impact on the company's financial metrics and investor confidence.

title: PT Bukit Asam Targets 16.55% Increase in Coal Production to 50.1 Million Tons by 2025
body: PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) targets to produce 50.1 million tons of coal in 2025, a 16.55% increase from its 2024 production of 43.3 million tons, aiming to boost its operational performance throughout the year. This growth target is expected to drive the company's financial metrics, with the goal of achieving significant revenue and profit increases.

title: Capital Nusantara Project Budget Remains Unblocked, Construction to Proceed as Planned
body: The Indonesian government has confirmed that the budget for the Nusantara Capital City (IKN) project is safe from cuts and will not be blocked, ensuring the project remains on track to meet its targets. The Ministry of Public Works will focus on completing existing projects, such as the Tripraja axis, legislative-judicial area, and the completion of the Garuda Palace and State Palace, rather than starting new ones.

title: Rupiah's Weakening Raises Concerns Over Potential Increase in Hajj Costs This Year
body: The Indonesian rupiah has weakened by 4% since the beginning of the year, sparking concerns about a potential increase in Hajj pilgrimage costs, as the base cost of Hajj is pegged to the US dollar and Saudi riyal. The rupiah strengthened by 0.05% to Rp 16,787 per dollar in yesterday's spot market trading, but the overall depreciation may impact Hajj costs.

title: Constitutional Court Ruling Paves Way for Revision of Financial Sector Development Law
body: The Indonesian Constitutional Court's ruling (No. 85/PUU-XXII/2024) has sparked calls to revise the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Act (Law No. 4/2023), which was implemented just two years ago, potentially leading to amendments to the roles of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) and Bank Indonesia. This development may impact the governance of the Deposit Insurance Corporation and the financial sector as a whole, with potential implications for the economy and investments.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Conducts Official Visits to Five Middle Eastern Countries, Securing Investment Commitments and Cooperation Agreements.
body: President Prabowo Subianto's official visit to five Middle Eastern countries resulted in several investment commitments, including a $2 billion investment from Qatar in Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara. Other agreements include a business deal between the Ministry of Agriculture and Al-Ain Farms Livestock Production PEA for dairy cow investment, and investments in renewable energy, among others.

title: Two Listed Companies in Indonesia Raise IDR 470 Billion through Rights Issue
body: As of April 10, 2025, two listed companies in Indonesia have issued rights with a total value of IDR 470 billion, according to the Indonesia Stock Exchange. This move indicates that despite the sluggish domestic stock market, some issuers are still seeking funding through the capital market, particularly through rights issues.

title: Investment Credit Growth Remains Strong Amid Slowing Credit Disbursement.
body: Despite slowing credit growth, banks expect investment credits to remain a key driver, with investment credits growing the fastest in recent months. This growth in investment credits typically reflects business optimism in long-term expansion, indicating a positive outlook for the economy.

title: Indonesia to Send High-Level Delegation to US to Negotiate Tariff Reduction and Balance Trade Deficit
body: Indonesia is sending a high-level delegation to the US from April 16-23 to negotiate favorable trade terms and address the 32% import tariffs imposed by the US, with plans to increase imports of key commodities like LNG, LPG, cotton, and soybeans. The delegation, led by Chief Economic Affairs Minister Airlangga Hartarto, aims to balance the trade deficit with the US, promote investment, and explore tax reforms, while maintaining relatively low tariffs on US imports.

title: Indonesian delegation to visit US for talks on recent tariff hikes on Indonesian goods.
body: A high-level Indonesian delegation, led by Coordinating Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto, will travel to the US from April 16-23 to discuss recently imposed 32% tariff hikes on Indonesian goods with key US officials, including the US Trade Representative and Secretaries of Commerce, State, and Treasury. The delegation aims to address trade deficits and perceived trade barriers, with Indonesia having compiled comprehensive documentation outlining bilateral trade relations and expectations for future economic partnership with the US.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges Nearly 4 Percent Amid Global Trade Tensions
body: Indonesia's benchmark stock index, Jakarta Composite Index, plummeted 3.82% to 6,262.23, wiping out Rp 431 trillion in market value, as foreign investors continued to retreat, booking a net sell of Rp 35.86 trillion year-to-date. The market capitalization of the Indonesia Stock Exchange shrank 3.88% to Rp 10,695 trillion, amid growing concerns over Indonesia's trade prospects and global economic headwinds.

title: Indonesia on track to achieve 12 million ton rice surplus this year, bolstering its ambition to become major global rice exporter.
body: Indonesia is on track to achieve a rice surplus of 12 million tons this year, with state logistics agency Bulog absorbing 840,000 tons of rice, a 2,000% increase from the same period last year, and rice stocks expected to rise to 3 million tons by the end of the month. The government's initiatives, including land optimization and infrastructure improvements, aim to increase rice production, with a target of 3 million hectares of new rice fields, which could lead to a 30 million-ton harvest and a 12 million-ton surplus.

title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Buy Transaction of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher acquired 210,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. on February 4, 2025, increasing his holding from 18,873,400 to 19,083,400 shares. The transaction, classified as an investment, was executed in two tranches at prices of IDR 520 and IDR 525 per share.

title: Penfabric Sdn Berhad Buy Transaction of PT Century Textile Industry Tbk
body: Penfabric Sdn Berhad, an insider, bought 9,115,900 shares of PT Century Textile Industry Tbk, increasing their holding from 60,000,000 to 69,115,900 shares. The transaction, valued at 400 per share, represents a significant increase in ownership. The purpose of the transaction is unknown.

title: Indonesian Government Plans to Expand Tax Base by Targeting Illegal Sectors
body: The Indonesian government aims to increase tax revenue by targeting illegal sectors, with Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati stating that concrete steps are being taken to optimize tax receipts and improve the tax ratio. The move is expected to face significant challenges.

title: PT Teladan Prima Agro Tbk (TLDN) Optimistic About 5-10% Growth in Production and Revenue by 2025
body: PT Teladan Prima Agro Tbk (TLDN) expects a 5-10% increase in production volume and revenue by 2025, driven by well-maintained plantations and stable commodity prices. The company remains optimistic about its business growth, citing productivity and profitability improvements.

title: Indonesian Stock Index Rises 0.99% to 6,678.91 on Friday
body: The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) surged 0.99% or 65.44 points to 6,678.91 on Friday, accumulating a 3.74% gain over the past week, despite still being down 5.66% since the start of the year. No specific company mentions were made in the article.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Rebalances IDX80 Index, Removes Two Stocks
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) has rebalanced its IDX80 index, removing two stocks, PT Global Mediacom Tbk and PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk, effective May 2025. The move is part of the exchange's regular evaluation of its indices, which takes place from May 2 to July 31, 2025.

title: Indonesian Stock Exchange Conducts Routine Evaluation of Main Indices
body: The Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) conducted a routine three-month evaluation of its main indices, including LQ45, IDX30, and KOMPAS100, resulting in the removal of one stock and replacement with another in the IDX30 index. The evaluation took place from May 2 to July 31, 2025.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Reevaluates Constituents of LQ45 Index
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has reevaluated the constituents of the LQ45 index, which will be effective from May 2 to July 31, 2025, but has decided not to change the composition of the index. No financial metrics were disclosed in the article.

title: Indonesia Experiences Bumper Crop of Rice, Attracts Foreign Importers
body: Indonesia's rice production has seen a significant surge in the last four months, attracting the attention of foreign countries looking to import rice from the country. President Prabowo Subianto is keen to capitalize on this opportunity, with several countries already seeking food aid from Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Parliament to Form Toll Road Working Committee to Evaluate Toll Policy
body: The Indonesian Parliament's Commission V has agreed to form a toll road working committee to evaluate the toll policy, particularly regarding the minimum service standards of toll roads, amid concerns over the increasing number of toll roads and their management. The committee aims to improve the services provided by toll road operators.

title: Harita Nickel Undergoes Stringent Independent Audit for Responsible Mining Practices
body: Harita Nickel, a sustainable integrated nickel mining and processing company, has voluntarily submitted itself to an audit process by the Initiative for Responsible Mining Assurance (IRMA), a global mining standard. The audit, which began in October last year, will assess the company's human rights, environmental, and social responsibilities, with results to be publicly released on the IRMA website.

title: Suryandaru Sell Transaction of PT Nanotech Indonesia Global Tbk
body: Suryandaru sold 16,200,200 shares of PT Nanotech Indonesia Global Tbk on 2025-02-03, reducing their holding from 16,200,200 shares to 0 shares, for personal needs.

title: Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko Buy Transaction of PT Logisticsplus International Tbk
body: Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko purchased 304,000,000 shares of PT Logisticsplus International Tbk on January 13, 2025, for a total amount of IDR 11,856,000,000,000, increasing their holding from 432,547,860 to 736,547,860 shares. The purpose of this transaction was strategic investment.

title: INV Management Pte. Ltd. Sell Transaction of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk.
body: INV Management Pte. Ltd. sold 1500000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk., decreasing its holding from 3007435597 to 3005935597 shares, for the purpose of 'other investments'.

title: Go Darmadi Sell Transaction of PT Soechi Lines Tbk.
body: Go Darmadi, an insider, sold 120,000,000 shares of PT Soechi Lines Tbk. at a price of 160, divesting their entire stake in the company, reducing their holding from 120,000,000 shares to 0 shares.

title: Dino Ahmad Ryandi Buy Transaction of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk
body: Dino Ahmad Ryandi acquired 15,000,000 shares of PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk, resulting in a total holding of 15,000,000 shares, for personal investment purposes.

title: Hasmoro Buy Transaction of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk.
body: Hasmoro, an insider, bought 787,000 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk. on 30 January 2025, increasing their holding from 725,249,889 to 726,036,889 shares, representing an investment purpose.

title: Barokah Melayu Foods Pte. Ltd. Buy Transaction of PT Champ Resto Indonesia Tbk
body: Barokah Melayu Foods Pte. Ltd. acquired 165,500,100 shares of PT Champ Resto Indonesia Tbk, increasing its stake to 1,085,500,100 shares. The transaction, categorized as a voluntary tender offer, was executed at a price of 1,025 per share, totaling 165,500,100,000.

title: Levoca Enterprise Ltd Sell Transaction of Bakrie & Brothers Tbk
body: Levoca Enterprise Ltd sold 5,195,000,000 shares of Bakrie & Brothers Tbk, reducing its holding from 50,642,237,270 to 45,447,237,270 shares.

title: Budi Gunawan Buy Transaction of PT Guna Timur Raya Tbk.
body: Budi Gunawan acquired 5,000,000 shares of PT Guna Timur Raya Tbk. at IDR 103 per share, increasing his stake to 10,340,000 shares. This investment brings his total ownership to 2.38% of the company.

title: Prajogo Pangestu Buy Transaction of Barito Pacific Tbk
body: Prajogo Pangestu bought 30,900,000 shares of Barito Pacific Tbk, increasing his holding from 66,854,606,765 to 66,885,506,765. The transaction was an investment, with a price of 923 per share. This buy transaction indicates Prajogo Pangestu's continued confidence in the company.

title: Hapsoro Sell Transaction of PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk.
body: Hapsoro sold 11,363,700 shares of PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk. at IDR 88 per share, reducing their holding from 375,974,800 to 329,145,700 shares.

title: Ditjen Minerba Holds Risk Management Training for 300 Employees
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources' Directorate General of Mineral and Coal (Ditjen Minerba) held a hybrid training session on risk management, attended by around 300 employees and inspectors from the mining industry. The session aimed to enhance employees' understanding of risk management to improve decision-making and business processes.

title: Fore Kopi Indonesia Becomes First Coffee Chain Startup to List on Indonesian Stock Exchange
body: PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk, a food and beverage company, has raised IDR 354.44 billion through its initial public offering, becoming the first coffee chain startup to list on the Indonesian Stock Exchange. As of September 30, 2024, the company had 217 outlets, with a focus on coffee shops.

title: Indonesia's Stock Exchange Announces Index Rebalancing with No Changes to LQ45
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange announced the results of its index evaluation, with no changes to the LQ45 index composition, which rose 1.10% to 750.02 on Friday, despite a 9.27% decline since the start of 2025.

title: Kopi Kenangan Changes Indonesia's Coffee Shop Business Landscape
body: Kopi Kenangan, a local Indonesian coffee brand, disrupts the dominance of foreign coffee shop brands in Indonesia, changing the business landscape since 2017. The brand's success marks a significant shift in the country's coffee shop industry.

title: Gold Price Drops at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang
body: The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) decreased by IDR 21,000 per gram, from IDR 1,986,000 per gram to IDR 1,965,000 per gram. The buyback price also dropped by IDR 21,000 per gram, from IDR 1,835,000 per gram to IDR 1,814,000 per gram.

title: Cinema XXI Expands its Network in Indonesia with Four New Locations
body: Cinema XXI (PT Nusantara Sejahtera Raya Tbk) has opened four new locations with 15 additional screens in Q1-2025, reaching a total of 1,365 screens across 260 locations in 66 cities and regencies in Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Closes in Green Zone with 0.99% Gain
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) ended the week with a 0.99% gain, closing at 6,678.92, with a weekly increase of 3.74%. Despite the index's growth, foreign investors still sold Rp 1.15 trillion worth of shares, albeit lower than the previous week.

title: Rupiah Closes Week with Slight Strengthening Against US Dollar
body: The Indonesian rupiah closed the week with a slight strengthening of 0.27% against the US dollar, driven by sentiment surrounding trade negotiations between Indonesia and the United States. The rupiah closed at Rp 16,829 per US dollar on Friday, up 0.26% from the previous day.

title: Prodia Widya Husada (PROD) Expands Production Capacity for Reagents Amidst Government's Free Health Check-Up Program
body: Prodia Widya Husada (PROD) is increasing its production capacity for reagents needed for health check-ups through its subsidiary, PT Prodia Diagnostic Line, as the government's free medical check-up program boosts demand. This move is expected to strengthen the company's position in the healthcare industry.

title: Indonesian Government Seeks to Attract Investment in Oil and Gas Sector
body: The Indonesian government is seeking to attract investment in the oil and gas sector, with the Indonesian Petroleum Association highlighting the country's potential with 65 unexplored sedimentary basins. The association also emphasized the need for a stable political climate, favorable fiscal policies, and economic viability to attract investors.

title: PT Hartadinata Abadi's President Director Adopts Cautious Investment Approach
body: Sandra Sunanto, President Director of PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HART), takes a contrarian approach to investing, focusing on stability, caution, and long-term value instead of high-risk, high-reward strategies. This approach is reflected in the company's investment portfolio.

title: Gold Price Hits Daily High of $3,425.3 per Ounce Before Correcting
body: The gold price reached a daily high of $3,425.3 per ounce on April 21, 2025, before correcting 1.38% to $3,298.3 on Friday, driven by profit-taking and risk sentiment in equity markets, according to Doo Financial Futures analyst Lukman Leong.

title: Kebijakan Tarif AS Dampak Pasar Saham dan Rupiah Indonesia
body: Kebijakan tarif resiprokal Presiden AS Donald Trump menyebabkan anjloknya pasar saham global, termasuk Indonesia, dengan indeks saham gabungan turun hingga 9% pada hari pertama pasc Liburan Lebaran. Nilai tukar rupiah juga melemah hingga level Rp 17.000 per dolar AS, meskipun Bank Indonesia melakukan intervensi untuk stabilisasi.

title: Rupiah Struggles to Gain Amidst US Dollar Volatility
body: The Indonesian rupiah has failed to capitalize on the weakened US dollar, with the exchange rate only rising 0.26% to Rp 16,829 per dollar on Friday, and declining 1.31% over the past month. The rupiah's struggles come amidst uncertainty surrounding US President Donald Trump's trade policies.

title: Indonesian Property Developers Must Prepare Strategies to Achieve Growth Amid Economic Challenges
body: Indonesian property developers must adopt various strategies to achieve growth this year, despite economic challenges such as weakened purchasing power, high interest rates, and the impact of high US tariffs. According to Bambang Ekajaya, Vice Chairman of Real Estate Indonesia, the growth of the property sector will be influenced by factors including the government's tax policies, lower interest rates for home loans, and the stability of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar.

title: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Announces Five Candidates for Director General of Oil and Gas
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced five candidates who have passed the administrative stage in the selection process for the Director General of Oil and Gas position, and will proceed to the next stages of the selection process, including interviews and assessments. The candidates will compete for the top position in the oil and gas sector.

title: Siloam International Hospitals Prepares for Full Implementation of Standard Inpatient Care Program
body: PT Siloam International Hospitals Tbk is preparing all its hospitals to fully implement the standard inpatient care program by June 30, 2025, to capture growth opportunities. The program aims to serve patients with national health insurance, or BPJS Kesehatan, and is part of the company's efforts to improve its performance.

title: Wealth Inequality in Indonesia Rises Sharply in Recent Years
body: According to the UBS Global Wealth Report 2024, Indonesia's wealth inequality ratio has increased significantly, with a Gini coefficient of 68 in 2023, up from 59 in 2008. The country's Gini coefficient reached 0.381 in September 2024, making it one of the countries with the highest wealth inequality.

title: Indonesia and US Make Progress in Trade Negotiations
body: Indonesia and the US have reached a milestone in their trade negotiations, with the two countries preparing to enter technical discussions. The Indonesian government has signed a non-disclosure agreement with the US Trade Representative, marking a significant step forward in the negotiations.

title: Indonesian Stock Index Surpasses 7,000 Level, Becomes One of ASEAN's Top Performers
body: The Indonesian Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) rose by 0.86% to reach 7,040.16, outperforming the VN-Index and Straits Times Index, which grew by 0.79% and 0.54% respectively. This milestone positions the IHSG among the top-performing stock indexes in ASEAN.

title: Indonesia Urged to Establish National Palm Oil Board to Improve Governance
body: Indonesia's Ombudsman recommends establishing a national palm oil board to improve governance in the industry, citing urgent need for improvement in upstream and downstream sectors. The Ombudsman has sent a formal letter to President Prabowo Subianto with five suggestions for improvement, including resolving overlapping conditions in oil palm plantation areas and improving regulations for palm oil mills.

title: Indonesian Forestry Task Force's Unilateral Actions May Worsen Investment Climate
body: The Indonesian Forestry Enforcement Task Force's confiscation of millions of hectares of oil palm plantations without dialogue and field verifications may worsen the country's investment climate and destabilize the country, according to a palm oil analyst from Bogor University Agriculture. The task force's actions may lead to conflicts, looting, and social unrest, ultimately affecting the economy, politics, and national security.

title: Indonesia's Mining Sector Urged to Adopt Sustainable Practices
body: The Indonesian government has urged the younger generation to become agents of change in achieving sustainable and environmentally-friendly mining practices, with the mining sector contributing significantly to the country's revenue, reaching IDR 140.46 trillion in 2024. Mind ID (MIND.ID) and the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources have partnered to promote sustainable mining practices.

title: Indonesia Reaffirms Commitment to Low Emission Energy through Clean Coal Technology
body: Indonesia has reiterated its commitment to transitioning to sustainable energy, with a focus on reducing carbon emissions, and has set a target of reaching net zero emissions by 2060, with clean coal technology playing a key role in achieving this goal. The country is projected to reach a peak of 270 million tons of coal by 2036, before gradually decreasing to 2060.

title: Indonesian Banks Show Resilience Amid Global Trade Tensions, Says S&P
body: Indonesian banks remain resilient to tariff-related disruptions due to their limited exposure to export-oriented companies at 2.5% and strong regulatory capital levels. While direct impacts from U.S. tariffs are minimal, S&P warns of indirect risks such as currency volatility and reduced household spending amid global trade uncertainty.

title: Palm Oil Producing Countries Defend Industry Against Bill Gates' Comments
body: The Council of Palm Oil Producing Countries has refuted Bill Gates' statement that palm oil is damaging to the environment, citing a lack of accurate data and highlighting the industry's sustainability certifications. The industry has seen a sharp decline in deforestation in Indonesia and Malaysia since 2017, with governments taking steps to ensure sustainable production.

title: Indonesian Banks See Growth in Digital Fee Income and Improved Asset Quality
body: Indonesian banks such as Bank Central Asia (BCA) and Bank Mandiri (BMRI) are reporting double-digit growth in digital fee income, with BCA having the lowest cost-to-income ratio and highest current account savings account ratio in the industry. Bank Mandiri has also seen improvements in its funding and asset quality, with the best asset quality amongst its peers.

title: Bank Negara Indonesia Sees 1% Year-on-Year Net Profit Increase in Q1 2025
body: Bank Negara Indonesia reported a 1% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR5.4 trillion in Q1 2025, driven by a 4.7% rise in net interest income, despite a 10.9% decline compared to Q4 2024. Operating expenses grew 4.3% year-on-year, while net interest margin declined 10 basis points due to lower loan yields, with loans growing 10% year-on-year but down 1.3% quarter-on-quarter.

title: Bank Central Asia Reports 9.8% Year-on-Year Increase in Net Profit in Q1
body: Bank Central Asia (not publicly traded) reported a net profit of $839.97m, driven by 12.6% year-on-year loan growth and a 20-basis point expansion, despite a 10bp increase in credit cost and non-performing loan ratio. The bank's net interest margin expanded 5.8% quarter-on-quarter, thanks to a higher current account savings account ratio and improvement in its loan-to-deposit ratio.

title: GS Supermarket to be Acquired by Local Company by May 2025
body: GS Supermarket, a South Korean retailer, will cease operations by May 31, 2025, and will be taken over by a local company, with the same product offerings but under a new brand. The new owner will continue to sell Korean products and daily necessities.

title: PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana (SSMS) Reports 23% Increase in Q1 2025 Profit
body: PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana (SSMS) reported a profit of IDR 352.37 billion in Q1 2025, a 23% increase from IDR 286.54 billion in Q1 2024. The company's revenue and profit also saw an increase, driven by its crude palm oil production.

title: Telkom Indonesia Sets New ESG Strategy to Achieve Zero Emissions by 2024
body: PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM) has set a new Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy, GoZero, aiming to achieve zero emissions by 2024 and become a sustainable business by 2030.

title: Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang Raises Gold Prices by IDR 23,000 per Gram
body: Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) has increased the price of certified gold bars by IDR 23,000 per gram, from IDR 1,871,000 per gram to IDR 1,894,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 23,000 per gram, from IDR 1,715,000 per gram to IDR 1,738,000 per gram.

title: Most Indonesian Stocks Miss Q1 2025 Earnings Estimates
body: Most Indonesian stocks failed to meet earnings estimates in Q1 2025, with financial and energy sectors reporting earnings per share (EPS) below analyst projections, while non-cyclical consumer goods, property, and raw materials sectors exceeded expectations.

title: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk to Hold Annual General Meeting of Shareholders
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) is set to hold its annual general meeting on May 28, where it will discuss the distribution of dividends from its 2024 fiscal year, which is expected to maintain a dividend payout ratio of over 60%. The company's dividend payout ratio has been consistently high, reaching 80% in 2024, up from 67.79% in 2022 and 70% in 2023.

title: Government to Provide Incentives for Coal Hilirisasi
body: The government plans to offer incentives to coal producers to support the hilirisasi agenda, including priority allocation of mining permits to state-owned and private companies. Additionally, changes to the use of areas and regions within established mining business permits are expected to facilitate this initiative.

title: Indonesian Rupiah Expected to Strengthen at Start of Week
body:
The Indonesian rupiah is projected to continue its strengthening trend at the start, with a 0.51% gain to IDR 16,445 per US dollar on Friday, amid a relatively positive global sentiment.

title: Thousands of Bank Accounts Used for Online Gambling and Criminal Activities in 2024
body: In 2024, tens of thousands of bank accounts were used for online gambling and criminal activities, including money laundering and drug trafficking. No specific financial metrics or company mentions were reported.

title: Indonesian Government Imposes Restrictions on Free Shipping, Stifling E-commerce Growth
body: The Indonesian government has introduced a policy limiting free shipping to a maximum of three days per month, aiming to promote healthy competition among e-commerce players and logistics companies, despite the absence of any issues with the free shipping program, which has boosted online sales and driven growth in the logistics industry, with the domestic logistics sector valued at IDR 1.358 trillion in 2024.

title: Pertamina NRE Eyes Areca Tree-Based Bioethanol Development
body: Pertamina NRE (PERTM) is exploring the potential of areca tree-based bioethanol development, with the company's CEO John Anis calling the tree a 'treasure' for Indonesia. Currently, Indonesia's bioethanol is sourced from sugarcane, cassava, corn, and sweet potatoes.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Closes in Green Zone, Eyes on China's Monetary Policy
body: The Jakarta Composite Index closed at 7,106.53, up 0.94% from the previous day, and is expected to focus on China's central bank's monetary policy on Monday, according to Edvisor Provina Visindo's investment analyst.

title: Foreign Capital Inflows Reach Rp 4.14 Trillion in Second Week of May 2025
body: Bank Indonesia reported that foreign capital inflows into the domestic financial market reached Rp 4.14 trillion in the second week of May 2025. Non-residents made net purchases of Rp 4.52 trillion in stocks and Rp 1.14 trillion in rupiah securities, while recording net sales of Rp 1.52 trillion in government bonds.

title: Indonesian Tobacco Targets 10% Sales Growth by 2025 Amid Economic Uncertainty
body: PT Indonesian Tobacco Tbk aims to increase sales by 10% by 2025 by expanding its domestic and export markets, with current sales dominated by the domestic market, accounting for almost 80% of its market share. The company plans to strengthen its position in the eastern region of Indonesia.

title: Majority of Investment Companies Report Negative Performance in Q1 2025
body: PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk (SRTG) reported a net investment loss of IDR 6.85 trillion in Q1 2025, up from IDR 2.3 trillion in Q1 2024. The majority of investment companies in Indonesia reported negative performance in Q1 2025.

title: Indonesia Considers Raising Tax-Free Income Threshold Amid Economic Pressure
body: The Indonesian government is considering raising the tax-free income threshold to boost consumer spending, as the country's middle class, the main driver of domestic consumption, is feeling the pinch of economic pressure. This move is expected to have a significant impact on the domestic economy, as a decline in their purchasing power would be felt widely.

title: BP Jamsostek to Have New Leader, Anggoro Eko Cahyo to Become PT Bank Syariah Indonesia's New Boss
body: Anggoro Eko Cahyo, the current Director of BP Jamsostek, will become the new boss of PT Bank Syariah Indonesia (BSI) following the annual shareholders meeting, leaving a vacancy at BP Jamsostek, which manages hundreds of trillions of public funds.

title: Indonesia Seeks New Export Markets Amid India-Pakistan Tensions
body: Indonesia, the world's largest producer of palm oil, is looking to open new export markets in Africa and East Asia to mitigate potential impacts from the India-Pakistan conflict, with India and Pakistan accounting for around 25% of Indonesia's total palm oil exports.

title: Bernardus Irmanto Appointed Acting CEO of PT Vale Indonesia Tbk
body: Bernardus Irmanto has been appointed acting CEO, replacing Febriany Eddy who resigned, with the appointment effective from April 24, 2025 until a definitive CEO is appointed, with the company ensuring that the appointment will not impact its operations, legality, financial condition or business continuity.

title: LG's Withdrawal from Titan May Delay Electric Vehicle Battery Production in Indonesia
body: LG's withdrawal from the Titan project may delay Indonesia's goal of becoming a key producer of electric vehicle batteries, with the project's cancellation expected to postpone production targets for nickel-based EV batteries. The withdrawal is reportedly influenced by external factors, including a global slowdown in EV sales and changes in LG's corporate strategy.

title: PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara (AMMAN) Pioneers Sustainable Mining and Innovation in Indonesia
body: PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara is advancing sustainable mining practices through cutting-edge technologies like 4D blasting and energy-efficient smelting, while prioritizing worker safety and environmental protection. The company aims to build a humane industrial future for Indonesia, emphasizing innovation and responsibility for future generations.

title: Indonesia's Credit Charge Card Payments Market to Reach $27.9B by 2025
body: Indonesia's credit charge card payments market is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 9.8% between 2025 and 2029, reaching $39.2 billion by 2029, driven by increased consumer spending and a rising preference for cashless transactions. The market saw a 7.8% rise in value in 2024, with the average credit or charge card being used 24.2 times, compared to just 3.9 times for debit cards.

title: Gudang Garam (GGRM) Injects IDR 1.5 Trillion into Subsidiary for Toll Road Project
body: PT Gudang Garam Tbk (GGRM) has injected IDR 1.5 trillion into its subsidiary, PT Surya Sapta Agung Tol, to support the construction of the Kediri-Tulungagung toll road project in East Java. The additional capital injection will help the subsidiary to complete the project.

title: TBS Energi Utama (TBS) Reduces Dependence on Fossil Energy Business by Selling Power Plant Shares
body: TBS Energi Utama (TBS) has sold its entire stake in PT Gorontalo Listrik Perdana, which operates the 2x50 megawatt Sulbagut-1 power plant, as part of its efforts to reduce dependence on fossil energy business. The sale is a significant step in TBS's strategy to shift towards cleaner energy sources.

title: Foreign Capital Inflow Returns to Emerging Markets, Including Indonesia
body: Foreign investors' capital inflow has returned to emerging markets, including Indonesia's stock market, with a net buy value of IDR 4.85 trillion in the past week, driving the Jakarta Composite Index to break through the 7,000 level and close at 7,141.09 on Monday.

title: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya to Open Over 1,000 New Stores by 2025
body: PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) aims to open over 1,000 new stores by 2025, with a focus on high-potential areas with lower operational costs. The company targets to open 1,200 new stores this year, comprising 1,000 Alfamart and 200 Alfamidi stores.

title: Bank Central Asia's Net Profit Grows 17.4% to IDR 20.2 Trillion
