```
body: Bank Central Asia's (BCA) net profit grew 17.4% year-over-year to IDR 20.2 trillion in January-April 2025, outpacing its 9.8% growth in the first three months. The bank's financial performance is expected to continue improving, signaling a positive trend in the banking sector amidst economic uncertainty.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Reaches 7,000 Level, Foreign Investors' Net Buy Reaches IDR 5.42 Trillion
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) has finally breached the 7,000 psychological level, driven by foreign investors' consistent buying activities, with a total net foreign buy of IDR 5.42 trillion from May 14 to 19, 2025. However, foreign investors may be deterred by the country's capital inflow restrictions, including the unusual market activity (UMA) mechanism, which may lead to a decrease in foreign capital inflows.

title: Indonesian Railway Company Acquires 54 Locomotives from US-based Progress Rail
body: PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has acquired 54 CC 205 locomotives from Progress Rail, Alabama, USA, with a total investment of $222.5 million or IDR 3.56 trillion. The new locomotives are expected to strengthen Indonesia's rail transportation of coal and other commodities.

title: PT Pertamina Hulu Energi (PHE) Issues $1 Billion Five-Year Global Bond with 5.25% Coupon Rate
body: PT Pertamina Hulu Energi (PHE) has issued its first global bond of $1 billion with a 5.25% coupon rate, rated Baa2 by Moody’s and BBB by Fitch. The company commits to responsible operations, emphasizing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) aspects.

title: Muhammadiyah Denies Plan to Acquire BTN Syariah
body: Muhammadiyah has denied plans to acquire BTN Syariah, a sharia-compliant bank, and instead will focus on strengthening its own sharia-based banking network.

title: Indonesian Government Raises Crude Palm Oil Export Tariff to 10%
body: The Indonesian government has increased the export tariff of crude palm oil (CPO) from 7.5% to 10% starting May 17, 2025, which may harm the competitiveness of local palm oil products in the global market.

title: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk to Distribute Cash Dividend to Shareholders
body:
PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKD) has received shareholder approval to distribute a cash dividend, following an annual general meeting of shareholders held on May 15, 2025, having recorded marketing sales of Rp 466 billion in Q1 2025
}
```

Let me know if you have any further questions!

title: Indonesia's Tin Smelting Project Faces Obstacles
body: Indonesia's tin smelting project, a key government program, faces challenges, with only three units currently operating. The project's progress is hindered by various obstacles, affecting the country's economy and investment.

title: PT Harum Energy (HRUM) Posts Strong Q1 2025 Financial Results
body: PT Harum Energy Tbk (HRUM) reported a revenue of US$298.94 million in Q1 2025, up 12.40% year-over-year, primarily driven by coal exports. However, coal export realization dropped 27.63% to US$112.24 million compared to the previous year.

title: Indonesian CPO Producers Face Increased Export Tariffs Amid Global Price Challenges
body: The Indonesian government has raised the export tariff for palm oil products from 7.5% to 10%, effective May 17, 2025, as per Minister of Finance Regulation No. 30/2025. This adds to the burdens of domestic CPO producers already coping with stagnant global prices.

title: PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk Remains Optimistic About Business Growth Amidst Slowing Consumer Spending
body: Despite expecting stagnant consumer spending in Q2-2025, PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ASPI) remains optimistic about its business growth, citing potential slowdown in consumption due to a shift in momentum towards the first quarter, unlike last year's high consumption in Q2-2024.

title: New Foreign Exchange Reserve Regulation Boosts Banking Sector Growth
body: A new regulation requiring companies to hold foreign exchange reserves from natural resource exports for 12 months starting March 1, 2025, has positively impacted the banking sector by accelerating growth in foreign exchange deposits. This policy has led to increased banking activity and economic benefits.

title: Indonesian Inflation Rate Sees Sharp Fluctuation in Q1 2025
body: Indonesia's inflation rate in Q1 2025 saw a sharp fluctuation, with a drastic jump from 0.76% to 1.95% year-on-year, driven by seasonal factors and global supply chain disruptions. The inflation rate was also influenced by the depreciation of the Rupiah and increased demand for food, beverages, and tobacco ahead of Ramadan and Idul Fitri.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Rises 0.86% Since Year Start
body: The Jakarta stock index has risen 0.86% since the start of the year, with a five-day consecutive gain as of Monday. The index has been trending upward since the end of last week.

title: MUFG to Merge Two Indonesian Lending Subsidiaries, Strengthening Market Position
body: MUFG is merging PT Adira Dinamika Multi Finance Tbk (ADMF) with PT Mandala Multifinance Tbk (MFIN), with ADMF as the surviving entity. The merger aims to strengthen ADMF's position as a market leader in Indonesia's multifinance sector.

title: Gold Mining Companies Benefit from Rising Gold Prices, Increase Revenue
body: Several gold mining companies, including PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) and PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN), are taking advantage of the gold price rally to increase revenue this year, with MDKA planning to record gold production of 100,000-110,000 ounces at a cash cost of USD 1,100-1,200 per ounce.

title: Fitch: Indonesian Banks Can Manage Weakening Rupiah
body: Indonesian banks have limited direct exposure to currency movements, with any impact likely to be felt through potential strains on borrowers, according to Fitch Ratings. The rupiah has depreciated around 4% since the start of the year, and banks' fx loans and deposits are relatively well-matched, minimizing the risk of widespread borrower distress.

title: Harga Emas Batangan Bersertifikat di PT Aneka Tambang Naik Rp 23.000 per Gram
body: PT Aneka Tambang (Antam) meningkatkan harga emas batangan bersertifikat sebesar Rp 23.000 per gram, dari Rp 1.871.000 menjadi Rp 1.894.000 per gram. Harga buyback juga naik Rp 23.000 per gram, dari Rp 1.715.000 menjadi Rp 1.738.000 per gram.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Declines 0.65% Amid Foreign Fund Outflows
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) dropped 0.65% to 7,094.6, with foreign investors selling Rp 406.19 billion in stocks. Analyst Alrich Paskalis from Phintraco Sekuritas noted the index had technically corrected after reaching above 7,200 due to overbought conditions.

title: PT Widodo Makmur Unggas Tbk Completes Debt Payment Obligation
body: PT Widodo Makmur Unggas Tbk (WMUU) has completed its debt payment obligation, with the company committing to fulfill all obligations according to the settlement agreement. In Q1 2025, WMUU reported a significant growth in net sales of IDR 140.27 billion, a 155.96% YoY increase, and a net loss of IDR 13.18 billion, an improvement from IDR 22.71 billion in Q1 2024.

title: Medco Energi (MEDC) Accelerates Transition to Green Energy
body: Medco Energi has made significant progress in its transition, with the Ijen geothermal power plant already operational and a solar power plant in Bali expected to begin production by the end of 2025, with a long-term goal of increasing its green energy capacity.

title: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi to Conduct 1:10 Stock Split, Reducing Nominal Value
body: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (PETRINDO) will conduct a 1:10 stock split, reducing the nominal value from IDR 200 to IDR 20 per share. The total number of shares will increase from 11.24 billion to 112.42 billion shares.

title: Indonesian Coconut Farmers Support Government's Export Levy Plan
body: The Indonesian Coconut Farmers Association supports the government's plan to impose an export levy on semi-husked coconut, but requests that the levy not exceed 5% and that the government sets a purchase price of Rp 5,000 per kg for farmers, ensuring that the industry absorbs all harvest results from farmers.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Against US Dollar Amid Weakened Greenback
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.12% to IDR 16,413 per dollar, and 0.30% to IDR 16,406 per dollar, according to Bloomberg and Bank Indonesia data. The rupiah's gain comes amid a weakened US dollar.

title: Haloni Jane Tbk Optimistic about 2025 Performance after Strong Q1 Results
body: Haloni Jane Tbk (HALO) reported a 67.24% year-on-year increase in sales to IDR 51.11 billion in Q1 2025, compared to IDR 30.56 billion in Q1 2024. The company is optimistic about its performance in 2025.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Weakens After Five-Day Rally
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 7,094.60, down 46.48 points or 0.65% on Tuesday, despite gaining 3.83% over the past week. The index's performance reflected mixed market sentiments amid its recent upward trend.

title: Indonesian Government Expects Weaker Rupiah in 2026
body: The Indonesian government has assumed a weaker rupiah exchange rate of IDR 16,500-16,900 per US dollar in 2026, which may impact importers, exporters, and individuals with foreign exchange needs.

title: Indonesia Aims to Achieve Energy Self-Sufficiency with Government Accelerating Energy Downstreaming
body: President Prabowo Subianto is pushing for Indonesia to achieve energy independence, with the Energy and Mineral Resources Minister discussing plans to accelerate energy downstreaming with the President. The government aims to start projects that can be groundbreaking, with a focus on lifting oil and gas production within the country.

title: Jakarta's Composite Stock Price Index Falls 0.65%
body: Jakarta's composite stock price index fell 0.65% to 7,094, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 405.31 billion, amid anticipation of Bank Indonesia's policy meeting results. Analysts provided stock recommendations for the day.

title: 25 Oil and Gas Companies to Invest in Indonesia's Upstream Sector
body: Twenty-five oil and gas companies, both large and medium-sized, are set to invest in Indonesia's upstream oil and gas sector, with a focus on exploration activities. No specific financial metrics or company names are mentioned in the article.

title: PT Multi Bintang Indonesia to Distribute Final 2024 Dividend
body: PT Multi Bintang Indonesia Tbk (MLBI) has received approval from its annual general meeting of shareholders to distribute its final 2024 dividend. The decision was made on May 16, 2025.

title: PT United Tractors Injects IDR 500 Billion into Subsidiary PT Acset Indonusa
body: PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR) has injected IDR 500 billion into its subsidiary, PT Acset Indonusa Tbk, through a private placement. This move aims to increase the company's capital without giving priority to existing shareholders.

title: PT Nusantara Infrastructure Targets Significant Growth in Toll Road Business
body: PT Nusantara Infrastructure (TICKER) targets a 5% increase in average daily traffic on its toll roads, reaching 228,000 vehicles per day by 2025. This growth is driven by its aim to achieve significant business performance growth this year.

title: PT Jasa Marga's Stock Price Drops 4.08% After Ex-Dividend Period
body: PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) stock price closed at IDR 4,000, down 4.08% from the previous day, after entering the ex-dividend period. The stock price fell to the red zone on Tuesday, following the ex-dividend period on Monday.

title: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk's Financial Position Expected to Remain Solid
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) is expected to post a strong operational recovery in Q1 2025, driven by a strong trend in gold prices and high nickel ore sales targets. The company's annual gold and nickel ore sales are also expected to surge.

title: Indonesian Competition Commission Investigates Fintech Lending Interest Rate Cartel Allegations
body: The Komisi Pengawas Persaingan Usaha is investigating suspected cartel practices in fintech lending interest rates, while the OJK views current rate settings as consumer protection measures. Prior to OJK Regulation No. 19/2023, consumers faced higher interest rates.

title: Indonesian Mortgage Credit Growth Slows Amid Economic Pressure
body: The outstanding mortgage credit of Indonesian banks grew 8.9% year-on-year to IDR 800.8 trillion in March 2025, slowing down from 10.7% growth in the previous month, according to Bank Indonesia data. The slowdown is attributed to domestic economic pressure.

title: PT Freeport Indonesia Prepares to Apply for Mining Permit Extension This Year
body: PT Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) is preparing to apply for an extension of its special mining business permit, with its current concession set to expire in 2041. Parent company Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX) stated it will meet all Indonesian government requirements, including a 10% ownership transfer to PT Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID), while the extension process remains in finalization.

title: IDX30 Stocks Become IHSG's Driving Force
body: The IDX30 index, comprising mostly blue-chip stocks, has been driving the IHSG (Indonesia Stock Exchange) lately, with Kiwoom Sekuritas expecting further upside. The index is seen as an 'executive train' that attracts foreign investors, with a majority of its constituent stocks being blue chips.

title: Indonesia Hosts ASEAN Post-2025 Energy Consultation Workshop
body: The Indonesian government, through the Directorate General of Minerals and Coal, welcomed representatives from ASEAN member states and Timor-Leste for the ASEAN Plan of Action for Energy Cooperation Post-2025 consultation workshop. The workshop aims to strengthen regional energy cooperation and discuss the proposed name change from 'Coal Clean Coal Technology' to 'Coal Carbon Management'.

title: Gold Prices Rise at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang
body: The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by IDR 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,923,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,766,000 per gram.

title: Bank Indonesia Predicts Retail Sales Decline, Retailers to Focus on Cost Cutting
body: Bank Indonesia's prediction of a retail sales decline in April 2025 has prompted retailers like PT Asosiasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ASOS) to focus on cost efficiency and productivity improvement. This move is expected to help retailers mitigate the impact of the predicted sales decline.

title: PT Austindo Nusantara Jaya Obtains IDR 3.6 Trillion Loan Facility from Multiple Banks
body: PT Austindo Nusantara Jaya Tbk has secured a loan facility worth IDR 3.6 trillion from several banks, including PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA), with a interest rate of 7% per annum and a maturity date of August 12, 2026. The loan facility is divided into two parts, with IDR 1.6 trillion from BCA and the remaining IDR 2 trillion from other banks.

title: Astra International (ASII) Posts Mixed Q1 2025 Results Amidst Challenges
body: Astra International (ASII) reported a 2.64% year-over-year revenue growth to Rp 83.36 trillion in Q1 2025, despite facing headwinds from declining coal prices and weaker domestic automotive demand. However, the company's net profit declined by 7.12% year-over-year to Rp 6.93 trillion during the same period.

title: Indonesia's Economic Growth Slows Down with Lowest Credit Growth Rate
body: Bank Indonesia has revised its 2025 credit growth target to a maximum of 11%, citing the lowest annual credit growth rate of 8.88% in April. The government is urged to support monetary policy relaxation with increased spending to boost economic growth.

title: BYD (BYD) Naik Daun, Masuk 10 Pabrikan Otomotif Terlaris di 2025
body: BYD (BYD) menjadi salah satu pabrikan otomotif terlaris di Indonesia, mencatatkan penjualan wholesale 3.486 unit dan retail 3.531 unit di April. Data dari GAIKINDO menempatkan BYD dalam jajaran 10 pabrikan otomotif terlaris pada 2025.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Rises 0.67% After Central Bank Cuts Interest Rate
body: The Jakarta stock index increased by 47.85 points or 0.67% to 7,142.46 after Bank Indonesia cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.5%. Analysts have recommended shares of Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) with a target price of Rp 2,750.

title: Kementerian ESDM Akan Tarik Blok Migas yang Belum Berproduksi
body: Kementerian Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) akan menarik 10 wilayah kerja minyak dan gas bumi yang belum berproduksi meskipun sudah mendapat persetujuan rencana pengembangan. Menteri ESDM Bahlil Lahadalia menyampaikan hal ini dalam acara IPA Convex 2025 di hadapan Presiden Prabowo Subianto.

title: Indonesia Sees 26,455 Cases of Layoffs, Up 5,000 from Last Year
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Manpower reports 26,455 cases of layoffs as of May 20, 2025, a significant increase of around 5,000 workers from last year. The data highlights the country's ongoing labor market challenges.

title: PT Cikarang Listrindo Tbk to Distribute $43.93 Million in Final Dividend for 2024
body: PT Cikarang Listrindo Tbk (CKLT) has announced a final dividend of $43.93 million for 2024, which has been approved at the company's annual general meeting of shareholders. The distribution is part of the company's efforts to provide returns to its shareholders.

title: Sritex Commissioner Arrested Amid Unresolved Delisting Issue
body: Iwan Setiawan Lukminto, Commissioner of PT Sri Rejeki Isman TBK (Sritex), was arrested on Tuesday night due to his alleged involvement in a credit scam worth IDR 3.6 trillion from several banks. This development adds to the company's woes, which include an unresolved delisting issue with the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: Indonesian Bank Credit Growth Slows Down to 8.88% in April 2025
body: Bank Indonesia reported that outstanding bank credit grew 8.88% year-on-year, the lowest growth rate since September 2023, mainly due to slowing consumption and working capital credit. This indicates weakening purchasing power amid economic uncertainty.

title: Indonesian Government to Increase Cigarette Excise Tariff in 2026
body: The Indonesian government plans to increase the cigarette excise tariff in 2026 to boost revenue, with a focus on four pillars: consumption, state revenue, worker sustainability, and cigarette control. The move is part of the government's efforts to increase revenue in 2026.

title: Bank Indonesia Cuts Interest Rate, Boosts Stock Market
body: Bank Indonesia lowered its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points, sparking a 0.67% increase in the stock market index to 7,142.46. Sensitive issuers such as banks and property companies gained from the rate cut.

title: Indonesia's Reference Coal Price Drops 8.89% to $110.38/ton in Second Half of May 2025
body: Indonesia's reference coal price for the second half of May 2025 fell to $110.38/ton, down 8.89% from the previous period. The price is also 3.23% lower compared to the same period in 2024.

title: Gold Prices Rise at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang
body: Gold prices at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by IDR 20,000 per gram, from IDR 1,910,000 to IDR 1,930,000, while buyback prices also rose by IDR 20,000 per gram, from IDR 1,754,000 to IDR 1,774,000.

title: PT Bank JTrust Indonesia Tbk (JTRI) Faces Share Suspension Over Free Float Requirement
body: PT Bank JTrust Indonesia Tbk (JTRI) has had its shares suspended since early 2025 for not meeting Bursa Efek Indonesia's 7.5% free float requirement. As of April 30, 2025, the bank's free float was approximately 6.17%, below the required threshold.

title: Banks Partner with Fintech Lenders to Sustain Credit Growth Amid Slower Demand
body: Banks are collaborating with fintech lending platforms to maintain credit growth as demand slows. Bank-disbursed funds to fintech lenders reached Rp 49.4 trillion as of February 2025, representing 61.69% of total fintech lending funding.

title: PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) Reports Strong Q1 2025 Performance
body: PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) saw a 45.82% year-over-year increase in net profit to IDR 149.75 billion in 2025, driven by a 68.97% year-over-year surge in sales to IDR 6.79 trillion.

title: Industri Urun Dana atau Securities Crowdfunding Catat Pertumbuhan Dana Hingga 126,50% di Q1-2025
body: Total dana yang dihimpun industri urun dana atau securities crowdfunding mencapai Rp 145,70 miliar pada kuartal I-2025, meningkat 126,50% dibandingkan periode sama tahun lalu. Pertumbuhan ini didorong oleh peningkatan jumlah penerbit dan investor yang memperluas basis proyek dan pendanaan.

title: UnitLink Insurance Premium Contribution Continues to Decline in Indonesia
body: In Q1 2023, unit-linked insurance premiums contributed only 23.23% to total premiums, with a value of around IDR 10.96 trillion, as per data from the Financial Services Authority. Meanwhile, total life insurance premiums reached IDR 47.19 trillion, up 3.08% year-on-year.

title: Sritex Faces Corruption Investigation Over State Bank Loans
body: PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (Sritex) is under investigation by the Attorney General's Office for alleged corruption related to loans totaling Rp 3.59 trillion from four state-owned banks, adding to the challenges faced by its creditors already dealing with the bankruptcy process.

title: Gold Price Drops at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang
body: The gold price at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) decreased by Rp 13.000 per gram, from Rp 1.923.000 per gram to Rp 1.910.000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 12.000 per gram, from Rp 1.766.000 per gram to Rp 1.754.000 per gram.

title: Indonesian Government Sets Moderate Revenue Target for 2026
body: The Indonesian government has set a moderate revenue target of 11.71%-12.22% of GDP for 2026, lower than the 12.36% target in 2025. The revenue target is outlined in the 2026 macroeconomic framework and fiscal policy document.

title: Indonesia and Saudi Arabia to Cooperate on Critical Mineral Commodities
body: Indonesia's Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, is targeting several critical mineral commodities to be included in the scope of investment cooperation between Indonesia and Saudi Arabia, which has just entered the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding. The cooperation opportunities include investments in critical mineral commodities including nickel, bauxite, and manganese.

title: Adaro Energy's Financial Report Shows Net Profit of $1.64 Billion in 2023
body: Adaro Energy (ADRO) reported a net profit of $1.64 billion in 2023, with a target to complete the second phase of its smelter project by Q4 2026, adding 500,000 tons of aluminum production capacity. The company aims to fully operate the smelter by Q4 2029, with an additional 500,000 tons of aluminum production.

title: Pensiunan Menghadapi Krisis Keuangan Akibat Pinjaman Online yang Macet
body: Outstanding kredit macet dari pinjaman online peer-to-peer lending meningkat 14,8% menjadi Rp 2,01 triliun hingga Desember 2024. Banyak pensiunan yang terjebak dalam krisis keuangan akibat pinjaman yang tidak terbayar.

title: Indonesia's Stock Exchange Struggles to Improve Quality Despite Increase in Listed Companies
body: Despite a significant increase in the number of companies on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX), the country's stock market continues to decline in global indices, with its weight in the MSCI Asia ex-Japan index falling from 5% in 2010 to 1% in 2025. The IDX is now actively seeking to list large companies, including conglomerates such as Wings and ABC, to improve the quality of its listings.

title: Indonesia's Government Budget Returns to Surplus in April 2025
body: Indonesia's government budget surplus reached IDR 4.3 trillion in April 2025, after three consecutive months of deficit, with state revenue and expenditure reaching IDR 810.5 trillion and IDR 806.2 trillion, respectively, indicating a positive signal for domestic economic improvement amidst global pressure.

title: PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk Lists on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk, a telecommunications infrastructure service provider, listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on July 24, 2023, focusing on the business-to-business segment with most of its partners being internet service providers.

title: PT Vale Indonesia to Distribute $34.65 Million in Final Dividends
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (Vale) will pay out $34.65 million in final dividends, equivalent to 60% of its 2024 net income of $57.76 million, following shareholder approval at the annual general meeting of shareholders.

title: Indonesian Rupiah Strengthens for Five Consecutive Days
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.67% to RP 16,217 per US dollar on Friday, marking its fifth consecutive day of gains. The currency also rose 0.15% to RP 16,289 on the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate.

title: Indonesia Urged to Accelerate State Spending to Boost Economic Growth
body: The Indonesian government is urged to accelerate state spending to stimulate economic growth, with realizations reaching Rp 806.2 trillion by April, down 5.06% year-on-year. Deputy Minister of Finance Suahasil Nazara noted the decrease is partly due to the absence of 2024's special election-related expenditures.

title: Certified Gold Prices Drop by Rp 11,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: Prices of certified gold bars in Indonesia have decreased by Rp 11,000 per gram, with Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) now selling at Rp 1,919,000 per gram. The buyback price has also dropped by Rp 11,000 per gram to Rp 1,763,000 per gram.

title: Retail Companies Expand Aggressively with Increased Capital Expenditure
body: Retail issuers are aggressively expanding their operations, primarily using capital expenditure to open new stores. PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (TICKER) has allocated between Rp 4.5 trillion and Rp 5 trillion to add 1,000 new outlets.

title: Indonesian Democracy Faces Setbacks Amid Military Involvement in Civilian Affairs
body: Indonesia's 27-year reform journey has been marked by concerns over democracy, with 68.6% of respondents fearing potential conflicts of interest when military personnel enter civilian institutions. The recent appointment of Djaka Budhi Utama as Director-General of Customs and Excise has sparked concerns over the military's increasing influence in politics.

title: FTSE Russell Adds Two Indonesian Stocks to Global Equity Index Series
body: PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk (AADI) and PT Daaz Bara Lestari Tbk (DAAZ) will be included in the FTSE Global Equity Index Series effective June 23, 2025, with AADI classified as small-cap and DAAZ as micro-cap.

title: Jakarta's Composite Stock Price Index May Strengthen This Week
body: The Indonesian stock market is expected to see limited strengthening this week, driven by foreign capital inflows and a predicted strengthening of the Rupiah against the US dollar, according to analyst Herditya Wicaksana of MNC Sekuritas (MNCN).

title: Jakarta Stock Exchange Defies 'Sell in May' Trend with 6.61% Increase in May
body: The Jakarta stock exchange saw a 6.61% rise in May, defying the historical 'Sell in May' trend, as foreign funds returned and boosted the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) to 7,214.16. This performance marked a reversal from the typical weakness observed in May over the past decade.

title: Indonesian Rupiah Strengthens Against US Dollar
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.67% to IDR 16,217 per dollar on Friday, and is expected to continue its upward trend on Monday. The rupiah's strength is attributed to the continued pressure on the US dollar, with the currency strengthening 0.15% to IDR 16,289 on the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) on Friday.

title: PT Bundamedik Tbk Launches Homecare Service for Patients
body: PT Bundamedik Tbk (BMHS) has launched a homecare service, Bunda Homecare, allowing patients to receive vaccinations and health checks at home, with plans to open new clinics and strengthen its partnership with BPJS Kesehatan.

title: Indonesia's Livestock Demand for Eid al-Adha Expected to Increase by 1.98%
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Agriculture has predicted a 1.98% increase in livestock demand for Eid al-Adha this year, with national demand expected to rise compared to 2024. No specific company mentions were made in the article.

title: Indonesia's Central Bank Cuts Interest Rate, Boosts Property Stocks
body: Bank Indonesia's 25-basis-point interest rate cut to 5.50% has positively impacted property stocks, but analysts from BRI Danareksa Sekuritas predict the direct impact on the sector's performance until 2025 may not be significant. The analysts expect a re-rating of property stocks leading up to and during the interest rate cut.

title: Gold Prices at PT Aneka Tambang Increase by IDR 4,000 per Gram
body: The price of certified gold bars at PT Aneka Tambang (ANTAM) increased by IDR 4,000 per gram to IDR 1,923,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 4,000 per gram to IDR 1,767,000 per gram.

title: Garuda Indonesia's Pilots Association Raises Concerns Over Management Practices
body: The pilots association of Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) has raised concerns over the airline's recruitment practices, unilateral termination of union fees, and alleged criminalization of union officials. The association has also complained about restrictions on freedom of expression and other management issues.

title: Indonesian Furniture and Crafts Exports Show Strong Growth in Q1-2025
body: Indonesia's furniture and crafts exports reached $644.83 million in Q1-2025, with total 2024 exports amounting to $2.6 billion, reflecting strong global demand. The Indonesian Furniture and Crafts Industry Association (HIMKI) remains optimistic about future growth potential.

title: PT Bakrie & Brothers Tbk Divests Shares in PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk
body: PT Bakrie & Brothers Tbk (BNBR) divested 1.792 billion shares, equivalent to 4.10% ownership stake, in PT VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas Tbk on May 22, 2025. The transaction marks a significant shift in the company's ownership structure.

title: 96.7% of Jakarta Hotels Report Occupancy Decline, 70% Consider Layoffs Amid Weak Demand
body: A recent survey by the Jakarta chapter of the Indonesian Hotel and Restaurant Association found that 96.7% of hotels reported a decline in Q1-2025, and 70% of respondents consider layoffs if the weak demand continues without supporting policies.

title: Indonesian Government Expects Investment Opportunities of IDR 2.967 Trillion in Electricity Sector
body: The Indonesian government expects investment opportunities of IDR 2.967 trillion in the electricity sector from 2025 to 2034, with IDR 2.133 trillion allocated for power generation, and IDR 1.566 trillion for independent power producers.

title: PT Lovina Beach Brewery Targets Positive Performance Growth with Expansion Plans
body: PT Lovina Beach Brewery Tbk aims to achieve positive performance growth through diversification of products to reach a wider market, with a optimistic outlook for 2025 driven by stable economic growth, increased purchasing power, and tourism sector development.

title: Indonesian Government Targets Formation of 80,000 Village Cooperatives by End of June
body: The Indonesian government aims to establish 80,000 village cooperatives by the end of June, with all cooperatives expected to launch simultaneously on July 12, 2025, coinciding with National Cooperative Day. The target was announced by Minister of Cooperatives Budi Arie Setiadi.

title: Indonesian Government to Auction 10 Geothermal Areas, Benefiting Renewable Energy Developers
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is set to auction 10 geothermal working areas and 11 preliminary survey and exploration areas this year, which is expected to benefit local renewable energy developers. The auction process will be conducted through the Genesis platform.

title: Indonesia's Banking Sector Shows Resilience with Moderate NPL Increase
body: The Indonesian banking industry maintained overall stable asset quality, with the non-performing loan (NPL) ratio rising slightly to 2.17% in March 2025 from 2.08% in December 2024. However, some banks reported higher NPL levels, exceeding 5%, while the loan at risk ratio increased to 9.86% from 9.28% in the previous quarter.

title: Bank Indonesia Eases Liquidity Rules to Support Banking Sector Growth
body: Bank Indonesia reduced the macroprudential liquidity buffer ratio for conventional banks from 5% to 4% and for Islamic banks from 3.5% to 2.5%, aiming to boost credit growth, which slowed to an 8.88% annual increase as of April 2025. This policy allows banks to reduce their holdings of government securities to increase liquidity and support lending activities.

title: Informasi insider trading PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra dalam PT Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia Tbk
body: PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, a major shareholder, acquired 1,891,500 shares of PT Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia Tbk (ISSP.JK) at IDR 294 per share, increasing its stake from 40.44% to 40.46% for investment purposes.

title: Indonesia Energy & Engineering Series 2025 to Feature Battery Show Indonesia
body: The Indonesia Energy & Engineering Series 2025 is set to feature the Battery Show Indonesia, a business-to-business exhibition that will bring together professionals, innovators, and industry players in the battery and electric vehicle sector. The event is expected to attract global companies, including Everexceed International Company Limited (Everexceed) and PT Rolls-Royce Solutions Indonesia, and is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of over 5.6% from 2023 to 2028.

title: PT United Tractors Tbk Obtains Renewable Energy Certificate from PLN
body: PT United Tractors Tbk (UT) has obtained a Renewable Energy Certificate from PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN), reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 12,596 tons of CO2eq. The certificate covers 28 operational locations, including the head office, branches, and sites across Indonesia.

title: PT Kalimantan Prima Persada Wins Indonesia Green Awards 2025 for Conservation Efforts
body: PT Kalimantan Prima Persada, a subsidiary of PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR), has received the Indonesia Green Awards 2025 for its efforts in developing eco-tourism in Sirang Pitu, Tapin Regency. The award recognizes the company's initiatives in improving environmental services, providing supporting facilities, and training local communities to manage and utilize natural tourism potential sustainably.

title: Indonesia Pushes for Nickel Industry Development to Boost Economic Growth
body: The Indonesian government is promoting the development of nickel-based industries, including electric vehicle batteries, to increase the country's economic value and become a major player in the global market, with a projected demand of 108.2 GWh of batteries by 2030.

title: PT Gaya Makmur Tractors Launches Three New Heavy Equipment Products from China
body: PT Gaya Makmur Tractors, a leading heavy equipment distributor in Indonesia, has launched three new products from China, including excavators and bulldozers, targeting the construction, mining, and plantation sectors.

title: Bank Indonesia and Banque de France Strengthen Bilateral Cooperation in Central Banking
body: Bank Indonesia and Banque de France have signed a memorandum of understanding to strengthen bilateral cooperation in central banking, digital innovation, sustainable finance, and regulatory frameworks, with a focus on anti-money laundering and combating terrorism financing. The cooperation will be implemented through policy dialogues, joint studies, capacity-building programs, and data information exchange.

title: Indonesia and China Sign MoU to Promote Bilateral Transactions in Local Currencies
body: Indonesia and China have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to establish a framework for promoting bilateral transactions in local currencies, expanding the scope of their earlier agreement. The MoU was signed by the governors of Bank Indonesia and the People's Bank of China, with the Chinese Premier and Indonesian President present at the event.

title: Moody's Expects Lembaga Pembiayaan Ekspor Indonesia's Capitalization to Remain Robust
body: Lembaga Pembiayaan Ekspor Indonesia (EXIMBKPI) is expected to maintain its robust capitalization, with a 32.9% in March 2025, following a IDR5T capital infusion from the government. However, its high stock of problem loans will continue to weigh on its net interest margin, with a modest return on assets expected over the next 12-18 months.

title: PT Bumi Resources Tbk Obtains Approval for Quasi-Reorganization
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) has obtained permission to reorganize its financial balance sheet, allowing it to show a profit without being burdened by past deficits. The company received approval at its annual general meeting of shareholders and extraordinary general meeting of shareholders on Monday.

title: Indonesian Government Cancels PLN Tariff Discount, Increases Subsidy Allocation Instead
body: The Indonesian government has cancelled the planned discount on PLN tariffs, instead increasing the allocation for wage subsidies from IDR 150,000 to IDR 300,000 per month. The government had previously announced plans to provide economic stimulus, including a discount on PLN tariffs.

title: Medco Energi Internasional Tbk to Distribute $63.29 Million in Dividends
body: PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has received approval from its Annual General Meeting of Shareholders to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year, totaling $63.29 million. The company will proceed with the dividend distribution to its shareholders.

title: Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund to Invest $5 Billion by 2025
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, the sovereign wealth fund of Indonesia, plans to invest $5 billion by 2025, focusing on themes such as hilirisasi, food security, energy security, manufacturing, and renewable energy. The fund's Managing Director, Danantara Arief Budiman, announced the investment target.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls 0.28% on Tuesday
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed 0.28% lower at 7,044.82 on Tuesday, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 736.24 billion. Analysts recommend Golden Energy Mines (GEM) at IDR 9,375.

title: Asian Currencies Sensitive to US Tariff Policy and Geopolitical Tensions
body: Most Asian currencies weakened against the US dollar, with only the Japanese yen, Thai baht, and Chinese yuan strengthening in the past week, according to Bloomberg data. The currencies are sensitive to US President Donald Trump's tariff policy and geopolitical tensions.

title: Indonesian Tire Industry Predicts Production and Sales Growth Amid Economic Pressures
body: The Indonesian tire industry is expected to see growth in production and sales volumes, according to the Indonesian Tire Association and the Indonesian Rubber Council, despite concerns over weakening consumer purchasing power amid economic pressures.

title: PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk Approves $136.4 Million Dividend Payout
body: PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGEOTH) has approved a dividend payout of $136.4 million from its 2024 net profit of $160.3 million, with the remaining $24 million retained as earnings. The company's annual general meeting of shareholders was held on Tuesday.

title: Adaro Minerals Indonesia to Distribute $120 Million in Dividends
body: PT Adaro Minerals Indonesia Tbk (ADMR) will distribute $120 million, or approximately IDR 1.95 trillion, in dividends, marking its first dividend payout since its initial public offering in January 2022). The dividend distribution has received approval from the company's annual general meeting of shareholders.

title: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia TBK Sees Improved Performance in Q1 2025
body: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia TBK (GOTO) reported a 4.1% year-over-year (YoY) increase in transaction value to IDR 144.6 trillion, with net revenue increasing 40.4% YoY to IDR 4.3 trillion in Q1 2025.

title: Indonesia's Economic Slowdown Exposes Failure in Education System
body: Indonesia's economic slowdown, projected until 2026, has led to a rise in unemployment, with 7.28 million people unemployed as of February 2025, with over 65% of them being educated individuals. The country's education system has failed to address the needs of the workforce, with over 60% of workers employed in fields unrelated to their academic background.

title: Gold Price Expected to Continue Rising Until Year-End 2025
body: The gold price is projected to continue its upward trend, with a current spot price of $3,382.80 per ounce, and Antam's gold price increasing by 1.83% to IDR 1,94 million per gram. Bloomberg data shows the gold price has risen 2.47% from the start of the week.

title: Government-Subsidized Loans Fall Short of Target in Indonesia
body: The Indonesian government's subsidized loan program for micro, small, and medium enterprises has failed to meet its target, with only 36% of the Rp 300 trillion target achieved as of May 2025. The program, which offers lower interest rates than non-subsidized loans, is crucial for boosting credit to these enterprises.

title: Multifinance Industry Growth Slows Down in April 2025
body: The multifinance industry's outstanding financing grew only 3.67% in April 2025, a significant decrease from 4.60% in March. This marks the 11th consecutive month of slowing growth since June 2024.

title: Jakarta's Banking Sector May Attract New Investors Amidst Regulatory Issues
body: Several Indonesian banks, including Bank JTrust Indonesia and Bank Maspion Indonesia, have yet to meet the free float regulation, while Bank Mayapada's capital adequacy ratio stands at a minimum of 10.47% as of March 2025, potentially attracting new investors from both domestic and foreign sources.

title: Venture capital industry shows signs of improvement with a 1.04% annual increase in financing to Rp 16.49 trillion as of April 2025
body: The venture capital industry in Indonesia has seen a turnaround after experiencing prolonged contraction, with financing increasing by 1.04% annually to Rp 16.49 trillion as of April 2025. This growth marks a significant improvement from the previous months, including a 0.34% contraction in March 2025 and a 0.93% decline in the month prior.

title: Unilever Indonesia to Distribute Almost All Net Profit as Dividends
body: PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) will distribute IDR 3.35 trillion, or 99.7% of its net profit, as dividends, with IDR 1.56 trillion already paid out as interim dividends and IDR 1.79 trillion to be paid out as final dividends by July 2, 2025.

title: Jakarta Sees Rise in Backdoor Listings with Recent Acquisition of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk
body: PT Gaia Artha Dinamic is acquiring 2.61 billion shares of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk, a telecommunications equipment distributor, in a backdoor listing deal. The acquisition is part of a growing trend of backdoor listings in Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Government Unveils IDR 24.4 Trillion Stimulus to Boost Domestic Economy
body: The Indonesian government has launched a stimulus package to boost domestic economic growth, but economists believe its impact on household consumption and liquidity in the real sector will be limited. The IDR 24.4 trillion stimulus will contribute less than 0.2% to Indonesia's IDR 22,000 trillion GDP.

title: Indonesian Stock Market to Receive IDR 51.47 Trillion in Dividend Funds This Month
body: Around 35 listed companies are expected to distribute a total of IDR 51.47 trillion in dividends, mostly from their 2024 financial year performance, which is expected to boost liquidity in the stock market.

title: Jakarta's Banking Sector Exercises Caution in Syndicated Loan Disbursal Amid Global Economic Uncertainty
body: Jakarta's banking industry has been cautious in disbursing syndicated loans for large projects, reflecting a 11.53% year-on-year decline in syndicated loan agreements worth USD 7.73 billion as of June 2, 2025, according to Bloomberg data.

title: United Tractors to Focus on Agricultural Sector Amidst Shift in Government Allocation
body: PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR) is shifting its focus to the agricultural sector, particularly in food estate projects, amidst a change in government allocation. The company is selling heavy equipment for these projects, with Director Iwan Hadiantoro citing a change in domestic heavy equipment market trends.

title: Logam Mulia's Certified Gold Price Drops by IDR 16,000 per Gram
body: Logam Mulia's certified gold price decreased by IDR 16,000 per gram to IDR 1,924,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by IDR 000 per gram to IDR 1,768,000 per gram.

title: Indonesian Insurance Companies See Profit Growth Amidst Challenging Economy
body: PT Asuransi Jasa Indonesia (Jasindo) reported a 68.34% increase in profit to IDR 67.81 billion as of April 2025, attributed to efficiency in operational lines and risk management.

title: OCBC Indonesia Partners with Ant International to Offer Embedded Financial Services to SMEs
body: OCBC Indonesia has partnered with Ant International to deliver embedded financial services to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), aiming to benefit thousands of small businesses in Indonesia over the next few years. The partnership will utilize Ant International's alternative-data modelling, credit strategy, and automated credit decision capabilities to offer differentiated services to SMEs within digital ecosystems.

title: PT United Tractors Tbk Hosts Astra Heavy Equipment, Mining, Construction, Energy Kick-Off 2025
body: PT United Tractors Tbk (UT) held its Astra Heavy Equipment, Mining, Construction, Energy Kick-Off 2025 event, themed 'Growing Evolving', to prepare for the challenges and opportunities in 2025. The event aimed to balance the company's business portfolio towards non-coal sectors as part of its non-coal transformation transition period from 2030 to 2050.

title: PT Remala Abadi Tbk's Shares Move Sideways After Acquisition by PT Iforte Solusi Infotek
body: PT Remala Abadi Tbk's shares have been moving sideways after being acquired by PT Iforte Solusi Infotek, a subsidiary of PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk, in a deal worth Rp 535.7 billion. The acquisition was completed on April 30, 2025, with the share price closing at Rp 1,425, before declining to Rp 1,350 on May 9, 2025, and later stabilizing at Rp 1,400.

title: PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama TBK's Stock Price Reaches All-Time High
body: The stock price of PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama TBK (PACK) has surged to Rp 3,340 per share, a significant increase from Rp 100 in November 2024, with a record high of Rp 3,510 per share. This marks an all-time high for the company's stock.

title: Gold Prices Rise at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang
body: The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by IDR 14,000 per gram to IDR 1,938,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 14,000 per gram to IDR 1,782,000 per gram.

title: PT Bumi Resources Tbk Struggles to Rise Amid Positive Sentiment
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk's stock has been stuck around IDR 120 in the past two weeks, despite positive sentiment and improving financial reports, while its affiliates PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk and PT Darma Henwa Tbk have seen significant gains. The company's financial reports have been improving, but its stock price has not reflected this.

title: PT HM Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) Stock Rises 31% from Year's Lowest Point
body: PT HM Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) stock has risen 31% from its lowest point of IDR 496 on April 8, 2025, to IDR 650 on Wednesday. Despite this increase, the stock is still down 12.16% compared to the same period last year.

title: Indonesian Government Faces High Debt Repayment Obligations in June 2025
body: The Indonesian government is expected to face a significant increase in debt repayment obligations in June 2025, with State Bond Notes (SBN) worth Rp 178.9 trillion due for repayment. This amount is the highest compared to other months in 2025, with SBN repayments in May and July amounting to Rp 42.4 trillion and Rp 34.7 trillion, respectively.

title: PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk Raises Capital through Private Placement
body: PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk, the operator of KFC restaurants, has raised capital through a private placement, issuing 533.33 million new shares at IDR 150 per share. The move is seen as a response to the current volatile stock market conditions.

title: PT Buyung Poetra Sembada Tbk Boosts Sales with Distribution Network Synergy
body: PT Buyung Poetra Sembada Tbk (BPOETRA) aims to increase sales by maximizing synergy between its distribution networks, as seen in its collaboration with Hoki and Indomarco at the National Sales Kickoff event in Jakarta, which will expand Hoki's product reach to various segments of Indonesian society. This strategy is expected to enhance the company's market penetration capabilities.

title: PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra Acquires Shares in PT Steel Pipe Indonesia Tbk
body: PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, a controlling shareholder, purchased 6,236,000 shares of PT Steel Pipe Indonesia Tbk (ISSP) at IDR 296 per share on June 4, 2025. The acquisition is part of the company's efforts to adjust its share ownership in ISSP.

title: Gold Price Drops by Rp 9,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 9,000 per gram, from Rp 1,938,000 to Rp 1,929,000, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 9,000 per gram, from Rp 1,782,000 to Rp 1,773,000, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

title: PT Merdeka Battery Materials TBK (MBMA) Sees Surge in Trading Volume After Joining MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index
body: PT Merdeka Battery Materials TBK (MBMA) experienced a significant increase in trading volume after officially joining the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index on June 2, 2025, with its stock price surging 24.86% to IDR 452 on Wednesday. The company's trading volume reached 1.54 billion shares, a substantial increase from the previous day's 129.9 million shares.

title: PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk Issues New Shares Worth IDR 80 Billion
body: PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk, the operator of KFC and Taco Bell in Indonesia, has issued 533.33 million new shares at IDR 150 per share, raising IDR 80 billion in funds, with two major conglomerates, Group Salim and Group Gelael, purchasing the entire issue.

title: Indonesian Life Insurance Sales through Banking Partnerships Decline in Q1 2025
body: Life insurance sales through bancassurance channels in Indonesia decreased by 2.4% to IDR 18.61 trillion in Q1 2025, compared to the same period in 2024, due to reduced customer activity at bank branches. The Indonesian Life Insurance Association reported the decline in premiums received by industry players from bancassurance channels.

title: Indonesian Banking Sector Expected to Improve Despite April Slump
body: Despite a decline in banking stocks in April 2025, some securities firms, including Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia, are projecting a better performance for the sector in the coming months, driven by positive sentiments and expected 5% profit growth in 2025.

title: Number of Crypto Investors in Indonesia Surpasses 14 Million, Exceeding Stock Investors
body: The number of crypto investors in Indonesia has reached 14.16 million as of April 2025, surpassing the number of stock investors, which stands at 7.001 million. This marks a significant increase of 450,000 crypto investors from the previous month.

title: PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk (AADI) Sees Large Transaction in Negotiated Market
body: A large transaction of 101.696 million shares of PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk (AADI) occurred in the negotiated market, valued at IDR 673.74 billion, at a price of IDR 6,625 per share. This transaction took place at 11:13 Jakarta time, below the daily trading price range of IDR 6,800-7,000 per share.

title: Bank Indonesia Targets 4.8-5.6% Growth in Sharia Economy This Year
body: Bank Indonesia aims to achieve a 4.8-5.6% growth in the sharia economy this year, driven by an increase in sharia financing. The target is higher than last year's projection of 4.7-5.5%, with sharia banking financing growth expected to reach 8-11%.

title: Indonesian Government Faces High State Bond Repayment in June 2025
body: The Indonesian government is expected to face a significant surge in state bond repayment obligations in June 2025, with a total of IDR 178.9 trillion worth of bonds maturing. This is the highest amount compared to other months in 2025.

title: Indonesia's Sharia Banking Market Remains Stagnant Despite Consolidation Efforts
body: Indonesia's sharia banking market has shown little growth in recent years, with assets reaching IDR 936.2 trillion as of March 2025, accounting for only 7.35% of the total banking industry assets. The market share has only slightly increased from 6.47% in 2020, prompting regulators to continue pushing for consolidation among industry players.

title: PT Arsari Tambang to Launch Tin Solder Factory in Batam by July 2025
body: PT Arsari Tambang, a mining company owned by Hashim Djojohadikusumo, brother of Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, is set to launch a tin solder factory in Batam by July 2025 through its subsidiary PT Solder Tin Andalan Indonesia. The new factory will contribute to the country's mining downstreaming project.

title: Indonesian Stock Index Falls 1.19% in a Week, Foreign Investors Sell Rp 4.7 Trillion Worth of Shares
body: The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) dropped 1.19% in a week, with foreign investors selling Rp 4.7 trillion worth of shares, mainly in big-cap stocks such as PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA), PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), and PT Astra International Tbk (ASII).

title: Several Indonesian Companies Expand Business by Establishing New Subsidiaries
body: At least eight Indonesian companies, including PT Buma Internasional Grup TBK (BUMI), established new subsidiaries in May 2025, expanding their business into various sectors including technology, healthcare, and energy. The new subsidiaries will engage in various activities such as seaweed cultivation, processing, and sales.

title: PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk to Distribute IDR 254.39 Billion in Cash Dividends
body: PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk (DSNG) will distribute IDR 254.39 billion in cash dividends, equivalent to IDR 24 per share, following a 35.6% year-over-year increase in net profit to IDR 1.1 trillion in 2024.

title: Indonesian Manufacturing Sector Remains Resilient Despite Contraction in PMI
body: Despite a decline in the Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) to 47.4 in May 2025, Indonesian manufacturing companies such as PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Kalbe Farma Tbk. (KALF), and PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk. (UNVR) have shown resilience in their performance. The PMI, reported by S&P Global, had contracted from 46.7 in April 2025.

title: PT Baramulti Suksessarana Tbk to Distribute US$20 Million in Dividends for 2024
body: PT Baramulti Suksessarana Tbk (BSSR) will distribute US$20 million in dividends for 2024, with each share receiving US$0.00764 or approximately IDR 123.82. The dividend distribution was approved by shareholders during the annual general meeting.

title: Indodax Records IDR 15.24 Trillion in April 2025 Transactions
body: Indodax, a cryptocurrency exchange, reported IDR 15.24 trillion in transaction volume in April 2025, contributing 42.83% of the national total. The national cryptocurrency transaction value in April 2025 was IDR 35.61 trillion, a growth from IDR 32.45 trillion in the previous month.

title: Indonesia's Economy Struggles with Rising Unemployment and Decreased Consumer Spending
body: Indonesia's economy is struggling with rising unemployment, which reached 7.28 million people in February 2025, and decreased consumer spending, resulting in a decline in production and sales in various industries, including retail and manufacturing.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Rises 0.63% Amid Foreign Net Selling
body: The Jakarta Composite Index rose 0.63% to 7,113.42 on Thursday, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of Rp 720.62 billion. The index weakened 1.19% over the week, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 4.7 trillion.

title: Baramulti Suksessarana's Stock Price Drops 7.03% in a Week
body: Baramulti Suksessarana Tbk's (BSSR) stock price fell 1.91% to IDR 4,100 per share on Thursday, following a 7.03% decline in a week, due to investor disappointment over dividend distribution.

title: Bytedance Requests Tokopedia Sellers to Integrate with Tokopedia & TikTok Shop Seller Center
body: Bytedance, the new owner of Tokopedia, has requested sellers to integrate with Tokopedia & TikTok Shop Seller Center by June 9, 2025, with many sellers expressing concerns and complaints on social media. The integration is mandatory for sellers to continue operating on the platform.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Falls 0.87% in First Week of June
body: The Jakarta stock index (IHSG) declined 0.87% to 7,113.42 in the first week of June, with the IDX High Dividend 20 and IDX ESG Leaders indices experiencing the largest drops of 3.73%. This follows a 6% gain in May.

title: Mayapada Healthcare Expands with $900 Million Investment from Bain Capital
body: Mayapada Healthcare has started construction of Tower 3 at its Jakarta Selatan hospital, with an investment of between Rp 900 billion and Rp 1.4 trillion, following a fresh injection of funds from Bain Capital Credit LP, a private equity firm from the United States.

title: ASEAN Manufacturing Industry Performance Remains Sluggish
body: The majority of ASEAN countries' manufacturing industries remained sluggish in May 2025, with most purchasing managers' indexes (PMIs) staying below 50, despite a slight increase from the previous month. Only Thailand, Singapore, and Singapore recorded PMIs above 50, with Singapore and the Philippines experiencing corrections from the previous month.

title: Jakarta's Consumer Sector Expected to Endure Despite Challenges
body: Despite facing challenges such as weakened consumer purchasing power, suppressed economic growth, and uncertain global economic conditions, top consumer goods issuers like PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Mayora Indah Tbk. (MYOR), and PT Cisarua Mountain Dairy Tbk. (CSDY) are still preferred. These companies are expected to continue performing well despite the economic headwinds.

title: Gold Price Drops by IDR 25,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The certified gold price in Indonesia dropped by IDR 25,000 per gram to IDR 1,904,000 per gram, while the buyback price also decreased by IDR 25,000 to IDR 1,748,000 per gram. Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is affected by this price change.

title: PT Sinar Mas Agro Resources Technology Tbk to Expand Business by Selling Bio-CNG Gas
body: PT Sinar Mas Agro Resources Technology Tbk (SMAR) plans to expand its business by selling bio-CNG gas from its palm oil waste processing, potentially adding new profits to its business. The company will seek shareholder approval at its annual general meeting on June 16, 2025.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia's Stock Price Plummets 14.33% in a Week
body: Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BRIS) saw its stock price drop 14.33% to IDR 2,570 per share, from IDR 3,000 per share, making it the fifth top loser in the past week. The price even touched IDR 2,460, the lowest level in the last month.

title: Oil Prices Move Away from Macro Assumptions, Widening Fiscal Gap
body: Global oil prices have moved away from macro assumption for the 2025 state revenue and expenditure budget, potentially widening the fiscal gap. Brent oil price rose 0.5% to $65.15 per barrel, while West Texas Intermediate oil price fell 0.3% to $63.04 per barrel.

title: Indonesia's Automotive Sector Sees Decline in Q1 2025 Sales
body: Indonesia's automotive sales declined 4.8% year-over-year in Q1 2025, with motorcycle sales also dropping 3% year-over-year, according to Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia, amid unstable domestic and global macroeconomic conditions.

title: Jakarta Retail Stocks Plunge Amid Weakening Economy
body: Retail stocks in Jakarta, such as PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa Tbk (MAPA) and PT Ace Hardware Indonesia Tbk (ACES), have plummeted by 34.58% and 32.28% year-to-date, respectively, due to the weakening economy.

title: US tariff policy to impact global commodity market, including Indonesia's aluminium exports to the US
body: The US decision to increase tariffs on aluminium imports from 25% to 50% starting June 4, 2025, may alter the global aluminium trade landscape, but PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (INALUM) reports that direct exports to the US are relatively low at 1,600 tons per year. This accounts for only 0.5% of INALUM's total aluminium billet sales, suggesting a limited impact on the company's overall business.

title: PT SLJ Global Tbk Sees Revenue and Profit Recovery in Q1 2025
body: PT SLJ Global Tbk (SLJG) reported a significant increase in revenue from US$344,062 to US$3.56 million in Q1 2025, resulting in a net loss of US$483,742 in March 2024 to a net profit of US$165,258 in Q1 2025.

title: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk to Distribute $271.5 Million in Dividends
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) will distribute a total of $271.5 million in dividends, equivalent to 80% of the company's net profit in 2024. The dividend payout translates to IDR 3,820 per share.

title: Ray Dalio Remains Unpaid Adviser to Indonesia's Danareksa
body: Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates, will continue to serve as an unpaid adviser to Danareksa, Indonesia's state-owned investment firm, despite earlier reports that he had pulled out of the role. Dalio's involvement was announced in March, and he joins other high-profile advisers, including Helman Sitohang, Jeffrey Sachs, and Thaksin Shinawatra.

title: PT Surya Toto Indonesia Prepares IDR 180 Billion Capital Expenditure for 2025
body: PT Surya Toto Indonesia (SURF) has allocated IDR 180 billion for capital expenditure in 2025, with IDR 100 billion to be used for renovating its office building in Cikupa, Tangerang Regency and Serpong, South Tangerang City. The capital expenditure is part of the company's strategy to strengthen its operational activities.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia's Shares Pressured by Rumors of Becoming a New State-Owned Bank
body: Bank Syariah Indonesia's shares are under pressure due to rumors that it will become a new state-owned bank, with Badan Pengelola Investasi, and Danantara reportedly negotiating to buy 51.47% of PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), 23.24% of PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI), and 15.38% of PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) shares.

title: Indonesian Financial Authority's Co-Payment Scheme to Impact Healthcare and Hospital Operators like PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk and PT Siloam International Hospitals Tbk
body: The Indonesian Financial Authority's co-payment scheme is expected to widely impact the healthcare industry, affecting not only insurance participants but also the performance of hospital operators such as PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk and PT Siloam International Hospitals Tbk. According to a study by CGS International, the majority of revenue for these hospital operators comes from private insurance patients who will be subject to the co-payment scheme.

title: Gold Price Rises by IDR 5,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 5,000 per gram to IDR 1,909,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 5,000 per gram to IDR 1,753,000 per gram. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company behind the Logam Mulia gold bars.

title: Barito Renewables Energy Leads Laggard Stocks in IHSG with 31.54% Decline
body: Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) has been the top laggard stock in the IHSG index, with its share price dropping 31.54% year-to-date to IDR 6,350 per share. The company's decline has contributed 113.13 points to the IHSG's decline.

title: Indonesian stock market lags behind regional peers due to numerous holidays and foreign investor outflows
body: The Indonesian stock market has underperformed its regional counterparts, with foreign investors pulling out Rp 4.7 trillion in the period of June 25, 2025, amid a week of declines. The outflow of foreign funds has led to a loss of momentum for blue-chip stocks, while regional markets such as the Kospi in Korea have remained in the green.

title: Indonesian paper industry faces heavy pressure from cheap imports, prompting calls for protection and internal transformation
body: The Indonesian paper industry is struggling to compete with cheap imports from countries like China, Korea, and Japan, leading to decreased profitability for local players, particularly small to medium-sized producers. The Indonesian Pulp and Paper Association is urging the government to provide balanced protection for the industry and is also encouraging internal transformation through increased efficiency, modern technology, and reduced production costs.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Remains Limited Amid Global Uncertainty
body: The Indonesian rupiah exchange rate strengthened slightly by 0.04% to IDR 16,291 on Monday, and 0.19% to IDR 16,277 on Thursday, according to Bloomberg and Bank Indonesia (IDX) data, respectively, despite global uncertainty and limited domestic positive sentiment.

title: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) to Expand Product Line and Raise Prices to Boost Performance
body: PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) is adopting an expansion strategy to boost performance amidst weakening consumer purchasing power, including raising the price of its Indomie instant noodles by IDR 100 per pack starting mid-February 2025. The company is also launching new products and expanding its overseas market to drive growth.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Closes in Green Zone Ahead of Idul Adha Holiday
body: The Jakarta stock index ended in the green zone, closing at 7,113.42, up 0.63% or 44.39 points from the previous day, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 720.62 billion.

title: Jakarta: Last Chance for Investors to Hunt for Dividend Yields from Mining Sector
body: This week is the last chance for investors to buy shares from mining sector companies to receive dividend yields, with multiple companies entering the cum-dividend period. Investors can purchase shares before the deadline to receive dividend payouts.

title: PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna Tbk (HMS P) to Enter Ex-Dividend Trading
body: The last trading day for PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna Tbk (HMS P) shares with dividend rights for the 2024 fiscal year ended on Tuesday, and the shares will enter ex-dividend trading on Wednesday. Investors who want to receive dividends must purchase the shares by Tuesday.

title: Centre Research Energy Clean Air Study Reveals Nickel Smelter Contribution to National GDP
body: A study by Centre Research Energy Clean Air and Center Economic and Law Studies found that nickel smelter activities in three provinces contributed Rp 83.17 to national GDP. The study, conducted by Centre Research Energy Clean Air, analyzed the impact of nickel hilirisasi in Sulawesi Tengah, Sulawesi Tenggara, and Maluku Utara provinces.

title: Micro, Small, and Medium Businesses Await Clarity on 0.5% Income Tax Rate
body: Micro, small, and medium businesses are still waiting for clarity on the continuation of the 0.5% final income tax rate, as the government has yet to publish new rules on the matter, leaving millions of businesses uncertain. The Directorate General of Taxation has confirmed that there is no new regulation regarding the extension of the tax rate.

title: PT Adhi Karya's Performance Slows Down in Early 2025
body: PT Adhi Karya Tbk's (ADHI) new contract acquisition decreased to IDR 2.6 trillion by May 2025, with 23% from state budget, 56% from state-owned enterprises, and 20% from private companies. This decline is in line with the company's overall performance slowdown in early 2025.

title: PT Surya Biru Murni Acetylene Tbk to Distribute IDR 3.7 Billion Dividend
body: PT Surya Biru Murni Acetylene Tbk (None) will distribute a cash dividend of IDR 3.7 billion, equivalent to IDR 4 per share, following approval from the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders. The dividend is based on the company's net profit for the 2024 fiscal year.

title: Number of Regional Development Banks in Indonesia's Stock Exchange May Increase
body: Bank DKI has received shareholder approval to conduct an initial public offering, with the Financial Services Authority supporting regional development banks to go public, potentially increasing their number in the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: Indonesia's Cement Industry Slows Down Amid Economic Downturn and Infrastructure Spending Cuts
body: Indonesia's cement sales declined in Q1 2025, with Kalimantan region experiencing the largest drop, amid a slowdown in economic growth and a 5.46% in infrastructure spending to IDR 400.3 trillion.

title: Erajaya Active Lifestyle Remains Optimistic Despite Economic Uncertainties
body: Erajaya Active Lifestyle, a subsidiary of PT Sinar Eka Selaras Tbk (Erajaya), has reported positive performance in the first quarter of 2025, with the management aiming to continue growth despite economic uncertainties in Indonesia. The company's optimism is driven by its strong first-quarter results.

title: Jakarta Stock Exchange Predicted to Test Resistance Area
body: The Jakarta Stock Exchange (IHSG) is expected to test the resistance area of 7,254-7,325 due to positive sentiment from the US-China trade talks, with the index still holding above the psychological support of 7,000. The market is waiting for the release of consumer price index data this week.

title: Bank Indonesia reports a 14.5% year-over-year growth in M0 adjusted to Rp 1.939.1 trillion in May 2025
body: The M0 adjusted position in May 2025 reached Rp 1.939.1 trillion, representing a 14.5% year-over-year growth, but a decline from the Rp 1.952.3 trillion recorded in April 2025. This growth is lower than the 13% year-over-year growth in the previous period, which was in line with the momentum of the lebaran holiday season.

title: Indonesia Implements New Tax Regulation to Strengthen International Information Exchange
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has introduced a new regulation to strengthen the legal basis for international information exchange, aiming to prevent tax evasion and avoidance, and to obtain information on tax obligations. The move is expected to improve tax transparency and compliance.

title: Blue Chip Stocks in Indonesia Underperform Market Expectations
body: In the last three years, Indonesia's blue chip stocks have underperformed the market, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) only showing a 0.38% increase from May 2022 to May 2025. This is despite being considered a long-term investment portfolio.

title: Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserves Remain Stagnant in May 2025
body: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves stood at $152.49 billion at the end of May 2025, barely changed from $152.47 billion in April, despite the government's issuance of global bonds, including Samurai bonds. The reserves were influenced by tax and service receipts, as well as foreign exchange earnings from oil and gas exports, offset by government foreign debt payments and rupiah stabilization efforts.

title: PT Sillomaritime Perdana Tbk to Distribute IDR 280.12 Billion in Dividends
body: PT Sillomaritime Perdana Tbk (SILLO) has announced a cash dividend distribution of IDR 280.12 billion, equivalent to 98.78% of its 2024 net profit of USD 17.41 million. The dividend payout of IDR 103 per share for the 2024 was approved by shareholders at its annual general meeting.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rises 1.64% with Net Buy of IDR 1.03 Trillion
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 1.64% to 7,230.74 on Tuesday, with foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 1.03 trillion. Analysts have provided several stock recommendations for the day.

title: PT Satyamitra Kemas Lestari Tbk (SMKL) expands to Central Java with a new factory and allocates Rp 500 billion for capital expenditure in 2025
body: PT Satyamitra Kemas Lestari Tbk (SMKL) is expanding its operations to Central Java by establishing a new factory in Batang, with a total capital expenditure of Rp 500 billion allocated for 2025. As of now, the company has already spent Rp 243.8 billion on land acquisition, land preparation, design, licensing, and building materials for the new factory.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Slightly After Long Weekend
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened by 0.10% to IDR 16,275 on Tuesday, following a long weekend, with economists citing a lack of new catalysts and ongoing trade negotiations between the US and China. The rupiah's strengthening was also reflected in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (JISDOR) which rose 0.01% to IDR 16,277.

title: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO) to Strengthen Commercial Strategy through Nickel Ore Sales
body: PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO) is implementing strategic projects to boost its future growth, including selling nickel ore, which has contributed $2.54 million in revenue in Q1-2025. The move is seen as a way to strengthen INCO's commercial strategy.

title: PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure Prepares Expansion to Boost Revenue
body: PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBK) is allocating IDR 3-4 trillion in capital expenditure this year to build new towers to meet customer needs, with the majority of the allocation to be used for this purpose. The company aims to boost revenue from its tower and fiber optic business.

title: Mandom Indonesia Faces Challenges Amid Shift in Consumer Spending
body: PT Mandom Indonesia Tbk (MANDOM) is experiencing challenges due to a shift in spending habits and decreased purchasing power in the first half of the year, affecting its production and trading of skincare, haircare, cosmetics, and perfumes. The company is looking for ways to adapt to this new dynamic.

title: Jakarta: Indonesian Mutual Fund Indices Show Positive Returns in May 2025
body: In May 2025, all Indonesian mutual fund indices recorded positive returns, with the stock index growing 4.44% and the mixed index increasing 2.92%.

title: Garuda Indonesia Sees 80% Seat Occupancy During Idul Adha Long Weekend
body: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) reported an 80% seat occupancy rate during the Idul Adha long weekend, driven by high mobility and demand for travel during the period. The airline optimized its seat availability to meet the increasing demand.

title: Bank Indonesia's 25bps Rate Cut Boosts Corporate Bond Issuance
body: Following Bank Indonesia's 25bps rate cut to 5.50% in May 2025, several companies, including PT Bank Mandiri Taspen, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), and PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk, are set to issue corporate bonds, signaling a more vibrant bond market.

title: Tokopedia and TikTok Shop Launches Seller Center to Support Local Businesses
body: Tokopedia and TikTok Shop have launched a new Seller Center to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) manage their business operations more efficiently. The launch is part of Tokopedia and TikTok Shop's commitment to driving sustainable growth and innovation in Indonesia's e-commerce ecosystem.

title: Logam Mulia's Gold Prices Increase by Rp 18,000 per Gram
body: Logam Mulia's (ANTM) certified gold prices rose by Rp 18,000 per gram to Rp 1,928,000 per gram, while buyback prices also rose by Rp 18,000 to Rp 1,772,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

title: Malindo Feedmill (MALF) Prepares Expansion Strategy Amid Economic Challenges
body: Malindo Feedmill is expanding its market reach and strengthening operational performance, targeting export markets in Japan, Singapore, and Oman, with plans to enter the Middle East and Asian markets. The company aims to increase its export market share, particularly for processed chicken products.

title: PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk Focuses on Corporate Rental Business
body: PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk (ASA) is strengthening its vehicle rental business by focusing on corporate clients with long-term contracts, which helps to mitigate the impact of seasonal fluctuations on rental volume and tariffs.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Against US Dollar on Wednesday
body: The Indonesian rupiah rose 0.09% to IDR 16,260 per dollar, supported by recent capital inflows, according to Lukman Leong, an analyst at Doo Financial Futures.

title: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk to Distribute $30 Million in Cash Dividends
body: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TICKER) will distribute $30 million in cash dividends, equivalent to IDR 489 billion, from its 2018 retained earnings. The company's shareholders approved the agenda to change the use of retained earnings from 2018, totaling $123.55 million.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index) IHSG Falls 0.11% to 7,222.45, Foreign Investors Net Buy IDR 79.04 Billion
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.11% to 7,222.45 on Wednesday, despite foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 79.04 billion. Analysts have provided several stock recommendations for today.

title: Several LQ45 Index Companies in Indonesia Have Not Yet Distributed Dividends
body: Several companies in Indonesia's LQ45 index have not yet distributed dividends, with some still awaiting approval from shareholders at their annual general meeting. The dividend distribution process typically requires shareholder approval before the announcement.

title: Indonesian State-Owned Enterprises, Including Garuda Indonesia, Under Evaluation for Funding Needs
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusaha Tengah (Danantara) is evaluating the funding needs of state-owned enterprises, including PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA), which has requested funding for the procurement of 15 aircraft. The evaluation is part of Danantara's role in supporting the expansion of state-owned enterprises.

title: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto Plans to Establish a National Revenue Authority
body: President Prabowo Subianto has reportedly prepared the structure of a national revenue authority, which will be directly responsible to the President, according to Edi Slamet Irianto, a member of the National Campaign Team's taxation expert council.

title: Syariah Stock Mutual Funds Show Improvement in Mid-2025
body: Syariah stock mutual funds recorded a 1.69% return as of June 5, 2025, but their performance varies greatly depending on their investment focus, according to Research Analyst Arjun Ajwani of Infovesta Kapital Advisori.

title: PT Citra Nusantara Gemilang Tbk to Distribute IDR 4.7 Billion Dividend, Up 15.58% YoY
body: PT Citra Nusantara Gemilang Tbk (CNGG) will distribute a dividend of IDR 4.7 billion, equivalent to 50% of its 2024 net profit of IDR 9.41 billion, driven by a 34.67% increase in revenue to IDR 508.50 billion.

title: Indonesian Government to Revise Nickel Mining Policy in Raja Ampat Region
