body: The government has revoked four nickel mining permits in the Raja Ampat region, including those of PT Anugerah Surya Pratama, PT Mulia Raymond Perkasa, PT Kawei Sejahtera Mining, and PT Nurham, and is set to revise its policy to allow for continued mining in the area.

title: Blibli (BLLI) Receives Shareholder Approval for Capital Increase
body: Blibli received approval from shareholders to increase capital without preemptive rights, aiming to implement a management and employee stock ownership plan. The approval was obtained during an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders held on Wednesday.

title: Indonesian Financial Authority Develops Gold Exchange-Traded Fund
body: The Indonesian Financial Authority is developing a gold exchange-traded fund, which can serve as an investment alternative for non-bank financial industries, such as pension funds and insurance companies, with a potential market value of IDR 20,000 per month. OJK Deputy Commissioner Iwan Pasila stated that gold can compensate for stock price fluctuations, making it a viable investment option.

title: Indonesia Considers Implementing Wealth Tax to Address Income Inequality
body: Indonesia is considering implementing a wealth tax to address the country's widening wealth gap, with only 1% of the population holding more than half of the national wealth, while the bottom 50% hold less than 5%. The government is studying the implementation of a wealth tax, which could generate up to IDR 150 trillion in revenue.

title: Indonesian Banks Issue Bonds to Diversify Funding Amid Tight Liquidity
body: Indonesian banks are issuing bonds to diversify their funding sources amid tight liquidity, with the loan-to-deposit ratio reaching 87.95% in March 2025. This move is seen as an effort to mitigate the pressure, as reflected in the data from the Financial Services Authority (OJK).

title: Indonesian Government to Issue Mining Permits for Small and Medium Enterprises
body: The Indonesian government is set to issue mining permits for micro, small, and medium enterprises, with the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources requesting the Minister of Cooperatives and Small and Medium Enterprises to identify eligible businesses. The move is expected to be formalized through a forthcoming government regulation.

title: Global Crude Oil Prices Fall Below $70 per Barrel
body: Global crude oil prices have fallen below $70 per barrel, down 16% year-on-year, which is expected to impact various sub-sectors in the manufacturing industry, particularly in reducing production costs and fuel costs.

title: Indonesian Travel Insurance Market Remains Resilient Amid Economic Slowdown
body: Despite a decline in domestic travel demand, Indonesia's travel insurance market continues to thrive, particularly for international travel segment, with PT Great Eastern General Insurance (GREAT) citing a significant impact on the domestic travel market due to government's efficiency policy and decreased purchasing power. The market is expected to remain resilient, driven by growing demand for mobility protection.

title: Indonesia's Path to Green Industrialization and Critical Mineral Management
body: Indonesia is shifting from a resource-based to a demand-based approach to manage its vast mineral resources, focusing on strategic minerals like nickel, copper, and lithium to support the global energy transition, with a goal of becoming a major industrial nation by 2045.

title: World Bank Report Reveals Higher Poverty Rate in Indonesia
body: The World Bank's updated poverty measurement has increased the poverty line, resulting in 68.2% of Indonesia's population, or 194.4 million people, living below the poverty line of IDR 49,244 per day. This is in contrast to the Indonesian government's report, which stated that 24.06 million people, or 8.57% of the population, lived in poverty as of September 2024.

title: Indonesian Government to Establish 80,000 Village Cooperatives by July 2025
body: The Indonesian government has established 78,719 village cooperatives as of June 4, 2025, with 17,659 units, but the rapid establishment process has raised concerns of corruption and political influence.

title: Indonesian Government to Revise National Poverty Line Standard This Year
body: The Indonesian government is set to revise and announce a new national poverty line standard this year, according to Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, Chairman of the National Economic Council. The new standard is expected to be announced soon, with a report already prepared for review.

title: Indonesian Government Reshuffles Management in Energy and Mining Sector
body: The Indonesian government has reshuffled the management of state-owned enterprises in the energy and mining sector, appointing individuals with backgrounds in the military and politics, including two police generals, to key positions at Mind ID, a holding company for Indonesia's mining industry. The move is seen as part of a broader effort to restructure the country's state-owned enterprises.

title: Gold Price Rises by IDR 23,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia rose by IDR 000 per gram to IDR 1,951,000 per gram, while the buyback price also increased by IDR 23,000 per gram to IDR 1,795,000 per gram. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company behind the Logam Mulia gold bars.

title: Global Securities Upgrade PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk's Stock Rating
body: Majority of global securities firms recommend buying GoTo's stock with an average target price of IDR 98,22 per share for the next 12 months, with 24 out of 30 institutions giving a 'buy' rating. Six institutions have given a 'hold' rating.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange to Boost Liquidity with Liquidity Providers
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) plans to increase liquidity by introducing liquidity providers, targeting an 11.5% increase in transaction value. The implementation is set to take place in the third quarter.

title: Indonesian Consumer Confidence Hits 3-Year Low in May 2025
body: The Indonesian consumer confidence index fell to 117.5 in May 2025, a 4.2-point decline from the previous month, marking the lowest level in nearly three years. This decline serves as a warning to the government that the economy is not healthy, as economic growth is still supported by consumption.

title: Indonesia's Electric Motorcycle Sales Plummet in Q1 2025
body: The Indonesian Electric Motorcycle Industry Association reported a sharp decline in electric motorcycle sales in Q1 2025, with only 30% of last year's total sales of 62,700 units. The industry had targeted 200,000 unit sales for the year.

title: Jetstar Asia to Close Operations, Including in Indonesia, According to Directorate General of Civil Aviation
body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation announced that Jetstar Asia plans to close all its operations, including those in Indonesia, as informed by the General Manager of South East Asia and South Asia of Qantas Group. The closure was announced verbally on June 11, 2025, with no official written notification received yet.

title: Two Indonesian Mining Companies to Distribute Cash Dividends to Their Shareholders
body: PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) and PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) have announced plans to pay out cash dividends to their shareholders, with ANTM distributing Rp 3.6 trillion or Rp 151.77 per share. The two companies, which are part of the state-owned mining holding company Mind ID, made the announcements at their annual general meetings of shareholders.

title: Mega Manunggal Property Expects Strong Performance This Year
body: PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk (MMLP) is optimistic about its performance this year, driven by new clients, including from China, and expects to exceed its target with an occupancy rate of over 90% by the end of the year.

title: Siam Cement's Subsidiary Considers Selling 10.57% Stake in PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk
body: Siam Cement Public Company Limited's subsidiary, SCG Chemicals Public Company Limited, is considering selling a 10.57% stake in PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk, a company owned by taipan Prajogo Pangestu. The sale is part of the company's strategy, according to a management letter to the Thailand Stock Exchange.

title: Indonesian Government Struggles to Collect Taxes Amid Economic Pressure
body: The Indonesian government's tax revenue realization until the end of April 2025 was only IDR 557.1 trillion, a 10.8% year-on-year decline, due to economic pressure, particularly in consumption. The government is struggling to collect taxes amid the country's economic downturn.

title: Nikel Prices Continue to Weaken, Affecting Indonesian Mining Companies
body: The global nickel price has dropped 14.26% over the past year, currently standing at $15.129 per ton, which may negatively impact Indonesian mining companies. The decline in nickel prices may lead to a decrease in revenue for these companies.

title: Gold Price Rises by IDR 9,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 9,000 per gram, from IDR 1,951,000 to IDR 1,960,000, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 9,000 per gram, from IDR 1,795,000 to IDR 1,804,000. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company involved in this price change.

title: Indonesian Banks' Liquidity Expected to Improve in Second Half of 2025
body: Indonesian banks' liquidity is expected to improve in the second half of 2025 due to recent rate cuts and higher foreign borrowing limits, which could free up funds for lending. Net interest margins are expected to compress in Q2 2025, but may ease in H2 2025

title: PT Mitra Bara Adiperdana Tbk Diversifies Business Amid Coal Industry Challenges
body: PT Mitra Bara Adiperdana Tbk (MBAP) is diversifying its business to reduce dependence on the coal sector, which is facing challenges such as export competition and fluctuating prices, with the company starting to implement diversification efforts since 2022.

title: Indonesia Faces Coconut Shortage Despite Being World's Second-Largest Producer
body: Indonesia is facing a shortage of coconuts and coconut-based products, despite being the world's second-largest producer, with exports to China reaching 68,065 tons in January-February 2025, valued at $29.5 million, has reduced domestic supply, leading to a shortage that has persisted even after Ramadan and Eid celebrations.

title: Interest Rates Play a Crucial Role in the Growth of Mortgage Credit Disbursement in Indonesia
body: The growth of mortgage credit disbursement in Indonesia is heavily influenced by interest rates, with banks having a larger portion of cheap funds able to offer more competitive credit rates. Despite Bank Indonesia's recent 25 basis point cut in the benchmark interest rate to 5.5%, mortgage rates are not expected to decrease immediately, particularly for banks with high funding costs.

title: Foreign Investors Dominate Indonesia's E-commerce Industry
body: Foreign investors, including ByteDance, Sea Limited, and Alibaba Group, have taken control of Indonesia's e-commerce industry, with Shopee, Lazada, and TikTok Shop being the top three e-commerce platforms in terms of GMV, with a total value of USD 55.1 billion, USD 18.8 billion, and USD 16.3 billion, respectively.

title: Bank Indonesia Expands QRIS Cross-Border Cooperation Despite US Protest
body: Bank Indonesia is expanding its QRIS cross-border cooperation to Saudi Arabia, China, and Japan, following successful implementation in Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand, with the transaction value continuing to increase.

title: Indonesian Banks Invest in Agent Banking to Boost Revenue and Deposits
body: Indonesian banks are innovating to grow their agent banking business, which not only contributes to commission revenue but also encourages low-cost fund collection, with some banks simplifying registration for new agents. This move is expected to drive business growth and increase deposits.

title: PT Fast Food Indonesia Secures Funding through Private Placement
body: PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk (FAST) raised capital through a private placement, issuing 533.33 million new shares at a nominal value of IDR 50 per share, potentially gaining IDR 80 billion in additional capital.

title: Famon Awal Bros Sedaya (FAMS) acquires majority stake in Lynas Medikal for Rp 17.25 billion
body: Famon Awal Bros Sedaya (FAMS) has acquired a 51.01% stake in Lynas Medikal, a distributor of medical equipment and pharmaceuticals in Indonesia, for Rp 17.25 billion. The acquisition involves the purchase of 17,250 shares, expanding Famon Awal Bros Sedaya's presence in the Indonesian healthcare industry.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls for Third Consecutive Day
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.53% to 7,166.06 on Friday, its third consecutive decline this week, but still up 1.37% for the week.

title: PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk Optimistic About Business Prospects
body: PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk (MIKA) aims to achieve double-digit growth in revenue and net profit throughout the year. The company's management remains optimistic about its business prospects until the end of the year.

title: PT Toba Pulp Lestari's Stock Sees Unusual Surge in Trading Volume and Price
body: PT Toba Pulp Lestari Tbk's (TOBA) trading volume significantly increased to thousands of lots per day, accompanied by a rapid price increase, peaking at IDR 920 per share on June 5, 2025. The stock saw a crossing of 1.283 billion shares on the same day, facilitated by Indo Premier Sekuritas.

title: Indonesia Aims to Implement EU Trade Agreement by 2026, Expects 5.4% Annual Export Growth
body: The Indonesian government targets the implementation of the Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU CEPA) to start in Q4 2026 or early 2027, expecting a 5.4% annual export growth. The agreement aims to increase market access, potentially boosting export performance.

title: Tokopedia Sellers Must Integrate with TikTok Shop Seller Center by Deadline
body: Tokopedia sellers must integrate with the TikTok Shop Seller Center by June 9, 2025, as announced by Bytedance, the new owner of Tokopedia after acquiring it from PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO). The integration, which started on April 8, aims to encourage sellers to switch to the new system.

title: Motor Prices in Indonesia Expected to Rise by 2025
body: Motor prices in Indonesia are expected to increase by 2025, with prices potentially rising by Rp 500,000 to Rp 2 million due to a 12% tax increase and the implementation of the Opsi Penjualan Saham (OPSN) policy.

title: Indonesian Stock Index Rises 0.74% in Second Week of June 2025
body: The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) increased by 0.74% in the second week of June 2025, recovering from a 0.87% decline in the first week. The index closed at 7,166.06 on Friday, with a high of 7,239.95 and a low of 7,133.38 during the period.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange Reconstitutes Three ESG Indices
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange has reconstituted three ESG indices, effective June 2, 2025, with PT Sinar Eka Selaras Tbk (ERAJYA) added to the ESG Sector Leaders IDX. The reconstitution is the result of an evaluation by the Indonesia Stock Exchange and the Biodiversity Foundation.

title: Amman Mineral International's President Director Resigns
body: Alexander Ramlie, President Director of Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN), has resigned from his position, effective June 14, 2025, to take on a new position as Commissioner of the company. The news was disclosed by the company's Secretary, Vemmy Febrianti, in a letter to the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: Gold Price Rises by IDR 8,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The certified gold price at PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) rose by IDR 8,000 per gram to IDR 1,968,000 per gram, while the buyback price also increased by IDR 8,000 per gram to IDR 1,812,000 per gram.

title: PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk. Stock Seen as Attractive Alternative Amidst Challenging Business Environment
body: PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk. (ASA) is considered an attractive alternative stock due to its diversified business model, as well as its rapid expansion in logistics. This is seen as a positive development amid the challenging business environment this year.

title: PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk's Stock Continues to Decline
body: PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk's (TOWR) stock has consistently declined since the beginning of the year, with a 16.41% drop to IDR 535 per share, and a 13.01% decline in the past month and 2.73% in the past week.

title: China's Exports to ASEAN Surge Amid US-China Trade War
body: China's exports to ASEAN surged 13% year-over-year to $51.3 billion in May 2025, according to a Citigroup Inc (C) report citing China's General Administration of Customs data. The growth is attributed to the escalating trade war between the US and China in the first half of 2025.

title: Bank Indonesia expected to maintain its benchmark interest rate at 5.5% due to global factors.
body: Bank Indonesia is predicted to keep its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5.5% in its meeting this week, considering global factors, after cutting it by 25 basis points in May. According to Banjaran Surya Indrastomo, Head of Economics at Bank Syariah Indonesia, the central bank has already utilized some of its monetary policy easing space in May.

title: Indonesian Economic Confidence Hits Lowest Level Since April 2022
body: The Indonesian economic confidence index dropped to 106 in May 2025, the lowest since April 2022, due to concerns over job availability and income. The index is expected to remain pessimistic in the coming months due to the impact of the Israel-Iran war on the economy.

title: Indonesia's Central Bank Digital Currency Project Enters Proof of Concept Stage
body: Bank Indonesia's digital rupiah project has entered the proof of concept stage, focusing on blockchain-based technology for a digital cash ledger. The digital currency will initially be used for transactions in the money market before being expanded for public use.

title: Digital Bank Interest Rates Remain High in Indonesia
body: Despite a decline in interest rates over the past year, digital bank interest rates in Indonesia remain high, with some banks offering base interest rates of up to two digits, particularly for consumer and micro, small, and medium-sized enterprise (UMKM) segments. Bank Amar Indonesia (no ticker) has set its base interest rate at 9.69% to 24.04% as of April 2025.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Closes in Red Zone, Analysts Provide Recommendations
body: The Jakarta stock index closed at 7,166.06, down 0.53% on Friday, despite foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 478.76 billion. Analysts provide stock recommendations for Monday, with no specific company mentions.

title: PT Autopedia Sukses Lestari TBK sees 21.38% annual revenue growth in Q1-2025 due to increased used car sales through caroline.id
body: PT Autopedia Sukses Lestari TBK, part of Triputra Group, reported a 21.38% annual revenue increase to RP 222.51 billion in Q1-2025, driven by higher used car sales via caroline.id. The company is preparing for further expansion to capitalize on the growing demand for used cars.

title: Integra Indocabinet Targets 25% Sales Growth in 2025 Amid Global Uncertainty
body: PT Integra Indocabinet Tbk (INCI) aims to achieve 25% sales growth in 2025 despite global trade war uncertainty, with the company's Q1-2025 performance meeting expectations. The target may still change depending on the new tariff policy announcement on July 9, 2025, which could directly impact the export market.

title: Syariah Home Financing Sees Positive Growth in Indonesia
body: BTN Syariah's syariah home financing grew 18.7% year-on-year to IDR 43.45 trillion as of March 2025, while its total KPR only increased by 7.8% year-on-year to IDR 286.5 trillion.

title: Rupiah Expected to Weaken Against US Dollar Amid Geopolitical Tensions
body: The Indonesian rupiah is expected to weaken against the US dollar due to geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran, with the rupiah spot rate weakening 0.37% to Rp 16,304 per dollar on Friday.

title: Indonesian Pension Industry Sees 8.26% Annual Growth in Assets
body: The Indonesian pension industry's total assets reached IDR 1.551 trillion as of April 2025, growing 8.26% year-over-year, while PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) saw its pension assets grow 2.9% year-over-year to IDR 5.96 trillion.

title: Sampoerna Agro Targets 5% Annual Growth in Fresh Fruit Bunch Production
body: PT Sampoerna Agro Tbk (SGRO) aims to maximize its performance this year by focusing on increasing crude palm oil productivity, targeting a 5% annual growth in fresh fruit bunch production. In Q1-2025, the company's CPO production increased by 11% year-on-year, with a 15% year-on-year increase in CPO sales volume.

title: Indonesia's Retail Sales Expected to Rebound in May 2025
body: Bank Indonesia reported a 5.1% year-over-year contraction in retail sales, but expects a 2.6% year-over-year increase in May 2025, driven by sales of cultural and recreational goods, food and beverages, and household appliances, coinciding with the Waisak and Isa Almasih holidays.

title: PT Delta Dunia Makmur Tbk Reports Net Profit of $36 Million in 2023
body: PT Delta Dunia Makmur Tbk (IDX: DOID) reported a net profit of $36 million in 2023, up from $28 million in 2022. The company's net profit has fluctuated over the past five years, with a net loss of $23 million in 2020 and a net profit of $20 million in 2019.

title: Escalating Iran-Israel Conflict May Pressure Indonesia's Economy
body: The escalating conflict between Iran and Israel may put pressure on Indonesia's economy if global oil prices rise, affecting the rupiah exchange rate. As of yesterday, Brent crude oil prices fell 1.91% to $72.81 per barrel, while West Texas Intermediate crude oil prices dropped 2.01% to $71.51 per barrel.

title: Massive selling action occurs in PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) stocks throughout June 2025, driven by foreign institutional investors taking profits.
body: A series of massive selling actions have been observed in PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) stocks throughout June 2025, primarily driven by foreign institutional investors engaging in profit-taking activities. The selling action is a significant event in the stock's performance, but specific financial metrics are not provided in the given news snippet.

title: Magran Living (MGLV) stock trading suspended due to significant cumulative price increase
body: The stock of Magran Living (MGLV) was suspended from trading on Monday, June 16, 2025, due to a significant cumulative price increase of 59.49% since the start of June, reaching a three-year high of Rp 252 per share. The suspension aims to cool down the market after the stock price surged from Rp 158 per share at the end of May 2025.

title: DBS Bank Indonesia Launches Spark Savings with ESG Focus
body: DBS Bank Indonesia (DBS) has launched Spark Savings, a savings account with a yearly interest rate of up to 3.25%, allowing customers to donate a portion of their interest earnings to social partners. The bank has reached over $368m) in green and social financing as of November 2024.

title: Moody's Expects Bank Negara Indonesia's Profitability to Remain Stable
body: Moody's expects Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) to report a return on assets of 1.8-1.9% in 2025, driven by its robust capitalization and stable funding structures. The bank's credit costs are expected to remain modest at 1.3%, with a liquidity coverage ratio well above the regulatory minimum.

title: PT Jasa Marga to Boost Performance with New Growth Engines
body: PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) is set to improve its performance this year, driven by toll rate hikes and the operationalization of new toll roads connected to the Trans-Java toll road, which will offset the negative impact of the government's 20% toll rate discount policy.

title: Indonesian Banking Industry Reduces Branches Amidst Digitalization
body: The number of bank branches in Indonesia decreased by 3,208 units to 21,035 units as of March 2025, reflecting a shift in strategy towards digitalization, according to the Financial Services Authority. This digitalization enables customers to access services anywhere and anytime, focusing on operational efficiency.

title: Hotel Fitra International Targets Double-Digit Revenue Growth by 2025
body: Hotel Fitra International Tbk (FITT) aims to reach IDR 15.1 billion in 2025, a 13.19% annual growth from IDR 13.34 billion in 2024, and targets double-digit revenue growth by 2025.

title: China's Exports to ASEAN, Including Indonesia, Surge Amid Trade War
body: China's exports to ASEAN, including Indonesia, surged 13% year-on-year to $51.3 billion, with Indonesia being the third-largest market for Chinese producers. The value of Indonesia's imports from China in May 2025 alone reached $6.8 billion, or around IDR 110.5 trillion.

title: Micro, Small, and Medium-Sized Business Credit Growth Remains Sluggish
body: Outstanding credit for micro, small, and medium-sized businesses grew only 2.3% year-on-year to IDR 1.4 trillion as of April, still lower than the 3.37% growth in December 2024, according to Bank Indonesia data.

title: Indonesia Sees 28% Annual Growth in Mobile Banking Transactions
body: Bank Indonesia reported 5.57 billion mobile banking transactions in Q1 2025, a 28.22% year-over-year increase, with a total value of IDR 6.45 trillion, up 23.45%. This growth is driven by the increasing adoption of superapps that enable customers to perform various transactions, including investments.

title: PT FKS Food Sejahtera Tbk (FKSF) Expects Increased Purchasing Power Due to 13th Salary Payment and Economic Stimulus
body: PT FKS Food Sejahtera Tbk (FKSF) anticipates a boost in purchasing power with the disbursement of the 13th salary payment and economic stimulus package in June and July 2025, coinciding with the school holiday season. The company references research data showing the national snack food market, particularly the extruded snack segment, is expected to grow over 10% as of April 2025.

title: PT Pelita Teknologi Global Tbk to Distribute 20% Cash Dividend
body: PT Pelita Teknologi Global Tbk (PELI) will distribute a 20% cash dividend from its 2024 net profit, equivalent to IDR 1.62 billion, after receiving approval from shareholders through an annual general meeting of shareholders. The dividend distribution is part of the company's corporate action.

title: Bank Indonesia Cuts Interest Rate to 5.5% Amid Global Pressures
body: Bank Indonesia lowered its interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.5% to stimulate the economy, citing stable inflation, anticipation of potential US Federal Reserve rate cuts, and slowing consumption and investment. The move aims to boost the real sector, which grew only 4.87% in Q1-2025.

title: BUMN Karya's Financial Performance Deteriorates in 2025
body: PT Adhi Karya Tbk (ADHI) saw a decline in new contract values, from Rp 9.4 trillion in 2024 to Rp 2.6 trillion in January-May 2025, reflecting the deteriorating performance of state-owned enterprises in 2025.

title: Indonesia's Energy Transition: The Role of Coal
body: Indonesia is undergoing a significant shift in its energy sector, driven by increasing domestic energy demand and global pressure to transition to cleaner sources. Despite efforts to promote renewable energy, coal remains a crucial component of the country's energy mix, accounting for 67% of domestic electricity generation. The government's plans to increase the value of mineral and coal exports, known as 'hilirisasi', are expected to drive economic growth and industrialization.

title: Indonesian President Calls for Natural Resource Industrialization Amid Global Crisis
body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo's annual state address highlighted the country's resilience in the face of global crises, with a 5.44% economic growth rate in Q2 2022, and a surplus of 106 trillion rupiah in the state budget, emphasizing the need for natural resource industrialization to drive economic growth.

title: Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund Plans to Acquire Bank Syariah Indonesia, Affecting Major Banks
body: Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, plans to acquire Bank Syariah Indonesia, which may involve divestments from Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI), with potential losses for the banks. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approval and may lead to transitional challenges for Bank Syariah Indonesia.

title: Amar Bank's Embedded Banking Service Promises Integration in Under a Month
body: Amar Bank (no ticker) is offering an embedded banking service that allows partners to integrate banking features into their apps and websites in under a month, with a net income of $9.25m in Q3 2024, up 20.37% from last year.

title: Indonesia's Largest Bank Launches Carbon Footprint Calculator to Promote Sustainability
body: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) has introduced a carbon footprint calculator on its superapp, Livin' Mandiri, to encourage customers to become sustainability champions, with the bank having $17.7 billion worth of sustainable loans as of September 2024. The app's 'Livin' Planet' feature suggests practical ways to offset harmful environmental practices, such as planting trees, and provides financing for climate-based programs.

title: Bank Mandiri's Net Interest Margin and Loan Growth Expected to Decline in 2025
body: Bank Mandiri's net interest margin is expected to decline to 5.1% in 2025, while loan growth may only reach 1% due to tight liquidity, according to UOB Kay Hian's report. Despite this, the bank's asset quality is expected to improve thanks to better quality new retail loans.

title: Moody's Expects Bank Central Asia's Asset Quality and Profitability to Remain Stable
body: Moody's expects Bank Central Asia (BCA) to maintain its high asset quality and profitability in 2025, driven by its robust transaction banking franchise and low funding costs, with net income expected to remain stable at around 3.8% of tangible assets.

title: Indonesian Banks Expected to Deliver Net Profit Growth in 2024/25 Fiscal Year
body: Indonesian banks are expected to deliver net profit growth in the 2024/25 fiscal year, with Bank Central Asia (BBCA) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) to lead the growth. Bank Negara Indonesia (BMRI) and Bank Mandiri (BMRI) are expected to deliver low-to-mid single-digit net profit growth, while BRI is expected to continue its restructuring in the second half of 2025.

title: Digital Banks in Indonesia Reach Profitability but Lag Behind Global Peers
body: In Q1 2025, all digital banks in Indonesia turned a profit, but their gains are still dwarfed by global players like Kakao Bank (KR) which reported a profit of IDR 4.3 trillion with 20 million customers in 2023.

title: Indonesia's Financial Authority Introduces New Health Insurance Regulations
body: The Financial Services Authority (OJK) has issued a new regulation, OJK No. 7/2025, which will come into effect on January 1, 2026, requiring policyholders to share 10% of the total claim amount, with a maximum of IDR 300,000 for outpatient care and IDR 3 million for inpatient care.

title: PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk Announces IDR 579.87 Billion Cash Dividend
body: PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ASPI) has announced a cash dividend of IDR 579.87 billion, or IDR 33.87 per share, equivalent to 65% of its 2024 net profit. The dividend distribution was approved by shareholders at the company's annual general meeting of shareholders.

title: PT Ciputra Development TBK Targets Rp 11 Trillion in Marketing Sales
body: PT Ciputra Development TBK (CTRA) aims to achieve Rp 11 trillion in marketing sales in 2025, similar to last year's target, with Rp 3.15 trillion already recorded in the first quarter, accounting for 29% of the company's target for the year.

title: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk Raises IDR 2.5 Trillion through Bond Issuance
body: PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (SSIA) has raised IDR 2.5 trillion bond through its subsidiary PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem (Weave), with two series of bonds offering a coupon rate range of 9.5%-11.5%. The bond issuance consists of two series, with tenors of 370 days and 2 years, respectively.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Rises 0.54% Amid Weakened US Dollar
body: The Jakarta stock index rose 0.54% to 7,155.85 on Tuesday, driven by a weakened US dollar and strengthened rupiah, with investors awaiting the Federal Open Market Committee's meeting results and global geopolitical developments.

title: PT Kalbe Farma's Performance Prospects Remain Positive
body: Despite facing challenges such as weakened purchasing power, Kalbe Farma (KLBF) is expected to maintain a stable margin through its expansion in the healthcare equipment and pharmaceutical segments. The company still has concerns about high raw material prices and yet-to-be fully recovered purchasing power.

title: Multifinance Sector Sees 11.08% Growth in Used Vehicle Financing
body: The multifinance sector in Indonesia has seen a significant growth of 11.08% in used vehicle financing, reaching Rp 117.15 trillion as of April 2025. This growth is a positive sign for the industry, which has been struggling with declining new car sales.

title: Four Regional Banks in Indonesia to Merge
body: Four regional banks in Central Java and East Java, including BPR Rejeki Insani, BPR Dutabhakti, BPR Bina Kharisma Insani, and BPR Bina Sejahtera Insani, will merge to strengthen the banking industry, with BPR Bina Sejahtera Insani becoming the acquiring bank.

title: Bank Central Asia Prioritizes Margin Stabilization Over Loan Growth
body: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) has reported a cost-to-income ratio of 28.5% in Q1 2025, the lowest among its peers, and is prioritizing margin stabilization over aggressive loan growth, with a loan-to-deposit ratio of 80% as of April 2025. The bank's loan growth stood at 3.2% in May and 12.8% year-on-year, with a target of 6-8% for 2025.

title: Indonesia's Sharia Insurance Industry Sees 8.04% Growth in Contributions
body: The Financial Services Authority reported that Indonesia's sharia insurance industry contributed IDR 9.84 trillion as of April 2025, an 8.04% year-over-year growth. Despite its potential, the industry still lags behind, with a small market share.

title: Moody's Raises Solvency Concerns for Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) Despite Strong Capital Ratio
body: Moody's expects Bank Tabungan Negara's profitability to decline to 0.55%-0.65% by 2025, citing higher credit costs, while the bank's low nominal leverage ratio may overstate its balance sheet buffers. Despite strong capital ratio, the bank faces solvency risks due to high asset risk and low provisioning.

title: Mind ID's 2024 Net Profit Rises 50% to IDR 36.53 Trillion
body: Mind ID, a holding company for the mining industry, reported a net profit of IDR 36.53 trillion in 2024, a 50.11% increase from IDR 24.33 trillion in 2023.

title: Jakarta Stocks See Gains, Led by Bakrie Group Shares
body: Shares of conglomerate companies, including Bakrie Group, have seen significant gains, with PT Bumi Resources Minerals' stock price surging 32.37% since the start of the year, driven by improved corporate actions and financial performance.

title: Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund to Invest $5 Billion in 2023
body: Danareksa, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, aims to invest $5 billion in 2023, with initial investments going to companies such as PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (Tbk) and PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (Tbk), which could boost liquidity and investor interest in the short term.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls 0.67% Amid External Pressures
body: The Jakarta Composite Index) dropped 0.67% to 7,107.79 on Wednesday, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 646.61 billion worth of shares, amid escalating Israel-Iran conflict and uncertainty in the financial market.

title: Indonesian Trade Finance Sees Positive Growth in Early 2025
body: Indonesia's trade finance sector showed a positive trend in early 2025, driven by an improvement in national export performance, with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recording a 69% year-on-year growth in export transaction volume to USD 31.4 billion in May 2025.

title: Indonesian Government's Retail Bonds See Strong Demand in 2025
body: The Indonesian government has launched seven retail bond products in 2025, with the first product, ORI027, absorbing the largest demand in history with total sales of IDR 37.36 trillion. Despite a decline in retail bond demand since the beginning of the year, the government remains optimistic about the prospects of retail bonds for the rest of the year.

title: Wealth Management in Indonesian Banking Sees Double-Digit Growth
body: Wealth management in Indonesian banking continues to show strong growth, with several banks recording double-digit growth in managed funds, despite a slowdown in third-party fund growth, with a 4.49% annual growth rate as of May, according to Bank Indonesia.

title: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) Approves $200 Million Share Buyback
body: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) has received shareholder approval for a $200 million share buyback, equivalent to IDR 3.3 trillion, following an annual and extraordinary general meeting of shareholders.

title: PT Perusahaan Perkebunan London Sumatra (LSIP) Reports 45% Annual Increase in Net Profit in Q1 2025
body: PT Perusahaan Perkebunan London Sumatra Indonesia Tbk reported a solid performance in the first three months of 2025, with a net profit of IDR 391.8 billion, up 45% year-over-year. The company's revenue also increased significantly by 47% year-over-year to IDR 1.2 trillion.

title: US Federal Reserve Maintains Interest Rate, Indonesian Markets React
body: The US Federal Reserve kept its interest rate between 4.25%-4.5%, while Bank Indonesia held its rate at 5.5%, causing Indonesia's composite stock index to drop 0.67% and foreign investors to sell Rp 646.61 billion worth of shares.

title: PT Eratex Djaja Tbk) Faces Lawsuit from Supplier CV Pacific Indojaya
body: PT Eratex Djaja Tbk (ERAT) is facing a lawsuit from supplier CV Pacific Indojaya over unpaid debts, with the first hearing scheduled for June 19, 2025. The lawsuit was filed on June 12, 2025, at the Jakarta Central District Court.

title: Indonesian Government Delays Sugar Tax on Packaged Drinks
body: The Indonesian government has delayed the implementation of a sugar tax on packaged drinks, a move welcomed by the country's food and beverage industry. The decision is expected to benefit companies operating in the sector.

title: Indonesia's National Bank Credit Growth Continues to May 2025
body: Bank Indonesia's data shows that outstanding bank credit grew only 8.43% year-on-year in May, slowing down from 8.88% in the previous month and 10.39% in December 2024, potentially weakening economic growth.

title: PT PLN (PLN) Records Positive Performance in 2024 with 12% Increase in Revenue to Rp 545.38 Trillion
body: PT PLN (PLN) achieved a positive performance in 2024, with revenue increasing by 12% to Rp 545.38 trillion compared to the previous year. The company's success is attributed to the government's support in helping PLN remain strong amidst global economic and geopolitical challenges.

title: Indonesian Government to Introduce New Regulations for Online Ride-Hailing Drivers
body: The Indonesian government is set to introduce new regulations for online ride-hailing drivers, aiming to improve their welfare, with Grab Indonesia (GRAB) participating in the discussion. The new regulations will categorize online drivers as micro, small, and medium enterprises.

title: Indonesian Banking Sector Sees Slowing Credit Growth and Deposit Increase
body: Bank Indonesia reported a slowdown in credit growth, with a 8.43% increase in May 2025, the lowest since 2021, while deposits rose 4.29% in the same period, the lowest since December 2023.

title: PT Putra Rajawali Kencana Targets 30% Revenue Growth to IDR 364.39 Billion
body: PT Putra Rajawali Kencana (PUTR) aims to achieve a 30% year-on-year revenue growth to IDR 364.39 billion this year, driven by expansion in logistics services for the energy, plantation, and chemical industries. The company's revenue was IDR 280.30 billion last year.

title: Indonesian Government Delays Sugar Tax Implementation
body: The Indonesian government has delayed the implementation of a sugar tax on packaged sweetened beverages, which was previously set to take effect in 2025, alleviating concerns among consumer goods businesses that the tax would increase their operational burdens.

title: PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk (ALSO) Skips Dividend Payment for 2024
body: PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk (ALSO) has decided not to distribute dividends for 2024, with the last dividend payment made in 2017, citing challenging performance. The company made this decision during its 2024 annual general shareholders' meeting.

title: United Tractors (UNTR) Expands Renewable Energy Portfolio with Increased Stake in Supreme Energy
body: United Tractors (UNTR) has increased its stake in geothermal energy developer PT Supreme Energy Rantau Dedap by acquiring an additional 103,638 and 129,291 shares, further solidifying its position in the renewable energy sector. This move is part of the company's efforts to diversify its business portfolio and invest in sustainable energy solutions.

title: Indonesia's Sovereign Wealth Fund Partners with PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (CAPC) to Build Chlor-Alkali Plant
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, has signed an investment agreement with PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (CAPC) to build a chlor-alkali-ethylene dichloride plant, marking its first investment project. The partnership is part of the fund's goal to invest in strategic sectors and drive economic growth.

title: PT J Resources Asia Pasifik Tbk Sees 7.4% Increase in Gold Production in 2024
body: PT J Resources Asia Pasifik Tbk (JRAS) reported a 7.4% year-over-year increase in consolidated gold production to 100,600 ounces in 2024, up from 93,700 ounces in 2023.

title: Indonesian Paradise Property Tbk (INPP) allocates Rp 1.1 trillion for capital expenditure in 2025
body: Indonesian Paradise Property Tbk (INPP) has allocated Rp 1.1 trillion for capital expenditure in 2025 to accelerate the completion of commercial projects and property sales, which are the company's priorities for the year. The allocation will be distributed across several major cities, including Jakarta, Semarang, Bandung, and Balikpapan, with approximately 30% allocated to Jakarta and 30-40% to Semarang.

title: Indonesian Pension Fund Investment Returns Down 12.9% in Q1 2025
body: Indonesia's pension fund investment returns reached IDR 5.7 trillion in Q1 2025, a 12.9% decrease from the same period last year. The decline is attributed to the ongoing trade war and geopolitical tensions.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls Below 7,000 Amid Geopolitical Tensions
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) dropped 1.96% to 6,968.64, surpassing the decline of other regional indices such as Malaysia, Singapore, and Vietnam. The fall was attributed to escalating geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran since Friday.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Plunges 1.96% Amid Middle East Tensions and Fed Rate Concerns
body: The Indonesian stock market plummeted 1.96% to 6,968.64, with foreign investors selling Rp 1.25 trillion worth of shares, amid concerns over Middle East tensions and the potential for the Federal Reserve interest rates to remain high. OCBC Sekuritas (OCBC) analyst Liga Maradona attributed the decline to the unresolved Middle East conflict and the Fed's hawkish stance.

title: Indonesian Government Establishes Four Types of Coal Price Benchmarks Based on Calorific Value
body: The Indonesian government has introduced four types of coal price benchmarks, known as HBA, based on calorific values ranging from 3,400 to 6,322 kcal/kg GAR, which will be used to calculate the benchmark coal price influenced by coal quality factors. The HBA values will consider factors such as calorific value, moisture content, sulfur content, and ash content to determine the price of coal.

title: PT Primadaya Plastisindo Tbk Aims to Improve Performance in the Remaining Year
body: PT Primadaya Plastisindo Tbk (PDPP) aims to boost production of polyethylene terephthalate-based gallons and recycled products to improve its performance, after reporting a 17.02% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 106.07 billion in Q1-2025.

title: Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Need Extra Attention from Government and Regulators
body: The credit risk ratio in the micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) sector continues to rise, alongside a slowing growth trend in credit growth, highlighting the need for extra attention from the government and regulators, as MSMEs contribute 6.6% to Indonesia's domestic product in Q1-2025.

title: Indonesia's Competitiveness Ranking Drops 13 Places to 40th in 2025 IMD World Competitiveness Ranking
body: Indonesia's competitiveness ranking dropped 13 places to 40th out of 69 countries in the 2025 IMD World Competitiveness Ranking, due to economic issues and high unemployment rates. This marks a significant decline from its previous ranking of 27th in 2024.

title: Bumi Resources to Boost Business Growth in 2025 by Acquiring Australian Gold and Copper Mine
body: PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) and its subsidiary, PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk, plan to diversify their business by acquiring an Australian gold and copper mine, Wolfram Limited, to capitalize on the global bullish gold price trend, aiming to boost business growth in 2025.

title: Indonesian Banks Raise Credit Interest Rates to Improve Profitability
body: Bank Indonesia reported a 3-basis-point increase in profit margin to 2.04% in April, leading to a 2-bps increase in the basic interest rate to 9.27%. The interest rate further rose to 9.75% in May.

title: Mitra Adiperkasa's 2025 Prospects Remain Solid Despite Food and Beverage Segment Decline
body: Mitra Adiperkasa Tbk's (MITA) 2025 prospects are solid, driven by its retail sales segment which grew 6.71% YoY to Rp 7.79 trillion revenue, despite an 8.65% decline in its cafe and restaurant segment to Rp 719.49 billion.

title: US Dollar Index Rises 0.01% After Federal Reserve Decision, Impacting Global Currencies
body: The US dollar index rose 0.01% to 98.91 after the Federal Reserve's decision to hold interest rates, resulting in a 1% increase over the past week and putting pressure on other currencies, including the rupiah, which fell 0.57% to RP 16,406. The decision also affected other currencies, such as the pound sterling, which decreased 0.02% to 1.3425, and the Japanese yen, which dropped 0.25% to 145.59.

title: Bank Indonesia Extends Credit Card Payment Relaxation Until 2025
body: Bank Indonesia has extended the credit card payment relaxation policy, which allows cardholders to pay 5% of their total bill, until December 2025. The policy was first introduced in December 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and has been renewed annually since then.

title: Chandra Daya Investasi to Raise Funds through IPO on Indonesian Stock Exchange
body: Chandra Daya Investasi, a subsidiary of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk, plans to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange, following the success of its sister company PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk. The IPO is expected to be one of the most successful this year.

title: PT Global Mediacom Tbk Offers IDR 1.4 Trillion Bonds
body: PT Global Mediacom Tbk (GLOBAL) has started offering IDR 1.4 trillion bond to investors since Thursday, with electronic allocation and distribution on June 20 and 24, 2025, and listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on June 25, 2025.

title: Harita Nickel (TICKER) expects higher revenue and net profit in 2025 despite global nickel price corrections
body: Harita Nickel (TICKER) is optimistic about its revenue and net profit in 2025, anticipating an increase due to improved operational performance from its subsidiary, PT Gane Permai Sentosa, which has started production this year. The company expects to increase production, driven by the contribution of its subsidiary, PT GTS, which has begun operations.

title: PT Archi Indonesia Tbk Explores New High-Grade Gold Deposits Amid Rising Gold Prices
body: PT Archi Indonesia Tbk (ARCI) is intensifying its exploration efforts to discover new high-grade gold resources, focusing on the eastern and western corridors of the Toka Tindung mine. The company aims to find additional gold deposits and resources to capitalize on the current trend of rising gold prices.

title: PT Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) Conducts Survey on Adjusting Stock Trading Unit Size
body: PT Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) is conducting a survey from June 16 to June 26, 2025, to gather input from stock market players on its plan to adjust the lot size of stock trading. The adjustment aims to deepen the market, according to Direktur Pengembangan Bursa Efek Indonesia, Jeffrey Hendrik.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 1.96% to 6,968.64
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 1.96% to 6,968.64, driven by external sentiments including geopolitical tensions, global monetary policy, and potential US tariff policies. Foreign investors also pulled out of the market with a net sell value of IDR 1.25 trillion.

title: Lotte Chemical Titan Aims for 5% Growth in 2025 Despite Challenging Petrochemical Industry Conditions
body: PT Lotte Chemical Titan Tbk (LCTT) targets 5% growth in 2025, despite the challenging petrochemical industry conditions due to economic slowdown and volatile raw material prices. The company's director, Calvin Wiryapranata, stated that 2024 will be a tough year for the petrochemical industry, citing unfavorable market conditions.

title: Blue Bird Allocates IDR 1.8 Trillion for Capital Expenditure This Year
body: PT Blue Bird Tbk (BLUE) has allocated IDR 1.8 trillion for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for fleet expansion and renewal. The allocation is similar to last year's, with the majority of the funds going towards adding and replacing vehicles in its fleet.

title: UN Report Shows Indonesia's Foreign Direct Investment at $24.21 Billion in 2024
body: According to a United Nations Conference on Trade and Development report, Indonesia's foreign direct investment in 2024 is estimated to be $24.21 billion, significantly lower than the $900.2 trillion reported by the Ministry of Investment. The difference between the two estimates is approximately $537.02 trillion.

title: Indonesian Sharia Stock Index Rises 4.31% Since Start of 2025
body: The Indonesia Sharia Stock Index surged 4.31% since the start of 2025, while the IDX-MES BUMN Index jumped 12.28%. Meanwhile, the Jakarta Islamic Index fell 0.48%, and the JII70 and IDX Sharia Growth Indexes declined 1.49% and 5.72%, respectively.

title: Indonesia's Tax Expenditure Projected to Reach IDR 515 Trillion in 2025
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Finance predicts that tax expenditure will reach IDR 515 trillion in 2025, a 2.1% increase from the previous projection of IDR 445.5 trillion. This growth is expected despite a contraction in state spending realization over the past five months.

title: Indofood Sukses Makmur and Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur to Distribute Cash Dividends for 2024
body: PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) have announced cash dividend distributions for 2024, with INDF distributing Rp 2.45 trillion or Rp 280 per share. The decision was approved by shareholders at the annual general meeting of shareholders held on Friday.

title: PT Jasa Armada Indonesia Tbk to Distribute IDR 125.16 Billion in Dividends
body: PT Jasa Armada Indonesia Tbk (IPCM) will distribute IDR 125.16 billion in dividends, equivalent to 75.02% of its net profit in 2024. The dividend includes an interim dividend of IDR 20.05 billion, or IDR 3.80 per share, which was paid in January 2025.

title: Fintech Lending in Indonesia Sees Significant Growth with 15.4 Million Borrowers
body: The number of fintech lending borrowers in Indonesia has increased by 58.7% to 15.4 million as of Q1-2025, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. This growth poses a challenge for fintech lending companies to maintain a healthy loan portfolio.

title: Indonesian Insurance Industry Lags Behind in Aviation Insurance
body: Indonesia's insurance industry is still lagging behind in aviation insurance, with most premiums going to foreign players due to factors such as international ownership of aircraft leasing companies. The local insurance market share in aviation insurance remains limited, according to the Chairman of the Indonesian General Insurance Association, Budi Herawan.

title: Indonesia's New Export Earnings Regulation Fails to Show Significant Impact
body: Indonesia's new regulation requiring exporters to bring back foreign exchange earnings has been in effect for over two months, but has only resulted in $22.9 billion in foreign exchange deposits from March to April 2025. The regulation has yet to show a significant impact on the country's economy.

title: Indonesia's 2025 State Budget Deficit Reaches IDR 21 Trillion by End of May
body: Indonesia's state budget deficit reached IDR 21 trillion by the end of May 2025, sparking concerns over economic instability. The deficit is still in line with the 2025 budget allocation of IDR 616.2 trillion, according to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani.

title: PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk Reports Solid Q1 2025 Performance with 4.18% Year-over-Year Revenue Growth
body: PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk (PPRI) reported a solid performance in Q1 2025, with revenue increasing by 4.18% year-over-year to Rp 42.19 billion. The company's net profit also saw a significant increase during the same period.

title: Blue Bird Allocates IDR 1.8 Trillion for Capital Expenditure This Year
body: PT Blue Bird Tbk (BLUE) has allocated IDR 1.8 trillion for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for fleet expansion and renewal. The allocation is similar to last year's, with the majority of the funds going towards adding and replacing vehicles in its fleet.

title: Rupiah Weakens Against US Dollar Amid Global Pressure
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.54% against the US dollar in a week, driven by the strengthening of the US dollar amid cautious Federal Reserve policy. The rupiah spot rate stood at Rp 16,397 per dollar, a 0.06% increase from the previous day's trading.

title: Rupiah Weakens Amid Geopolitical Tensions
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.52% to Rp 16,484 per US dollar on Monday, according to Jisdor Bank Indonesia, amid geopolitical tensions that sparked market concerns. The rupiah spot rate also fell 0.58% to Rp 16,492, according to Bloomberg data.

title: PT Diastika Biotekindo Tbk Plans Initial Public Offering on Indonesian Stock Exchange
body: PT Diastika Biotekindo Tbk (CHEK) plans to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO) of up to 815 million shares on the Indonesian Stock Exchange. The company aims to list on the exchange with the ticker symbol 'CHEK'.

title: Certified Gold Price Drops by Rp 10,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 10,000 per gram to Rp 1,932,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 10,000 per gram to Rp 1,776,000 per gram. This is according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

title: PT Trimitra Trans Persada Tbk Aims to Raise IDR 152.05 Billion through IPO
body: PT Trimitra Trans Persada Tbk, a logistics company owned by taipan Djoko Susanto, is seeking to raise IDR 152.05 billion through an initial public offering (IPO) to fund its warehouse expansion and logistics fleet addition. The company plans to issue up to 563.24 million shares with a nominal value of IDR 100 per share, with an offering price range of IDR 240-270 per share.

title: PT Pancaran Samudera Transport to Conduct Initial Public Offering
body: PT Pancaran Samudera Transport is set to conduct an initial public offering (IPO) from July 2-4, 2025, offering 222.353 million shares, or 15% of its total shares, to the public at a price to be determined after bookbuilding. The company aims to raise funds to support its business growth.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls Amid Middle East Tensions
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 1.69% to 6,790.13 on Monday, amid escalating tensions in the Middle East, with investors avoiding risky assets and waiting for further clarification on the situation. The Head of Research at Kiwoom Sekuritas, Liza Camelia Suryanata, attributed the decline to the increased risk of conflict escalation.

title: Six Indonesian Companies Launch Initial Public Offerings Amid Geopolitical Tensions
body: Six companies in Indonesia are proceeding with their initial public offerings (IPOs) despite geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, with five of them launching their bookbuilding process simultaneously on Monday. The companies are seeking funding through the Indonesian Stock Exchange.

title: Rising Global Oil Prices to Impact Indonesian Companies
body: The surge in global oil prices is expected to negatively impact Indonesian companies that rely on oil as a raw material or fuel, while benefiting oil and gas producers. The price of West Texas Intermediate crude oil rose 2.41% to $75.83 per barrel, while Brent crude oil prices jumped 2.19% to $78.96 per barrel.

title: Indonesia's Hajj Financial Management Agency Targets IDR 188 Trillion in Managed Funds by 2025
body: The Badan Pengelola Keuangan Haji (BPKH) aims to reach IDR 188 trillion in managed funds by 2025, a 9.52% increase from IDR 171.65 trillion in 2024. This target was announced by BPKH member Harry Alexander at the Muamalat Tower.

title: US-Iran Tensions Trigger Risk-Off Sentiment in Global Markets
body: The recent US attack on Iran has led to a risk-off sentiment in global markets, causing a potential capital outflow in emerging markets, including Indonesia, where government bond yields have increased, with the 5-year yield rising to 6.47% and the 10-year yield increasing to 6.81%.

title: PT Catur Sentosa Adiprana Tbk to Distribute 2024 Dividend
body: PT Catur Sentosa Adiprana Tbk (CSAP) has announced that it will distribute a 2024 dividend of IDR 36.94 billion, or 19.17% of its 2024 net profit of IDR 192 billion. The company made the announcement at its annual general meeting of shareholders.

title: PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper and PT Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia to Distribute Dividends to Shareholders
body: PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper Tbk and PT Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia Tbk, both part of the Sinarmas group, will distribute dividends to their shareholders based on the results of their annual general meeting of shareholders on June 16, 2025. The dividend distribution is a positive outcome for the companies' shareholders.

title: PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk Expands Business through New Coffee Shop Venture
body: PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk (MIDI) is expanding its business by increasing the number of stores outside of Java Island and venturing into a new business line called JA-DI, a coffee shop chain. This new business is expected to boost the company's performance.

title: CIMB Niaga Auto Finance Sees 8% Decline in Shariah Financing Amid Weak Automotive Market
body: PT CIMB Niaga Auto Finance (CNAF) has experienced an 8% year-over-year decline in shariah financing to IDR 1.12 trillion as of May 2025, due to the weak automotive market. To mitigate the impact, the company is diversifying its market through various strategies.

title: Geopolitical Tensions in Middle East May Impact Indonesian Stock Market
body: The Indonesian stock market may experience continued pressure this week due to geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, particularly following the US military aggression against Iran. Analysts predict a shift in investment assets if the situation escalates.

title: PT Mitra Pack Tbk Targets 20-30% Revenue Growth to IDR 231-250 Billion
body: PT Mitra Pack Tbk, a distributor of several packaging brands, aims to increase its revenue by 20-30% to IDR 231-250 billion this year, driven by expansion plans and positive industry prospects. The company expects its net profit to rise 15% to IDR 16 billion, with sales reaching at least IDR 231 billion by 2025.

title: Indonesian Banking Industry Sees Improvement in Liquidity in June 2025
body: The Indonesian banking industry experienced a tightening of liquidity in April 2025, but showed signs of improvement in June 2025, with banks' ownership of government securities increasing to IDR 1.183 trillion as of June 18, 2025, up from IDR 1.165 trillion on April 14, 2025.

title: US Intervention in Iran-Israel Conflict May Put Pressure on Rupiah
body: The US intervention in the Iran-Israel conflict may lead to increased pressure on the rupiah exchange rate, with the rupiah weakening 0.54% in the past week, and the dollar strengthening 0.06% to IDR 16,397 on Friday.

title: Indonesian Retailers' Dividend Payouts Reflect Business Strategies Amid Economic Uncertainty
body: Despite economic uncertainty and slowing consumer spending, Indonesian retailers are still distributing dividends, with the dividend-to-net-profit ratio serving as an indicator of their business strategies and priorities. The varying dividend payout levels reflect differences in strategy among retailers, with some prioritizing profit retention over shareholder returns.

title: Indonesian Banking Credit Growth Slows Down to 8.43% in May 2025
body: Bank Indonesia reported that banking credit growth slowed down to 8.43% in May 2025, lower than the 8.88% growth in April 2025 and 10.39% growth in December 2024. Banks are opting to place their funds in securities rather than increasing credit disbursement.

title: Indonesian Government Considers Allowing Industrial Zones to Import LNG Directly
body: The Indonesian government is considering a proposal to allow industrial zones to import liquefied natural gas (LNG) directly, in response to frequent complaints from industrial players about gas supply issues. The regulation would enable industrial zones to import gas independently if domestic supply is insufficient.

title: Indonesian Government Opens Up Live Cattle Importation
body: The Indonesian government has lifted quotas on live cattle imports, including dairy and beef cattle, due to a national shortage of dairy cattle, with only 540,000 dairy cattle available, meeting only 18-20% of national demand. This move aims to increase domestic milk production.

title: Gold Prices Consolidate After Significant April Surge
body: Gold prices have been consolidating after a significant surge in April, with Antam's gold bar price dropping 0.91% to IDR 1.942 million per gram, despite a 26% year-to-date increase. The decline follows a 1.93% correction in spot gold prices to USD 3,385.7 per troy ounce.

title: Indonesian Multifinance Industry Sees Surge in Bond Issuances
body: The multifinance industry in Indonesia has seen a significant increase in bond issuances, with a total value of Rp 11.64 trillion as of May 2025, a 20.44% increase from the same period last year. This trend is driven by the decline in benchmark interest rates, making bonds a more attractive investment option.

title: Indonesian Government's Productive Sector Expenditure Slows Down
body: The Indonesian government's expenditure on the productive sector has slowed down, sparking concerns about economic growth in Q2-2025. The realization of state expenditure until May 2025 reached IDR 1.016,3 trillion, an 11% decrease compared to the same period last year.

title: Indonesian Property Insurance Industry Sees 14.1% Decline in Premium Revenue in Q1 2025
body: The Indonesian property insurance industry experienced a 14.1% year-over-year decline in premium revenue in Q1 2025, reaching IDR 7.8 trillion. The decline is attributed to economic uncertainty, according to Asosiasi Asuransi Umum Indonesia (AAUI) Chairman Budi Herawan.

title: Indonesian Fintech Firm Akseleran Accused of Fraud Amid Regulatory Concerns
body: Akseleran, an Indonesian fintech firm, is under scrutiny for alleged fraud, with regulators investigating refinancing practices involving six borrowers with outstanding loans worth IDR 178.2 billion. This development has raised concerns about the company's governance and the overall peer-to-peer lending industry in Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.88% to 6,907.14 on Friday
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.88% to 6,907.14 on Friday, marking a cumulative decline of 3.61% over the week. Analysts predict a limited upside for the index on Monday, with support at 6,894 and resistance at 6,981, but caution against potential corrections.

title: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng Buys Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk
body: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng, an insider, acquired 2,544,900 shares of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (SQMI.JK) at IDR 43 per share, increasing their stake to 3,152,947,229 shares or approximately 0.06% of the company's total shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 5,595,900,000, is for personal investment purposes.

title: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng Buy Transaction of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk
body: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng, an insider, acquired 5,147,300 shares of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (SQMI.JK) through a personal investment, increasing their holding from 3,136,204,029 to 3,141,351,329 shares.

title: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng Buy Transaction of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (Buyer)
body: Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng acquired 6,000,000 shares of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (SQMI.JK) on June 9, 2025, increasing his holding from 3,141,351,329 to 3,147,351,329 shares. The purpose of the transaction was personal investment.

title: Hasmoro Buy Transaction of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk.
body: Hasmoro acquired 724,600 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk. (HEAL.JK) through a buy transaction, increasing their holding from 737,510,989 to 738,235,589 shares, representing an investment purpose.

title: PT Victoria Investama Tbk Buy Transaction of PT Victoria Investama Tbk.
body: PT Victoria Investama Tbk acquired 390,213,000 shares of its own stock, increasing its holding from 9,572,044,411 to 9,967,417,411 shares. The transaction, categorized as 'Penguatan Permodalan Entitas Anak' or strengthening of subsidiary capital, was conducted at a price of IDR 115 per share. This buyback transaction indicates the company's confidence in its future prospects and potential to increase shareholder value.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 1.74% Amid Global Tensions
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 1.74% to 6,787,140 on Monday, with almost all sectors experiencing pressure, amid concerns over the impact of the US involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict and the potential closure of the Strait of Hormuz. The closure of the Strait of Hormuz could affect global commodity prices, as it accounts for 20% of global crude oil consumption and 10% of LNG trade.

title: Garuda Metalindo Explores Non-Automotive Segments Amid Weak Indonesian Automotive Industry
body: PT Garuda Metalindo Tbk (GMET) is looking to diversify into non-automotive segments as the Indonesian automotive industry faces decline due to economic weakness, with the company seeking to capitalize on various opportunities. The industry is experiencing a downward trend due to decreased consumer purchasing power, increased layoffs, rupiah depreciation, and high interest rates.

title: PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Tbk (CMNP) Opts Not to Distribute Dividends for 2024
body: PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Tbk (CMNP) has decided not to distribute dividends for 2024, citing the need to focus on several projects in 2025, including the construction of two toll roads. The company will use its 2024 net profit to fund these projects.

title: Moody's Expects PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia's Profitability to Decrease in 2025
body: Moody's has affirmed PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) 's Baa2/P-2 deposit ratings, citing strong profitability, capital adequacy, and funding, despite high asset risk due to its lending to small enterprises. BRI's profitability is expected to decrease in 2025 due to higher funding and credit costs, although its capitalization will remain strong.

title: PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) Expands Non-Coal Business to Boost Revenue
body: PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) is diversifying its business into non-coal sectors, focusing on renewable energy and coal downstreaming, with the goal of increasing non-coal business contributions to total revenue. The company is actively developing solar power plants and other renewable energy sources.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Following Iran-Israel Ceasefire Agreement
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.84% to Rp 16,353 per US dollar following a ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel, according to Bloomberg. The currency's movement remains uncertain, but the agreement has provided a positive impact on the rupiah's value.

title: Jantra Grupo Indonesia Targets 27.69% Revenue Growth in 2025
body: Jantra Grupo Indonesia (JGRI) aims to achieve significant revenue growth in 2025, targeting IDR 74.3 billion, a 27.69% increase from 2024 projections, driven by network expansion and strategic partnerships. The company's director, Imam Sujono, announced the target, which is expected to drive business growth.

title: PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company Tbk Plans to Buy Back Shares Worth IDR 1.45 Trillion
body: PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company Tbk (ULTJ) plans to buy back its shares with an allocation of IDR 1.45 trillion, funded from its internal cash reserves. The buyback will cover the cost of share repurchase, brokerage commissions, and other expenses.

title: Gold Prices Continue to Fall Amid Geopolitical Tensions
body: Gold prices dropped 2.53% to $3,320.7 per ounce, while Antam's gold price fell 0.92% to IDR 1.93 million per gram, amid easing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East. The decline in gold prices is expected to continue its bearish trend.

title: Indonesian Stock Market and Rupiah Fluctuate Amid Global Tensions
body: The Indonesian stock market and rupiah exchange rate experienced fluctuations on Tuesday, with the IHSG index rising 1.21% to 6,869.17 and the rupiah strengthening 0.84% to Rp 16,354 per dollar, despite ongoing global tensions and uncertainty.

title: PT Pancaran Samudera Transport to Use IPO Funds for Fleet Expansion and Working Capital
body: PT Pancaran Samudera Transport, a shipping company, plans to use IPO funds to add vessels and working capital, aiming for 10%-15% growth in performance this year, after reporting revenue of IDR 980.16 billion and net profit of IDR 243.36 billion in 2024.

title: Danatara Asset Management Injects $405 Million into Garuda Indonesia
body: Danatara Asset Management, through Badan Pengelola Investasi, has injected $405 million into PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) as part of the airline's restructuring process that began in 2022. The investment, in the form of a shareholder loan, aims to support Garuda Indonesia's continued operations.

title: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) Allocates IDR 1 Trillion for Expansion
body: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) plans to aggressively expand its business, allocating IDR 1 trillion for capital expenditure in 2023, up from IDR 704 billion in the previous year. The expansion plans include building new hospitals, including RS Kasih in Cirebon and RS Mitra Keluarga in Sidoarjo, scheduled to be completed in 2025.

title: Indonesia's Rice Prices Remain High Despite Being World's 4th Largest Producer
body: Despite being the world's 4th largest rice producer, Indonesia's domestic rice prices remain high, with 150 areas experiencing price increases in the third week of June. This is contrary to expectations that abundant rice production would lead to lower prices.

title: Indonesia Expands QRIS Cross-Border Payment System to Saudi Arabia and China
body: Bank Indonesia's expansion of the QRIS cross-border payment system to Saudi Arabia and China is expected to drive growth in digital wallet transactions, with predictions of 10%-15% annual growth in QRIS transactions and 15%-20% growth in cross-border QRIS transactions via digital wallets.

title: Small-Cap Companies to List on Indonesian Stock Exchange through IPO
body: PT Merry Riana Edukasi, a small-cap education business, is set to list on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) with a 25% stake or 266.66 million shares offered. This move is part of the IDX's support for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to go public.

title: Bank Rakyat's Micro, Small, and Medium-Sized Business Loan Quality Deteriorates
body: The non-performing loan ratio of Bank Rakyat's micro, small, and medium-sized business loans increased to 11.91% in March 2025, up from 10.70% in the same period last year, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. This is concerning as the majority of Bank Rakyat's loan disbursements are to this sector.

title: Indonesia's Non-Performing Loan Ratio Rises to 2.24% in April 2025
body: Indonesia's non-performing loan (NPL) ratio increased to 2.24% in April 2025, up from 2.17% in March 2025 and 2.08% in December 2024, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. The rising NPL ratio is attributed to the country's economic downturn, which may continue to impact the banking sector.

title: PT Jayamas Medica Industri Tbk Expands into Global Market Amid US-China Trade Tensions
body: PT Jayamas Medica Industri Tbk (JMIF) is preparing to expand its market reach globally, capitalizing on the strategic opportunity to supply healthcare equipment amidst rising import tariffs imposed by the US on several countries, including China. The company sees potential for growth in the global market, driven by increasing demand for healthcare equipment.

title: Indonesian Kompas100 Index Falls 5.87% Since the Start of the Year
body: The Kompas100 index has declined 5.87% since the beginning of the year, outpacing the 2.98% drop in the IHSG index, due to factors including the correction of large-cap stocks in the index. According to Mirae Asset's Head Research & Chief Economist, Rully Arya Wisnubroto, the decline is driven by several factors.

title: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk Expands Accessibility through Toll Road and Transjabodetabek T31
body: PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIK2) is expanding its accessibility through the development of the Kamal-Teluknaga-Rajeg toll road and the Transjabodetabek T31 transportation system, which is expected to increase the number of visitors and support residential sales, with a target of Rp 5.31 trillion in revenue for 2025.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 1.21% on Positive Response to Iran-Israel Ceasefire
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) closed 1.21% higher at 6,869.17 on Tuesday, driven by positive market response to the ceasefire announcement between Iran and Israel. However, analysts warn of potential limited correction still looming over the IHSG.

title: PT Widodo Makmur Perkasa Tbk Projects 57% Revenue Growth to IDR 830 Billion by Year-End
body: PT Widodo Makmur Perkasa Tbk (WIDO) expects its revenue to reach IDR 830 billion by the end of the year, a 57% increase from IDR 539 billion in 2024. This growth is expected to have a direct impact on the company's operational performance and bottom line.

title: Several Companies Plan to Issue Bonds and Sukuk in Indonesia
body: Several companies, including PT RMK Energy Tbk (RMKE), have announced plans to issue bonds and sukuk in the Indonesian stock exchange, with RMKE targeting to raise Rp 1.5 trillion from its bond issuance. The first phase of the issuance will involve Rp 500 billion in bonds.

title: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk to Conduct Share Buyback Worth Up to IDR 1 Trillion
body: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The company, a subsidiary of PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKD), aims to implement this buyback strategy to support its business growth.

title: Indonesia's Bursa Efek Indonesia Considers Adjusting IPO Targets Amid Decline in New Listings
body: The number of companies planning to go public in Indonesia has decreased, with only 14 companies in the pipeline with a total valuation of IDR 7.01 trillion, down from 102 companies in March 2025. This decline may be a sign of an impending economic crisis, as companies are hesitant to raise funds due to uncertain market conditions.

title: Sritex's Bankruptcy Process Complicated by Corruption Allegations
body: The Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has named a former director of PT Sritex (SRTX) as a suspect in a corruption case, complicating the company's bankruptcy process. The alleged corruption involves misused credit facilities from PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat and Banten and PT Bank DKI, which could lead to the seizure of Sritex's assets.

title: Indomaret Expands Business with 300 New Stores in First Half of 2025
body: PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional Tbk (Indomaret) has opened 300 new stores in the first half of 2025, reaching 30% of its target of 1,000 new stores for the year. The company is taking a cautious approach to expansion, considering factors such as location selection.

title: Gold Price Drops by Rp 8,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,932,000 to Rp 1,924,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,776,000 to Rp 1,768,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a decline in gold prices in the country.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.54% Amid Banking Sector Pressure
body: The Indonesian stock market index fell 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.143 on Wednesday, driven by pressure on big cap stocks, particularly in the banking sector. Despite this, Asian markets were mixed, with some gains seen amid hopes for a continued ceasefire between Iran and Israel and a positive response to the latest statement from the Federal Reserve governor.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Against US Dollar Amid Positive Sentiment
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.33% to Rp 16,300 against the US dollar on Wednesday, driven by positive sentiment following the announcement of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel by US President Donald Trump. The currency's appreciation was also reflected in the spot market, where it gained 0.48% to Rp 16,292, according to Jisdor Bank Indonesia.

title: PT Ifishdeco Tbk Expands into Palm Oil Business with 1,504 Hectare Land in Sulawesi
body: PT Ifishdeco Tbk, a nickel mining company, plans to venture into the palm oil business with a 1,504.26 hectare land in Sulawesi. The company aims to diversify its business portfolio with this new venture.

title: Indonesian Parliament to Conduct Fit and Proper Test for Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor Candidates
body: The Indonesian Parliament's Commission XI will conduct a fit and proper test on July 1, 2025, to select a new Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia (BI) to replace Doni Primanto Joewono, whose term ends in July.
