The test will be held before the Commission submits its recommendations to the President.

title: Indonesian Deposit Rates Rise in May 2025 Despite Central Bank's Rate Cut
body: In May 2025, Indonesian deposit rates surprisingly increased despite the central bank's rate cut, driven by competition among banks to attract deposits. The average 3-month deposit rate rose to 5.71% from 5.69% in April, while the 24-month rate increased to 4.38% from 4.34%.

title: Apexindo Pratama Duta (APEX) Focuses on Improving Performance by 2025 through Rig Utilization
body: PT Apexindo Pratama Duta Tbk (APEX) aims to improve its performance by 2025 through rig utilization, following a 3.82% year-over-year decline in revenue to $22.87 million in Q1-2025. The company is taking steps to address its poor performance in the first quarter of this year.

title: Indonesian Mutual Fund Industry Sees Positive Growth Despite Geopolitical Risks
body: The Indonesian mutual fund industry has recorded a positive achievement, with assets under management reaching IDR 806.5 trillion as of May, up 0.88% from the previous month. Despite this growth, the industry still faces risks, particularly from escalating geopolitical tensions and slowing economic growth.

title: PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi's Performance Remains Sluggish in Q1
body: PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk's (MTel) performance in the first three months of the year remains sluggish, but its strong dominance in the national market with a 44% market share helps maintain its solid position among digital infrastructure companies. The company's extensive national network, including areas outside of Java with long-term contract offerings, supports its market lead.

title: PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk Receives Shareholder Approval for Strategic Corporate Actions
body: PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk (PROVID) has received approval from its shareholders to implement strategic corporate actions, including a rights issue and a capital increase without pre-emptive rights. The approval was granted during an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders and an independent shareholders' meeting on Wednesday.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.54% Amid Global Financial Uncertainty
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.14 on Wednesday, amid global financial uncertainty due to Middle East tensions. The decline marks a continued downward trend in the first half of 2025.

title: Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Sets Reference Prices for Nickel and Gold
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has set the reference price for nickel at USD 15,221/ton and gold at USD 3,313.97/troy ounce for the second period of June 2025, representing a 1.19% decrease and 1.06% increase, respectively, compared to the previous period.

title: Badan Pengelola Investasi to Invest $120 Million in PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy
body: Badan Pengelola Investasi is set to invest $120 million in PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy TBK, a subsidiary of PT Pertamina (PERTM) in the energy sector. The investment, worth approximately IDR 1.9 trillion, was agreed upon several weeks ago, according to Chief Investment Officer Pandu Sjahrir.

title: Djarum Expands Business into Hospital Sector with Acquisition of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk
body: Djarum, through its subsidiary PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, has acquired 559.185.300 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a hospital operator, at a price of IDR 1.875 per share. The acquisition marks Djarum's expansion into the hospital sector.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict Threatens Global Energy Supply, Indonesia on High Alert
body: The escalating conflict between Israel and Iran has sent shockwaves to the global energy market, causing a 9% surge in Brent crude prices, and Indonesia, as a net oil importer, is particularly vulnerable to the impact on its trade balance and fiscal condition.

title: Medco Energi Acquires 24% Stake in Corridor Block from Repsol
body: PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has signed an agreement with Repsol E & P, S.à.r.l. to acquire a 24% stake in the Corridor block from Fortuna International Inc for $425 million. The transaction is expected to be completed in Q3-2025.

title: Indonesian Government to Impose Income Tax on Online Marketplace Sellers
body: The Indonesian government is set to impose income tax on online marketplace sellers, with the Directorate General of Taxes finalizing a legal framework to simplify tax administration and ensure fair treatment for micro, small, and medium-sized businesses. The move is expected to affect sellers on platforms such as Lokapasar.

title: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk to Conduct Share Buyback Worth Up to IDR 1 Trillion
body: PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion through its subsidiary, PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk, over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The buyback is aimed at stabilizing the company's stock price and increasing shareholder value.

title: PT Eka Sari Lorena Transport Tbk Faces Challenges in Bus Transportation Industry
body: PT Eka Sari Lorena Transport Tbk (LRNA) is struggling to overcome various challenges in the bus transportation industry, aiming to improve its financial performance after a disappointing 2024. The company's overall business segment performance was unsatisfactory last year.

title: Indonesia to Launch New Energy Zone in Halmahera Timur in June 2025
body: Indonesia is set to launch a new energy zone in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara, in June 2025, which will be the country's first battery energy industrial zone, developed in partnership with Chinese investors and state-owned enterprises. The zone will focus on nickel-based energy production.

title: Medco Group's Ijen Geothermal Power Plant Offers a Glimpse into Renewable Energy
body: Medco Group's Ijen geothermal power plant, located in Banyuwangi, offers a unique look into renewable energy with its steam-powered turbines, producing electricity while maintaining a low environmental impact. The plant, operated by Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC), is a key project for the company's green energy initiatives.

title: Global Conglomerates and Contractors Eye Indonesia's Geothermal Expansion
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced that global conglomerates and contractors are interested in expanding geothermal energy in Indonesia. This move is expected to boost the country's renewable energy sector and attract significant investments.

title: BI-Fast Transactions See Significant Growth in Volume and Value
body: BI-Fast transactions reached 393.73 million, a 45.45% year-over-year increase, with a total value of IDR 969.43 trillion, a 38.17% year-over-year increase, driven by massive digital banking adoption and lower costs.

title: Lo Kheng Hong Increases Stake in PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk (SIPD) to 5.02%
body: Lo Kheng Hong has increased its stake in PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk (SIPD), a palm oil plantation company, to 5.02% with 778,857,000 shares. This is an increase from the previous day, when Lo Kheng Hong did not hold more than 5% of the company's shares.

title: Indonesian Telco Operators' Data Quota Scheme Under Fire for Allegedly Causing Consumer Losses
body: Indonesian telco operators' data quota scheme is being criticized for allegedly causing consumer losses of up to tens of trillions of rupiah per year. The operators are defending their practice, citing business norms and ministerial regulations.

title: Indonesian Investment Firms Focus on Improving Performance Amidst Market Fluctuations
body: Several Indonesian investment firms, including PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk. (SRTG), are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025 after reporting negative investment results in the first quarter. These efforts come amidst fluctuations in the Indonesian stock market.

title: Long Holiday in Q2 2025 Fails to Boost Data Traffic and SIM Card Sales for Indonesian Telecom Operators
body: A research report by BRI Danareksa Sekuritas predicts that the long holiday in Q2 2025 will not significantly increase data traffic and SIM card sales for Indonesian telecom operators, with many operators still distributing old stock with large discounts. The report highlights the uneven absorption of SIM cards, particularly offline.

title: Indonesian Anti-Corruption Commission Investigates Alleged Corruption at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BRI)
body: The Indonesian Anti-Corruption Commission (KPK) is investigating alleged corruption in the procurement of goods and services, specifically EDC machines, at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BRI). The KPK has summoned former BRI Vice President Director Catur Budi Harto for questioning, but has not yet named any suspects.

title: Indonesia's Tax Revenue Expected to Contract 35-40% in Semester I-2025
body: Indonesia's tax revenue in Semester I-2025 is expected to contract 35-40% compared to the same period last year, which recorded IDR 885 trillion. This contraction is predicted despite an assumption of positive growth in other tax revenues.

title: Merry Riana Education to Launch Initial Public Offering on Indonesian Stock Exchange
body: Merry Riana Education, a Indonesian education company, is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite challenging market conditions. The company's founder and commissioner, Merry Riana, remains optimistic about the listing, citing the company's organic growth since 2014.

title: Indonesia's Fiscal Pressure Prompts Government to Consider Increasing Bond Issuance
body: Indonesia's government is facing fiscal pressure this year, with a budget deficit since the beginning of the year, and is considering increasing bond issuance to address the issue, with a current deficit of Rp 21 trillion or 0.09% of GDP as of May.

title: Rupiah Strengthens Against US Dollar Amid Weakening Greenback
body: The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 1.2% against the US dollar this week, closing at Rp 16,209 per dollar on Thursday, as the US dollar weakened. The rupiah also strengthened 1.01% against the dollar in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) to Rp 16,233 per dollar.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 0.96% on Thursday
body: The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 0.96% to 6,897.40 on Thursday, but still experienced a 1.02% decline over the past week. The index has been trending downward despite the daily gain.

title: Martina Berto's Revenue Rises 3.2% to IDR 431.6 Billion in 2024
body: PT Martina Berto Tbk (MBTO) reported a 3.2% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 431.6 billion in 2024, leading to an 86% improvement in net loss to IDR 4.46 billion. The company's bottom line improved significantly compared to a net loss of IDR 31.93 billion in 2023.

title: Indonesia's Protectionist Import System Hinders Meat Industry Growth
body: Indonesia's import system is seen as protectionist, with non-tariff measures hindering the meat industry, particularly for beef, which is mostly imported. The government is considering abolishing import quotas to increase availability and affordability of high-quality beef, supporting food security and consumer welfare.

title: Bank Indonesia Records 43.77% Increase in Financial Surplus in 2024
body: Bank Indonesia reported a financial surplus of IDR 52.19 trillion in 2024, a 43.77% increase from IDR 36.3 trillion in 2023, driven by high revenue of IDR 228.66 trillion and expenses of IDR 161.3 trillion.

title: Metrodata Electronics to Strengthen New Business Lines, Targets Positive Growth in Infinix Smartphone Sales
body: PT Metrodata Electronics Tbk (MTDL) is expanding its business lines, including selling and distributing Infinix smartphones, targeting positive growth in Indonesia's entry-level to mid-range market. The company aims to capitalize on increasing demand in this segment.

title: Deep Source Pte. Ltd. to Acquire 77.19% Stake in PT Master Print Tbk
body: Deep Source Pte. Ltd., a Singapore-based company, is set to acquire 1.472 billion shares or 77.19% of PT Master Print Tbk's total issued and paid-up capital, valued at an undisclosed amount, making it the new controlling shareholder of Master Print.

title: Merry Riana Education to Launch Initial Public Offering on Indonesian Stock Exchange
body: Merry Riana Education TBK is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite current challenging market conditions. The company remains optimistic about its listing plans.

title: Indonesian Banks Host Large Events to Attract New Customers and Boost Digital Transactions
body: Several national banks in Indonesia are hosting large events, such as concerts and marathons, to attract new customers and increase digital transactions. Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) is expecting a 15-20% increase in transactions and digital service activations through its Jakarta International Marathon event.

title: Indonesian Investment Firms Struggle with Portfolio Performance in Q1 2025
body: Despite a challenging market, some Indonesian investment firms are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025, following negative investment results in Q1 2025, with PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk (SRTG) reporting a net loss of IDR 6.85 trillion, a 197.82% increase from Q1 2024.

title: Indonesia to Launch $6 Billion Nickel-Based Energy Project in Halmahera Timur
body: President Prabowo is set to launch the groundbreaking of the Feni Haltim energy project in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara on June 29, 2025, with an investment value of $6 billion or approximately Rp 97.8 trillion. The project will establish a new energy zone based on nickel as a raw material.

title: Indonesia's Directorate General of Taxes to Finalize Marketplace Tax Regulations
body: The Directorate General of Taxes is finalizing regulations to appoint marketplaces as tax collectors for online sellers, with a 0.5% final income tax rate applicable to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises with annual sales above IDR 500 million. Online sellers with sales below IDR 500 million will be exempt from the tax.

title: Gold Price Drops by Rp 17,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,907,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,751,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

title: Certified Gold Price Drops by Rp 4,000 per Gram in Indonesia
body: The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,884,000 to Rp 1,880,000, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,728,000 to Rp 1,724,000. This change is reflected in the prices offered by Logam Mulia, a subsidiary of PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Expected to Record Significant Surplus in May 2025
body: Indonesia's trade balance is projected to record a significant surplus of $2.29 billion in May 2025, driven by the recovery of export activities and easing of global uncertainty. This surplus is significantly higher than the $158.8 million realized in April 2025, according to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata (PERMATA).

title: Indonesia's Mutual Fund Industry Sees Growth with 15 Million Investors and IDR 503 Trillion in Assets
body: Indonesia's mutual fund industry has seen significant growth, with the number of investors increasing to 15 million in May 2025 and assets under management rising to IDR 503 trillion. The industry is expected to face challenges with new regulations, including the Miku policy, which aims to strengthen investment managers' capital and competitiveness.

title: Indonesian Consumer Price Index Expected to Return to Inflation in June 2025
body: The Indonesian consumer price index is predicted to return to inflation in June 2025, driven by increases in food prices, with a monthly inflation rate of 0.08% expected, reversing the deflation of 0.37% in May 2025, according to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata (PERMATA).

title: Indonesia's 2025 National Budget Execution Falls Short of Expectations
body: Indonesia's national budget execution for 2025 has fallen short of expectations, with a remaining budget of IDR 303.8 trillion as of May 2025, resulting from a IDR 324.8 trillion budget realization and IDR 21 trillion budget deficit. This shortfall is a significant concern for the country's economic stability.
